Ratings.comment: Dr. Bengal is just the most spectacular professor I have ever had at OSU. I feel honestly honored to have taken his class, and you bet I will take more. Definitely take a class with him if you have the chance!!!

Steven Bengal is the funniest professor I have ever had. He makes you want to attend lecture since he makes the content engaging, interesting, and can lighten the serious content with his humor. He is not a tough grader so if you do the work you should do good. I cannot recommend him enough, he is an amazing professor.
He's funny

Really a great professor and an interesting class, would recommend to anyone looking for an engaging class. I feel all of the assignments were easy enough and if I didn't miss one of the exams, I would have easily gotten an A without much studying
BEST PROFESSOR EVER! Exams are easy enough, cheat sheet on every exam, and tons of extra credit. He makes lecture fun and definitely recommend.

Great professor. His class was test-heavy, but he allowed a cheat sheet. Assignments are clearly instructed and he grades easily. He does not respond to emails fast, but when he does it is very helpful. Made class engaging and fun. it is very helpful when he does

I think I may be in love with him. Best professor of my life, I think. Don't know how anyone will top this. Hilarious and engaging lectures--he is clearly incredibly smart and truly understands the subject inside and out and is passionate about teaching it. Syllabus and slides and creatively made in Canva and are organized really well.

One of the best professors at OSU by far. Lectures were always entertaining but material itself can be boring especially if you have taken other law/crim classes. Assignments are kind of tedious and feel pointless, but I would do whatever assignments to take Dr. Bengal tbh. Oh also extra credit!
He was one of my favorite professors that I had at ohio state!!

Dr. Bengal kept every single lecture fun and entertaining. While lectures were not mandatory he did do tophats for grades and you did not know when he would do them. But the lectures were a class I never found myself dreading to go to. Pretty exam heavy, with some tricky questions. Overall, this has been my favorite class I have taken so far!

Lecture is never boring, you usually won't want to skip this class. The grading is very clear and there are a few extra credit points up for grab. All assignments have a flexible deadline of a week which is super helpful. His exams aren't set up to trick you --> go to lecture, pass the exams. Oh, and always do the cheat sheets.

Steven was a truly incredible professor. This class was incredibly entertaining. He was hilarious and witty and made paying attention to the lecture much easier. The material is also relatively easy and straight-forward. No complaints at all.

best professor I have had and love this class! You have 3 exams which you get a notesheet (ec). The assignments seems bad but they really aren't! You also have 2 weekly assignments but they are just for completion. Show up to class and write down all the examples! Examples are key for the class!!!!
Very fun, passionate, and entertaining.

One of the easiest classes I've taken, almost too easy. A couple of assignments a week, shouldn't take more than an hour, no reading required. He's a great, engaging, and funny professor, though gets off topic really easily. In my case, these tangents meant missing out on potentially interesting topic areas due to time constraints.

I wouldnt count on him responding to emails, if you go to office hours hes very good. All assignments have a one week grace period which is a lifesaver. No exams are cumulative and you are allowed a notes sheet for all of them. He does take attendance which really is important took me from an A+ to B+. recorded lectures are bonus class is very fun
Funny.

Another slayful semester with Dr. Bengal. I've taken three of his classes and all of them have been amazing. His lectures are very informative and funny, and he is very open to questions and goes above and beyond to answer them.

Absolute gem of a professor with excellent humor, fascinating and quirky anecdotes and plethora of OBJECTIVE psychology studies (and he's got a TON of passion for psychology and his favorite experiments)! Really down-to-earth, caring, and open-minded. Workload is light, tests are fair, and takeaways are deep and practical. Best GE diversity class!

I adore Professor Bengal as a human, but not as a prof.. I was frustrated because one of the exams was way harder than the rest, and everyone I knew consistently did poorly. Lots of A students with 66 %. He is super funny and approachable but does not often answer emails or questions. Grading is unclear sometimes, participation grade is scattered.

Boring as hell. I just play Tetris or watch YouTube in class because it is impossible to pay attention to her for more than 12 seconds. 55 minute lecture comprised of a 20 minute talk about random logistical items and 35 minutes of incoherent blabbering about random stuff. Knowledge checks and mission reflection assignments were also nonsensical.

didn't offer any feedback
acted like students were still in high school

Dr.Pino is actually insane! She will go through every assignment once you are finished with the course and try to accuse students of AI use or plagiarism. I was a student accused of this and it sure was a process to get it all figured out. PLEASE DO NOT TAKE HER COURSES UNLESS YOU WANT A COAM ACCUSATION!

Horrible professor, DO NOT TAKE. Treats us like we are kids & explains stuff that is COMMON SENSE down to the detail. Attendance is mandatory and will tank your grade if you don't go. Everything you learn in the class, you can learn by yourself by reading the textbook. LONG BORING lecture, she doesn't care abt anything but her class (1/2 Post)

Horrible professor, do NOT take this class. She acts as if we are kids and has to explain everything down to the details, THINGS THAT ARE COMMON SENSE. AND she takes FOREVER TO GRADE stuff. (1/2 Post)

Dr. Pino is really nice & probably a good person, but her classes are so painful, I wouldn't recommend them to anyone. She treats college students like elementary schoolers, continues lecturing past scheduled time, uses tophat to track attendance every class, uses respondus for exams & knowledge checks, & schedules exam reviews outside of class.
This professor is on a witch hunt to find academic misconduct. Multiple accusations with no evidence. Beware of the witch hunts.

Attendance is mandatory due to TopHat, and it can drop your grade if you aren't there each lecture. Material was not difficult, but lectures were very drawn out and felt over explained. Knowledge checks are open book, which was a plus. The 3 exams were not terrible. She's a hard grader on missions. Not a terrible class, just hard to pay attention.

Dr. Pino was great. She has clear expectations and outlines the class in a consistent way. I averaged a B on exams (without much studying) which weren't too bad. Reading the textbook isn't even necessary if you show up. However, do NOT skip her class. She does not post lecture slides. TopHat and knowledge checks count for a lot! Just show up!

Dr. Pino was a great professor, and I would love to take another class of hers! Her exams are pretty straight forward and easy to study for and she's a pretty easy grader when it comes to the writing assignments. Attendance does matter for knowledge checks, but otherwise she's very accommodating and has great late work policies.
She's very nice and her exams are easy to study for. She does knowledge checks only available during class time and it's locked by a password so attendence is pretty much mandetory.

Dr. Pino is an exceptional professor! She really cares about her students and truly sets everyone up to excel in her classes. She gives plenty of resources and is very organized in her teaching style. I would love to take another class of hers. She, in my opinion, is the ideal professor. She's very accommodating and compassionate, too!

Dr. Pino is all over the place.. my biggest issue is that she teaches this college class as if it is a high school class. There have been moments where she has told us stuff like "we still have two minutes" before class ends and it just gives "the bell doesn't dismiss you, I do" sort of vibe. She staight up treats us like highschoolers- embarassing
teaches like its a class of 5th graders, interrupts lectures to tell students in a massive lecture hall to put their phones down. Tophats are mandatory and makeup a significant portion of your grade.

Dr. Pino was a great and understanding professor. Yes, her lectures were slow to get through but she made sure everyone understood the material. She is easy to reach for help on issues. Tophats are a big part of participation so, come to class! Overall Dr. Pino cared a lot about her students!
Easy class but the lectures were a drag to sit through and you had to go for points even though the material is all common sense.

She really cares about her students and always tries to get you to engage in lecture. There is a lot of reading, but lectures are straightforwards, but she moves through them slowly and over explains stuff. Attendance pretty much required to get points on tophat and not miss in class assignments. Accommodating and SLDS friendly.

Pos psych was such an easy class but so easy I was so bored. She over-explains everything and lowkey treats us like we are 5 years old. Unfortunately, every day is a lecture and she constantly does top hats so you can't miss class.

Interesting class but over explained everything. Had guided notes so if you missed class could not get them, and always did tophats. Exams are pretty easy and there is extra credit. Really nice professor just did too much sometimes.

She is very nice, yet this is the worst class I have ever taken. It feels like it was made for third graders. She over explains everything to a degree I didn't know was possible. If you are any type of cynic DO NOT TAKE POSITIVE PSYCHOLOGY. This class feels like reading a poorly written self help book. this review was 13,100 characters pre-editing

The best professor I had, the material is a lot and it combines a lot of bio but if you do the reading and lectures and study you would be in good hands. his lecture are so engaging and genuinely love going to his class. be aware tech is not allowed in the class and you need the old school book and pen in the lecture.

Just finished the 1st 3313 Exam. It was HARD. He covered the material in lecture & the lectures are great, but I didn't read enough of the book. I had his cog neuro class  before and some stuff is similar, but 3313 is way more detail. He gives extra credit though. Only problem is when other students ask random questions about stuff not on the exam.

Excellent professor. Made lectures interactive & fun. He introduces a lot of material you don't get in other psych classes and he is very fair on grading and extra credit. Very accessible outside of class too, He gave me advice on getting into grad school and is a pretty cool guy. You can basically ask him anything and he will tell it like it is.

SO much hype around this man, I had him for mem and cog and now im in his neuro class. He talks so fast. weekly quizes that if you do poorly on he will not open it to see what you do wrong. his lectures are long and boring and barely covers the content on the weekly quizes. he is very smart and professional but not good for a professor....

He is by far the best instructor I have had at OSU. (I'm a 3rd year). This was my second time taking this class and it was the lectures that made it for me. Attendance isn't mandatory, but the content of the lectures was AMAZING and actually helped me do well on the Exams. Weekly quizzed with only 4 questions. Homework is just summarizing articles.

Dr. Siefke is a nice person but he isn't a good lecturer. His exams do not align with the material that is presented in class. The class itself isn't worth a lot of points. Be prepared to read and study hard for his exams.

Dr. Siefke is a great guy. If you respect him and the class material, he will do the same for you. He was always willing to meet with me outside of class when I did poorly on a quiz or wanted to review what I missed on exams. Textbook readings are not required but helped me succeed in the class. There is also ample opportunity for extra credit.

Siefke is hands down my favorite teacher at OSU so far and even made stats interesting and fun. I had his neuro class before & this was WAY different. Not bad, just different content. He's super nice & really wants to help you learn. He is fair as long as you follow the rules in the syllabus. 4 Exams, 6 assignments (kinda hard), and a weekly quiz.

do not take this professor. in class you would think he explains things well and then you take your quizzes and it doesn't align with what he teaches. an overly difficult class for no reason. also finishes lecture notes the day of your test so won't give you much time to review beforehand!

Good professor but the way he taught this class does not work for me compared to his cognitive classes that I got an A in. Weekly quizzes, three exams that are mostly conceptually and not math, then you have the assignments. I hated the assignments though, actually the death of me but thats probably me being dramatic. I would recommend someone else

First time teaching the class and he did great! This is part of his interest so he really understood all of the topics. Weekly quizzes and exams. They are easy, just need to make sure you can differentiate between all the terms. But its like your basic psych class honestly! Highly recommend!!!! Exams and quizzes were take home and open note!

Dr. Siefke is my favorite professor I have ever had.  he does not allow any technology in lecture which alot of people didn't like at first but it works great for me.  He is so pationate about the subject matter and does a great job making lectures engaging.

Very smart but hard class. One thing I wish I knew is there is no flexibility with exam conflicts. I had to move a doctor's appt so just plan ahead. You can get extra credit which is good, but exams are difficult!! Overall nice guy and loves teaching.

Clearly very passionate about the subject and cares about students understanding and succeeding. Can't help but hate the course content, but that's not his fault. Pretty funny guy and he constantly tries to create an environment where people feel comfortable to ask questions during class time despite it being a lecture.
Hard exam questions.

There is a good chance Dr. Brian cares about your education more than you could hope to for yourself. He made me passionate about learning again as a burnt-out senior. Did not allow technology (phones, laptops, or tablets) in class which I hate to admit definitely helped me learn. Exams and quizzes were not difficult and mostly on Quizlet.

Weekly quizzes which can be found on quizlets, attendance isn't mandatory but it helps to go to understand the course. Gives 3 larger assignments which re writing heavy but pretty easy. Exams are 50 questions 50 minutes open note online and he gives you several days to complete it. Exams are pretty easy and straight forward. Great guy, cares a lot.

Dr. Brian is very genuine in wanting his students to succeed. He answers questions in lecture very thoroughly. My only complaint is that lectures started to feel repetitive and a little dry so it was really hard for me to pay attention. That's partially because of the content and partially a me problem too though. He gives some extra credit too.

If this your first time taking stats then you need to be going to every lecture or this class will kick your ass. He is a great professor and really really cares about his students. The hardest part of the class is the homework assignments so start them early and go in for help if you need it. He also gives extra credit quizzes which are wonderful

I hated the way he did the presentations, he had all the answers and explained them rather then doing step-by-step teaching. He's a super nice guy but his teaching style cause a good amount of people to struggle. Also, if you take this course I recommend loaning an Ipad from osu to take the best notes.

Dr. Jamie is my favorite professor in all of the Psychology department! They are respectful, understanding, caring and incredibly knowledgeable in the course content. Their lectures are engaging, often funny and easy to follow. The course load is super manageable so long as you are attentive and engaged in class!
Good prof. Class was graded by 3 tests (each worth 25% of your grade) and a final project (25%). class was well structured and lecture content was heavily based on homework readings
I love Dr. Jamie They are an amazing professor that made class fun and interesting everytime we had class. Would recommend PSYCH4555, Adolescent Sexuality, with Dr. Jamie.

Dr. Jamie is great. Class is engaging. Usually, the homework is to read the chapter and any additional readings before class. The grade is 75% exams and 25% final project. No extra credit or homework grades. But, if you study well, you'll do well on the exams. Jamie makes the topics interesting and the class is set up well. Definitely recommend.

This class is organized so that you read your weekly assignments before that week of class so that everyone can participate in class discussion. Sometimes it is lecture, but the format of this course is definitely collaborative. It is not a ton of work, Dr Jamie is a treasure.

This class was extremely easy, got a perfect 100%. There is a ton of reading, 24 journal articles (20pg avg) and then a worksheet for each one. Attendance is mandatory as there is a participation submission at the end of every class. Take the class for an easy A.
Great guy and class was overall easy but the quizzes were sometimes oddly hard and specific and attendance was randomly taken.
Class was more difficult than expected. 3 quizzes, 10 questions each where cumulative... final exam was only 20 questions, cumulative off of 18 chapters. you HAVE to study 24/7

There is random attendance, you have three exams which are 10 questions 20 points, the exams are easy though, and you have reflections (3 sentences max) based off your exam. Half your grade is basically attendance and reflection so easy points. I think this class is easy and would recommend it! Despite my bad grade, I think it's easy to get an A

He is good at presenting lectures but his slideshows are short and the readings are mandetory. His quizzes are pretty difficult and you have to do a project with a large group. He wants his students to succeed and has valuable experiences he shares during class.

Leif has been my favorite professor at Ohio State so far. He is hilarious, he makes lectures and the learning topics interesting, and he uses stories from his real world experiences to help us understand various terms or topics. He genuinely cares about students and wants everyone to do well.

I loved Leif's class his lectures are funny and engaging. He tells stories from his real-world experience and it really brings the already interesting content to life. The class isn't easy but it's not too difficult either. He wants us to truly learn the content which I appreciated. Couldn't recommend him or this class enough.

Leif is a professor who will always make sure to grab your attention. His lectures can teach difficult topics in entertaining and understandable ways. The "midterm" quizzes are very short and most of the class grade is made up of attendance and easy reflections. Overall, amazing and funny professor and I'd highly recommend 3331 with him.

I loved this class so much! Leif is an amazing professor. There are 3 ten ten-question quizzes which normally take less than 20 minutes to do, 3 reflections that are super easy and make up like 25% of your grade, and 5 attendances which are also 25%. Just show up and you should be okay, I barely studied, just know your terms. Offered so much EC!

This course was overall intellectually stimulating. I wish Leif taught more courses because I would take all his classes. He is a fair professor and cares about his students. He makes class very enjoyable and fun. I had this class at 9:30am, I commute, and I always looked forward to coming to his class. I wish all professors were like this!

Dr. Smith is a very funny professor who gives pretty engaging lectures. Quizzes are difficult at first because he likes to trick you with his questions, but once you know his testing style they become fairly easy. Attendance is random and you need a doctor's note if you claim to be absent because of a sickness, which he can be a stickler about.

As a psychology major, I think this class is incredibly important to prepare for the future. The class isn't hard, all grades are based on quizzes, reflections (easy points), attendance, and the final. I personally wouldn't take a class with Smith again mainly because of his teaching style. It doesn't work for everyone unfortunately.

Amazing class and professor who had some great stories from his own experiences. He made the class fun and engaging. Attendance matters as he takes it randomly throughout the semester, but I had a great time so never skipped.

Leif himself is great! The class is very interesting. Class consisted of 9 quizzes, 4 attendance grades, and group project. He takes attendance at random so make sure you show up to class. The quizzes were short (5 questions) but they left no room for error. Great class if you're a good test taker, but don't take to boost your grade.
Leif makes class enjoyable. He has some challenging quizzes, but as long as you study the material and take notes during lecture you should be able to keep a manageable grade.

W/ Leif ATTENDANCE MATTTERS. 5 quizzes (scheduled), 5 attendace & 5 reflections (both not scheduled & taken in class. in my class in the last 4 weeks, which was annoying), & final only 200 points total (not weighted.) He promises hella extra points but only offered like 5 points. He has cool stories from clinical experience. show up & you'll pass.

w/ Leif, ATTENDANCE MATTERS. I didnt like Leif's class because lack points (nothing is weighted). 200 points in total, 5 quizzes, 5 attendance and reflections (separate things primarily taken in the last 4 weeks of the semester), and the final. Everything is cumulative. With that said, if you attend and pay attention, you'll pass also cool stories.

Leif was not my favorite professor. he was entertaining at first, but he began to repeat his stories a lot and let students get off topic. Lectures took longer than they needed to. Not graded on many things (5 attendance, 5 reflections, 5 quizzes, and a final). quizzes were 10 mcq, but were cumulative and some were a bit challenging.

For such an early class, it was the one I never wanted to skip. His lectures were always equally as entertaining as they were informational. His experience in the field and his advice were helpful to anyone considering becoming a psychologist. However, his quizzes are a little difficult so make sure you study! Attendance is also SUPER important!!

If you do decide to take his class, make sure you show up for every class because he makes attendance basically 50% of your grade. There's no debating your missed attendance situation unless it's severe enough to warrant a doctor's note.

Super harsh grader with no feedback. I would expect that if he wants us to be creative, he would be as well. Instead, he made us regurgitate the information in a "new" way for most of the assignments which was not helpful to learn the material. However, I did not watch one lecture and still got an A-, so do the discussion posts.

I loved this professor. I was having a lot of issues with my accommodations, and he was nothing but understanding. A super chill guy, and his exams are just effort. You gotta go to class and learn. He explains everything well, and has funny jokes and references.

Dr. Turner is an awesome professor. The main thing you need to do is ATTEND LECTURE. Not only is it important, because some of his slides are pictures and you need the in-person context but he's genuinely so funny and tries his best to keep us engaged and participating. Love that man and would highly recommend!!

Dr. Turner starts off the semester saying he's not comedian and more of a researcher, yet consistently made every lecture enjoyable. Super straightforward exams just go to lectures. I also appreciated his movie references.
As long as you go to class, exams are easy and straightforward questions straight from lecture and slide. By far the funniest professor I've taken, even when he's not trying to be.

Very solid professor. Super nice and funny little jokes here and there to keep the class awake. Definitely go to class, the powerpoints dont have enough text to get by just downloading them and not paying any attention. Also, in-class tophat is pretty much just participation points. Study a couple days in advance for exams and youll be fine.

Intro to ERP was a difficult class only because the concepts were very in depth, but he and the TA went easy on the grading because of this. I really felt like a lot of information was cut out because it was so detailed. This probably could be two or three classes. You will also learn how to code.

Dr. Turner's class exams were RIDICULOUSLY difficult. He expected you to recall examples from class from MONTHS prior to the exam without informing you that it would be on the exam. His test is strictly memorization and less about learning the content. Good luck trying to get a meeting with him because he is only in Columbus 2 days a week.
He is pretty good. I'd recommend him. My only complaint is he wears sweaters a bit too often for my taste. I think it's unhealthy.

Can be confusing because he doesnt always have text explaining some slides but if you go to class you usually get what he means. Likes to focus on studies behind concepts which is nice. Has some relatively easy hw assignments to help your grade and his exams arent too bad. study 1-2 days for them. Super helpful with questions.  Nice guy.

lectures are lengthy and sometimes cause info overload. he really is passionate about cognitive neuroscience but his lectures are tiring. simple assignments and few and far between but article readings are long. be prepared for awkward silences to ensue during lectures.

Sometimes is a bit unclear or a bit dry in lectures, but all in all, he is a really smart dude and really enthusiastic about cognitive neuroscience. The class wasn't very hard to begin with, but he was always very willing to help students and to ensure that everyone succeeded.

one of the kindest human beings while also being so passionate about the material and moreso the students that he's teaching. fantastic energy and presentations with a great attitude. if you ever have the chance to take a course with him while he's in his grad program you really should

I'm taking another class with dr. Yocom this semester recuse of how much I like her. She's very organized and on top of things. Her timing is honestly insane. She's super understanding and super friendly.

Dr. Yocom is a nice person but awful as a lecturer. Her exams do not align with then lecture/homework. She grades tough on exams too. The course is homework heavy. She will make you feel defeated as a student. There are tons of opportunities for extra credit and I would take complete advantage of that.

Dr. Yocom was great! She offered A TON of extra credit, and has many assignments dropped from your final grade to ensure one bad assignment doesn't screw you over. There are 4 exams that aren't super difficult, weekly problem sets, and homework assignments. She's always willing to help and I thought she was very fair. Highly recommend!
There's a lot of reading in the text book and the homework takes a while sometimes. There's not much work outside of this besides in class activities and a group project.

Professor Yocom can be hit or miss - she offers a lot of extra credit, but lectures and readings don't always align with exams. Use resources like unstuck AI to supplement and stay on top of the material.

The tests in this class were nothing like the material she teaches during lecture.  She focuses heavily on calculations during class, but then on tests we do no calculations and it's all conceptual topics.  When asking her for help she basically tells the class to try harder and go to the learning lab, which isn't helpful either.

I am writing this after the release of our second exam score. Our class average was a 50% and it feels like she is gaslighting us into thinking it is our faults for failing. I understand we need to study outside of class, but there is nothing to study, she provides us with little material to study on the exams. I don't recommend Anna Yocom.

Since this was an online class I never met Dr. Yocom. About the class, however, is that it's not "difficult." The textbook is just very dry and long when all it needs to do is describe formulas. It is difficult to filter out what is necessary for homework and tests. Overall, it is a dull statistics course and you will need to put in the work.

Great professor! Loved her. For this class, don't waste too much time on the textbook readings or questions. She only tests on class context which is way less in depth than the textbook. The classes were engaging and she has you discuss interesting questions with people around you. Overall a great class. Answers questions.

Dr. Yocom is kind and caring - she explains the material thoroughly. The textbook can be hard to follow and the homework assignments provided don't directly translate to exams (calculation homework vs concept exams) do all the extra credit she offers and you'll be fine (I got C's on 3 of the exams but ended up with an A-).

The notes were not able to be access until after class, so during class your on your own. Had a lot of responses like, "You'd have to check the textbook to understand" to questions. Attendance mandatory because she would randomly give extra credit for being in class. Exams material were different from lecture material. So hard I had to drop it.

She has a random in-class assignments making the attendance mandatory since its worth points. Chapter assignments are over 2 hours long not including the reading you have to do to prepare for exams. She's not thorough when you come to her with questions or need help with improving your grade. Very difficult and tough grader.

Dr. Yocom is amazing!! she made data analysis so easy. Her lectures were interesting and helpful. Work load was manageable and all helped my understanding of the content. Lots of extra credit opportunities! We were allowed to have a doubled-sided note page for every exam (including the final). The book was also helpful. Take Dr. Yocom if you can!!

She was a nice professor and explained things well, but the homeworks were nothing like the exams. Our weekly homework and our weekly in-class assignments were mostly math problems, and her exams were strictly application-based, not math. Lots of extra credit opportunities, but her exams were heavy, worth nearly 60-70% of your final grade.

Anna is one of my favorite professors I have ever had! You do not have to be good at math at all to succeed in this class. She is funny and really cares about the topic and her students. She offered sooo much extra credit, and a cheat sheet on every exam! Lectures were only mandatory like once a week. Can not recommend her enough!

Course had a lot of opportunities for extra credit. I'm not a huge fan of stats, but she was always excited and had a very positive energy about her. Loved answering questions and helping her students.

Dr. Yocom was the worst professor I have had yet. You have to do a lot of reading which I was fine with but sometimes the readings wouldn't be clear. When you ask her about it in class she doesn't do a good job clarifying, and talks in circles a lot. She also wants us to rely on our peers to help teach instead of teaching herself. 0/10

If you dont like to read dont even consider taking this class. If you dont read youll have no idea whats going on. She expects you to learn from the reading and then she elaborates in class yet doesnt teach. I asked her what something meant and she said "Yea, I dont do definitions i just do explanations if you want a definition read the book" 0/10

Dr. Yocom has great lectures that included slides, videos, charts, and examples. She allows a front&back page of notes on exams, uses TopHat for feedback & getting-to-know-you questions, gives 3 1-pagers throughout the sem, 3 extra credit assignments, is available after class, will meet to discuss exam grades, & encourages discussion in class.

Dr. Yocom is a wonderful instructor who always makes your contributions feel valued. The course is mostly discussion based, which helps keep your attention. I'll admit, the textbook homework was unnecessarily tedious, but you get used to it. Because it covers the whole lifespan, be prepared to take a lot of information in...a lot...

I absolutely loved Dr. Miller! I cannot say enough good things about her as a person and as a professor! She was caring and genuine towards students with passion for the course content and for our research projects. She made research approachable and provided a support system. I recommend Dr. Miller and this psychology of motivation course fully.
She's my top recommendation for psych students. You'll love her, and so will your GPA.

Her class is straightforward, and fun to be in. She clearly cares for her students, and makes it clear we are her priority. if you can take her, do it! You will walk away with an A as long as you do the assignments.
She was the most amazing professor. She really cares about her students. This was the best way to end my college career. I have never taken a class this easy!! Take it!!

I'm taking Dr. Miller for both Psychology of Personality and Motivation Psychology.  Overall, she has been the unexpected highlight of the semester and I truly am thankful for the understanding of what students are going through and emphasizing learning and caring over just forcing grades, how compassionate education should be.

Her theoretical approach to the course makes me think about finding myself, and these deep thoughts carry with me. I like thinking about what my ideal self would look like and the steps I could take to get there. This class is helping me to recognize what I really like about myself as a future counselor and appreciate my unique personality more.

Dr. Miller loves psychology so much. We do interesting activities to understand working with various personality types. I'm often thinking of personality throughout my day now. Class is thought provoking.I also prefer the way she structures the class for learning with resources available online. I'm registered to take another course with her.

Dr. Miller cares deeply about us as human beings and helps us apply the psychology of motivation to our lives.  The way she teaches gets to each student's passions with goal setting techniques and psychological confidence to believe in our hopes.  She is enthusiastic about psychology, and I highly recommend her.  Very flexible and understanding.

The only reason that I didn't rate 5/5 was because the start of her classes was quite drawn out about the final paper. We were beginning our research for the project before we even touched on any of the topics in class. Very confusing but I can tell her heart is in a good place and she really tries. I would take her classes again.
I appreciated Dr. Miller's course design, positive teaching style, and genuine desire to help students with understanding psychology, grad school, and career decisions.

Dr. Miller is amazing and always gave me positive feedback that was very encouraging. I enjoyed learning about all the disorders that fall under abnormal psychology. I learned a lot in a short amount of time.  Would definitely take a class taught by her again.  She is very caring and the learning makes you feel relaxed.

Dr. Miller was a great professor! The 6 week course was one discussion post (that was writing parts of your "final paper") and one quiz (multiple choice, take up to 3 times) each week, and turning in your paper at the end.

She also gave great feedback on everything graded, and was flexible with due dates if students needed an extra day or so!

Most caring professor I've seen. She takes time to clearly grade homework and gives tons of feedback. A very easy 6 week summer course-just a weekly multiple attempt quiz, and a weekly discussion board that breaks down the sections of the research paper (instead of a final). definitely recommend!
Super caring and understanding of time constraints and she constantly extended deadlines and helped whenever she was asked.

It was really my honor to have Dr. Miller as my instructor again this summer. I am grateful that Dr. Miller knows how to let us be in a good mood to study psychology. I will take another two courses with Dr. Miller this autumn semester, and I am excited. The feedback Dr. Miller sent me is useful and helpful for my writing and learning.
Dr. Miller has always been one of my favorite professors! She genuinely cares about her students and their success. She is intelligent, kind, and understanding. I will always recommend her classes!
Kind Professor, always smiling at her students, even though some students never attend her class. Got full marks on each assignment, would definitely take again.

Literally the easiest thing I have ever done in my life was this course. It is only out of 100 points but there is really no way you cannot get a 100% in the course. Discussion posts every week that help you with your final research paper and easy quizzes you get 3 tries on. You do not have to go to class, which is sad bc she is so kind and caring.

I love this woman. She is so sweet and caring. Easy grading for weekly multiple choice quizzes that are online, unproctored, and right from the lectures with no time limit. The lectures are engaging and encourage you to talk to the people around you. Her life is interesting and I love her attitude towards sport psych.

Absolutely love Dr. Miller!!!! She is such a kind person and so incredibly welcoming to everyone and understanding of people needing accommodations. The class is super intellectually stimulating.  It is clear Dr. Miller loves teaching.
Smart.  Knowledgeable.  Expert in his field.  Loves his subject matter.  Pay attention.

he's a good professor and very knowledgeable, but sometimes his explanations are still very complex and don't help. the coursework consists of 5 short quizzes (the lowest quiz is dropped, 10% of your grade ), a 2 page paper (15%), a midterm (30%), and a final (45%). the final is graded on a curve. the slides he posts on carmen are super unhelpful.

His slides did not match the provided slides on canvas they were just graphs from the books. The class consisted of 5 pop quizzes, a paper, and a midterm/ final. No information or study guides were provided it was me and the textbook for this class (which didn't help much). Sign up for this class if you want to teach yourself.

This dude would talk in the most monotone voice making him extremely hard to pay attention to and his lectures were just him talking about graphs given in the textbook. 5 quizzes, a paper, and a final exam are the only grades. Quizzes have nothing to do with slides. Would go off on very long tangents about things not related to class. Horrible.
The worst professor I have ever experienced.
I can't hear what he is talking about wherever I sit and he had a lot of quizzes. The ppt he gave in class and on carmen are totally different! I won't have any of his class again.

- talks very quietly and is extremely hard to hear during his lectures. He offers a zoom which is nice if you cannot go to class 
- barely has any grades for you and the quizzes and tests are so hard and barely has anything to do with what is taught in lectures 
- no review guides, the slides only have pictures of graphs and no information

very intelligent guy but only gives slides he thinks are important. slides are just pictures of the graphs from the book. overall grade in the class is based on 4 quizzes, 1 paper, a midterm and a final. quizzes and tests are on completely different things that are not provided in the slides given
He teaches his classes in a very low voice that is impossible to hear, his lectures have nothing to do with the exams, and he provides no review. If you want to fail the class you can choose it.
Worst class ever in OSU, he is so boring and the quiz is unrelated to what he taught, half of the class got 1/0 from his quiz. Don't take this class. :)
Prof. Jagacinski is nice guy and fun to talk with. Really learned a lot from his class.

This class is supposed to be a basic psych requirement but I struggled a lot. He hands out notes but he leaves A LOT out so they don't make sense and he doesn't post any notes online. Pop quizzes, one midterm and a cumulative final so there are not many points. He is super nice but I would not recommend taking his class.

This is a class I'm assuming is supposed to be easy going and basic. His lectures have little if any relevance to the text book making it confusing to refer between the two for the tests. He wastes an unbelievable amount of paper, printing out his slides (which do not make sense even when explained). 0 study guide material, small amount of grades.
I'm in his class at the moment. I have tried so hard to pay attention, but I am confident that it is impossible. Painfully boring.
Excellent teacher.  Enjoys and knows his subject matter.  Friendly and helpful.
Though it's been nearly 5 years, I often refer to what I learned in this class in discussions with colleagues.
Richard is smart.  Pay attention.  You might learn something.  Actually, he is quite brilliant.  He enjoys his work, and is generally interested in progress of the students.

His lectures were boring, but he gave us handouts to follow along with, so that was helpful. He has 2 paper (easy), 4 quizzes (easy) and two test (moderately easy. I think I would take his class again.
His "slides" were incomprehensible. There were about 4 total grades in the class. It was boring.

Dr. Jagacinski was a very poor teacher. He never taught anything and his lectures were boring. Also, there are not many points in the class so it is easy to go down a letter grade and his midterms are pretty hard

Dr. Phenis is a knowledgeable professor. He records all of his lectures and makes them available to access outside of class. He does not have exams throughout the semester besides the cumulative final. There is a group project. There are weekly quizzes. He does random TopHats for extra credit as well.

Dr. Phenis is a very knowledgeable professor. He records all of his lectures and makes them available to access outside of class. He does not have exams throughout the semester besides the cumulative final. There are some assessments on the material that can be difficult. There are weekly quizzes. He does random TopHats for extra credit as well.

Dr. Phenis is clearly very passionate about research and that's amazing in a prof. but he talks himself into circles and the lectures are so dense you lose focus immediately w/ how much you get talked at. His slides make sense and meeting with him 1on1 clears up a lot of questions, but he makes simple concepts difficult to grasp in class.

I'm not sure why Dr.Phenis' ratings are so low, he was an amazing professor. He had flexible deadlines or all assignments, open note exams (including the final), extra credit, and test corrections, and was very nice. An A is 100% possible if you use all available resources. I would 100% take another class with him in the future.

I wouldn't say that Dr. Phenis is a bad lecturer. The topic of neuroscience isn't meant to be easy. Although attendance isn't mandatory, I suggest you go. He can give a lot of good tips and hints for the assessments. Yes, the grading for them are harsh but there is a reason you get remediations for them. Remediations are grade boosters! Do them!

I really enjoyed the structure of this class. People complain about the assignments he gives, but I feel like they were really beneficial because he allows remediations which encourages students to review old material. There are also many opportunities for extra credit.

The class was really lecture heavy, but the material was interesting and he gave about a million different chances for extra credit. Even though the assignments he gave were difficult, I feel that they were beneficial because the remediations he offered encouraged students to review past material.

This a very content heavy class, and although the material is hard, you can definitely still end with a good grade if you put the work in. Rewatching each lecture helped me do good on the quizzes and assessments, and there are opportunities to fix your mistakes for a better grade on these assignments as well.

Phenis is NOT a good lecturer, NOT an easy grader, and NOT a professor to learn from. If you believe that this class will be a wonderful commencement to your neuroscience major, you will be deeply disappointed. The only reason I get an A is by using materials from other sections and studying for my other neuroscience class. Take Dr. Coutellier.

Lectures are extremely boring and exhausting with a huge amount of unnecessarily complicated content. He tries to hide important information for tests from the slides and makes questions as convoluted as possible. His free-response questions are graded all-or-nothing, and remediations are graded harshly. This class makes me hate neuroscience.

He is the worst professor I've ever taken a class with. He's a boring and bad lecturer, he allows to redo things but you have to get 100% on the remediation and do a bunch of work with it which takes hours. 0/10 recommend him. There's much better professors or classes in general (if this isn't a specific requirement for you). Save yourself
Lectures can be dry, but Dr. Phenis is approachable. Tough group projects require diligent partners. Quizzes are tricky, but he's flexible on late work. Unstuck study helps streamline study prep.

Dr. Phenis is a fantastic teacher. Even if you miss deadlines or receive a poor grade, he always offers extensions, penalty removals, and remediations to improve your score. He's not always available, but during work hours, you're guaranteed a comprehensive response quickly. Deadlines and instructions on assignments are very clear and regulated.

Dr. Phenis was able to answer any questions I had quickly. People noted that he is boring, but the material he has to work with is so dry. He does have a lot of guidelines and deadlines that can get confusing. Don't have flaky partners; the group project is a big part of the grade. There are many ways to succeed if you work hard and seek it out.
A research methods class truly about neuroscience. Overly complex group assignments that go way out in the weeds. Confusing instructions and generally boring to listen to. Would not recommend
Do NOT waste your time with him he is so boring and the group projects are probably the worst thing ever. You will inevitably be confused the entire time and not end up learning a single thing

Very difficult to keep up with his lectures and often times his test/quiz questions arent even found on the slides he provides. You'd have to rewatch all of his zoom recordings to understand topics because you cant really study off of his slides.

Content is difficult and his lectures can be a bit hard to understand but if you pay attention and take advantage of remediations it's completely doable to get an A, I found it very helpful to make my own notes and to ask him any questions after class.

Dr. Phenis was a great professor, lectures were informative and you could tell he cared about teaching the material. Class itself was not too difficult at all, one cumulative final, sort of bi-weekly quizzes and assessment assignments (less points, weighted heavier). If you pay attention in lecture you will have no problem! Offers remediations too

Dr. Phenis is a nice professor. Although his lecture is boring and quizzes are difficult to understand. But he has a nice late hw policy and if you did something wrong, he will give you an opportunity to fix that if you have a reasonable reason.

Prof. Cravens-Brown is a passionate and engaging instructor. Her class is manageable with lots of extra credit opportunities. The content is interesting, and she genuinely cares about her students' success. unstuckstudy was a helpful study tool alongside the readings and lectures.

Weekly homework: chapter reading & reading assignment (usually 30-45 minutes). Lectures were interesting & engaging. Attendance tracked by top hat questions (2-4 per class). NO EXAMS. 4 application assignments (~15 questions). Participation in research program is required; took up time outside of class but was easy. Minimal work. Highly recommend.

She's great! The lectures aren't necessarily mandatory but there's solely in-class activities that make it more encouraged for students to attend class. There was no final exam for us which made it stress-free. She has a somewhat strict no phone policy and a laptop zone in the lecture hall but it wasn't a big deal since notes weren't required.

Please disregard my grade because I missed far too many classes; otherwise, I would've gotten closer to an A with minimum effort. The lectures can get pretty boring. She does have her TA's watch for people getting off-task (on phones, on laptops, talking, etc.) so if you cannot help yourself with that kind of thing, maybe choose another professor.
She sure has energy! Its a fun class but if you don't really like psych it can be a drag. She is super entertaining and keeps the students engaged.

I'm obsessed with Lisa CB, she is so funny and really wants to keep her students interested in the material. You can also tell she genuinely cares about all her students and wants them to do well. She's super kind and there's not a ton of outside work, I would definitely take her as a professor again!

Easy to get a good grade. Provide 12 extra credits. Use Tophat to take attendance and ask questions. Can miss a few lectures and recitations based on your grade. No final exam, but optional quiz point make up exam(score will add to quiz category as extra credit.)

READ THE ENTIRE SYLLABUS. I didn't and it put me behind a lot on REP credits. But CB does a good job keeping students informed of deadlines. Very funny and interesting person; lectures weren't bad. Extra credit! Lots of points are from in-class. This isn't a class you'll want to skip if you want an A. Weekly quizzes are just vocab, pretty easy.

Such an easy and interesting class! LCB is a very fun professor and is very approachable. There is plenty of extra credit throughout different sections, and she sets the course up so you can earn more points than you can get, basically giving you points to throw away.

Dr. Cravens-Brown is so cool. I had my intro to psych class in a lecture hall of 600 and was still able to learn the content and do well. She's easy to contact outside of class and is always straightforward with grading. Overall I'd highly recommend taking a class with her!
Vocab quizzes are given every Tuesday but super easy! I would love to take her again!

She is an easy laid back teacher. We have weekly 5 point quizzes that take maybe 15 minutes to study for every Tuesdays. She goes through a lot of case studies and examples when she lectures. She does top hat questions which are like general questions for points every class.

Dr. Cravens-Brown was awesome. This class was about psychology podcasts and was mainly a discussion-based class. She was very interesting and intelligent and it was a very engaging class that felt like a community. It's very easy to get an A as long as you show up every day and do the discussion posts.

She's friendly and approachable, and I enjoyed taking her class. No textbook, but a lot of reading in her class, mainly research articles for group projects. Be prepared to communicate/work with many different people in the class; almost every day is a group project with a randomly-assigned group. Graded on completion of assignments and attendance.

Conflicted about her - very good, high quality prof who's passionate about clinical psych. but her teaching style is unorthodox - no lectures which means no notes/slides. Class title is deceptive - not actually about clinical psych. Exams are essay for better/worse but lots of extra credit opps. grading is strict. nothing is hard but unfamilar.
She made class fun and interesting.
She made class funny and interesting. I never skipped this class. There aren't any major surprises on her tests, just study the material and you'll do well.

You need the book for the online exams. I can't imagine trying to do those without it. Participation matters a lot, it's like 30% of your grade, but she's hilarious so it was rare that I didn't want to go to class.

Definitely the best professor I've had at OSU! Couldn't bring myself to skip her class because it was so fun. Exams are all online, and a decent amount of your grade comes from attendance/participation. She makes topics that are sometimes seen as taboo really easy to discuss. Show up and make sure you get the textbook and you'll pass.

Dr. CB is awesome! Super engaged in lectures and gives really relatable/funny personal stories. Makes the topic of sex very comfortable and fun. Uses random tophat questions for participation points. Exams are all online and decently easy. Buy/rent the book. Definitely recommend taking her and this class, you won't regret it!

Dr. Deshpande should not be your first choice when learning Psychology. She is very verbose and her slides do not cover the material well. Her lectures are not very engaging, but if you are super interested in the material and do the hw (which is not that bad) you can finish the class with an A.

One of the top 3 worst professors I've had in my collegiate career. It's a talent to be this boring. She is also a very tough grader, one of the hardest psych classes I've taken, not based on material but simply the teacher. Avoid her if you can.
She was great and tried to answer abstract questions to the best of her ability. The practice forms are tedious but easy if you do the reading. Overall would take again for another class.
Sooo boring oh my goodness. She talks in circles and rambles a ton. It was physically painful
She rambles a lot; puts me to sleep I swear. She's a tough grader, takes a long time too. Talks in circles during lecture.

From my experience with Ms. Prurtha, she's a very sweet and caring professor. Her lectures can be a bit boring, but the class is easy and there's a lot of opportunities for extra credit. I have had her for both 3310 and 2300. I struggled 3310 because her teaching was confusing, but I'd recommend her for 2300 for an easy A and not much work
This professor cares a lot that students are actually learning the subject matter. I got a lot out of this course and now feel much more confident about reading research.

I'm really enjoying this course with Prutha. The research articles she picks for the practice forms are always interesting, and the forms although a lot of work have helped me understand the concepts better and do well on the tests.
It's her talent that she can make such an interesting class so boring

Professor would talk in circles, and her lecture slides are all graphs!! She doesn't explain things well, and it's incredibly difficult to take notes with her rambling. The majority of the points were from the 3 exams and one small project. Be prepared to read the textbook and teach yourself all the concepts. Interesting topic, terrible professor.

Super slow grader. Grades the reviews that are supposed to help you study for the test a month late and the exams are nothing like class. When you do ask questions or go over homework, she gives complicated and unclear explanations. In order to get credit for your homework you have to be present in class, but other than that going is useless.
She seemed like a nice person but her lectures are extremely unengaging. I could never focus on what she's saying. The forms are easy though
Incredibly boring lectures, expects much more time commitment to a required psychology major class about Google scholar than is necessary.

This professor really cared about whether students understood concepts and explained things several times if students were still confused. She encourages students to ask questions and come to office hours. I recommend that you attend lectures, instead of having extensively information on the slides, she verbally elaborates on concepts.

Tests were very poorly worded. Her lectures were painful to sit through and she speaks very monotone and *maybe* 2 people out of the 80 in the lecture would answer her questions (she asked a lot) and it was very awkward and cringe. I tended to just zone out in that class and get annoyed. I stopped going to class in the end, not worth going.

This class is not the easiest with this professor. Making sure you read the textbook before class will help in order to understand the lectures. Professor does not seem engaged in the material and the lectures are confusing and hard to understand in class. Attendance is not mandatory. Exams are not the easiest. I would take with another professor.
Avoid her. Most arbitrary professor ever meet. She make things complicated and Unorganized class powerpoint. She collect opinions about students but never listen. classes are boring and difficult.

This class isn't particularly difficult if you read the textbook and attend class. But the lectures are just truly painful. She is very quiet and asks many questions, but she is not engaging at all, so the class has so many awkward silences. She also kind of gets upset when nobody participates. She only uses pictures in lecture slides.

Had to read the textbook to understand concepts she didn't explain well. Lectures SO BORING, supposedly mandatory, but I left after submitting the daily questionnaire because they didn't benefit me. Annoying that you can't see wrong exam answers without a zoom w her. Taught myself the whole time, but enjoyed the content! Very neuroscience-y!

Ms. Prutha is an awesome teacher! She is so sweet and nice. Her class is easy, there are no homeworks! You should however show up to class because the notes are very helpful for the exams! The exam is not timed and is open-notes, so be sure to be in class. This professor is a bit shy, so interact with her and answer the questions. I recommend her!
Aita was a great professor, everything is very straight forward. While attendance is not mandatory, there will be top hats or in class activities that you will get a zero on if you don't attend.

100% would take it again it was the easiest A of my life, he is very understanding and most assignments are online. Lectures are a little boring but push through and go because there are random quizzes to check attendance.
Absolutely loved having him for Psych 1100. He connected info in lectures to modern, real-world examples. He is understanding and easy going. I definitely would recommend taking this class with him.

Easily one of my favorite professors. He is very helpful and very clear in his lectures. I had never really been too interested in psychology before this class, and he completely flipped that. There are some classes that I never want to go to class, but for this class, I never want to miss it.
He is such a caring guy. Class was super easy but I did learn some. Definitely take him for Psych if you can.
Aita is so cool and chill. He actually loves psych. This class is easy because exams and quizzes are open note and online. Aita is super funny too. 10/10 recommend !!!!!!

Amazing person and teacher! I loved this class and coming to class every MWF. The class material was interesting and easy to digest. I found this class to be very easy to understand and a great first class for psychology!

He is the best!!!! So understanding and is here to genuinely help you succeed. Psych is easy in general but he truly made the class a breeze. It is pretty lecture heavy but the weekly discussions are really engaging. He is pure and great!!

Professor Supe is engaging and passionate, but the class is quite challenging. Expect tough exams that make up most of the grade. Utilize Unstuckstudy and other study tools to stay on top of the material.

I had heard great things about her, but absolutely not for this course. Every week we have knowledge recaps to complete that are supposed to be based on what we learned in class that week, BUT she NEVER finishes the content. I'm talking 100+ slides and maybe gets through 20 and then leaves you to fend for yourself. I have to spend HOURS on them.
Dr. Supe was a great, personable professor who incorporated lots of fun examples & interaction in her lectures! As long as you go to class & engage thoroughly with the material, you'll be fine.

Dr. Supe was great! You definitely need to go to lectures to understand the material, but if you do you'll find clear explanations for concepts described in interesting ways. Class is largely exam based but she lets students use notes so tests are pretty easy if you come prepared.

Might be different in person, but I am taking this class asynchronously and enjoying it. Dr. Supe is a great lecturer and obviously very passionate about her field. Her quizzes are straight forward as long as you can apply the material you learned.

She is a great teacher, is very funny, and is open for comments and questions. There were some assignments but the exams were worth a large portion of the grade. They were very difficult and the averages were usually C's. I had to work very hard to keep an A.
Super memorable lectures. Very caring Proff. Exams were MC and very easy. 10/10 would take again.

super engaging and well-organized class, attendance not mandatory but i found myself coming every day bc of interesting content and delivery. also tests are really based on lectures + lecture slides (posted on carmen), not the book - even tho ur grade is really dependent on how you perform on tests, if u listen + go over slides youll be fine!

She was an amazing professor! I personally would not take the class if you aren't the best test taker, as your grade is primarily your exam scores. It definitely isn't homework heavy at all and she's very accessible, but it isn't a show up and pass kind of class, you have to definitely put in the effort.

In addition to learning foundational concepts of the course, I learned a lot about teaching -  and about teaching online specifically - from taking Dr. Supe's Online Behavioral Neuroscience course at Ohio State. She considers not only content delivery - which she does exceptionally well, but also how students learn to learn. A rockstar educator.

Pros:Is an engaging lecturer and assignments are reasonable. 
Cons:Believes she is more accommodating than she is. Students are able to turn in homework or quizzes three days late twice, not the worst extension policy, but she frames it as being so understanding even though three days is not a lot of time when you're really going through it.

I would recommend taking Dr. Supe for an upper level neuro class! She is really fun and assignments are pretty easy. Three group projects throughout the semester, but all very manageable. She's very accessible outside of class and fair grader with clear expectations.

She is so awesome she made me switch to neuro, she is hilarious so passionate about her subject and a super engaging and sympthetic professor. I would normally hate a professor if I didn't get an A but I just cant hate her she is an awesome lecturer and makes the material funny and engaging. I'd recommend her to anyone!

Extremely well set up online course. Sends out weekly reminders and wants students to do well. Wants to get to know you when you drop by office hours. If you watch all the lectures, it is pretty easy to get an A. Be prepared to spend about 10-20 hours watching lectures per week, though.

Great prof, she's an excellent teacher. Great at breaking down complex topics and approaching potentially sensitive topics thoughtfully and respectfully. This class was group-project heavy, but it's full of overachieving neuro majors, so you should be fine. There is an emphasis on the real-world application of knowledge and science communication.
I would recommend taking this class because its really hard. The teacher is nice but you will most likely struggle.
Amazingly knowledgeable and informative. Notoriously difficult core class, wasnt so hard online and asynchronous but not sure if it asynchronous still

I had Dr. Supe for both PSYCH3313 and again for PSYCH4501, and she is just as wonderful. This class is themed around sleep and the brain, and there are no exams -- just three group projects and weekly Carmen quizzes. She cares a lot about the wellbeing of her students and is one of the most understanding professors I've had at OSU.

Dr. Supe is a very kind lecturer, and I enjoyed Behavioral Neuro! The notes are extremely long, however, and tests are difficult with little time to complete. If you are struggling, Dr. Supe is a great person to access and is understanding. The coursework is very time consuming, but if youre interested in the topics then its really not horrible.

Phenomenal professor. She really understands her students. Class was very organized and consisted of two assignments, a quiz and a video essay each week. The quizzes come straight from the PPT, the video essays are very simple and are only like a minute long. The assignments can be reading research papers to doing infographics. Cool class too!
I deeply enjoyed his class, and I wish he taught more than two classes. Live laugh loved him. Super helpful works with students and is very passionate about what he teaches, and you can tell. 10/10

Lectures were very confusing, he was never clear on what exactly we had to do. For exams, I am jealous of people that took 2300 from a different professor and finished with minimal coursework and high grades (and NO exams). Def only take this professor if you absolutely need to. There are many better professors at OSU.

Best prof I could have had for this course. I ended up loving the class and he made the materal interesting. In order to secure an A, read the textbook and review. The class is extremely tied to the textbook. He cares about attendance so go to lectures,he gives lots of examples though so theyre helpful. Overall, really nice and cares about students
His classes are amazing! He is a great teacher, and I would definitely take his classes again

Jesse is a really down to Earth, who really cares about his students. If you put in the work you will for sure get a good grade. I loved this class, and he made it so interesting to learn about. He love's feedback from his students and wants to really make the class the best it can. Definitely take his class if you can!

Jesse took over this class mid-semester and was extremely understanding of the disorganization of the class. He's passionate, friendly, and funny. W ish he taught the class the whole semester--I would've liked it a lot more! Student feedback important to him, and he made several changes to the course based on students' opinions to better serve us.

easily one of the best profs Ive had at OSU and hes only a grad student! he makes asynchronous lectures really engaging, is very personable, and you can tell he really wants his students to do well. the class feels easy, but I also feel like Ive learned a lot. I would definitely recommend taking a class with him even if psych isnt your thing!!

I'm a 3rd year, and I've never rated a single professor of mine BUT i explicitly created an account to write about Jesse. He is, BY FAR, the best teacher I've ever had here at OSU. His lectures are funny (with current memes), he's super approachable, takes ALL feedback, and genuinely cares about every student. I'm actually sad the semester ended :(

BEST TEACHER EVER!!! Highly recommend taking social psych (3325) with jesse. He truly cares about his student's success and is such a fun professor to listen to. You can tell how much he loves psychology and teaching. Very interesting class and he gives great examples to help you understand. Midterms very much reflect what we learn in lectures.

The best professor I have had here. i scheduled another class with him for next semester solely because he is teaching it. Super interesting and funny guy and the class is not very hard if you pay attention

Best professor ever. I've taken his classes twice, both asynchronous online and in person. Even his asynchronous class/lectures were interesting. I tried to take his class again next semester but didn't need the credit. His classes were genuinely the highlight of my day.

Dr. Bengal is an amazing lecturer, about halfway through the semester the information gets stale. I recommend not skipping class because the exams are difficult and fully based off of what he talks about in class. Other than that, the weekly survey and journals are very easy, really only a couple other assignments and no cumulative final.

Dr. Bengal is just the most spectacular professor I have ever had at OSU. I feel honestly honored to have taken his class, and you bet I will take more. Definitely take a class with him if you have the chance!!!

Steven Bengal is the funniest professor I have ever had. He makes you want to attend lecture since he makes the content engaging, interesting, and can lighten the serious content with his humor. He is not a tough grader so if you do the work you should do good. I cannot recommend him enough, he is an amazing professor.
He's funny

Really a great professor and an interesting class, would recommend to anyone looking for an engaging class. I feel all of the assignments were easy enough and if I didn't miss one of the exams, I would have easily gotten an A without much studying
BEST PROFESSOR EVER! Exams are easy enough, cheat sheet on every exam, and tons of extra credit. He makes lecture fun and definitely recommend.

Great professor. His class was test-heavy, but he allowed a cheat sheet. Assignments are clearly instructed and he grades easily. He does not respond to emails fast, but when he does it is very helpful. Made class engaging and fun. it is very helpful when he does

I think I may be in love with him. Best professor of my life, I think. Don't know how anyone will top this. Hilarious and engaging lectures--he is clearly incredibly smart and truly understands the subject inside and out and is passionate about teaching it. Syllabus and slides and creatively made in Canva and are organized really well.

One of the best professors at OSU by far. Lectures were always entertaining but material itself can be boring especially if you have taken other law/crim classes. Assignments are kind of tedious and feel pointless, but I would do whatever assignments to take Dr. Bengal tbh. Oh also extra credit!
He was one of my favorite professors that I had at ohio state!!

Dr. Bengal kept every single lecture fun and entertaining. While lectures were not mandatory he did do tophats for grades and you did not know when he would do them. But the lectures were a class I never found myself dreading to go to. Pretty exam heavy, with some tricky questions. Overall, this has been my favorite class I have taken so far!

Lecture is never boring, you usually won't want to skip this class. The grading is very clear and there are a few extra credit points up for grab. All assignments have a flexible deadline of a week which is super helpful. His exams aren't set up to trick you --> go to lecture, pass the exams. Oh, and always do the cheat sheets.

Steven was a truly incredible professor. This class was incredibly entertaining. He was hilarious and witty and made paying attention to the lecture much easier. The material is also relatively easy and straight-forward. No complaints at all.

best professor I have had and love this class! You have 3 exams which you get a notesheet (ec). The assignments seems bad but they really aren't! You also have 2 weekly assignments but they are just for completion. Show up to class and write down all the examples! Examples are key for the class!!!!
Very fun, passionate, and entertaining.

One of the easiest classes I've taken, almost too easy. A couple of assignments a week, shouldn't take more than an hour, no reading required. He's a great, engaging, and funny professor, though gets off topic really easily. In my case, these tangents meant missing out on potentially interesting topic areas due to time constraints.

I wouldnt count on him responding to emails, if you go to office hours hes very good. All assignments have a one week grace period which is a lifesaver. No exams are cumulative and you are allowed a notes sheet for all of them. He does take attendance which really is important took me from an A+ to B+. recorded lectures are bonus class is very fun
Funny.

Another slayful semester with Dr. Bengal. I've taken three of his classes and all of them have been amazing. His lectures are very informative and funny, and he is very open to questions and goes above and beyond to answer them.

Absolute gem of a professor with excellent humor, fascinating and quirky anecdotes and plethora of OBJECTIVE psychology studies (and he's got a TON of passion for psychology and his favorite experiments)! Really down-to-earth, caring, and open-minded. Workload is light, tests are fair, and takeaways are deep and practical. Best GE diversity class!

I adore Professor Bengal as a human, but not as a prof.. I was frustrated because one of the exams was way harder than the rest, and everyone I knew consistently did poorly. Lots of A students with 66 %. He is super funny and approachable but does not often answer emails or questions. Grading is unclear sometimes, participation grade is scattered.

this man is so real. aside from that he's very caring and handles the subject matter in a very sensitive and informative way that helps us to gain a different perspective on the topic. lectures are great, not too much homework, and exams are easy if you study!

Group work is terrible, but Dr. Bengal makes it bearable! This class was very challenging, but Dr. Bengal was there to support us every step of the way. He gives wonderful feedback, and his great sense of humor helps numb the pain when that feedback is negative. He's quite literally an award-winning instructor, so take his classes!

I'm writing this to those of you who attend the first day of class and think, "Wow, this guy sounds so annoying." I thought the same thing on the first day, but I was quickly humbled. Steven is the funniest professor I've had at OSU and he can thoroughly relate the content to the students. He actually teaches and I felt prepared for every exam.

Absolutely loved Steven Bengal as a professor. Literally, the best professor I've ever had hands down. His exams can be vigorous but his class is an absolute must-take, a professor I will never forget.

Dr. Bengal is one of the best professors I have had at OSU. Funny, engaging, and eccentric. Cheat sheets for exams, but make sure you go to class and pay moderate attention because the slides are not self-explanatory.

He's an eccentric and funny guy with excellent music taste. Initially, I was intimidated and scared for my wellbeing in this class, but because he's very good at explaining and teaching, I ended up doing very well. He also gives good feedback if you meet with him during office hours.

Super interesting and eccentric guy. His voice is really funny to listen to. Explains the materials very clearly and tries to answer questions all the time. Even though data analysis seems like a dull class he actually makes it a lot more engaging. Would recommend taking any of his classes.

I really enjoyed this class, and though I may not have always understood the material, Dr. Bengal was more than willing to help with any questions I had. He may talk incredibly fast but I guess he's just excited about the material. Also, he might be a stand up comedian in his spare time (need confirmation on this)

11/10 My favorite professor EVER. I hate college, but looked forward to his class every day. He wants students to succeed, actually learn, and treats you like a colleague. His assignments were fun to do (I know, it sounds like a reach,) exams are fair (plus cheat sheet!,) and lectures are top tier. TAKE HIS CLASS TAKE HIS CLASS TAKE HIS CLASS!!!
Literally the best professor I've ever had. He's super funny and it's easy to get an A in the class if you do the homework and pay a moderate amount of attention. Couldn't recommend him more.

A very funny professor who always asks us to "bombard" him with questions and is very quick to respond to emails. He provides full and short lectures on each chapter and puts an emphasis on individual exploration. We had a weekly quiz, discussion posts, questions, journal entry/ activity, and a quiz make-up activity with no exams or tests.

professor bengal is soo funny and makes sure that he is available for students whenever they need. it's very clear that he genuinely cares about teaching and his students. the course load is heavy and confusing at times but very interesting. if you're confused about something, he provides great explanations and will clear things up. def recommend

Super funny guy. Lectures aren't mandatory but are never boring - I would recommend attending but he posts abbreviated recorded lectures that are super helpful as well. His tests can be a bit difficult, though - it's sometimes hard to tell exactly what you need to know versus what is extra information. Regardless, he's wildly entertaining.

I love Doctor Bengal. He is kind but also extremely hilarious in his classes. His mixture of self-deprecation as well as his beautifully crafted power points make him my favorite professor I have had yet. Though the lectures are not attendance-mandatory, you don't want to miss them (especially for his random tangents).

For Halloween, he dressed up as Steve from Blue's Clues and all of us collectively spent the lecture trying to figure out if he was in costume or not, because it wasn't far from how he dresses daily.

11/10 would attend a lecture of his about paint drying.

I don't do rate my professors, but he deserves an awesome rating. The funniest professor and one who cares about his students. He's always asking us for questions and when we ask them he is so happy to answer them. I hope he stays as a professor for a long time because he can make learning fun.

Dr. Bengal is funny & relatable, but I did not like his course, he's unprofessional and swears a lot, and although the tests are relatively easy, the format rubbed me the wrong way. Plus, when I took his class, I missed a thing or a religious holiday, and he wouldn't let me make it up. That assignment was the difference between an A- and B+ for me.

Dr. Bengal is an amazing professor!! I took another one of his course in AU 2021 and I absolutely loved it.
