Dr. Bengal is amazing at lecturing and he has a way of making sure that you remember the material being taught. Although the exams can be challenging, he is always open to help during his office hours. Definitely recommend!!

Professor Bengal is a very swell guy. I would say lectures are mandatory if you want to have success in this class, especially if you do not have a background in data. I did not know much going in, but I feel pretty confident moving forward because of this course. It's not easy material but I feel lucky I had Dr Bengal to help.

This was by far my favorite class this semester. Dr. Bengal is super engaged in the teaching material, funny and has high standards for students. Homework, projects and exams were challenging but fair, and I learned a lot from them (they did not feel like mindless busy work). 100% recommend this class and Dr. Bengal.

Dr. Bengal is extremely knowledgeable in the topics he teaches and is very generous with extra credit opportunities. The course itself is test heavy (4 exams) but his are not cumulative and they're over less than 5 subjects each. Bengal is very enthusiastic and encourages students to ask questions to make sure they understand the material!

SB is very enthusiastic and caring and is very knowledgeable. We had 7 homework assignments that were only 7 questions and 7 points each and they impact your grade a decent amount. we had 4 exams, 30 questions (mcq) and 30 points each. plenty of time to prepare and ask questions if you need to. Lots of extra credit opportunities, so take them!!

Bengal is a hilarious professor. His lectures can tend to get ambiguous and his exams reflect such ambiguity, but if you show up to class and pay attention and take good notes you will be fine. His self-deprecating humor made me want to go to class.
Dr. Bengal is a really good professor. Lectures aren't mandatory. He is really funny and engaging and makes taking this course fun. I would definitely recommend taking this course again.

I loved this class. the lectures, videos, and readings Professor Bengal gave us were so engaging and interesting. I learned so much in this class as well. Also, the online class had no tests. It was very easy if you just did the work. Also, there were so many extra credit opportunities to boost your grade.
super funny guy. made lectures really fun with his wit and occasional curse word. but genuinely works to make sure all of this students understand the material. you can tell he truly cares!

Dr. Bengal's lectures are very entertaining. Even though attendance isn't mandatory, you'll want to go to class. There are four exams, but since you don't have to do math they aren't that hard. As long as you understand the material you'll be fine.

This was just a freshman seminar class, but Dr. Bengal made it really fun and informative. Other than a smaller assignment every 2ish weeks, it was really just showing up to his very enthusiastic, engaging lectures that would get you an A.

I took ap stats so I pretty much knew everything in the class already, but still went most days because Dr. Bengal is so great. He is super funny and talks really quickly so his class isnt boring. If you go to lectures, study, and do the extra credit, you will do good in the class. I ended with a 102% because there is so much extra credit.

I've taken two classes with Dr. Bengal (online and in-person) and both were great! He's super energetic and cares about teaching a lot. He responds to emails very quickly and encourages office hour attendance and will make appointments around your schedule. He does talk a bit, but the information is always relevant. By far my favorite teacher @ OSU
Didnt like his lectures. Rambles wayyyy too much
Best professor I have had at OSU. Gave lots of extra credit and did not go in-depth with math concepts.

Bengal is very clearly interested in what he is teaching. This was my second class with him and I will be taking more. As long as you put in effort in his classes you should not have a problem passing.

Dr. Bengal is a great choice for Data Analysis. His lecture videos were very helpful and clear on what he wanted you to know. Quizzes and homework were not always easy, but he did offer make-ups for quizzes, which saved my grade, in addition to the extra credit opportunities outside of class. Strongly recommend him if you struggle with math!
Dr. Bengal is a great professor. He makes course content interesting, relatable, and funny. He creates clear criteria for assignments and discussions - he wants you to succeed in the course!

Professor Bengal's class was a great class to take. His pre recorded lectures weren't hours long and they were very straightforward. You can tell he wants students to succeed and understand the material.

I loved this online 4-week course! It was supposed to be in person, but COVID. He is the funniest prof ever, and all lectures are pre-recorded. No proctorio because 'infringement of rights.' Super brief 10-min lecture overview and then you go through powerpoint on your own. No exams, just weekly quizzes/discussions. I put in about 2.5 hrs/ week

I didn't even need to show up to class because I had already taken a similar course, but I showed up just because he was that funny and I enjoyed sitting there and listening to him. He made me genuinely laugh out loud so you should take this course just to brighten your day honestly.

This professor is one of the funniest most charismatic guys. He truly knows his stuff and also relates it to nerd topics somehow? Due to COVID everything was online but his lectures were just as hilarious and funny as in person. He also makes sure everything is up to date and current with events happening right now. Also, NO BOOK!
Prof Bengal is a great teacher and does his best to make class interesting. He's a kind person and will work with you so that you will succeed. A true gem, there are not many professors like him.
He is a great guy who makes the lectures interesting and funny. He is a very nice relatable guy and his classes are a good time. He is very passionate about what he does and his class is fairly easy.

dr bengal is hands down one of the best professors I have had at osu. he makes everything so clear and simple. his lectures are interactive and interesting! he knows how to make sure concepts "click" before moving on.
He is the nicest guy and always willing to help. He is so goofy it makes class really enjoyable. Lots of big terms but just listen to him to explain it.

I would highly recommend taking this class with this professor. It's a hard class but he tries his best to 'not make you want to gouge out your eyes'hi. I won't say that's a direct quote but he makes funny remarks like that often to break up how boring the material is.

Bengal is one of the funniest professors I have ever encountered. However, I thought that PSYCH 2220 was hard and there weren't that many opportunities for points. However, I worked hard and I still got an A. He is a really great guy and always willing to help. I also took him for PSYCH 2300 the following semester and it was a lot easier.

Professor Bengal is a 10/10 guy. Highly recommend! His exams which are the bulk of his points are more scenario based but are very similar to his daily and weekly questions! Remember to do those because those small points can add up. Also, Top Hat points are very important but he usually did it once a week! He's hilarious!! Such a gem.

One of the funniest, enthusiastic, and all-around caring professors I've had at OSU. He really enjoys teaching the material and tries his best to make it interesting even if the content itself is not. He will help you through any questions you have and makes everything clear. Show up, do the notes, and study some before exams nothing too crazy.

Professor Bengal is hilarious and he tries to provide real examples to psychological concepts. He does TopHats for attendance about twice a week, but attendance is not mandatory. Either he or his TA is a TOUGH grader though. There were only a few assignments and if you make the slightest mistake on any, your grade will tank. Still a fun prof. tho.

He's funny and tries to make lectures interesting. I didn't think his tests were bad, the problem is that he (or maybe his TA) is a really tough grader when it comes to the homework assignments. Would have gotten an A if it weren't for that. He says attendance isn't mandatory. but then he does tophat questions and makes them grades.

He is funny and overall nice. His tophat questions are always hilarious. Attendance is not required but he does tophats sometimes and they count towards your participation grade. Reading lecture slides is much more helpful than going to lectures because he is pretty good at making concepts very confusing by explaining them. Tests are hard.

Dr. Bengal is probably the funniest lecturer I've had thus far. He makes the material enjoyable, and helps you relate the content to real world situations. He DOES talk very fast, but he recognizes this and makes a conscious effort to slow down. He always asks if we have any questions before moving on. Definitely make sure to read the textbook.

Dr Bengal is an interesting professor. He is funny and a little neurotic. He is very knowledgable when it comes to psych of security, and he makes it easy to understand. Test material is right from the slides. Attendance is optional, but will occasionally do a TopHat question that helps build attendance points, but they are throughout the semester.

Dr. Bengal is very lively and tries his best to make the generally dry subject of stats more interesting. He tends to focus on concepts rather than calculations (all multiple choice exams). The structure of the class is slightly annoying due to there only being 200 points, so you can miss very little to get an A - so I wouldn't call it an easy A
best teacher ever! super funny, really informative, and he's really committed and intelligent.

He is super cool and funny. Doesn't grade too tough and does an awesome job teaching the materials. You don't necessarily have to go to class but he does tophat randomly so you can miss a good amount of points not going.

Dr. Bengal is an amazing teacher. He talks fast, but he makes research methods in psychology somewhat interesting. He is funny and explains things very well. There are not many grades to go off of, and I only used the book for practice questions for exams but that was helpful. Definitely, go to class.

I think he's a great guy but personally wasn't a fan of his teaching style. Very quick speaker and his slides were long and PACKED, were hard to study from. Definitely had to put in work to get the grade. Material in class is mind numbing but he does his best to making it interesting. Grades: 3 Exams, 3 assignments, and tophat attendance points.

Dr. Bengal is an entertaining, funny and very knowledgeable lecturer. I learned a lot from him. The material can get a bit dry toward the end of the class. Tests were very fair. He is very helpful in office hours and is friendly; however, he is slow to respond to emails. You're graded on very few things, just a warning.
Boring class but fantastic lecturer. Has a great knowledge of research methods and can communicate the knowledge clearly to the class. Would take class from this guy again.
A great professor. Humor was well mixed with constructive feedback.

Psych3325 was a very interesting course and Professor Bengal was the best teacher I have had so far at OSU. He is kind, extremely funny, and gives very entertaining lectures that make learning the material enjoyable. It is important to do well on the exams as there are very few grades in the class, but if you study you are sure to do well.

Steven is amazing. I added his class a week after classes started due to dropping a different 2367 class and it was one of my best decisions of college. He's an amazing prof and has hilarious lectures. There aren't many grades in the class though so study for the tests! Also follow the guidelines for the papers. Trust me.

This is a really dry class, but Dr. Bengal's funny, cute and dorky style makes it bearable. His teaching is great and you can tell he really cares about his students. However... have to say his tests are kind of weird and hard to get used to, and he doesn't answer emails very well. So I have a little bit of mixed feelings, but overall not too bad.

Professor Bengal was a pleasure to take. He doesn't make you buy a textbook and he gives you  study guide before each exam. Basically, if you do the study guide and read over it, you will do fine of the exams. There's a few trick questions on each one, however. He's funny and really up to date on events.
The most passionate prof I have had thus far! He never takes attendance, but his lectures are so entertaining that I never skipped. Exams are tough, but the class is definitely worth taking.
This guy is the truth.  Very passionate, knowledgeable, and most of all, enthusiastic.  I highly recommend taking one of his courses.
He is very funny in class and create great atmosphere in class, he made all the materials seem so vivd and fun it is the best class I'm taking this semester really enjoy it.

His lectures are very thorough and he really knows what he is talking about. Makes them interesting by adding a lot of memorable examples. Attendance wasn't mandatory but he did randomly take attendance every now and then. Exams were a little tough but if you study the material well you'll be fine.

Good teacher, explained everything pretty well and class was super easy, only really have a group project at the end which is graded very generously.  I personally wouldn't take again because I felt like I didn't really learn the material, but that shouldn't stop you from giving this class a try
She was a very nice and good teacher. Her class is very easy and there is no final just a little super easy presentation

Professor Lee was very good at explaining psychological concepts, and giving students more resources to explore the concepts on their own. Class was SO easy, no tests or quizzes, mainly graded on participation (weekly reading) and group project at the end of semester. Honestly it would be really hard not to get an A in this class.

Dr. Hines was great. I was thrown into this class by my advisor because of a last minute class drop by the school, and he made it enjoyable. He usually responds quickly to emails which is great. The class is VERY lecture heavy. He posts base level notes, but adds a lot of information in the lectures. The exams were all open note!

Dr. Hines was a very sweet and passionate guy. Lecture was not required and all the materials were online and open book open note for exams. He would try to get the class to talk and no one would, so he is a very interactive professor even with a class of 150 students. He is very sweet and forgiving!

Dr. Hines is very well prepared for class and an overall nice professor. Grades in this class are almost all group projects and writing but it's very manageable. Overall I didn't have to put much work in to get an A and this class was still very educational.

The exam format was horrible. I couldn't finish any of the exams due to 10 multiple-part short-answer questions that needed sources in the given time. He took forever to grade and with no feedback. Huge semester-long group project that constantly had issues. The class is not for people with busy schedules. I passed, but I wish I never took it.
Lectures aren't very exciting but assignments are generally easy and is a fair grader

Prof. Hines is such a caring professor and you can tell. His teaching style is so in touch with the world and Genz, and the media content he pulls to explain concepts is so good. He is genuinely a funny and entertaining teacher and I would recommend his class to anyone.

I took this for the diversity GE and loved it.The class is easy-open note quizzes, 2 group projects, and a weekly discussion board.  Dr. Hines is a great professor.  He tries to make class fun, keeps students engaged, and has a very modern outlook which is really great for this class.
very easy course and he tells you exactly what you need to know for exams. weekly discussion posts and 2 group projects so not much work at all. he's very accessible and willing to help!!

Professor Hines was nothing but good to my class, and he did a really good job teaching for it being his first semester teaching that particular course. His classes are very interactive, tests are open note, and he tries his best to listen to everyone.

Essentially a psychology of sociology class. Tests are easy and were open note, some group projects were fun. Information was very interesting and very applicable to people doing social sciences. Professor did his absolute best to stay politically neutral despite political nature of some topics.
Dr. Hines was a pretty good professor. His course content is pretty easy to understand and gives good lectures. His exams were open-note as well. Highly recommend!

Pros: Cool younger teacher. interesting material. open note exams. does unique projects like infographics and podcasts. funny lectures
Cons: lots of readings. delayed grading. granted it was his first year teaching this course, but not very organized. fun overall tho. didn't really learn how to rule the world

Overall the class is pretty easy but there are a lot of assignments for this class that take up a considerable amount of time and are only worth 3-6 points. Super nice guy and he makes lectures interesting, but the 1-2 long response discussion posts that are only worth 3 points are hard to find motivation for.
Smart.  Knowledgeable.  Expert in his field.  Loves his subject matter.  Pay attention.

he's a good professor and very knowledgeable, but sometimes his explanations are still very complex and don't help. the coursework consists of 5 short quizzes (the lowest quiz is dropped, 10% of your grade ), a 2 page paper (15%), a midterm (30%), and a final (45%). the final is graded on a curve. the slides he posts on carmen are super unhelpful.

His slides did not match the provided slides on canvas they were just graphs from the books. The class consisted of 5 pop quizzes, a paper, and a midterm/ final. No information or study guides were provided it was me and the textbook for this class (which didn't help much). Sign up for this class if you want to teach yourself.

This dude would talk in the most monotone voice making him extremely hard to pay attention to and his lectures were just him talking about graphs given in the textbook. 5 quizzes, a paper, and a final exam are the only grades. Quizzes have nothing to do with slides. Would go off on very long tangents about things not related to class. Horrible.
The worst professor I have ever experienced.
I can't hear what he is talking about wherever I sit and he had a lot of quizzes. The ppt he gave in class and on carmen are totally different! I won't have any of his class again.

- talks very quietly and is extremely hard to hear during his lectures. He offers a zoom which is nice if you cannot go to class 
- barely has any grades for you and the quizzes and tests are so hard and barely has anything to do with what is taught in lectures 
- no review guides, the slides only have pictures of graphs and no information

very intelligent guy but only gives slides he thinks are important. slides are just pictures of the graphs from the book. overall grade in the class is based on 4 quizzes, 1 paper, a midterm and a final. quizzes and tests are on completely different things that are not provided in the slides given
He teaches his classes in a very low voice that is impossible to hear, his lectures have nothing to do with the exams, and he provides no review. If you want to fail the class you can choose it.
Worst class ever in OSU, he is so boring and the quiz is unrelated to what he taught, half of the class got 1/0 from his quiz. Don't take this class. :)
Prof. Jagacinski is nice guy and fun to talk with. Really learned a lot from his class.

This class is supposed to be a basic psych requirement but I struggled a lot. He hands out notes but he leaves A LOT out so they don't make sense and he doesn't post any notes online. Pop quizzes, one midterm and a cumulative final so there are not many points. He is super nice but I would not recommend taking his class.

This is a class I'm assuming is supposed to be easy going and basic. His lectures have little if any relevance to the text book making it confusing to refer between the two for the tests. He wastes an unbelievable amount of paper, printing out his slides (which do not make sense even when explained). 0 study guide material, small amount of grades.
I'm in his class at the moment. I have tried so hard to pay attention, but I am confident that it is impossible. Painfully boring.
Excellent teacher.  Enjoys and knows his subject matter.  Friendly and helpful.
Though it's been nearly 5 years, I often refer to what I learned in this class in discussions with colleagues.
Richard is smart.  Pay attention.  You might learn something.  Actually, he is quite brilliant.  He enjoys his work, and is generally interested in progress of the students.

His lectures were boring, but he gave us handouts to follow along with, so that was helpful. He has 2 paper (easy), 4 quizzes (easy) and two test (moderately easy. I think I would take his class again.
His "slides" were incomprehensible. There were about 4 total grades in the class. It was boring.

Dr. Jagacinski was a very poor teacher. He never taught anything and his lectures were boring. Also, there are not many points in the class so it is easy to go down a letter grade and his midterms are pretty hard
Didn't teach us anything. Boring.

Spends entire 2-hour lecture posting random graphs and charts with no flow or purpose. Very hard to follow or understand, and overheads are hard to see. I expected a lot from the course, but was disappointed to see how he teaches. I haven't had his exam yet, but I'm not very optimistic given how he presents the material. Course packet's unorganized

Oh boy.  Dr. Jagacinski is a really nice guy, and it is obvious he knows this material well.  That being said, even he is not excited about the material.  Add to that, he teaches off of an ancient projector that forces one to be at the front of the lecture hall, it equals a pretty dull class.  Attendance is mandatory because he gives 4 pop quizzes.

TERRIBLE!!!! DONT TAKE with him!! He is a nice person, but his lectures were unbearably boring. The information is incredibly hard to understand from him. All he uses are graphs. It is just graph after graph after graph. Seriously consider a different class or teacher!!

Dr. J. is a nice enough guy, who certainly knows his stuff but not all people were meant to be teachers.  Several times he disgustedly woke people up who were sleeping in class.  Sure that's disrespectful of the student, but his monotonous droning and old fashioned overheads are somewhat responsible.
If you want to take a good nap, take his class.

He's a very nice guy who definitely wants his students to understand the material. This class is difficult and you have to read and completely understand the text (which is dry) in order to do well on the test but he is willing to help you and will explain the material until you understand if you go to his office hours. I would recommend.
Very difficult and hard. Boring

Dry sense of humor. Attendence is a MUST!! He gives 4 pop-quizzes. Lectures weren't very exciting, he uses overheads straight from the textbook. Dr. Jagacinski is very informative. Mid-term and final were difficult but do-able. It is best to read the textbook before class

dry/goofy sense of humor that I liked; lectures were informative although material itself wasnt always very interesting; genuinely nice person- you can tell he is brilliant, but if you want extra help you will need to be proactive about it; make sure you show up to class!

Probably the most boring professor I've ever had to listen to. His lectures are torture. They're boring and he tries to be funny but he's not, so that makes it even worse; also, you're forced to sit through these horrid lectures because he gives 4 pop quizzes. He pretty much only uses overheads that are straight from the textbook.

Common sense material, he's very boring, doesn't take attendance but has ONLY pop quizzes. It forces you to come to class. His lectures are extremely boring and he doesn't even have power point slides.. just boring overheads.

Very boring material and he is really confusing to listen to. If you don't know too much about stats.. he's not going to teach you the basics. He assumes you already know a lot about the topic. The material is so dry. He tries to slip some jokes into the lectures.. but it's just painfully boring.
Boring boring boring.  Just looked at graphs all day everyday for an hour and a half. Don't miss class or get the notes from someone else if you do miss it.

He is a really nice person and cares about you understanding the class.  It is a very boring class and text, but if you can get past that and work hard you can still do ok.  It's a hard class and he does just lecture with no notes other than graphs, but he'll help you as much as you're willing to go meet with him.

This class was tough to stick with.  He lectures right out of the book, (the text is pretty dense, too) and his lectures are boring (uses graphs on an overhead.)  But, if you can stick it out, he does use a curve since his exams are so tough.  It makes for a long quarter, but it's not impossible.  He is a nice guy, and does try to be helpful.

Mr. Jagacinski is a really nice person and it seems important to him that the students understand what he is teaching. He is very dedicated and knowledgeable. One time he actually went out of his way to help me correct the APA format on my paper, which I thought was really nice because it wasn't his place to have to do that. Lectures might be a lit

Basically teaches straight from the book, but only covers maybe 10% of what is tested, and the book itself is practically one big block of monotonous text, so have fun reading that. You will get full points taken off of papers for improper citation and then find out those points are equate to full points off the final grade.
Oh my god....I've been here for 4 years - worst teacher ever.  Very nice - but you WILL fall asleep in this class!!! Monotone, Mumbling..the works!

Dr. Jagacinski is a nice man who is genuinely interested in his subject matter.  His degree is from Harvard or some other Ivy League school and his genius exceeds his ability to communicate the material clearly.
the course was good, but the tests were difficult, and the homework was unclear. It would have also been nice if he had presented research from the last decade.
This is an easy class, if you don't don't get this guy. I heard all the other professors are more clear and they have better grading systems. Get another Professor for Pysch 300!!
Very nice man.  This professor really knows his stuff, and will explain if asked, about anything you don't understand.  Don't be afraid to ask him.  I recommend him to other students.

VERY BORING!! It was very hard to stay alert and attentive in his class. It was also rather difficult to understand him, he mumbles alot. His tests are difficult unless you read and do flashcards on terms and stuff for the class.
Borrrring...lectures on an on about pointless over head graphs that everyone can barely even see.  The class material is easy, but the tests were hard and confusing.
He's VERY boring and lectures seem pointless but then he pulls random questions out of nowhere.  He's generally easy, but you'll be bored to tears.

Prof. Cravens-Brown is a passionate and engaging instructor. Her class is manageable with lots of extra credit opportunities. The content is interesting, and she genuinely cares about her students' success. unstuckstudy was a helpful study tool alongside the readings and lectures.

Weekly homework: chapter reading & reading assignment (usually 30-45 minutes). Lectures were interesting & engaging. Attendance tracked by top hat questions (2-4 per class). NO EXAMS. 4 application assignments (~15 questions). Participation in research program is required; took up time outside of class but was easy. Minimal work. Highly recommend.

She's great! The lectures aren't necessarily mandatory but there's solely in-class activities that make it more encouraged for students to attend class. There was no final exam for us which made it stress-free. She has a somewhat strict no phone policy and a laptop zone in the lecture hall but it wasn't a big deal since notes weren't required.

Please disregard my grade because I missed far too many classes; otherwise, I would've gotten closer to an A with minimum effort. The lectures can get pretty boring. She does have her TA's watch for people getting off-task (on phones, on laptops, talking, etc.) so if you cannot help yourself with that kind of thing, maybe choose another professor.
She sure has energy! Its a fun class but if you don't really like psych it can be a drag. She is super entertaining and keeps the students engaged.

I'm obsessed with Lisa CB, she is so funny and really wants to keep her students interested in the material. You can also tell she genuinely cares about all her students and wants them to do well. She's super kind and there's not a ton of outside work, I would definitely take her as a professor again!

Easy to get a good grade. Provide 12 extra credits. Use Tophat to take attendance and ask questions. Can miss a few lectures and recitations based on your grade. No final exam, but optional quiz point make up exam(score will add to quiz category as extra credit.)

READ THE ENTIRE SYLLABUS. I didn't and it put me behind a lot on REP credits. But CB does a good job keeping students informed of deadlines. Very funny and interesting person; lectures weren't bad. Extra credit! Lots of points are from in-class. This isn't a class you'll want to skip if you want an A. Weekly quizzes are just vocab, pretty easy.

Such an easy and interesting class! LCB is a very fun professor and is very approachable. There is plenty of extra credit throughout different sections, and she sets the course up so you can earn more points than you can get, basically giving you points to throw away.

Dr. Cravens-Brown is so cool. I had my intro to psych class in a lecture hall of 600 and was still able to learn the content and do well. She's easy to contact outside of class and is always straightforward with grading. Overall I'd highly recommend taking a class with her!
Vocab quizzes are given every Tuesday but super easy! I would love to take her again!

She is an easy laid back teacher. We have weekly 5 point quizzes that take maybe 15 minutes to study for every Tuesdays. She goes through a lot of case studies and examples when she lectures. She does top hat questions which are like general questions for points every class.

Dr. Cravens-Brown was awesome. This class was about psychology podcasts and was mainly a discussion-based class. She was very interesting and intelligent and it was a very engaging class that felt like a community. It's very easy to get an A as long as you show up every day and do the discussion posts.

She's friendly and approachable, and I enjoyed taking her class. No textbook, but a lot of reading in her class, mainly research articles for group projects. Be prepared to communicate/work with many different people in the class; almost every day is a group project with a randomly-assigned group. Graded on completion of assignments and attendance.

Conflicted about her - very good, high quality prof who's passionate about clinical psych. but her teaching style is unorthodox - no lectures which means no notes/slides. Class title is deceptive - not actually about clinical psych. Exams are essay for better/worse but lots of extra credit opps. grading is strict. nothing is hard but unfamilar.
She made class fun and interesting.
She made class funny and interesting. I never skipped this class. There aren't any major surprises on her tests, just study the material and you'll do well.

You need the book for the online exams. I can't imagine trying to do those without it. Participation matters a lot, it's like 30% of your grade, but she's hilarious so it was rare that I didn't want to go to class.

Definitely the best professor I've had at OSU! Couldn't bring myself to skip her class because it was so fun. Exams are all online, and a decent amount of your grade comes from attendance/participation. She makes topics that are sometimes seen as taboo really easy to discuss. Show up and make sure you get the textbook and you'll pass.

Dr. CB is awesome! Super engaged in lectures and gives really relatable/funny personal stories. Makes the topic of sex very comfortable and fun. Uses random tophat questions for participation points. Exams are all online and decently easy. Buy/rent the book. Definitely recommend taking her and this class, you won't regret it!
She is just wonderful. So engaged in class with interesting material to lecture on. She doesn't lecture on what is on the textbook so that part is up to you, but the textbook is an easy read.

Lisa was a professor that cared A LOT about what she taught, as well as having a good relationship with her students. This class style is different than others in the way that there were no exams, almost all of the points came from in-class participation and assignments. Its a good filler class, but there is work during class unlike others.

I learned so much from Lisa in my gender class. For one, she didn't teach a regular lecture(slide)class. The students were communicating with each other, and the conversations had a lasting impression on me. I find myself talking about the content of the course to everyone I encounter now. Thank you for this delightful experience, Lisa.
I thought I didn't like her for like a good month or 2, but turns out she is really cool. I just didn't  how it sounded as if she was getting smart with me when I spoke to her.
I loved this class. The professor is super hilarious and makes the class engaging. Easy A if you take notes.

I love Lisa!! I've taken two of her classes and she's been great for both of them. The tests can be a little tricky, especially for this class. (But I also didn't read as much as I should've.) Her lectures are fun and interesting, and she's very approachable and loves to help you out if you go to office hours.

Dr. CB is my favorite teacher I have ever had. The subject material is my academic focus, so I'm biased in saying that it is super interesting, but I think most people agree, it rocks. The tests are entirely based off of in-class lectures, so you have to show up, but you'll want to come anyways because the class rocks.

She is one of my favorite teachers, you can tell she loves what she does.   She also does a great job at making lectures interesting.  But make sure you attend class, she does a lot of participation points

Professor Cravens-Brown was amazing!! A lot of particpation so attendance is a must!! But you'll find yourself wanting to go to learn about the day's discussion and subject! She was always bright and cheery and really made the class quite delightful!

SO many in class assignments, hard tests, but she was a good teacher and stats was required for a psych degree so if you have to take this class then I would take it with her because I was actually able to understand the content

Dr. Cravens-Brown is an extremely intellectual woman, and I recommend taking her Human Sexuality class to anyone who may be interested. She's very clear about grades from the get-go and attending class is paramount since almost all of the exam questions are based on lectures (maybe 15% come from the book, so you need to have it as well).
Great instructor but as far as exams go, 90% of the material on the exams is from the lectures so good notes are key.
Lisa was AWESOME. Assignments and Exams were all online. Allows you to use notes. Lectures were fun and active. Nothing really bad to say. I would recommend her class!

LCB is a good teacher, but you will be very dependent upon the textbook for most learning. Reading is essential. HW every week and easy exams. I studied <1.5 hrs per exam and scored very close to perfect. 5% total extra credit also helps. TBH, I didn't pay attention too much in class and did well. Only took class for the minor. No major complaints.

Dr. C-B is a very enlightened professor. She does more than deliver information because she challenges the student to think for themselves. Some people may get offended because she is very research based, but take it as a grooming lesson. Especially if you wish to go to grad school or do research. She's down to earth and great at what she does.

Though everyone I've talked to says they loves her as a teacher, She can not teach this class. Nothing makes sense. Her slides are useless. I am surviving in the class by learning everything from the book, not her. Take this class with another professor!
She is a brilliant teacher. It wasn't hard at all to pay attention in her 8am class. Loved every minute of it.

She is a breath of fresh air! I talked about loving her class so much my friends started coming to her class just for fun. She is wonderful. If you come to class and do your work, it's an easy A. Online exams, attendance is extra credit and the online reading assignments are fascinating! TAKE THIS CLASS.

Great class, many easy extra credit opportunities, online exams. You can tell Lisa is knowledgeable and passionate about the subject, but she also adds in humor to her lectures. You'll need to go to class to do well, but I didn't purchase the book and ended up with a high A.

She is an extremely interesting teacher, and I enjoyed her vibrant personality and sense of humor. She knows how to teach and she does it well. The tests were all on CARMEN and timed, but it helped that I was able to glance over my notes if I needed them. Overall, she is a solid teacher, and I would recommend taking a class with her.
This professor was alright. The class in general was pretty easy (it was mostly just a vocab centered class).

I was really excited to take a class with her due to all of the good reviews.  boy was I wrong. She comes off as very rude, and has no problem failing you on the group project if she doesn't like the topic you chose. She also spends a lot of time telling boring, personal stories that don't relate to the material. The tests are easy though.
Best teacher ever!!!

This class was really easy. She let us redo 2 tests (so that you can get up to 100% on them). However, I was not one of the people to actually like the teacher herself. Every single time I asked a question, she'd reply with, "Oh, I can't tell you that." She did this 3 separate times. So I went to the TA and she would answer my questions.

I stumbled onto Prof Cravens-Brown out of a mutual interest in subject matter. Doing an independent study is pretty difficult but she made it soooo fun. She would have me in tears sometimes because she is so funny!!! She was able to communicate the difficult material in a very clear way. She is a wealth of knowledge and will keep you on your toes!

MOST AMAZING TEACHER AT OSU! Human Sexuality is the most interesting and fun class and Lisa is truly the best teacher I have ever had! She is informative, makes class fun and is really passionate! If you get the chance to take her class, DO IT!
Stats in Psychology may be a boring subject but she makes it very interesting and is very helpful its a somewhat difficult class but she breaks everything down very well.
She is the best lecturer! She is so helpful, clear and interesting. Take every class she teaches, you will not regret it.
Awesome professor. She's hilarious and her lectures are enjoyable
I absolutely loved this class. Very helpful teacher who loves what she teaches and it shows in how she conducts herself during classes. Could not recommend this woman enough!
She was the best professor I have had at OSU. She is energetic and makes material interesting. There is no busy work in this course and options for bonus points.

She is literally the best prof I have had at OSU. Her lectures are extremely entertaining and you learn a lot. She uses a lot of humor and stories about her family/life to keep class awesome. Take her for whatever class you can. This class should be required for the major!

Dr. Cravens-Brown is a great professor to have. She tells great stories about her children and family that relates to class. She also shares things about when she was doing therapy. She made boring and sad topics entertaining and easy to learn.  Great class to take.
Enjoyed the material and the attituted she had while teaching us. I would recommend this class to anyone even semi-interested in this subject.

She is an awesome teacher. Very knowledgeable over the topics she teaches and is very genuinely interested in helping people and see them succeed. The class is very interesting and she is very entertaining in her lectures and incorporates interesting media. I would 100% recommend her as a teacher.

Interesting class and the perfect professor to take it with!  She is very clear and enthusiatic about what she does and there will never be a boring day in class. Homework reading material is even interesting.  I have learned and will be taking a lot out of this class. Highly highly recommend!!

very entertaining! topics are interesting and she tells fun stories at the same time. tests are simple if you study. attendance isn't mandatory, but you'll want to go and get the notes... she also gave extra credit to those with high attendance.

Very eccentric teacher - fun to listen to. Had one issue with my project grade - she told us after we turned in the project that if we did what she asked us, we would get a B, and only by doing extra will you get an A. Otherwise nice teacher.

She's a lecturer, so her main focus is to teach, which is a very nice change from many professors in the psych department. Class was fun and interesting with plenty of extra credit. Definitely my favorite class this quarter.
Awesome, awesome class. Lisa was a very enthusiastic, interesting and helpful professor. This class is pretty easy just make sure you go to lecture, a lot of info on the exams come just from lecture!

She's very very good! I like the way she arrange the schedules and she's very helpful if you have questions. lectures are very important even though she will let you make up attendance by finishing extra homework, going to class very helps a lot! take her class.
Makes class very easy and entertaining.
attendance isn't mandatory but there is a sign in sheet every class - if you attend all of them you get bonus points. really fun teacher, tons of stories and always an interesting class to attend
very good attitude toward teaching! Makes stats easy to understand.
Awesome professor, relates subject matter to real events and stories from her life, couldn't imagine a better prof to teach a class on sex.  and you'll learn a lot!

Lisa is such a fun and exciting teacher! I love her! She will make you burst out laughing in an 8am class. Lecture is mandatory since she doesn't post any notes. Grade comprised of 5 carmen discussions, 3 midterms, and a non-cumulative final. Go to class, study a little, and you will have no problem. I highly recommend taking a class with her!!!!!!
She is awesome..very recommended
Lisa Cravens-Brown is extremely dedicated to her students. Her class is full of hands on learning and humor.

The class was great, Extremely interesting.  I enjoyed the subject and she kept me awake for an 8:30 am class.  The only issue i had with her was that she is opinionated and pushes her views on the class as FACT. She claims to be open minded, yet she only considers her own ideologies to be correct and dismisses all other possibilities
Loved her.  She was the most interesting professor I've ever had.  Great sense of humor, made me want to go to lecture.

I think Lisa Cravens-Brown is an awesome teacher who communicates the subject matter very clearly and thoroughly! She is very passionate about the subject matter which makes the class atmosphere very inviting and relaxed. It was an 7:30am class and she made it so interesting that it was almost impossible to fall asleep in class! Awesome teacher who
Very helpful and extremely enjoyable class environment! You can tell she loves her job and that's what makes a great teacher! Very clear and is quite funny! :) You'll enjoy this class!
excellent and very easy course. quizzes online with the book and periodic projects. no midterms, and no final if you do well on the quizzes!
Great teacher, not very difficult. This class was a lot of fun, but there were so few points that if you missed a few, you were in a bit of trouble. Would definitely recommend, though.

Great teacher, enjoys teaching students and helps keep classes interesting with stories about all of her experiences in therapy.  You do lose points for missing a class, but exams are based off the notes with maybe 3-5 questions from the text.  Overall she's great and I'd recommend any of her classes
Professor is really funny and helpful!  My all-time favorite class at OSU!

She is awesome. One of the best, most passionate professors I have ever had. Attendance was mandatory, but that was no problem, I love going to class. She has a great, fun, goofy personality and really know her psychology. She definitely goes out of her way to help her students and has helped me out a lot. Love her.
She is fantastic! She's a great teacher and she's really funny. The class is already interesting and she makes it even better. Take this class!
Very very good teacher. She knows what she is talking about!

Pretty decent class, you have to attend to get the attendance grade (20 points). Also, there are 4 exams, 30 points each plus 6 extra credit homework assignments worth 1 point each. Pretty easy class if you attend lecture; she doesnt post the notes or outlines online or send them to you via email, even for an excused absense.

Attendance is required.  If it weren't, the only people who would be there are the girls who love to giggle ecstatically as she brags about how great her two kids are.  I aced every test but got a C on attendance (reading the book is much more enjoyable), which is telling of her teaching abilities.
Awesome class! She's an awesome teacher and makes lecutres hilarious.  This is the only class I look forward to going to... def take her 333.02 class on human sexuality!

She was great! She is very very liberal though and she devotes much of the class to homosexuality and not much to heterosexuality.  Overall she was funny and the class is very easy! Only textbook question on a test was a bonus no need to buy.
She makes her Psych 333.02 class interesting and funny.  She also has a lot of stories.  The exams are not the easiest, but she offers extra credit.

She's fantastic! I took both 540 and 333.02 with her and loved both. She's very personable and engaging, as well as incredibly helpful. Exams are not the easiest but don't let that scare you away because you will enjoy learning from her. She is definitely my favorite professor at Ohio State.

Puts outlines on Carmen that follow the notes in class.  Just print the outline, come to class, fill it out and you have an easy A.  You could also get by with filling it out yourself via the textbook, but it was easier to go to class.  The exams came directly from the class notes.

Extremely interesting lectures.  However, her tests were somewhat hard, but she curved significantly at the end of the quarter.  One of my favorite professors at OSU.  Make sure you go to office hours...it helps out a lot!

She is very energetic and makes the class interesting.  I think her 530 class was easier than it normally would be because I took in summer quater.  There were 4 exams.  Each was multiple choice and 30 minutes long.  She also provided extra credit opportunities.
She grades her homeworks easy, do all of the extra credit. Her exams however were very lengthy and sometimes difficult.
Great, nice, and helpful teacher.

Laura is an AMAZING professor because she is so personable and  very organized. She relates her real-world experience to what she is teaching and makes the classroom experience relaxed and enjoyable. Probably the BEST professor that I have ever had an Ohio State and I'm not even a Psychology Major. She made it worth getting up at 8:30am.

Everyone should take this class! Its so fun, interesting and not too difficult. Homework is easy, test arent too hard (if you study)and there are lots of opportunities for bonus (do them). GO TO CLASS and you wont need to read, however, this is the greatest book you will ever have for a class.

I thought she was wonderful, and I sincerely wish I could take more classes with her. Her lectures are all power point, and everything is explained in complete detail. Absolutely NO NEED to buy the book, as she only will quiz you on her class notes. The quizzes are fair, and HW is graded easily. You do not want to have to do the 4th h.w. (its hard!

Hit or miss.  Material was interesting, a few too many personal ancedotes, and she likes to use semi-tricky questions on quizzes.  She is incredibly knowledgable, and I took a lot away from here.  I got a B from just going to every class and never touching the book.

She was a pretty awesome lecturer. Kept up with current research and told us alot of side stories that help in remembering the material. Very helpful professor, clear and interesting lectures. I would definitely take her class again and recomend her class to anyone else interested.
The lectures are very interesting and she has alot of fun stories to go with them! I thought the quizzes and homeworks are very fair and information is very interesting!

Had her for 333 and 530.  Both classes were relatively easy.  Lectures go right along with the book, and tests aren't too hard if you come to class.  She's funny and often lets class out early.  Overall, a really good professor.

Probably one of the least sympathetic people I have ever met. Lectures were boring, homework was pointless and she doesn't grade them herself. All together worse professor I've had here. My greatest sympathy's go out to those of you who have class with her
Very interesting class, and she is willing to help you succeed on the tests. Very approachable and lectures were easy to follow and went right along with the book.
Tests are a little hard but keeps class fun and interesting.

Great class, great teacher! Didn't mind the class starting at 8:30a because the information was so interesting. She told great stories about her kids and was very willing to answer questions. No need for the book, quizzes are pretty easy if you study and the final isn't much worse. Highly recommended!

I adored this class and this professor.  Quizzes are easy if you attend class and go over your notes. The text book is totally unnecessary. This professor is funny and makes lecture fun to attend; I managed to make it to class nearly every day for an 830 lecture.

Very helpful teacher. She is also very kind and funny. The class material is not very exciting but she does a great job to keep you interested (considering it is a psych requirement). Homework is not too difficult and she grades fairly. Tests arent super easy but they arent too hard. She likes applied questions rather than definitions.

took human sexuality with her.  class was interesting and humorous at times.  assignments were not very hard and graded fairly.  sometimes she took a long time to return our graded homework.  don't need to read the book -- nearly all of the material is presented in lecture.  just attend class and you'll be fine.
Really good teacher, makes class fun and interesting.
Great professor.  She's very helpful, informative, and fun but you will definitely have to study for her tests.
No Comments
You rock girl :)

She is an awesome teacher.  There is not a lot of work either.  There is reading but you do not have to do it because her notes are so good and her tests come from her notes.  She is available for help if need be.  She also makes the material very easy to understand.  I highly suggest taking any class with her.
She's fantastic!
LISA IS AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!! The best prof in the department

Dr. Deshpande should not be your first choice when learning Psychology. She is very verbose and her slides do not cover the material well. Her lectures are not very engaging, but if you are super interested in the material and do the hw (which is not that bad) you can finish the class with an A.
She was great and tried to answer abstract questions to the best of her ability. The practice forms are tedious but easy if you do the reading. Overall would take again for another class.

From my experience with Ms. Prurtha, she's a very sweet and caring professor. Her lectures can be a bit boring, but the class is easy and there's a lot of opportunities for extra credit. I have had her for both 3310 and 2300. I struggled 3310 because her teaching was confusing, but I'd recommend her for 2300 for an easy A and not much work
This professor cares a lot that students are actually learning the subject matter. I got a lot out of this course and now feel much more confident about reading research.

I'm really enjoying this course with Prutha. The research articles she picks for the practice forms are always interesting, and the forms although a lot of work have helped me understand the concepts better and do well on the tests.
It's her talent that she can make such an interesting class so boring

Professor would talk in circles, and her lecture slides are all graphs!! She doesn't explain things well, and it's incredibly difficult to take notes with her rambling. The majority of the points were from the 3 exams and one small project. Be prepared to read the textbook and teach yourself all the concepts. Interesting topic, terrible professor.

Super slow grader. Grades the reviews that are supposed to help you study for the test a month late and the exams are nothing like class. When you do ask questions or go over homework, she gives complicated and unclear explanations. In order to get credit for your homework you have to be present in class, but other than that going is useless.
She seemed like a nice person but her lectures are extremely unengaging. I could never focus on what she's saying. The forms are easy though

This professor really cared about whether students understood concepts and explained things several times if students were still confused. She encourages students to ask questions and come to office hours. I recommend that you attend lectures, instead of having extensively information on the slides, she verbally elaborates on concepts.

Tests were very poorly worded. Her lectures were painful to sit through and she speaks very monotone and *maybe* 2 people out of the 80 in the lecture would answer her questions (she asked a lot) and it was very awkward and cringe. I tended to just zone out in that class and get annoyed. I stopped going to class in the end, not worth going.

This class is not the easiest with this professor. Making sure you read the textbook before class will help in order to understand the lectures. Professor does not seem engaged in the material and the lectures are confusing and hard to understand in class. Attendance is not mandatory. Exams are not the easiest. I would take with another professor.

This class isn't particularly difficult if you read the textbook and attend class. But the lectures are just truly painful. She is very quiet and asks many questions, but she is not engaging at all, so the class has so many awkward silences. She also kind of gets upset when nobody participates. She only uses pictures in lecture slides.

Ms. Prutha is an awesome teacher! She is so sweet and nice. Her class is easy, there are no homeworks! You should however show up to class because the notes are very helpful for the exams! The exam is not timed and is open-notes, so be sure to be in class. This professor is a bit shy, so interact with her and answer the questions. I recommend her!

I have her for Psych 1100, Shes such an easy grader, honestly you dont have to try to hard for this class. Just take the notes and youll be fine. She does open note exams and she gives out extra credit also. The only thing that I didnt like about her was how she sometimes seems confused about what shes teaching. She has lack of passion.

Shes a very timid person but also very kind, and knows what shes talking about. PArticipate in class otherwise its so quiet and awkward. The tests aren't hard, but if you don't read over the materials you won't do well. Don't assume this is an easy class because its psych. Part of the points are given if you just do it (like the REP experiments),

I had Prutha for her first semester teaching and loved her and her class. She is incredibly helpful and dedicated to her teaching. The few times I emailed her, she responded within hours with very detailed answers. Her class calls for a lot of note taking and term memorization but she gives great examples for remembering the material. Recommended!!
Aita was a great professor, everything is very straight forward. While attendance is not mandatory, there will be top hats or in class activities that you will get a zero on if you don't attend.

100% would take it again it was the easiest A of my life, he is very understanding and most assignments are online. Lectures are a little boring but push through and go because there are random quizzes to check attendance.
Absolutely loved having him for Psych 1100. He connected info in lectures to modern, real-world examples. He is understanding and easy going. I definitely would recommend taking this class with him.

Easily one of my favorite professors. He is very helpful and very clear in his lectures. I had never really been too interested in psychology before this class, and he completely flipped that. There are some classes that I never want to go to class, but for this class, I never want to miss it.
He is such a caring guy. Class was super easy but I did learn some. Definitely take him for Psych if you can.
Aita is so cool and chill. He actually loves psych. This class is easy because exams and quizzes are open note and online. Aita is super funny too. 10/10 recommend !!!!!!

Amazing person and teacher! I loved this class and coming to class every MWF. The class material was interesting and easy to digest. I found this class to be very easy to understand and a great first class for psychology!

He is the best!!!! So understanding and is here to genuinely help you succeed. Psych is easy in general but he truly made the class a breeze. It is pretty lecture heavy but the weekly discussions are really engaging. He is pure and great!!

Professor Supe is engaging and passionate, but the class is quite challenging. Expect tough exams that make up most of the grade. Utilize Unstuckstudy and other study tools to stay on top of the material.

I had heard great things about her, but absolutely not for this course. Every week we have knowledge recaps to complete that are supposed to be based on what we learned in class that week, BUT she NEVER finishes the content. I'm talking 100+ slides and maybe gets through 20 and then leaves you to fend for yourself. I have to spend HOURS on them.
Dr. Supe was a great, personable professor who incorporated lots of fun examples & interaction in her lectures! As long as you go to class & engage thoroughly with the material, you'll be fine.

Dr. Supe was great! You definitely need to go to lectures to understand the material, but if you do you'll find clear explanations for concepts described in interesting ways. Class is largely exam based but she lets students use notes so tests are pretty easy if you come prepared.

Might be different in person, but I am taking this class asynchronously and enjoying it. Dr. Supe is a great lecturer and obviously very passionate about her field. Her quizzes are straight forward as long as you can apply the material you learned.

She is a great teacher, is very funny, and is open for comments and questions. There were some assignments but the exams were worth a large portion of the grade. They were very difficult and the averages were usually C's. I had to work very hard to keep an A.
Super memorable lectures. Very caring Proff. Exams were MC and very easy. 10/10 would take again.

super engaging and well-organized class, attendance not mandatory but i found myself coming every day bc of interesting content and delivery. also tests are really based on lectures + lecture slides (posted on carmen), not the book - even tho ur grade is really dependent on how you perform on tests, if u listen + go over slides youll be fine!

She was an amazing professor! I personally would not take the class if you aren't the best test taker, as your grade is primarily your exam scores. It definitely isn't homework heavy at all and she's very accessible, but it isn't a show up and pass kind of class, you have to definitely put in the effort.

In addition to learning foundational concepts of the course, I learned a lot about teaching -  and about teaching online specifically - from taking Dr. Supe's Online Behavioral Neuroscience course at Ohio State. She considers not only content delivery - which she does exceptionally well, but also how students learn to learn. A rockstar educator.

Pros:Is an engaging lecturer and assignments are reasonable. 
Cons:Believes she is more accommodating than she is. Students are able to turn in homework or quizzes three days late twice, not the worst extension policy, but she frames it as being so understanding even though three days is not a lot of time when you're really going through it.

I would recommend taking Dr. Supe for an upper level neuro class! She is really fun and assignments are pretty easy. Three group projects throughout the semester, but all very manageable. She's very accessible outside of class and fair grader with clear expectations.

She is so awesome she made me switch to neuro, she is hilarious so passionate about her subject and a super engaging and sympthetic professor. I would normally hate a professor if I didn't get an A but I just cant hate her she is an awesome lecturer and makes the material funny and engaging. I'd recommend her to anyone!

Extremely well set up online course. Sends out weekly reminders and wants students to do well. Wants to get to know you when you drop by office hours. If you watch all the lectures, it is pretty easy to get an A. Be prepared to spend about 10-20 hours watching lectures per week, though.

Great prof, she's an excellent teacher. Great at breaking down complex topics and approaching potentially sensitive topics thoughtfully and respectfully. This class was group-project heavy, but it's full of overachieving neuro majors, so you should be fine. There is an emphasis on the real-world application of knowledge and science communication.
I would recommend taking this class because its really hard. The teacher is nice but you will most likely struggle.
Amazingly knowledgeable and informative. Notoriously difficult core class, wasnt so hard online and asynchronous but not sure if it asynchronous still

I had Dr. Supe for both PSYCH3313 and again for PSYCH4501, and she is just as wonderful. This class is themed around sleep and the brain, and there are no exams -- just three group projects and weekly Carmen quizzes. She cares a lot about the wellbeing of her students and is one of the most understanding professors I've had at OSU.

Dr. Supe is a very kind lecturer, and I enjoyed Behavioral Neuro! The notes are extremely long, however, and tests are difficult with little time to complete. If you are struggling, Dr. Supe is a great person to access and is understanding. The coursework is very time consuming, but if youre interested in the topics then its really not horrible.

Phenomenal professor. She really understands her students. Class was very organized and consisted of two assignments, a quiz and a video essay each week. The quizzes come straight from the PPT, the video essays are very simple and are only like a minute long. The assignments can be reading research papers to doing infographics. Cool class too!

Her class was the most challenging one I've taken as a psych major, but it got better later in the semester. Most of the content was learned from the lectures, which could get lengthy. Textbook was optional. Homework/discussions were pretty easy. Biweekly quizzes were worth many points and could be stressful because of time constraints.
The lectures were A LOT, especially for online class, but if you kept up and took good notes her exams were a breeze. Open note, open book (although I don't use the book) and no surprises at all.

Class was completely online and done on your own time. There is a quiz every other week that's worth a decent amount, however, there is a decent amount of extra credit that really helps your grade if you do it. If you have questions office hours can be very helpful. They told many stories told and videos can get tedious but overall decent class

Took this class during the times of Covid so it was all online with pre recorded lectures. I found it very difficult to pay attention during these lectures especially when each module had at least 10 lecture videos. Professor Supe seems like a great professor, but I wish she would have cut students a little slack during these hard times.

COVID-19: Class was asynchronous, gave lots of opportunities for points via quizzes, assignments, discussion boards. Great lecturer, enthusiastic delivery of material. Assignments could be busy work and somewhat insulting to collegiate level students (scavenger hunt activities?), but fine for the points. Be prepared to keep up with lectures.

So funny and lively! A bright and warm person who keeps students engaged and feeling cared about. Always looked forward to the energy and chuckles. Her exam questions are typically "what does this do, what is its structure, what is its function" or "what would happen if this structure/system was impaired". Know all that and you'll ace :)

Professor Supe was an awesome professor. I had her in Summer 2020, so things were a bit odd with the new online schooling but she made everything you need easily accessible. It's important to take notes during lectures and can take a bit of time if you take a lot of notes. The lectures and notes you take are important to study for exams.

I have to say, I was nervous to take this course online and dreaded it being one of the harder core topics in Psychology. However, Dr. Supe makes it really informational and fun to learn. You can tell she loves teaching the topic and has a big interest in aspects of the brain. Would recommend 100 percent. Pay attention to lectures and do the work!

i LOVE dr. supe!!! shes so energetic & truly makes difficult topics easy to remember through tips, tricks, acronyms, and real-world scenarios. her tests are easy as long as youre attentive and attend her lectures. cant get an A if you rely on just her notes. however, she gives hints on what to study & is always open to questions after class

Supe cares very much for her students and is passionate about the material she teaches. She is on top of emails and willing to meet with students however she can. Three exams and a research project are the major grades. The project isn't bad, but the exams can be difficult if you don't study. Attendance is not mandatory, but I would recommend it.

Supe is incredibly passionate about her students and subject matter. She responds to emails incredibly quickly and is always accessible. She even went to Oxley's three times a week so we could chat with her (it was an online section). The exams are difficult, and you need to watch all the lectures, but if you prepare, you can pass. 4 exams

Dr Supe is my favorite professor so far. Shes incredibly knowledgeable about the class and you can tell she genuinely cares about both what shes teaching and her students. Everything on her tests she covers in lectures so the textbook wasnt really needed. If you want to take an interesting class with an amazing professor take this one.

My favorite professor at Ohio State. She is so funny and makes lecture so enjoyable. If you review the notes and attend class her tests become fairly easy. I wish I could take another one of her classes again.
i did online psych with supe and theres SO MUCH extra credit. its definitely not a hard class but don't be stupid and not try
You'll learn tremendous things in Dr. Supe's class. There is quite of bit of reviewing required to be successful in this course but it is one of the most rewarding lectures I have ever attended.

Dr. Supe was a fantastic professor. She made lectures exciting and engaging, and is very communicative with her students if you need help. The class requires a sufficient amount of studying, but if you put in the effort this class is very doable. You can tell she is super passionate about the field and does a good job at spreading this passion.

I took this class online, which made it a bit more challenging because it's your own initiative to watch the lecture, but the recorded lectures are super good and helpful, and the tests are pretty much just off the slides (I never used the textbook). The assignments are a nice grade buffer, and you don't have to do all of them. Great class!

Dr. Supe is one of the best professors I have experienced in my first year at OSU. She is honestly a wonderful person and really cares about the success of her students. She does go very fast through lectures but you definitely get used to it. Anyone who has to take 3313 should take it with her :)

Brings an amazing energy to every class. Cares a lot about the material and cares for each individual student. Super accessible outside of class and will remember you a long time after you take the class and check up on you. Tests arent too hard if you Review the PowerPoints and show up for class to pick up the key sections. My favorite professor.

I received a high A in the course but stopped going to lecture after a month. She constantly brought up her kids when it wasn't necessary and over complicated easy concepts. I walked out of her class feeling much more confused than when I started. Exams are straight from the slides, but it doesn't hurt to read the textbook.

Supe doesn't drop grades, offer study guides/reviews, or more than 1 extra credit assignment. Exams cover a LOT of material. Supe is a really great lecturer, but when other OSU profs are known to be easier and it's your grade vs. theirs, I'd definitely recommend trying to take this class with someone else.

Dr. Supe was a really good professor. This class was super interesting and I looked forward to going to class. She did a good job of making the information clear and understandable. You can tell she is very knowledgable. The class is fast-paced so if you skip lectures you will be lost. I studied a lot but it felt very rewarding to do well.

Dr. Supe is the best professor I have had yet! She is such an entertaining lecturer and if you go to lecture you will learn so much and enjoy doing so. Shes so caring and very motherly However, attendance itsnt mandatory and if you study her slides well and you should do fine on the exams. The exams are the majority of your grade, though, so STUDY

Supe knows this class very well. You will learn TONS of information very quickly which is what makes this class so difficult I CANNOT stress enough how important it is to review outside of class. Be ready to take good notes and pay attention because a lot of the information is base level for the rest of the class. She gets a bad rap but good prof.

I believe her reputation is unwarranted. She was arguably one of the best lecturers I've had and I would definitely recommend taking her class. She is passionate in what she teaches and her lectures are very interesting. Her exams are fair and straight forward. Very much enjoyed this class. You do not need the book.

She's really funny (even if she doesn't always mean to be) and it's clear she's really passionate about what she does and what she teaches. It moves pretty fast and is honestly way harder than I was ready for, but she keeps the information interesting and throws in some strange examples that get lots of laughs. If you need this class take hers.
Very good.

She's nice and you can tell she understands the material... However, she flies through the material and gives no indication as to what will be on the exam so you just end up studying hundreds of slides per exam. Exams are impossible I literally studied for HOURS and failed almost every one. Honestly if you need a neuroscience, take cognitive neuro.

Dr. Supe was a pretty good professor and gave useful comparisons and mnemonics for concepts. She tells you right away that you don't need the book and everything is based off her slides. Exams were pretty fair and easy, but if you don't understand something prepare to be patronized. I would definitely go to another professor for help.

Dr. Supe was an amazing preofessor! She told us she typically teaches neuroscience and that it had been awhile since teaching psych 1100, but she did a fantastic job of making sure we covered the basics and giving us thorough background information to help us understand. Lectures were hilarious. Would definitely take her again!

If you love neuroscience/ psychology then you will love this class. She made things so interesting and was clearly very passionate about what she does. That being said studying is a must for this class. A little tip: get a white board to draw out some of the brain mechanisms. I went from a C on the first exam to a A+ on the second with this method.

I took two of Dr. Supe's courses, 3313 and 3310. This was a mistake. One of her courses (3310) was much easier than the other. Her content is lecture heavy, you do not have to go to class, but the textbook isn't used so its helpful to go. Grades are all exams with no curve and no extra credit. She also doesn't offer much if you are struggling.

She is very passionate about the material she teaches and tries to make the class interesting. The exams aren't too hard, and she is very helpful in office hours. She emphasizes the importance of learning over straight memorization.
Solid choice in professor, IF you are willing to put in the work for it. Go to class so the lectures make sense. Best advice is to read lecture slides ahead of time since they are posted online.

Took this class with her & dropped it after 3 midterms because I still had a C after studying like crazy. Dropping was the best decision I made, I retook it next semester with someone else & got an A. SoI dont recommend her to anyone. This is the first neuro major class, & I know so many people who switched their major after taking it with her!

She is awesome. Her class was super hard and had to retake it, but it's due to difficulty of material. She is super flexible about meeting to help you, she gives lots of examples in lectures of concepts she discusses. She refuses to curve unless literally everyone does poorly. Would recommend her to anybody!

Just reads off of slides. Gives no study tools - practice questions, study guides, etc. Exams are online, & makes you show her your score when you finish and basically judges you to your face if you do bad. It was so embarrassing. Bad at answering questions, leaves you more confused. I studied more for this class than any other, & had to retake it.

Probably the worst presentations I have ever had from a professor. I understand that textbooks provide better detail to material but her online lectures were pretty awful. Quick, didn't write down what she was wanting to say on the slide.

Dr. Supe is a wonderful professor. Make sure you come to lecture. She provides PowerPoints, but they wont make much sense if you dont go to lecture to hear her explain them. Dont buy the book. I got an A without using it. The exams are fair, just make sure you study the PowerPoints. Shes really funny. Highly recommend her as a professor.

I've had Dr. Supe for two classes now and enjoyed her lectures each time. The book is not needed for this class as all the information that will be on the exam is covered in the posted PowerPoints. The exams were all multiple choice and online, meaning you would see your score immediately at the end. Great teacher, would for sure take again.

Dr. Supe is a funny, but her lectures are pretty dull. Make sure to bring coffee to class. Be prepared to takes notes on your laptop. We do entire chapters each lecture, so you won't have time to hand write notes. Study hard. Don't worry about the textbook. Exams are all based on her slides. Dr. Supe is nice and understanding, so don't be afraid.

I loved Dr. Supe, you can tell she is passionate about the material. I found the course to be super interesting but be sure to study for exams ahead of time(I recommend study groups). Exams are going to be pretty straightforward and only cover material from her lecture ppts. It's definitely not an easy A but if you put in the work you will be fine.

The course is set up for neuro majors even though psych majors are required to take it too. Your grade is very dependent on your exam scores. This is easily the hardest class I've taken and had to retake it because I failed the first time. The second time around, I am still struggling to get a passing score because her exams are so tough.
Bad course structure

Dr. Supe is easily most amazing professor I have had at OSU. She is really knowledgable on the subject and really tries to get students curious. She is so funny and really keeps you entertained. Don't buy the book unless you're a neuro major. If you skip class, you will fail the course. The tests are difficult but fair.
She wasn't necessarily hard to listen to but be prepared to fly through material, and have a lot of studying on your own to do.

Supe is a great professor. She makes lecture interesting and you can tell she genuinely loves what she teaches. Her tests cover a lot of material and require a lot of studying, but the information comes right from the slides. Lecture is not needed, but for some of the harder concepts it helps to hear her explain it.

Huge ppt lectures, each 40-80 slides. She covers about 5-7 of these per exam. Tests are based on slides, over random details. Not accessible, office hrs are appointment only. Rushes at end of class after going off topic constantly. No extra credit, study guide, or practice questions. Can't drop 1 exam like every other 3313 teacher. Many dropped.
Exams were easier than what I expected. Use powerpoint slides to study. Covers a lot of material in lecture but just get the big picture to do well. Cares about her students!

Each week there are two small assignments, a small short answer (sometimes opinion based) and a short quiz that can be retaken. The midterms and final are in person and very easy as long as you read the night before.
Genuinely cares about the material which makes for engaging, easy-to-follow lectures for difficult information.  Also, friendly and understanding of students' difficult schedules.
