One of my favorite professors at OSU. This class is extremely detail-oriented, but lectures are engaging and Dr. Supe is very enthusiastic. Find what works for you. I found reading the book very helpful - some test questions are based specifically from the book however, the book isn't absolutely necessary to pass class. Overall, A+ professor

There is a lot of material covered in this class and it's a little hard to keep up during lectures, but there is a study guide and the test is straightforward. Homework is easy and book wasn't really needed. Supe was really helpful and gave a pretty substantial extra credit assignment.

Not a hard of a gen ed, but I put little to no effort in it admittedly. Lectures were a bit boring. You can skip this class and pass if you have good test taking skills and go over basic concepts, but there are in class points to receive that'll likely make you go anyway. Didn't respond to my emails either, but overall is pretty clear.
She is very caring and helpful. Her lecture uses examples to clearly explain the definition in the textbook.

Kristin Supe is awesome!! Her lectures are interesting (I actually paid attention), and I loved how she explains concepts clearly and includes relevant examples to go along with them. Tests are over a lot of material, but memorize all the info on the lectures and you won't need the textbook. Can get away with skipping occasionally. Easy homework.

You don't need the book to pass, but I advise paying attention and going to lectures. I printed out all the slides in advance, and that helped me a lot, but she is very good in explaining everything and gives study guides for her exams

One of my favorite professors. Enthusiastic about the material and easy to talk to. Very straightforward with her lectures, if you go to class and pay attention you will be fine. Her tests are pretty much straight from the slides, and you can pretty much cram and be okay on the exams. The final isn't cumulative either, which is a plus.
GO to lecture and follow with notes posted on carmen. DO the study guides. Fair tests. Tries to make lectures interesting.  Grade consists mostly of four exams including final.

The BEST behavioral neuro professor. She loves what she does, her lectures are clear. The textbook is helpful but you really don't need it. Go to office hours, she's great to talk to. The tests are detailed but by far the easiest of all the introductory neuroscience professors'.

Incredible professor! She cares so much about the content and makes it really interesting, so go to lecture. She makes a really complex topic more understandable to the general public and has fun while doing it. Study her LECTURES and ask questions. Make practice questions for yourself to study and you'll do great!

VERY good professor. Definitely knows her material. Tests are pretty specific and you will need to study, but that aren't horrible. Lots of information but she makes the class fun. Puts the slides online so attendance isn't necessary but does 5 random checks throughout. Overall, great teacher and good class.

The class is tough. It is a ton of material to cover so the lectures are fast-paced and overwhelming. However, Dr. Supe does everything she can to make it better. She is hilarious and a great person, she's super excited to help with the class or with life in general. Slides are online, but attendance is a good idea because it's a hard class.

Dr. Supe is by far my favorite professor so far at OSU. She gives very thorough lectures, makes the information interesting, and is really genuinely interested in her students doing well. Her tests aren't extremely difficult, but you have to know the information pretty well. If you study and work at it, an A is easily achievable.

She was ok. She was definitely entertaining. I took her for an upper level course (3000) and it was a challenge. You really have to put in work when it comes to exams. I didn't know what to study for and with the large amount of  material and limited questions and didnt know where to focus, which is painful when you have 3 other classes

I really enjoyed this class. I was skept to take it at first bc I thought it would be hard. She provides a lot of info so know how to take good notes. Most exciting thing we got to do was touch a human brain. Final isn't cumulative so that's a plus. You'll be thankful you took her class.
Amazing, amazing, amazing... did I say amazing

One of my favorite professors so far. She makes class enjoyable, all exam material is covered in lecture, questions are straightforward. Study with a friend and quiz each other. Don't lose hope if you don't do well on the first exam, because they get progressively easier (don't get cocky and not study, either). But youcan get an A just by cramming.

This professor truly wants her students to succeed, and if you are going to take Psych 3313, she is the professor I would recommend. The information in her slides is more than enough and she allows time for questions on lectures before and after class. Be ready to study hard for the tests, if you do so, you will succeed!

Kristin is a great professor. She truly wants every student to succeed and will give you the materials to do so. She provides organized notes to follow, and attendance is not mandatory. I recommend attending each lecture, however, because they are interesting and helpful.

Definitely a LOT of material. Her lectures and ppts. are super organized so you don't have to go to class, but it's worth it to go because she makes it so interesting. Hardly any HW, grade is based pretty much on the tests but they aren't hard (if you study!) one of the most knowledgeable teachers I've come across. Take her if you get the chance!

Professor Supe is one of my favorite professors I've had at OSU. She's very funny and engaging. You don't need to go to her lectures but most people do because they are so enjoyable. You definitely have to study for this class as the tests cover tons of information. I would definitely recommend you choose her as a professor.

She is an amazing professor. Her assignments aren't hard and the exams are straight from the lectures. Go to her lectures because she will tell you what you dodo not need to know for the exam. Also really helpful if you ask her questions after class and is genuinely interested in getting students to enjoy her class! Very engaging, great professor!

Very good teacher. Very easy tests too. She gives 2 midterms and a final. She's fun and makes the material enjoyable. I went to all the lectures and got really good grades (A), but you don't even have to go to lecture as she puts all her notes online. Very easy and would recommend 1010.

Dr. Supe is hilarious and engaging without trying too hard. She understands that some of the material is boring so she switches things up and interacts with students a lot to keep lectures interesting. I really felt that she wanted us to succeed as opposed to those professors who try to trick their students, and the tests are fair. Take her class!!
Supe is cool. She does a great job lecturing. Not much homework. Come prepared for exams and stay on task with the readings and you should do ok.

Overall great professor. Very organized and clear about what you need to know. Tests are pretty detailed but straightforward and mostly memorization. You don't need to attend class to do well in this class but lectures are interesting and helpful. Would definitely recommend taking her class!
Awesome lectures, fun test questions (integrated hermoine and ron into a few questions on the final), don't have to go to class at all but she makes it fun and its easier to learn from it.

Best professor I've had at OSU.  Great presenter, well organized, and made lecture fun and interesting.  If you can, make sure you take a class with this woman, because quite honestly I consider my experience with her a treat.

hilarious teacher and really enjoys teaching. presents info very well. makes information very clear. taught anatomy and biology to me better than any bio professor at OSU. take this class, but be prepared to study. worth it.
she was such an awesome teacher and made dry, difficult material simple and easy to understand! absolutely loved her.
She is the best psychology professor I have ever had and explains the material so clearly and so well--take her!
She's an awesome lecturer and makes semi-difficult material super easy.  I loved her.

She is really nice and easy to approach. Her quizzes are easy, her class is overall easy. You dont have to go to lectures all the time because it is easy to catch up but the midterms are slightly trickier so study for those. But she is an amazing teacher and makes the class fun.
Solid. As a sophomore I've only had two other good teachers. I enjoyed the class. She showed funny and interesting clips pretty much every day.
Love her!

Kristin was awesome! She was is my favorite teacher thus far. If you ask her a question, she'll give you different examples to make it clearer. She was really nice and really funny. Her notes are very organized and easy to study.

Kristen is an awesome teacher! Coming into college I was extremely nervous but she made the transition to my first Psych class very smooth.  Her quizes are super easy, and if you know the vocab, you'll ace all of the exams. She's always open to talk to and she is easy to approach.  If you have the chance, definitely try and get into her class!

She is very kind and helpful. Her lectures are all based on ppt and there will be class nots to be distributed every class. Attending the class is not necessary, reading the textbook in dorm is enough. but it definately helps to listen to her lecture, cuz it ll be so boring to read the textbook everytime. her lectures are full of funny stuffs!

Kristin is alright. Her lectures are all ppt and she uses a lot of videos. Her lectures are fun and all, but they get to the point where it's TOO fun. Her quizzes are ridiculously easy but are nothing compared to how hard the exam is since she doesn't make them. It's gotten to the point where I'll rather teach myself the material than go to class.

Awesome teacher! Class is pretty much 100% from the book, and so are all the quizzes and tests. READ THE BOOK! If you know the bold and italicized words and key concepts, you will ace the class. It's not always necessary to attend if you read the book, but in harder sections it definitely helps, and sometimes she gives extra credit just for coming!

Horrible professor, DO NOT TAKE. Treats us like we are kids & explains stuff that is COMMON SENSE down to the detail. Attendance is mandatory and will tank your grade if you don't go. Everything you learn in the class, you can learn by yourself by reading the textbook. LONG BORING lecture, she doesn't care abt anything but her class (1/2 Post)

Dr. Pino is really nice & probably a good person, but her classes are so painful, I wouldn't recommend them to anyone. She treats college students like elementary schoolers, continues lecturing past scheduled time, uses tophat to track attendance every class, uses respondus for exams & knowledge checks, & schedules exam reviews outside of class.

Attendance is mandatory due to TopHat, and it can drop your grade if you aren't there each lecture. Material was not difficult, but lectures were very drawn out and felt over explained. Knowledge checks are open book, which was a plus. The 3 exams were not terrible. She's a hard grader on missions. Not a terrible class, just hard to pay attention.

Dr. Pino was great. She has clear expectations and outlines the class in a consistent way. I averaged a B on exams (without much studying) which weren't too bad. Reading the textbook isn't even necessary if you show up. However, do NOT skip her class. She does not post lecture slides. TopHat and knowledge checks count for a lot! Just show up!

Dr. Pino was a great professor, and I would love to take another class of hers! Her exams are pretty straight forward and easy to study for and she's a pretty easy grader when it comes to the writing assignments. Attendance does matter for knowledge checks, but otherwise she's very accommodating and has great late work policies.
She's very nice and her exams are easy to study for. She does knowledge checks only available during class time and it's locked by a password so attendence is pretty much mandetory.

Dr. Pino is an exceptional professor! She really cares about her students and truly sets everyone up to excel in her classes. She gives plenty of resources and is very organized in her teaching style. I would love to take another class of hers. She, in my opinion, is the ideal professor. She's very accommodating and compassionate, too!

Dr. Pino was a great and understanding professor. Yes, her lectures were slow to get through but she made sure everyone understood the material. She is easy to reach for help on issues. Tophats are a big part of participation so, come to class! Overall Dr. Pino cared a lot about her students!
Easy class but the lectures were a drag to sit through and you had to go for points even though the material is all common sense.

She really cares about her students and always tries to get you to engage in lecture. There is a lot of reading, but lectures are straightforwards, but she moves through them slowly and over explains stuff. Attendance pretty much required to get points on tophat and not miss in class assignments. Accommodating and SLDS friendly.

Interesting class but over explained everything. Had guided notes so if you missed class could not get them, and always did tophats. Exams are pretty easy and there is extra credit. Really nice professor just did too much sometimes.

I'll give everyone a crash course. The lectures are long, but you must go as questions for a grade are taken there. Dr. Pino is a tough grader on some written assignments. Study for exams and you'll do fine. Dr. Pino is kind and generally helpful, and it isn't her fault the class isn't set up well. Dr. Pino is easy to reach by email too.

A fantastic person. She is the first professor to have treated me like a human at this large school. She realized the pandemic was hard on us and gave us all of the help she could. The class is pretty light. Main thing is to get the experiments done early and study for the tests.

best professor ive had here so far. She is so caring and wants to see her students strive and succeed. The exams were a bit challenging, but she made class fun. Didn't get much homework and she was always there to help. You can tell she loves teaching, she is always happy and cheerful. Just an angel and so generous and kind. Def. recommend.

Class experience is great, shes very organized and certainly knows what shes teaching. You can tell she really cares about the success of her students. The tests are tough, especially the final but if you study hard and read the books youll do fine. Participation is necessary if you want a good grade too.

You could tell Lauren really cared about the success of her students; she puts in a lot of work for her students' success. However, her lectures are a bit dry, but paying attention and taking note of the examples is very helpful. Work hard throughout the course and study hard for the final; it was much harder than the midterms.
She was a pretty good teacher but very quiet. The assignments were laid out well. You had to be in class everyday to get the notes you needed unless you ask a friend. Attendance is marked.

Dr. Boyce is the best. She's personable, quick to respond, very understanding, and I genuinely enjoy her lectures. She's also really funny and has a great personality. Her grading is clear and she genuinely wants her students to do well. Definitely one of the best professors I've had at OSU.
She is just wonderful! Great teacher and person, makes the material very accessible and is always there to help you succeed
Genuinely awesome professor

A very bubbly person, gives off english teacher vibes. She also seems like she has ADHD lmao. 

Course was super interesting! Concepts were easy (basically operationalized common sense) and there's semester-long groupwork where you present a research study and write a mock research proposal.

KRISTY BOYCE IS THE BEST PROFESSOR AT OHIO STATE. Her lectures are so interesting and she is truly so kind and caring. She is always willing to provide help to her students no matter what. I wish I could take all my classes with Professor Boyce.

one group project that you work the entire semester through, easy lectures and exams, I really enjoyed the material (but i'm also a psych major). she is easy to email/talk to whenever you need help. grade based on chunks of group projects, and 3 exams. you can get an A even without going to lecture; there is one group presentation

I genuinely loved taking this class and will be looking for more classes that she teaches. Her lectures were very informative and I was always interested in what she was saying. She's very passionate and enjoys social psychology and it shows, and it definitely shows. If you don't take one of her classes, you're definitely missing out.

This class was very boring but easy. There were some interesting parts, but only reason I went is because of TopHat. Lectures are extremely long (20+ slide) and she will tell you to read the book, but you don't need to. I would have had an A in the class, but I got docked points on my project!
This class was very easy in terms of assignments and quizzes. Her lectures get a little boring but she is extremely nice and very caring! Attendance wasn't required.

Professor Boyce was so caring and you can really tell that she is passionate about her field. Lectures were organized and to the point and she took measures to make sure everyone understood everything she was teaching. I would definitely take another one of her classes.

Good professor, easy class. Don't need to read textbook, tests are easy. She records the lectures, but I'm not sure if that's because of COVID. Would probably be boring if I had to go to class because it takes me 15 minutes to watch each lecture once I skip past everything irrelevant and play it at double speed. She's caring and easygoing.

The only assignments were two group projects, 3 exams, and REP participation, so if you got a bad group things were awful. Lectures were straightforward, and she provides PDFs of the slides to take notes on. Open-note exams. Highly recommend.
The lectures were pretty boring for me, but Dr. Boyce does everything she can to make class more fun. She is very kind and helpful.

She gives a lot of work and the class requires you to read the entire textbook due to inquizitive. She does seem like she cares about the students but thats hard to display in an online course. There are no cumulative exams, just quizzes every other week on the chapters we worked on. There also is no final.

Dr. Boyce really wants her students to do well. Her lectures are super clear and she gives guided notes for each one. There are a couple of group projects and a presentation but they aren't too bad. Midterms and final are online, non-cumulative, open note. She is incredibly nice too.

One of the best instructors I have ever had. She gave on-topic and focused lectures, was understanding of personal circumstances, and was highly accessible outside of class. Go to class and take notes, and you will do well while learning a lot. Absolutely amazing professor!
Exceptional professor and made one of my first classes at OSU enjoyable!

This is my second class was Dr. Boyce. Not only are her classes typically pretty easy for upper-division courses, but she is also an amazing person. She will put in extra work to make sure you understand the material.

Truly an amazing person. Overall, the class content is very easy to understand, and watching her lecture slides prior to the lecture was plenty for the quizzes. Everything was open-note and pretty simple. Just do the assignments and you will be very successful!

She is very clear on the assignments and their due dates, always sending email reminders to get them done. The exams were open book and times, but if you read the chapter you would easily get an A. There are weekly readings and mini-quizzes about the chapter, as well as homework, but it was all very manageable and open book.

Dr. Boyce's class was pretty interesting. I appreciated the fact that her lecture videos managed to be succinct while covering almost everything we needed to know. There were quizzes every other week, which were usually pretty easy if you watched the lectures and read the textbook, and the HW was generally easy points, too. Definitely recommend!

Dr. Boyce was very kind in her feedback, though I never interacted with her in person. Her class was easy and the criteria was clear while learning a lot. It was a great intro class, not too intense but I learned enough.

Dr. Boyce is an easy grade and assignments are easy. I took this class asynchronously, so all of the quizzes were open note. Dr. Boyce is also extremely understanding and gives everyone two "oops" passes to get extensions on the assignments. She also provides opportunity for extra credit.

Professor Boyce is awesome! I learned so much from this class and would definitely take her again. Assignments and tests are straightforward, and there are extra credit opportunities. If you just pay attention during lecture and have a rough understanding of the weekly articles, you'll be fine. Overall this was a very easy class.
Dr. Boyce is awesome. Her class is super informative, and she's great at teaching the material. If you do the work, you'll get the grade you want.

A good course to fill your schedule with if you're already slammed. The assignments are very short and she gives guided notes for you to write in while reading the textbook. If you pay attention to the material and put effort into discussions/journals, you're sure to get an A

Go to class because all the notes are taken in class. You don't need a textbook or anything but remember there is no curve. I was .01 away from an A and could not be rounded but overall she is a super nice professor and it should be easy as long as you study.

Such an easy class. Very straightforward assignments and exams. I barely studied because her lectures and notes were enough to understand the material. She's a wonderful professor as well, very understanding and kind. This is my second class with her and I only have nice things to say about her. Truly a gem.

Dr. Boyce creates a really laid-back lecture environment. Always open to hearing our ideas and feedback. Exams were a breeze, you could look over the notes 20 minutes before and pass. Really nice woman and a really interesting class too.

This professor is very kind and upbeat. She is always positive when lecturing and makes being in class enjoyable. She is knowledgeable and respectful of her students. She is always open to her students feedback and comments. The class is engaging and she relates the information to our everyday life.
This class was all one big group project, but there was plenty of time in class to (almost) finish everything needed. Dr. Boyce is honestly a queen, and I would recommend all of her classes!

I enjoyed this class. Prof Boyce was very caring and always encouraged participation. The class wasnt hard. Many concepts were somewhat common sense. However, the exams were a tad harder than the lectures (not super hard though). After the first exam, you get used the setup. Id suggest this class with Prof Boyce! Easy A!

Dr. Boyce is a wonderful professor and I really enjoyed class. Exams and paper were all very easy and if you show up to class and take notes you'll do fine. Biggest issue in the class was the number of annoying students who asked constant, unrelated, questions that slowed us down. Dr. Boyce is amazing and I hope to take another class with her.

Dr. Boyce is one of the nicest profs I've ever had. She is truly passionate about social psych, and her lectures are really interesting! She is also very willing to help and engage with students, as she usually ends class 5 minutes early so people can ask her any questions they may have. Her tests are super easy if you pay attention in class.

Dr. Boyce is one of the sweetest and most approachable professors I've ever taken a class with. Always willing to answer all questions after and during class and was also open to various student suggestions. Lectures are v interesting and the class material is not difficult at all. I highly recommend taking a class with her if you get the chance!

The Most Manageable Honor Course I've taken. (Class Avearage is A 93.8%) Just make sure you attend every class,and know the concept of the slide and the main result of the research article. Most part of the video assginment can be done during class time. Great Professor! Would Highly Recommended!

Kristy was a great instructor! As long as you go to class and get the notes, everything else is straightforward. She explains concepts very well, is very open for questions, and seems to love what she does. I would definitely recommend her!

I loved her class! It was very straightforward and engaging. She's very approachable and always gives examples, explains and makes sure everyone understands. The material was not difficult at all. If you pay attention in class and do just a little review before the exam, you should easily get an A. Take her class!

Ms. Boyce is a pretty nice professor! She is caring, kind, and very knowledgeable at the same time. I remember when I chatted with her about one of the social psychology topics I am interested, and the next day she sent me the email about some researches and books she recommended. (But it doesn't mean the class is easy!!!)
I love her! She is amazing! Her lecture is amazing and she is a great professor with caring and understanding. Highly recommended for her classes.

This was my second class with Dr. Boyce and I still love her! She is the sweetest lady to ever walk this planet. The class itself is SUPER easy, everything is basically common sense or is explained in detail in lecture. Also, I asked D. Boyce to be a reference for a research position and she was SOOO willing and so excited to help me. Love her!!

Easy A. Grades consists of 3 parts 1In-class assignment is predictable. See the syllabus, make sure you go to every last class of each chapter 2Written HW, do it in advanced, and go office hour to check answer with her 3Tests , just review the slide, if miss just tell professor and she will give you her slide to take photo, since it is not posted

This woman is amazing!! So sweet & friendly, makes lectures relevant to students, gives insightful examples, and asks for opinions about exams/material covered. Her tests are directly what she teaches, but she doesn't put the powerpoints online so you have to go to class if you want the easy (but enjoyable) A

I took 2 classes (2300&3530) with Dr. Boyce, and I loved taking both of them. She presented intriguing lectures, very fair tests, and she was very accommodating to my crazy schedule when I took her class (optometry school interviews & family emergencies. The only downside for someone who likes to skip class is her random in-class assignments.

Kristy is a wonderful professor who makes lecture interesting and relatable. She is passionate about her are of expertise and relays information very well. No book is needed in order to obtain a decent grade. There are some in class assignments that count for attendance/ in class assignments but are super easy. I for sure will take her class again

She was SOOO nice. Her class was the easiest one I had all semester and I plan on taking another one of her classes next semester. Her tests count for a majority of the overall grade, but they are graded very fairly. GO TO CLASS. only 2-3 homework assignments for the semester because everything else is done in class.

Great prof for many reasons. Very passionate and gives fair exams. Always go to class because she assigns random assignments for points. Cares about students' wellbeing and eagerly answers questions. Not too warm and fuzzy. Would definitely take her class again.

Dr. Boyce is very clear and knowledgable. She loves teaching and wants her students to understand the material well. She does not try to make this class more difficult than it needs to be. A chill and fair professor for an interesting class.
Random in-class activities will be the death of you. The lecture is basically copy and pasted onto the exams.

Dr. Boyce is great! She is funny, nice, and enthusiastic. Grade consists of 3 exams (58%), 3 easy homework assignments (29%), and several random but very easy in-class assignments (13%), which she uses as an incentive to attend class, as you never know which days she will hand them out. If you show up, do the assignments, and study it is an easy A!

One of my favorite professors here because of how much enthusiasm she has for psychology and her students. Definitely recommend taking a class with her at least once. Make sure you go to class and take good notes, as she does not post full slides online.

Dr. Boyce was a really great professor! I went into the class thinking that it wouldn't be that interesting, but Dr. Boyce's profound insight and enthusiasm for the subject matter proved me wrong. Her lectures are very organized and she communicates the information very well making it easy to understand. Couldn't have been more satisfied!

Great professor! Exams were straight from the notes and super clear. Don't need to read over your notes more than once for an A. The 4 short assignments were easy and also straight from notes. In-class activities were basically free points for participating. Best professor to take this class with - nice, clear, and informative.

Her class is so easy, I have gotten 100% on both midterms with barely studying. As long as you show up (to get points for the in-class activities, which are worth a good portion of the class), you will do fine. There are only 4 homework assignments and they take maybe 10 minutes each. She's super caring and I would recommend taking her class!

I liked this woman. I took in the summer, so we only had 2 papers & 3 exams. Literally all you have to do is take  the notes she writes in class, plus her examples she gives (she doesn't post powerpoint slides).  I wish she wouldn't take off points on your exam grade if you had an excused note !!

I absolutely loved Dr. Boyce! Go to class b/c she'll have in class assignments that add up and can help your grade. Study the notes and you should be able to get a A! I liked her class so much that I tried my best NOT to skip it because I enjoyed it so much. One of the kindest profs I've ever had! Very personable too-we even grabbed coffee once!

The exams were pretty easy. Hw assignments were also easy but boring. You need to attend lecture for in class assignments and because the notes are not complete. The material was very boring for me, but Dr. Boyce is funny and tried to keep people interested.
Excellent Professor.  I really liked her, and had a great time in class.  Cute too.

Boyce was an amazing professor and I would definitely take her again. Tests were easy if you put in the work and read the textbook. She was so nice and even let me reschedule a test after a family emergency. Great professor.
Kristy was pleasant. Her class was easy, fun and her lectures were very clear. There are in class assignments which are super easy so don't miss too many days.

She was great! This class was super fascinating (though I'm biased because this is my area). The tests were not overly difficult if you went to class. The overall workload is light for this class! Would definitely recommend for anyone interested in personality!!
She has passion for this class and is really helpful.
Very clear contents in class. Just go to class, do your in-class activities, write down her added comments, and memorize terms before class :)

She was a great instructor! Tried to make material stimulating and interesting when it was a bit dry! Super sweet and ver approachable! Tests were easy if you study her lecture notes! Attendance isn't mandatory but you should attend for she gives random in class assignments.
Really great professor!! She made the topics interesting and was very helpful if you had any questions.
Really great professor, she is really enthusiastic about the topic.

Wonderful teacher--just be sure to read the textbook for material she doesn't cover in lecture. The good thing is that she will tell you what she won't cover in class, so you will know exactly what to look for in the text book.

She's such a sweet lady! Exams were easy and straightforward. Final was cumulative, but she gave a study guide so it was super easy. She had random in-class assignments that just count for attendance points, so you need to go to class. Studied directly from the slides, didn't even buy the book. Interesting class!

Easiest A of my college career. All the information was presented in class on the slides, and the tests were clear and straightforward. Lecture was boring but mandatory because she gave random, inclass assignments. Final was not cumulative like other 1100 classes; however, each group had a presentation project which was different but not too bad!

The class (Psychology of the Self) itself was very interesting.  The power point slides were sometimes confusing.  For example, she might cite a research study but not give specific details of the study (# ps? Premise?).  If you read the book along with the power point slides, the class is very easy. If you don't read, you might be confused.

I really liked Dr. Boyce. She was sweet and made lectures interesting and entertaining. As long as you studied, her exams were manageable. Had to attend class because there were random in-class assignments for attendance purposes.

I loved this class so much. Dr. Boyce is very clear when she lectures and takes her slides right from the book (though I still think it's worth it to buy the book and do the readings, but that's just me.) She's also extremely helpful in office hours and it really shows that she wants everyone to do well. Great sense of humor and personality too!

Dr. Boyce is one of the best professors I have ever had. It's true that you can't afford to miss class, but she is such a good teacher that I never had any desire not to go in the first place. As long as you put effort into studying and attending class, you should get an A no problem. The class itself is not difficult by any means.
Very nice and helpful! All info is communicated very clearly in lectures. If you go to class, you'll get an A!

Dr. Boyce does not teach blow off classes, but she's not super hard either. She is EXTREMELY willing to help!! After going to office hours my grade increased dramatically. Don't by the textbook, her notes are all you need. Makes the class very interesting. HIGHLY recommended!

Even though this class is a joke, I only got a B+. It's out of so few points if you miss a single in-class assignment its going to hurt you. You just can't afford to lose any points on quizzes &in-class assignments. So go to class. dont buy book either, her notes are verbatim from the text

One of the worst professors I've encountered. Very ambiguous test questions that are graded on exact definitions of a concept. Not to mention the midterms and final consist of 8-10 short answer responses. The papers are easy to write but she is the most nitpicky grader I have had in a long time. Take Art Ed for a 2nd writing course DO NOT TAKE THIS
Kristy was sometimes unclear with assignments, but usually tried to help. Exams were hard and based on lengthy articles that could have had a thousand possible test questions.
Straightforward style of teaching. Exams are fairly easy if you go over the notes.

easy easy easy class. attendance isn't mandatory but she gives a lot of in class assignments (they aren't worth much but are helpful towards your grade). definitely take her class if you get the chance.

fantastic teacher. No mind games. she presents the material and she is fair. Have to attend class for points, but she wants you to learn. A refreshing change from the other burned out crappy osu psych profs! Wonderful teacher, they should all be like this.
She is fantastic. Gives you all the info you need in lecture, along with a note 'guide' you can follow along with and fill in. Very fair grader and a genuinely nice person. Take her class!

She's really nice and easy, very clear, you could get all the material from the book easily but she has in-class assignments that you can't miss, so go to class.  Quizzes 1 wk before each exam were really helpful for a procrastinator like me.  I got an A- and most of my points off were from missing super easy in-class assignments, so go to class.

She's such a sweet teacher and uses good examples to explain complex material. I never used the textbook. She breaks the class up with the in-class assignments, so go if you want the points. Study for the quizzes! Won't call you out to talk in class either :)
Boring.  Just like all psychology professors, it is just reading definitions from a powerpoint.

She is very helpful and nice and I would recommend her class.  Lectures can be boring but class attendance is mandatory because she gives in class assignments that you can't make up, so missing them can really hurt your grade.
Very nice and helpful instructor. I enjoyed taking her class and would recommend it to other students.
boring class, ambiguous test questions, useless in class assignments. Shes cool but not that good of a teacher
Go to her office hours. Her exam questions are ambiguous, but she'll help you with all the assignments. Go to class or you'll miss points on in-class assignments.
So nice and helpful, will explain things in a different way if you need. Lots of examples to help you understand. Very thorough. I recommend this prof!
Took intro to social psych with her. She is so nice and is very clear and interesting in her lectures. Not a blow off class but easy to understand.
Dr. Boyce is one of the nicest professors i have encountered at Ohio State.  Genuinly interested in her field, her students, and her school.  Take any class by her if you have the choice.
Dr. Boyce is awesome! She makes lectures interesting and has good stories that help you understand and remember the material. Go to class, take good notes, and you should do well!

The best professor I had, the material is a lot and it combines a lot of bio but if you do the reading and lectures and study you would be in good hands. his lecture are so engaging and genuinely love going to his class. be aware tech is not allowed in the class and you need the old school book and pen in the lecture.

Just finished the 1st 3313 Exam. It was HARD. He covered the material in lecture & the lectures are great, but I didn't read enough of the book. I had his cog neuro class  before and some stuff is similar, but 3313 is way more detail. He gives extra credit though. Only problem is when other students ask random questions about stuff not on the exam.

Excellent professor. Made lectures interactive & fun. He introduces a lot of material you don't get in other psych classes and he is very fair on grading and extra credit. Very accessible outside of class too, He gave me advice on getting into grad school and is a pretty cool guy. You can basically ask him anything and he will tell it like it is.

SO much hype around this man, I had him for mem and cog and now im in his neuro class. He talks so fast. weekly quizes that if you do poorly on he will not open it to see what you do wrong. his lectures are long and boring and barely covers the content on the weekly quizes. he is very smart and professional but not good for a professor....

He is by far the best instructor I have had at OSU. (I'm a 3rd year). This was my second time taking this class and it was the lectures that made it for me. Attendance isn't mandatory, but the content of the lectures was AMAZING and actually helped me do well on the Exams. Weekly quizzed with only 4 questions. Homework is just summarizing articles.

Dr. Siefke is a nice person but he isn't a good lecturer. His exams do not align with the material that is presented in class. The class itself isn't worth a lot of points. Be prepared to read and study hard for his exams.

Dr. Siefke is a great guy. If you respect him and the class material, he will do the same for you. He was always willing to meet with me outside of class when I did poorly on a quiz or wanted to review what I missed on exams. Textbook readings are not required but helped me succeed in the class. There is also ample opportunity for extra credit.

Siefke is hands down my favorite teacher at OSU so far and even made stats interesting and fun. I had his neuro class before & this was WAY different. Not bad, just different content. He's super nice & really wants to help you learn. He is fair as long as you follow the rules in the syllabus. 4 Exams, 6 assignments (kinda hard), and a weekly quiz.

do not take this professor. in class you would think he explains things well and then you take your quizzes and it doesn't align with what he teaches. an overly difficult class for no reason. also finishes lecture notes the day of your test so won't give you much time to review beforehand!

Good professor but the way he taught this class does not work for me compared to his cognitive classes that I got an A in. Weekly quizzes, three exams that are mostly conceptually and not math, then you have the assignments. I hated the assignments though, actually the death of me but thats probably me being dramatic. I would recommend someone else

First time teaching the class and he did great! This is part of his interest so he really understood all of the topics. Weekly quizzes and exams. They are easy, just need to make sure you can differentiate between all the terms. But its like your basic psych class honestly! Highly recommend!!!! Exams and quizzes were take home and open note!

Dr. Siefke is my favorite professor I have ever had.  he does not allow any technology in lecture which alot of people didn't like at first but it works great for me.  He is so pationate about the subject matter and does a great job making lectures engaging.

Very smart but hard class. One thing I wish I knew is there is no flexibility with exam conflicts. I had to move a doctor's appt so just plan ahead. You can get extra credit which is good, but exams are difficult!! Overall nice guy and loves teaching.

Clearly very passionate about the subject and cares about students understanding and succeeding. Can't help but hate the course content, but that's not his fault. Pretty funny guy and he constantly tries to create an environment where people feel comfortable to ask questions during class time despite it being a lecture.
Hard exam questions.

There is a good chance Dr. Brian cares about your education more than you could hope to for yourself. He made me passionate about learning again as a burnt-out senior. Did not allow technology (phones, laptops, or tablets) in class which I hate to admit definitely helped me learn. Exams and quizzes were not difficult and mostly on Quizlet.

Weekly quizzes which can be found on quizlets, attendance isn't mandatory but it helps to go to understand the course. Gives 3 larger assignments which re writing heavy but pretty easy. Exams are 50 questions 50 minutes open note online and he gives you several days to complete it. Exams are pretty easy and straight forward. Great guy, cares a lot.

Dr. Brian is very genuine in wanting his students to succeed. He answers questions in lecture very thoroughly. My only complaint is that lectures started to feel repetitive and a little dry so it was really hard for me to pay attention. That's partially because of the content and partially a me problem too though. He gives some extra credit too.

If this your first time taking stats then you need to be going to every lecture or this class will kick your ass. He is a great professor and really really cares about his students. The hardest part of the class is the homework assignments so start them early and go in for help if you need it. He also gives extra credit quizzes which are wonderful

I hated the way he did the presentations, he had all the answers and explained them rather then doing step-by-step teaching. He's a super nice guy but his teaching style cause a good amount of people to struggle. Also, if you take this course I recommend loaning an Ipad from osu to take the best notes.

Great professor. This was my second time taking PSYCH 2220 (Stats) and I did way better this time, thanks to Dr. Brian. He was super helpful meeting me for office hours and he really cares about students actually learning. You will do well if you do the reading and go to class. He's also hilarious and makes stats actually kinda fun.

Best professor I have ever had! I am taking him again for a stats class next semester! His class is very engaging and he explains things very well, and answers questions very well! The exams are easy as they are not trick questions, they are just like, what is the function of the amygdala? He loves his job and it makes his class wonderful!!!!!

Best professor I have had! I am taking his Psych 2220 class next semester because of how amazing he is! He knows what he is talking about and wants to help people understand, he loves when you ask questions! He is very passionate and his midterms are easy, median is usually around 44/50 and you find out your grade right after you take the exam!

Dr. Siefke is very passionate about what he teaches, which makes class fun. While I was hesitant about his "no tech during class" rule, I grew to appreciate it. He knows how to keep you engaged in a lecture. I did not enjoy the 3 written assignments, but they are helpful for future classes in the Psych major. Would recommend him.

Dr. Brian is a wonderful professor! Although he teaches upwards of 300 students per semester, he finds time to answer questions quickly. He clearly puts a lot of thought and effort into his lectures and every interaction with his students. The material is hard but not too hard, and as long as you pay attention and engage you will do well!

This is one of the most difficult classes I have taken and barely hung onto an A. This professor is also one of the most passionate, entertaining and engaging educators I have ever had. He kind of reminds me of Jack Black in School of Rock. The book is the densest I have ever read, lectures are dense but I am glad I had this fantastic professor.
Very caring professor. Opportunities for EC, and always open to meet for extra help. Really wants the best for his students.
Great professor! Taking him again next semester

GREAT professor! Always available if you need help. He really cares about his students. He always checks to make sure the class is understanding the material. He understands the stress of college students. Overall amazing professor. Always open to answering any questions during lecture with no problem. Would recommend.

Dr. Brian is amazing. He really cares about you understanding the material. I am not a math person, but I understood every unit with ease because of the way he lays it out. Boils materials down to nuts and bolts, makes sure that you understand WHY the information is helpful in the real world, and is so encouraging of questions. Gem of a professor!

There are 3 research papers, 4 exams if I remember correctly and weekly quizzes that are no longer than 5 questions that are review of the chapter done last week. Gives out a few extra credit opportunities although their not worth a lot but extra credit is extra credit. Easy to digest lectures, he is very nice, would take a class he teaches again.

Dr. Brian is great. Exams were fair & straight forward, esp. if you went to class. Lectures were clear & engaging - he made a point to answer as many question as possible & still paced the lectures and material well! You can easily ace the assignments if you put more than minimal effort in (make a draft or two). Was very supportive. Take his class!

4 exams, one gets dropped, only 3 assignments which take some time but not very difficult!! I found the class very interesting as a neuro major, and the lectures were clear as he thoroughly explains concepts that students have trouble with. Also, exams are more than fair, the study guides are all you need to do well!
Amazing

The Exams are difficult. Weekly quizzes are fine, and Assignments are graded a little harshly. Lectures are not mandatory but try to go around exams for the course. Not graded by many things, so it is important to do well on the things that are graded. Overall, just okay. Dr. Siefke is a really nice guy, though. Just was a lot of information.

Took his 2220 and 3513, his energy is lil awkward online but works well in-person. 3513 ppt is not as useful as 2220 (you can pass the exam plainly rely on the ppt in 2220). 
Recommend 2220. 3513 is okay but the content isn't very interesting & need to remember lots of facts.

Dr Brian is a good guy! His class was easy and he goes verrrry in depth on the material. Sometimes lecture can get boring because we would be spending way too much time on some topics. This was mostly due to questions asked by students. I found myself skipping some lectures ONLY because I had a base knowledge of stats. He is really helpful though!

This professor doesnt care about you at all. When you have family deaths and forget to turn an assignment in and ask literally the next day to turn it in he says NO. It sucks because we are going through this tough time with covid, we have to take online courses which sucks even more because its so confusing but death in the family & he says so !

Dr. Siefke was a great teacher. I only attended half of the first lecture and never went again. Weekly quizzes were very easy, and you'll need to put in some effort for the exams and assignments but they were still fine. One exam is dropped and there's lots of extra credit from the quiz points. Easy and smooth-sailing class overall!

One of the best neuroscience teachers I have had the pleasure of taking. Funny, respectable, and always willing to help a student. He is very clear with how the class will be graded and drops one of the exams. I did not attend most classes and still achieved a 100% in the class.

I took Data Analysis in Psychology with Dr. Siefke and I have to say it is probably one of the most rewarding classes I've had at OSU. The material is rather challenging, but Dr. Siefke does a great job of keeping things easy to follow and make sure that everyone in the lectures are keeping up with him. He offers extra help if you need it, and EC
Dr. Brian is a great professor, and I really enjoyed 3513. It was a fairly easy class as compared to other neuro classes. I would highly recommend the class and professor!

I loved having Dr. Siefke for Data Analysis! He's very approachable, and he really wants to make sure everyone understands/is comfortable with the material. I would definitely reccommend staying on top of the reading and taking quality notes, as these will make it easier to follow the lectures and complete the assignments.

Definitely take Dr. Brian if you can! He always says this class isn't a math class but it sadly is (esp. towards the end) BUT he is always there to help and truly wants his students to succeed. He's super laid-back and makes class easy to get through. He does have weekly quizzes but that was the only negative aspect of his class.

Dr. Brian is an amazing professor and you can tell he prioritizes the well-being of his students. He teaches the material well and everything is understandable. The exams and quizzes are fair and he gives lots of opportunities for points in class so if you do all the work and attend lecture you should be able to get an A.

Dr. Siefke gives *very* good lectures, strongly encourages participation in class and gives a very reasonable workload. He has a great attitude, being very laid back during class and can be funny. He puts a lot of emphasis on reading the textbook but almost all material is still covered in lecture. If you apply yourself, you can easily get an A.

Dr. Siefke was an amazing professor. I could definitely tell that he cared a lot about both his students as well as the material he was teaching. The class was graded based on the best 3/4 exams, 3 papers, and weekly quizzes. He gave plenty of opportunities for extra credit. You do have to know a lot of material, but his exams were straightforward

A really funny and caring professor. He makes lectures interesting just by how passionate he is about the material. He is always willing to work with students and homework is minimal. Quizzes only cover material directly covered in lecture, so no need to over study. Great professor, awesome guy.

Siefke is a fantastic professor. I took Intro to Cognitive Neuroscience with him, and I've never taken a college-level STEM class but he explains everything very clearly and genuinely cares about making sure we understand the material. He also loves to discuss with students who stay after class and answers every question nonjudgmentally. Take him!

He's a great professor and very caring, but this class was kind of difficult. Assignments are really time consuming and a pain and his exams are somewhat difficult. Even if you study, you'll see something confusing on there you're not familiar with. He does give extra credit though which is nice and helps. Also drops your lowest exam score!!

I'm sure he's usually a better professor, but in these weird COVID-19 circumstances he was... frustrating and unwilling to adjust his course accordingly. His tests are difficult, but the 3 other assignments were easy (but also time-consuming busy work). Attend lectures, test questions sometimes directly refered to lecture content not on the slides.

For an introductory neuroscience class, PSYCH 3513 taught by Dr. Brian is definitely not recommended. Unless you are trying to minor/ major in neuroscience and this is the only available class, I recommend taking other classes. Even though I got a good grade, looking back I spent so much time on this class when I only took it for my requirement.

Siefke is a good lecture and is very helpful with any questions. I thought his class was extremely hard, but I ended up with an A. I have talked to Neuroscience majors (I'm a Psych major) and all of them say that his class is easy. So it just depends on your perspective.

He's very kind and wants his students to do well. The content wasn't hard at all, I thought. The quizzes he makes us do every week are annoying, because they're due at noon, so it's easy to forget. The learning lab offers extra credit, so go there!! Also, get help from there for assignments. Overall, a manageable stats class!! Take him!

Dr Brian is a great professor and cares a lot about his students and making sure you grasp the concepts of psychology. I recommend reading the textbook so you don't have examples of studies/cases that may appear on the exams. Daily pop quizzes are a thing so attendance is basically mandatory because points for the class are scarce. Overall great.

Brian is more than happy to answer any and all questions in class and his lectures are very clear and interesting. His love and passion for neuroscience is clearly demonstrated everyday in lecture. He is a very understanding guy and truly cares about his students. 11/10 take Siefke if you can !!.
Amazing teacher, 10/10

At OSU Ive had so many professors not take the time to address individual student needs, but Professor Siefke has been considerate and helpful so far this semester! Its not even the end of the semester, so the fact Im taking the time to write this should say something about the quality of his character. Deff select his class. Worth it.

Professor Siefke is the most helpful professor I've ever had. I had him for Cog Neuro and Research Methods, both topics that could be very dry and uninteresting. However, Professor Siefke's fascination with psychology is infectious which makes the topics all the more bearable.

This is my second class with Brian, and I found him to be GREAT for 2220. He goes over material time and time again and truly acts like a "servant to the students." 6 HW assignments (about two hours each), 4 exams (multiple choice 40 questions), and weekly online quizzes (most end up being extra credit). Show up to class bc he gave out EC 3 times!

What a good guy. This man made a very awful semester for me a little bit brighter with his class. Yes its stats. Yes its sometimes isn't SUPER interesting, but he cares about all of us and you can tell. What a warm spirited professor, he deserves your attention.

Brian is a really awesome professor. He understands a student's life and is overall a genuine person and it shows in his teaching. I definitely had to read the book thoroughly because he sped through the lectures every time with a bunch of info, but I still went because he sometimes gave extra credit. I was worried about the course but he was great

Brian is very chill and relatable. He knows his stuff and loves to answer questions in class. Be prepared to read the book and go your notes a lot if you want an A. He makes really helpful powerpoints and tells you exactly what is going to be on the test and what to study which is nice. He also likes to put extra credit on the tests and curves.

I really enjoy Dr. Brians lecture. He is very knowledgeable and wants his students to succeed. Hes very helpful in class and over email if you have questions. For someone who has never taken a stats class ever, he made the material very easy to understand. Highly recommend him!!

Dr. Siefke is a nice lecturer, and really cares about the content he teaches and your understanding of it. The downside is he often uses a lot of jargon, and he moves at a relatively fast pace as there is a lot of content to cover. Sometimes you can feel overwhelmed because of the amount of information he crams into a short time frame.

I took him for Psych2220 and Psych3513. Dr. Siefke is a great professor who really cares about what he teaches. If you pay attention during class and go over his slides, you'll do good. The material is on the tougher side, but Dr. Siefke does a great job explaining it and making it easy to understand. I wish I could take another one of his classes!

He is passionate about teaching but sometimes gets himself too wound up and confuses terms and concepts leaving himself to clarify his mistake later in an email. Funny guy though and gives you plenty of chances to earn points in extra credit if you show up to class.

Brian is one of the best professors I have had at OSU. He is very quick to respond to emails if any issues arise. Easy short online quizzes every week, 3 assignments, and 4 exams (get to drop lowest one). Gives extra credit quizzes and extra questions on exams sometimes. Great lecturer; very helpful to go to class but is not absolutely necessary.

Siefke is an incredibly relaxed man. He has very few assignments or expectations, and a lot of the class only shows up for the exams which can be aced from the online posts alone. That being said, I gained a lot from going to lecture because this man is truly personable and funny. He's the type of professor you want to have a beer with. Easy exams.

Dr. Siefke is one of the best professors I've had at OSU. He explains the class material throughly and is extremely helpful during office hours. Even though this was his first time teaching Data Analysis, I believe most of my classmates also loved his teaching style. He gives a lot of extra credit and is a fair grader! Definitely recommend 10/10

I have had this professor twice now. Once for Research Methods, and now for Cog Neuro. He treats students fairly and offers a ton of extra credit. Although it is true that the reading is pretty boring, he makes the central ideas in lecture interesting & he puts the slides online. The assignments & exams are ok if you study. I definitely recommend.

Communicates the material extremely clearly and does a lot of examples in class that make sense; he always lets his students know that he cares about their success in his class and is always open to questions; best prof I have had so far in psych department

Great professor. Very enthusiastic and realistic. Extremely approachable and caring about material. Slides posted online, no attendance grade. Tests are straightforward and easy. Disclaimers: Does not allow electronics in his classroom. Requires 2pt quizzes every week (online) but are due at 12pm on Monday, so are easy to forget.
He cares about his students' success and is very thorough and easy to understand. One of my favorite professors on campus

Brian is awesome! I've never had a professor care so much about my progress as a student and I felt prepared for every exam. I like his teaching style and when he calls people out who are absorbed into their phones during lecture. He always asked if we had questions and gave us plenty of opportunities to get the grade we wanted. Learned a lot!!

Brian was one of the most caring professors I have ever had. He really makes sure his students are set up for success. He provides a ton of extra credit quizzes(he didn't do pop quizzes with us) and his assignments are easy 100%. Midterm two was definitely the hardest, but pretty much all exams are lectures and study guide material.

Brian was an amazing teacher. While its true that his lectures were a little fast paced and confusing, Brian always made sure his students understood the material. If you had a question, no matter how dumb it seemed, Brian would answer it without judgement. Brian made Psych 2300 an easy A. Plus, he dropped the lowest exam score.

Class isnt mandatory but he really does highlight what will be on the midterms. Do the study guides and you will ace the tests. Great lecturer, engages with the class with demonstrations and really does care about his students. If you can take him for this class i would highly recommend doing so.

Brian is a cool guy overall but he's a mediocre lecturer at best. He flips through slides extremely fast and leaves students frustrated at the end of class. He is more than welcoming to help but also makes lecture a little confusing. You really should read the book if you want a good grade. However, he does drop your lowest test grade so thats nice

He really cares about his students, he loves when people ask questions during lecture. Very open outside of class. Exams only cover lecture content, but he can move fast in lecture. Wording on exams can be a little tricky so watch out for that. Drops lowest exam score!

AMAZING prof for cognitive neuro. Extra credit pop quizzes at the end of every lecture. Doesn't use textbook, so always go to class. Exams are off of his powerpoints, but very detailed. Cares about his students but doesn't deal with slackers. He will answer every question he knows and research ones he doesn't.

He's pretty passionate about the topic, but can get boring. Syllabus says the textbook is required, but I never read it and did fine. Do well on the pop quizzes, because you can get a ton of extra credit from then; I got so much I didn't have to take the final. 3 midterms, 1 final, lowest of any dropped, 3 short papers

He is a very good professor, he cares a lot about doing well in class. This class isn't too hard, he gives you many opportunities to get a bunch of extra credit. Lectures are long and can be boring but he shows a lot of great examples. Overall, he is a great professor!

Lectures were long and got boring quickly. Repeated himself a lot and then blew through important slides. Exams 1 and 3 were average, but Exam 2 was hard and clearly drawn from the boring textbook nobody reads. But, assignments were easy 100%s, and pop quizzes gave me 14 extra credit points, and I didn't have to take the final. Pros and cons.

Brian is a great instructor and I really enjoyed taking his class. He has a pop quiz every class but once you receive 20 points you will get extra credit. I had over 10 extra credit points! The pop quizzes are easy as long as you look over the lectures before class. The exams are a little tricky but he will add some points to increase the average.

Easiest Class Ever Today I take Exam 3 and assuming I get above a 40/60 it will mean I'll have aced the class AND won't have to take the final.  This class is ridiculously easy, go to lecture, you're paying for it after all, and study for the first couple exams

I met with him 3 times and he is a great instructor who cares a lot about us. The book WAS kind of dry and detailed, but it wasn't that bad. I disagree with other posters that lectures were boring! He knows a lot about the material and mixed it up with videos and experiment demos sometimes. The quizzes are not really that hard if you come to class

Overall, he seemed pretty out of touch with his students. The majority of us are neuro majors who have seen most of this material before, but it often felt like we were being coddled. His idea of teaching "critical thinking" is to constantly preach his own biases on topics covered in class. Reading directly from slides makes for boring lectures.

Pop quizzes every class that are easy IF you read the book, which is super long and dry. Even he admits that it's filled with too much information, but still tests off everything in the book. Includes very specific questions from the reading on exams that aren't discussed in class. Took 3 weeks to grade a scantron. Would not recommend.

Excellent teacher. He kind of has to dumb down and simplify the material for some of the students, but is definitely dedicated to making sure you get it. Always willing to help outside of class, too Not very hard class at all if you do the reading and go to class. The pop quizzes every class are easy and also a way to get extra points by the end.

He's a good lecturer, although the subject matter can be a bit dry. Communicates clearly and gets really excited about neuro. Pop quizzes are kind of hard but reading the book help a lot. Exams are average difficulty.
Feels like you're taking an advanced neuro class when in reality it's supposed to be an easy intro class. His lectures are boring and the material is heavy, avoid taking this class with him.

Horrible teacher, blows through notes, says things will not be on the test but then puts them on there. Pop quizzes at the "end" of every class but changed it to randomly during class. Extremely boring presentations. Supposed to be an extremely easy class for neuro majors, it has been my hardest.

Lectures are incredibly boring. This is supposed to be the joke neuroscience intro class but he really make you work for it. Reads off slides, gives 3 question quizzes every class which you actually have to study for, and he speeds through notes so it is impossible to get them all. says exams are easy but worded weird.

Class is quite easy. He is a nice guy but he teaches at a level below many of his students. Tends to read off slides and go very quickly toward the end of class. Sticking to a schedule is very important to him. Exams are easy. Gives short quizzes each class in place of attendance. Gives 3 assignments which is only outside work.

Definitely dedicated to student learning. Does not allow laptops/cellphones in class, but that helps for being focused on lectures. Lots of material to learn and most of grade is from tests. Does not take attendance, but going to class definitely helps because there are short pop quizzes almost every class period.
SO cool. VERY laid back and easy going. He really wants you to succeed. It's more a friend teaching a friend instead of professor to student.

Brian is a great teacher. He presents the information in a clear and interesting manner. He was very easy to set up an appointment with. He doesn't take attendance, but we get short 3 question multiple choice quizzes at the end of most classes that help our grades. Attendance is not taken, but showing up definitely affects your grade.

By far the best professor you can get. Attendance isn't mandatory but he doesn't post the lectures/slides on Carmen and he gives 1 point quizzes almost every class (easy quizzes) so going to the lectures is the best way to do well. He is very passionate about psychology and his students and it makes the class enjoyable.

The best professor I've ever had. He answers every question, no matter how difficult, and if he doesn't know the answer right away he will find it on his own time and email the class. He's very passionate and dedicated to psychology.

Dr. Jamie is my favorite professor in all of the Psychology department! They are respectful, understanding, caring and incredibly knowledgeable in the course content. Their lectures are engaging, often funny and easy to follow. The course load is super manageable so long as you are attentive and engaged in class!
Good prof. Class was graded by 3 tests (each worth 25% of your grade) and a final project (25%). class was well structured and lecture content was heavily based on homework readings
I love Dr. Jamie They are an amazing professor that made class fun and interesting everytime we had class. Would recommend PSYCH4555, Adolescent Sexuality, with Dr. Jamie.

Dr. Jamie is great. Class is engaging. Usually, the homework is to read the chapter and any additional readings before class. The grade is 75% exams and 25% final project. No extra credit or homework grades. But, if you study well, you'll do well on the exams. Jamie makes the topics interesting and the class is set up well. Definitely recommend.

This class is organized so that you read your weekly assignments before that week of class so that everyone can participate in class discussion. Sometimes it is lecture, but the format of this course is definitely collaborative. It is not a ton of work, Dr Jamie is a treasure.

This class was extremely easy, got a perfect 100%. There is a ton of reading, 24 journal articles (20pg avg) and then a worksheet for each one. Attendance is mandatory as there is a participation submission at the end of every class. Take the class for an easy A.

Wonderful human and professor. Take any classes you can with Dr. Ladanyi! Exams aren't easy, but they are fair and he provides you with in class review and a practice test the week of. Go to class, lectures are engaging and it is difficult to succeed if you skip, attendance matters for exam performance and your overall grade in the class.
I deeply enjoyed his class, and I wish he taught more than two classes. Live laugh loved him. Super helpful works with students and is very passionate about what he teaches, and you can tell. 10/10

Lectures were very confusing, he was never clear on what exactly we had to do. For exams, I am jealous of people that took 2300 from a different professor and finished with minimal coursework and high grades (and NO exams). Def only take this professor if you absolutely need to. There are many better professors at OSU.

Best prof I could have had for this course. I ended up loving the class and he made the materal interesting. In order to secure an A, read the textbook and review. The class is extremely tied to the textbook. He cares about attendance so go to lectures,he gives lots of examples though so theyre helpful. Overall, really nice and cares about students
His classes are amazing! He is a great teacher, and I would definitely take his classes again

Jesse is a really down to Earth, who really cares about his students. If you put in the work you will for sure get a good grade. I loved this class, and he made it so interesting to learn about. He love's feedback from his students and wants to really make the class the best it can. Definitely take his class if you can!

Jesse took over this class mid-semester and was extremely understanding of the disorganization of the class. He's passionate, friendly, and funny. W ish he taught the class the whole semester--I would've liked it a lot more! Student feedback important to him, and he made several changes to the course based on students' opinions to better serve us.

easily one of the best profs Ive had at OSU and hes only a grad student! he makes asynchronous lectures really engaging, is very personable, and you can tell he really wants his students to do well. the class feels easy, but I also feel like Ive learned a lot. I would definitely recommend taking a class with him even if psych isnt your thing!!

I'm a 3rd year, and I've never rated a single professor of mine BUT i explicitly created an account to write about Jesse. He is, BY FAR, the best teacher I've ever had here at OSU. His lectures are funny (with current memes), he's super approachable, takes ALL feedback, and genuinely cares about every student. I'm actually sad the semester ended :(

BEST TEACHER EVER!!! Highly recommend taking social psych (3325) with jesse. He truly cares about his student's success and is such a fun professor to listen to. You can tell how much he loves psychology and teaching. Very interesting class and he gives great examples to help you understand. Midterms very much reflect what we learn in lectures.

Horrible group project. Didn't end up learning anything useful due to all of the stress trying to understand the impossibility complex group project directions. His lectures are incredibly dry and uninteresting. Please never take anything with this prof.

Dr. Phenis is a knowledgable professor who is very passionate about psychology. He prioritizes students    learning the content rather than the grade given. All quizzes and exams were open-note and take-home. Overall I would recommend everyone try to get him as a professor.

Dr. Phenis is a knowledgeable professor. He records all of his lectures and makes them available to access outside of class. He does not have exams throughout the semester besides the cumulative final. There is a group project. There are weekly quizzes. He does random TopHats for extra credit as well.

Dr. Phenis is a very knowledgeable professor. He records all of his lectures and makes them available to access outside of class. He does not have exams throughout the semester besides the cumulative final. There are some assessments on the material that can be difficult. There are weekly quizzes. He does random TopHats for extra credit as well.

Dr. Phenis is clearly very passionate about research and that's amazing in a prof. but he talks himself into circles and the lectures are so dense you lose focus immediately w/ how much you get talked at. His slides make sense and meeting with him 1on1 clears up a lot of questions, but he makes simple concepts difficult to grasp in class.

I'm not sure why Dr.Phenis' ratings are so low, he was an amazing professor. He had flexible deadlines or all assignments, open note exams (including the final), extra credit, and test corrections, and was very nice. An A is 100% possible if you use all available resources. I would 100% take another class with him in the future.

I wouldn't say that Dr. Phenis is a bad lecturer. The topic of neuroscience isn't meant to be easy. Although attendance isn't mandatory, I suggest you go. He can give a lot of good tips and hints for the assessments. Yes, the grading for them are harsh but there is a reason you get remediations for them. Remediations are grade boosters! Do them!

I really enjoyed the structure of this class. People complain about the assignments he gives, but I feel like they were really beneficial because he allows remediations which encourages students to review old material. There are also many opportunities for extra credit.

The class was really lecture heavy, but the material was interesting and he gave about a million different chances for extra credit. Even though the assignments he gave were difficult, I feel that they were beneficial because the remediations he offered encouraged students to review past material.

This a very content heavy class, and although the material is hard, you can definitely still end with a good grade if you put the work in. Rewatching each lecture helped me do good on the quizzes and assessments, and there are opportunities to fix your mistakes for a better grade on these assignments as well.

Phenis is NOT a good lecturer, NOT an easy grader, and NOT a professor to learn from. If you believe that this class will be a wonderful commencement to your neuroscience major, you will be deeply disappointed. The only reason I get an A is by using materials from other sections and studying for my other neuroscience class. Take Dr. Coutellier.

Lectures are extremely boring and exhausting with a huge amount of unnecessarily complicated content. He tries to hide important information for tests from the slides and makes questions as convoluted as possible. His free-response questions are graded all-or-nothing, and remediations are graded harshly. This class makes me hate neuroscience.

He is the worst professor I've ever taken a class with. He's a boring and bad lecturer, he allows to redo things but you have to get 100% on the remediation and do a bunch of work with it which takes hours. 0/10 recommend him. There's much better professors or classes in general (if this isn't a specific requirement for you). Save yourself
Lectures can be dry, but Dr. Phenis is approachable. Tough group projects require diligent partners. Quizzes are tricky, but he's flexible on late work. Unstuck study helps streamline study prep.

Dr. Phenis is a fantastic teacher. Even if you miss deadlines or receive a poor grade, he always offers extensions, penalty removals, and remediations to improve your score. He's not always available, but during work hours, you're guaranteed a comprehensive response quickly. Deadlines and instructions on assignments are very clear and regulated.

Dr. Phenis was able to answer any questions I had quickly. People noted that he is boring, but the material he has to work with is so dry. He does have a lot of guidelines and deadlines that can get confusing. Don't have flaky partners; the group project is a big part of the grade. There are many ways to succeed if you work hard and seek it out.
A research methods class truly about neuroscience. Overly complex group assignments that go way out in the weeds. Confusing instructions and generally boring to listen to. Would not recommend
Do NOT waste your time with him he is so boring and the group projects are probably the worst thing ever. You will inevitably be confused the entire time and not end up learning a single thing

Very difficult to keep up with his lectures and often times his test/quiz questions arent even found on the slides he provides. You'd have to rewatch all of his zoom recordings to understand topics because you cant really study off of his slides.

Content is difficult and his lectures can be a bit hard to understand but if you pay attention and take advantage of remediations it's completely doable to get an A, I found it very helpful to make my own notes and to ask him any questions after class.

Dr. Phenis was a great professor, lectures were informative and you could tell he cared about teaching the material. Class itself was not too difficult at all, one cumulative final, sort of bi-weekly quizzes and assessment assignments (less points, weighted heavier). If you pay attention in lecture you will have no problem! Offers remediations too
