Dr. Yocom is a good professor. She is engaging and truly wants to see her student succeed. Expect weekly homework, one attendance day each week, and a decent amount of extra credit. You will need to put in the effort, but overall, it is not a difficult class. Anyone who did not get the grade they had hoped for, simply didn't put in enough effort.

Dr. Yocom is a very tough grader. She looks for very specific information and I find myself questioning all my answers. She doesn't seem particularly interested in teaching, often having to make corrections to papershomework answers she has typed up to present to the class. I would recommend finding a different teacher for this class if possible.

Anna is tough, I'm not gonna lie. But I also didn't put in as much effort as I should have. I missed a few homework assignments and participation points. If I would have gone to lecture more often, I would have easily gotten a B or higher (and I'm bad at math). Buy the textbook or make friends with someone who has it. You need it.

Dr. Yocom's test are pretty fair and the homework is 30% of your grade. So as long as you study, do the homework, and show up on Fridays (attendance counts on review days) you should get at least a B no problem. I should note some homeworks have problems from the textbook on them, but you can use the books they have at the learning lab.

homework due every week  and an online quiz or two due every few weeks. I would recommend REALLY putting thought into your homework because a lot of your grade comes from there. GO TO LEARNING LAB FOR EXTRA CREDIT. On exams, start with the computations so you don't run out of time. Multiple choice can be tricky- it sucks but read the book to help.

All you have to do to pass this class is the homework and do well on the tests (that's just to pass).  If you want to excel in this course you need to show up everyday and study a bit.  It's an easy class to take and if you don't show up (despite the fact that it's mandatory) then your final grade will only decrease 4 points.

Dr. Yocom is a great prof. The class set up allows you to succeed. HW was 36% of the grade so it is worth taking the time to do it well and you get to drop 2. Practice in class each week is really helpful and you get attendance credit so go to class on these days. She's a little peppy for my taste but helpful.

I knew things because of past stat classes. You have to go to lecture though because it can get confusing. Don't like turning in homework online. Needs more examples and better powerpoint! Attendance is taken at random times, so may the odds be ever in your favor. Also you will have to buy the textbook for maybe 3 homework questions all semester

If you attend class you should be fine. Her tests aren't super straight forward, but they're not impossible. Takes attendance once a week, and you'll have weekly hw and quizzes, but has a reasonable amount of extra credit available.

If you're able to attend every lecture,  course is easy to follow. If you don't intend to be there every day, you probably don't want to take this class.  "Study guides" are literally chapter titles and section titles straight from the book, and she only posts partial notes online. I spent hours reading. Participation assignments once a week.
I appreciated how approachable she was, which made a tough subject easier to relate to.

She was very clear in her explanations, but had a lot of material to cover. With that, going to the TA with questions was very helpful as well as getting practice examples at recitation. I would definitely attend class because any statistics is hard if you don't see the examples worked out.

Oh, Dr. Yocom. While I did get an A in this class, I'm pretty sure it was due to the AP Stats I took in high school. Anyone in her class can tell you that her test questions are often very poorly worded, and any attempt to question her will leave you with a sarcastic, condescending response. If possible, try to find another professor.

She contradicted herself constantly and the class wasn't clear on right answers at all. The homework is very confusing and she loves to grade you hard on things that could have gone either way as the answer. Wouldn't recommend her at a all. You will need the book because she doesn't teach herself but outlines what the book says.

She is terrible at teaching Data Analysis (stats). Frequently disengages the class by reading from the book. Only engages when a higher up is in the class evaluating. Every point counts with her terrible grading scale for a math based class. Babies the class with comments an elementary school teacher would use yet unable to actually teach us.

While she is helpful, I just can't get over how the relation from her tests and homework don't matchup. The questions she makes are open ended and difficult to find answers too. I felt like everyday someone was challenging her on wording of questions. She is helpful, but more trouble to take any of her classes than they are worth.
The best professor ever that you can get for a statistics class. She gives couple extra credits assignments and also curve the class! Homeworks assigned are super helpful! Love her!
She's super sweet, answers any questions, and the class is mind-blowingly easy. If you go to class and pay attention somewhat, you'll get an A. Very minimal work outside of class.

Dr. Yocom is a great professor who keeps the class interesting with fun and interactive activites that allow psychology to be related to your own life. Tests are difficult, as they reflect concepts and your understandings of those concepts.

This class was SO EASY. The only thing that is frustrating is that it seems many students were not prepared with the pre reqs for the class, I felt I was ahead of the game with my AP Stats course in high school. Exams are very fair and you get to make a formula sheet to use. Show up to class, take notes and you should get an A.
Incredibly boring and there is very little class involvement. Class wasn't a hard topic but how she taught made people often zone out. She also dinks a lot of silly points off writing assignments.

Dr. Yocom was great!  Sweet and kind, and the class wasn't hard.  Lots of annoying group activities in class but I mostly just did them alone and she didn't seem to care.  Considering it's a research methods class it wasn't all that boring.  Would take from her again.  Got an A.
She's a good instructor for Primate Cognition. Knowledgeable and passionate about the subject. As long as you read the textbook, go to class, and do the discussion posts, you'll be fine.

She is very nice and interests in material. Homework and quizzes make a up huge part of the grade. Unfortunately, these assignments are completed online so you cannot ask for clarity on her extremely poorly worded, open ended, and arguably incorrectly constructed questions.

Very difficult. Not interesting material. You often lose major points for minor mistakes. It's a math class, not a psych class. She is unhelpful and does not make the material interesting in any way. Unfortunate that this class is required for the major.

Dr. Yocom is an excellent professor! She is engaging, well prepared for class, and a genuinely caring and skilled teacher. She is fair, but that also means you can't slack off. You have to do the work, study, and attend class.  You will have to apply what you?ve learned in class on the exams.  She makes it easy to learn though.  Just pay attention.

She is a really nice teacher and is genuinely interested in helping the class. The problem is that her exams are really difficult. She doesn't use the homework/review questions as a guide to her exams "Why would I test you on something you already know?". I studied hard, went to review sessions, and did my homework and still did poorly on exams.
Really nice teacher. Makes sure you understand material. The material is tough important to attend class. She will offer extra credit, and curves when needed
She's a great professor. She really knows what she's talking about and answers emails quickly.
Wish I never took this class with this professor. Not a good experience.
Clear and nice. Just go to class and you'll be fine. make sure to review notes. exams are hard because it takes the info and puts if in situations. If you study and go to class, not bad at all.
Really nice teacher. Wants to help and teach. Lectures are really long. Do need to study for tests and quizzes. Overall, good class. Hard to stay focused and memorize everything.

you are not required to attend classes, but I highly recommend you to cause it's so interesting! she tries her best to make it fun and clear. I love the videos in class. the textbook is really funny too.  Her materials were wellllll organized and easy , just memorizing a lil bit. My favorite class. Exams are easy too.

She is so sweet. She tries really hard to make class fun and is always willing to hear what you think. I only went to class on test days and still got an A. It's the easiest class I will ever take at college and the material is actually interesting.
made the class interesting

Anna was an awesome professor! She knew how to make class interesting and was very enthusiastic about hte material.  Studying is important for both quizes and exams, but if you do the work it is not hard to get an A.

Anna was such a cool professor. Every class had guided notes that followed a powerpoint. The guided notes could either be done in class, or followed the book pretty consistently too. She showed a lot of interesting visuals and stories that made the learning more applicable to life.
Great professor. Class was interesting and easy. You will have to study a little but its not hard at all.

Anna is extremely enthusiastic, which was off-putting at first, but I came to appreciate it because it helps keep the material interesting. She's very helpful and wants her students to succeed. She is funny and very knowledgeable. The book is unnecessary, the guided notes on Carmen are exactly what you need to study. I Highly reccommend her class.
Awesome teacher, really enthusiastic, loves what she is teaching. Guided notes make lectures and studying really easy.
No Comments
No Comments
One of my favorite professors! She truly cares about her students and is very accommodating!

I absolutely loved Dr. Miller! I cannot say enough good things about her as a person and as a professor! She was caring and genuine towards students with passion for the course content and for our research projects. She made research approachable and provided a support system. I recommend Dr. Miller and this psychology of motivation course fully.
She's my top recommendation for psych students. You'll love her, and so will your GPA.

Her class is straightforward, and fun to be in. She clearly cares for her students, and makes it clear we are her priority. if you can take her, do it! You will walk away with an A as long as you do the assignments.
She was the most amazing professor. She really cares about her students. This was the best way to end my college career. I have never taken a class this easy!! Take it!!

I'm taking Dr. Miller for both Psychology of Personality and Motivation Psychology.  Overall, she has been the unexpected highlight of the semester and I truly am thankful for the understanding of what students are going through and emphasizing learning and caring over just forcing grades, how compassionate education should be.

Her theoretical approach to the course makes me think about finding myself, and these deep thoughts carry with me. I like thinking about what my ideal self would look like and the steps I could take to get there. This class is helping me to recognize what I really like about myself as a future counselor and appreciate my unique personality more.

Dr. Miller loves psychology so much. We do interesting activities to understand working with various personality types. I'm often thinking of personality throughout my day now. Class is thought provoking.I also prefer the way she structures the class for learning with resources available online. I'm registered to take another course with her.

Dr. Miller cares deeply about us as human beings and helps us apply the psychology of motivation to our lives.  The way she teaches gets to each student's passions with goal setting techniques and psychological confidence to believe in our hopes.  She is enthusiastic about psychology, and I highly recommend her.  Very flexible and understanding.

The only reason that I didn't rate 5/5 was because the start of her classes was quite drawn out about the final paper. We were beginning our research for the project before we even touched on any of the topics in class. Very confusing but I can tell her heart is in a good place and she really tries. I would take her classes again.
I appreciated Dr. Miller's course design, positive teaching style, and genuine desire to help students with understanding psychology, grad school, and career decisions.

Dr. Miller is amazing and always gave me positive feedback that was very encouraging. I enjoyed learning about all the disorders that fall under abnormal psychology. I learned a lot in a short amount of time.  Would definitely take a class taught by her again.  She is very caring and the learning makes you feel relaxed.

Dr. Miller was a great professor! The 6 week course was one discussion post (that was writing parts of your "final paper") and one quiz (multiple choice, take up to 3 times) each week, and turning in your paper at the end.

She also gave great feedback on everything graded, and was flexible with due dates if students needed an extra day or so!

Most caring professor I've seen. She takes time to clearly grade homework and gives tons of feedback. A very easy 6 week summer course-just a weekly multiple attempt quiz, and a weekly discussion board that breaks down the sections of the research paper (instead of a final). definitely recommend!
Super caring and understanding of time constraints and she constantly extended deadlines and helped whenever she was asked.

It was really my honor to have Dr. Miller as my instructor again this summer. I am grateful that Dr. Miller knows how to let us be in a good mood to study psychology. I will take another two courses with Dr. Miller this autumn semester, and I am excited. The feedback Dr. Miller sent me is useful and helpful for my writing and learning.
Dr. Miller has always been one of my favorite professors! She genuinely cares about her students and their success. She is intelligent, kind, and understanding. I will always recommend her classes!
Kind Professor, always smiling at her students, even though some students never attend her class. Got full marks on each assignment, would definitely take again.

Literally the easiest thing I have ever done in my life was this course. It is only out of 100 points but there is really no way you cannot get a 100% in the course. Discussion posts every week that help you with your final research paper and easy quizzes you get 3 tries on. You do not have to go to class, which is sad bc she is so kind and caring.

I love this woman. She is so sweet and caring. Easy grading for weekly multiple choice quizzes that are online, unproctored, and right from the lectures with no time limit. The lectures are engaging and encourage you to talk to the people around you. Her life is interesting and I love her attitude towards sport psych.

Absolutely love Dr. Miller!!!! She is such a kind person and so incredibly welcoming to everyone and understanding of people needing accommodations. The class is super intellectually stimulating.  It is clear Dr. Miller loves teaching.

Dr. Miller is an amazing professor who really cares about her students. Attendance isn't required, but you have to do weekly discussion posts. These are mostly about the final project, which is broken up through the semester and is very easy to complete. Quizzes are online and you get two attempts. I'm happily taking her a third time next semester.

Dr. Miller is really laid-back and super kind to all of her students. She accepted any and all late work up to the last days of the semester, which was really helpful. I had her previously for an online Psych of Personality and she was great then too!

class is mostly discussion posts and the final is a project that she helps you complete throughout the semester. she's one of the sweetest professors ever and genuinely cares about students doing well. easier than some of my 1000 levels tbh

Dr. Miller is an amazing professor. Class assignments are very manageable and there are no exams. Her lectures are really interesting, and she is also super flexible when it comes to showing up to class and turning in assignments. She also cares about her students and understands that they have other things going on outside of her class

Lisa gives you discussion posts to do weekly and there are a few quizzes that you can take twice but they are not hard. just look over the slides and you'll be okay. class format is based on a study you conduct and then you write a research paper over the course of the semester. I highly recommend her for an upper division class

By far my favorite professor! She is so easy going and understanding. You can easily get over 100% in the class. I will be taking 3 other classes with her next semester based off of the great experience that I had! I recommend!

I have taken both this class and organizational psych with her because she honestly grades on effort. Her assignments were very straight-forward and easy. You can tell she genuinely loves her students and what she teaches.
Dr. Miller is so nice and really cares about her students!

I loved taking Dr. Miller's class. She has awesome and interesting lectures and grades very easily. The semester project was very interesting and fairly easy. Overall I really enjoyed all of the material and did not stress about this class. There was weekly quizzes but they were super easy.

This is my second course with Dr. Miller and I wish I could take a third! Dr. Miller is kind and compassionate. She is clear with her assignment requirements and wants her students to succeed. Dr. Miller's class brightened my day. If you take her course, attend lectures to fully benefit from her teaching!

Loved Dr. Miller's caring and positive engergy.  The professor provided advice for graduate school that helped me in my entrance interviews.  Being able to select my own topic and work on my own research led me to discover my desired area of focus in psychology.  Highly recommend and would take again if I wasn't graduating.

It's mostly lectures and group work in class. The syllabus didn't match the class at all, which made it really confusing. She's really nice and helpful with questions, and lenient overall. The grading felt all over the place though, wouldn't take again.

Psychology of Emotions class is my second class with Dr. Miller this term. I actually fell behind due to a personal issue. She was so kind with helping me get back on track with exceptional empathy.  We've touched on every emotion this term...we learned how to create and savor good emotions and how to cope together with difficult emotions.

Positive Psychology with Dr. Miller is my 3rd class with this professor.  I'm planning to enroll in her class this summer too.  She is always passionate about the topics and offers opportunities to practice psychology skills in class.  Always very kind.  I learn about my ways of thinking and also about how to help other people.  Highly recommend!

Dr. Miller was an amazing instructor! She always teaches the information clearly and makes the topic fun to learn. I learned a lot from this class.  Professor Miller was passionate about both the course material as well as helping her students. I am very happy I took it as I learned a lot.

very kind person with a truly big heart, genuinely cares for all her students learning and wellbeing. really has a great way of orating, especially to such a large class audience, still asking questions and listening to students. i appreciate her positive attitude which was an uplifting part of my day. i also appreciate her leniency with deadlines.

Lisa Miller took on the task of teaching this new course, and I think she did an excellent job of doing so. 
Dr. Miller was very communicative in what exactly we had to do, and always greeted us with kindness and a smile. She always encouraged us to ask questions about the material, and she did a great job of explaining everything. Just loved her.

A gem of a human being, Dr. Miller was absolutely amazing. I had horrible health issues this semester. She made accommodations immediately and was the reason I was able to finish school. Easy to learn from, encourages independent thought, never hesitates to help. I had a lot of great professors, but Dr. Miller is best of the best in psychology.

This is my second class with Dr. Miller and I enrolled in more courses next semester with her. She is absolutely amazing and opened me up with self analysis. She has the kindest heart and truly cares about her students. I look forward to going to her class!!! I always look for her name when signing up for classes because that's how awesome she is.

This class was my breathe of fresh air this semester, go with the flow. There were no strict deadlines. Lecture sparked some heated discussions, but was very interesting to see my classmates views. The only assignments were weekly discussion boards which in turn were copy and pasted into my final project as they are used as the building blocks.

This is my second time having this professor and I really appreciate the format with which she organizes her classes. Lectures are group-oriented and there is a lot of interaction. This professor is a fair grader and is always in a joyful mood.

This is a class for the new GE, so this was her first time teaching it. The course itself was very boring and mundane, but Prof. Miller was up for the challenge and did her best to teach to us. She is extremely kind-hearted and very communicative, and a very kind grader. Hated the class, but Prof. Miller definitely made it easier to bear.

The summer course for Theories of Personality is online and has a relaxed vibe for learning comfortably.  Topics are interesting.  Dr.Miller helps you create your own ideas for research on personality topics you enjoy.  I will submit my final course paper for my grad school portfolio.

Dr Miller is my absolute favorite professor of all time. I already took her classes and specifically signed up for another one because of how much I enjoyed her teaching style. Not only is she super organized but she genuinely encourages thought-provoking conversation. Miller emphasizes mental health above all. Absolutely loved taking her classes
Love Dr. Miller!  Very warm and understanding.  I would take another class with her in a heartbeat.  100% recommend.  She is intelligent but also fun loving in class.

Learned alot about myself and the psychological world. Dr. Miller is uplifting and gives the feeling like she truly cares about you.  She stays organized and on schedule but also gives more time if students need it. She is passionate about happiness, relationships, and sports psychology. If you have the chance, take her class.  Genuinely kind human

Dr. Miller is a brilliant caring professor.  Brightened the day with energy!  She structures the class with hands-on activities.  It's not a boring lecture with a professor going on and on.  Highly recommend.  She's very inspiring about helping you with life and professional choices.  We learned psychological skills on top of research skills.

Like other reviewers said: this class is VERY easy. You don't need to show up and still get an easy A as long as you turn in your weekly discussion boards, quizzes and final paper. Her lectures were super boring and filled with mindless small group activities. I feel unprepared for upper-level classes because there was no in-depth learning.

Dr. Miller is a great professor. She cares about the material and her students. Lectures seemed kind of pointless at times but she offered great feedback about our research paper project. As long as you do the weekly quizzes and keep up with discussion boards you don't have to go to class to get an A.

Dr. Miller's research methods course is very laid back, with only a few quizzes, one final paper, and weekly discussion boards that add up to your final paper. The layout of this course takes a huge load off of the effort to tie the essay together. Best of all, her courses have no exams!

EASIEST class Ive ever taken. Theres no exams just 10 5point quizzes. The quizzes are open note and she gives multiple attempts. Her class is focused on discussion so theres a discussion every week. Theres one research paper due at the end of the semester. Super easy and shes so caring. Highly recommend

Lisa Miller is notorious for being an incredibly caring professor and understanding when you come to her with any difficulty or reason for absences. She genuinely really cares about her students and it shows. Every assignment she gives is pretty easy, except there is one research paper you need to write throughout the year.

Almost too easy. You could theoretically not do anything and still get an A, but if you are here to learn you can learn a lot in her classes. I enjoy challenges as I learn better that way, this class is not a challenge. But it did make my life easier. Listen an pay attention, you can learn something that will better your life forever :)

Ive taken many classes with Professor Miller. Loved this class! Loved the focus on high-performance psychology and psychological skills training. Its clear she loves her job and is passionate about helping students.

Professor Miller was outstanding! Her class was stimulating, and the format allowed us to be creative. I love how she created a class plan that built up to the largest project so it wasnt too overwhelming. I dont think Ive ever met a professor that cared so much about our mental health. I believe all classes should be like this. Enjoyed it!

I love Dr. Miller! She is such an incredible energetic person and professor! I have only high praise. Ive taken several courses with her. She is so kind, compassionate, flexible, and enthusiastic about teaching. The courses were well organized with an easy to follow structure. Highly recommend! One of the best professors at OSU!

Dr Miller is very nice and sweet. However, she gives out so many group projects and discussion assignments. I prefer lecture classes, but most classes were just discussions so I stoped going and I ended up with a 100. Its an easy A if you do what you need to do, but if you aren't into group projects and discussions I wouldn't take this class

Dr. Miller is not only a great professor, but a sweet woman as well. The research project seemed daunting at first, but she broke it up into weekly DB posts, which let us make step-by-step progress on it each week. For project itself, she let us simply compile our posts into the final paper and format them. Strongly recommend her for this class!

I had her for my research methods class and she was amazing. My brother passed away during the semester and I also got extremely sick and she was very understanding and excluded me from assignments and gave me extra time whenever I needed it. The research project is super fun and I like how we worked on it all semester. Shes a great professor.

Dr. Miller was really understanding this semester and did her best to make the course manageable despite everything else. The final paper was broken up into discussion posts throughout the course which made it pretty easy to do. There were also weeks where you got points for just checking in on the discussion boards which I appreciated.
She is a sweetheart! I loved her positive psychology class and it has helped me in my personal life so much! Take her classes, you wont regret it! She truly wants the best for her students.

I loved her this semester! Such a kind and understanding professor and empathetic to all of us students. She knew how to keep things so lighthearted and wholesome even with covid hovering over all our heads !

Dr. Miller is a GREAT professor. This is definitely a low maintenance class, but its really interesting. Dr. Miller really cares about her students and wants you to genuinely enjoy the class. Definitely take her if you have the chance, shes a sweetheart!

Dr. Miller is one of the sweetest profs I have ever had. Especially with the confusion of COVID-19, Dr. Miller has gone out of her way to ease the load on the students and make sure that her class was not a source of stress for anyone. 10/10 would recommend any classes from Dr. Miller!

Best professor @ OSU. Very kind, caring and understanding. Pushed back due dates to accommodate for COVID-19 and other stressors. Class is out of 100 points, I finished with 100/100. Quizzes are unlimited attempts and easy if you review the notes. Final was easy and youre given two attempts. Final project was lowkey fun, easy and quick to finish.

Dr. Miller is a wonderful professor! I think she specializes in positive psychology, and she applies it no matter the class; she makes everything simple and engaging and always knows how to motivate students.
Dr. Miller so the best professor at OSU. Quizzes are unlimited attempts and only one big paper for a research class. No midterms at all. She is very caring and understanding. Highly recommend.

Dr. Miller is a great professor. The class is insanely boring, but she tries to make it interesting. She posts all of her powerpoints, does not take attendance, and the only grades are a research project, journal, and a few quizzes that have unlimited attempts. She wants you to succeed in the class.

Any class available with Dr. Miller, I highly recommend it! She is an angel of a professor. She cares about her students and wants them to succeed. Assignments usually have multiple attempts. She grades things fairly easy. Love this woman.

I took this online class during the summer and it was by far the most interesting class I've taken thus far. The prof is really caring, supportive and willing to help you. The exams are based off reads in the textbook, so you will still have to put in effort and time to prepare for exams. Other than that, I highly recommend this class.

Dr. Miller is one of the sweetest professors Ive ever had. Shes so modest but brilliant and makes everything very easy to understand. She enlists group conversations and makes everyone feel comfortable speaking aloud in class. Dr. Miller is a must have for psych1100.

Dr Miller is literally the best professor Ive ever had. She teaches multiple courses at OSU and really has her students success at the top of her priority list. Would highly recommend taking any of her classes and also getting to know her. Shes absolutely awesome!

There are a lot of sections for Intro Psych at OSU, but if you can, sign up for Dr. Miller's section. She made psych extremely simple, gave us unlimited attempts at the section quizzes, and tried her best to anticipate which questions would be on the midterms (the midterms were the same for all sections, so she had no control over the material).

I have taken 3 classes with Dr. Kays now and he is my favorite professor at OSU. His classes are so interesting and he actually cares to teach rather than read slides verbatim. Super down to earth and has so much knowledge and experience... I highly recommend taking one of his courses to anyone!

I took abnormal psych online with Dr. Kays. The setup of the course was a bit confusing at times and communication seemed to be lacking. The coursework itself was really easy to manage. There was only one assignment due per week and the exams were very easy if you have read the textbook and watched his lectures! Would take again!

Dr. Kays is such a kind professor. He truly cares about his students, and is very informal with his lecture style. He explains the topics well, and makes the class very easy with open-note midterms and one assignment per chapter (which you can keep doing until you get an 100). Also, his thursday meditations are so calming.

Beginning of the semester was rough just because of exterior things going on but Dr.Kays always tried to make his material as engaging as possible! He was extremely helpful and kind about any situation with his classes. Exams are open note online, and homework you can do till you get 100%. 10/10

A rough semester at the start due to reasons other than academics, but Dr. Kays seems to be a great person and instructor based on his talked about experiences. Very down to earth and informative! Material wasn't the most exciting but not much he could do about that. Favorite part was the meditations before class!
The content is dry but the class is easy and prof Kays has good insight from his experience.

He's an extremely understanding professor! All exams are open note and you have one homework assignment per chapter *but you can do it till you get a 100* super easy class and attendance isn't mandatory!

Dr. Kays was an amazing professor. He truly cares for his students and has been the most personable professor I've had at OSU. He admits that that the material can sometimes be dry for this course, but he makes it as interesting as possible. He doesn't make the course harder than it needs to be. Open book and note exams with all MCQ questions!

Online lectures went suuuper slow and were not all that useful for me. he begins them with mindfulness meditation that he asks questions about on his exams. I only went for those and then left the call and ended with an A. If you do his study guides, it is almost question-by-question correlated to his exams. Easy A. homework is learning curves

Dr. Kays has a lot experience in the field. Ive taken 3 of his classes because I love how he takes the course and applies it to his real world experiences in the field. He listens to concerns about grades and exams. He will modify exam dates and give points back to exams if you email him and think a question is confusing. Exams are open book

The entire grade for this class is based off of 3 exams. They arent very hard & open book, but if you actually want to learn about counseling, he barely teaches. The entire course is reading the book and taking exams with occasional audio lectures. Also, at the end of the semester he put in final grades wrong, which was very stressful.

Dr. Kays is a great professor and you can tell he really cares about his students. At the beginning of every class we do a different meditation to help us relax. There are only 3 exams which are very easy if you fill out the study guide, and other than that your only assignments are inquisitives. Would highly recommend Dr. Kays.

Dr. Kays is one of the best professors I've had. This course not only teaches you a lot about the subject and how to implement it into psychology for patients but also for yourself. I used to be so stressed w school and personal issues but when I went to his Positive Psy class the stress would just go away. Journaling was huge in class! LOVED IT.
Dr Kays is engaging and really knows how to relate to students. Follow syllabus read textbook and enjoy his expertise

Dr. Kays was the greatest professor ever. He teaches the subject matter VERY well and clearly, and makes hysterical comments to try and prevent students from falling asleep. He had the class laughing almost every class period. I highly recommend Dr. Kays. He is one brilliant man! Note: Read textbook for exams. Exams aren't too bad at all.

There are a number of great psych professors at Ohio State and he's one of the better ones.  He doesn't just know the material, he's got a lot of experience in .it, as well.  Always has a good story to tell.  Read the book and go over notes and you'll be fine

Very laid back and nice guy. Attendance is not mandatory, he posts the slides on Carmen and they are extremely helpful. Read and outline the book alone and you will get an A on every exam. This is a very easy honors course, I highly recommend it.

I think he was a temporary professor for psych 100 honors, but honestly I love this man. He keeps it simple and clear, exams are pretty straight forward. I would highly recommend this class, do the readings and you will definitely get an A.
Interesting material presented in an engaging manner...really liked the class and Professor Kays. Bonus is he's a hottie!

Took him for Psychology in Sport, and the class is extremely interesting if your interested in athletics, duh. 2 exams and a final and that was it. Go to class and study the powerpoints. I suggest this to anyone interested.

Attendance isn't required, however there are in-class assignments (that you get credit for if you are there, just points for attending those days). Her lectures are entertaining, and she keeps you engaged the full hour. Most of your grade is off of 3 exams. I earned an A on all three. Show up, pay attention, study a little -- you'll do well.
She is very kind and funny. Her slides are well organized and easy to follow. They make it easy to study for her exams and as long as you study you'll do well.

While she appears to care about her students, I personally did not have many good interactions with professor Supe. She did not seem enthusiastic about helping when I asked her about how I could improve my grade, and any time I talked to her outside of class, I felt like I was burdening her with my time. Some might benefit from her, but I did not.

Just the best. If you have the chance, take her. She's funny, kind, and genuinely cares about the class material and her students. Lecture information is very easy to assimilate, and tests are pretty easy if you pay attention.

Dr. Supe is amazing. I'm a junior and she's the best prof I've had so far. Her lectures are engaging. She helps to make the content relevant and easier to conceptualize. Her exams are the perfect mix of challenging but doable.  I loved this class.

Dr Supe taught a frankly useless class (Gen Ed) in a really cool and helpful way. She played a lot of funny clips to keep us engaged. She was also genuinely interested in us and our personal lives. I had hardly any work outside class.

She's honestly an amazing prof, her lectures are interesting and her tone is engaging. She's the only PSYCH 3313 prof that gives exams, so watch out for that, but I feel like I learned a lot and would absolutely love to be in her class again.

I love Dr. Supe!! Her lectures truly were engaging and fun to go to. Attendance is mandatory in that she does a random, once-weekly TopHat, but it isn't a huge part of the grade. Group projects were manageable, and the weekly Carmen quizzes were application-based. She genuinely enjoys teaching and cares about her students!

Biweekly quizzes for grades and quite a few homework assignments, but very doable. If you watch her lectures and put in a google doc, you can command f to help on quizzes. it is a lot of info but it is not necessarily hard info. be ready for application-based questions more than just facts.

Dr. Supe is genuinely very sweet and caring. I was lucky to have her for launch seminar, which is a pretty boring class, but she made me look forward to it. The assignments are mostly busy work, but the few ones that make you think, she will stay after class to help you if you need. Try to have her if you can, she made 1201 actually bearable.

It's like she wants students to study during breaks (I had exams the day right after fall and thanksgiving break) when they should be with their families/friends! Plus, the course material is pretty hard but she doesn't do anything to make it easier to get a decent grade. Yes, she is a good teacher but honestly, she seems to lack compassion.
Taking 3313 online and asynch and it is not bad. lots of short (

Material was difficult at times for sure, but she was always so kind in the emails if you needed help or had a question. If you take good notes and do decent on the tests, you should be able to get a decent grade. Easy assignments, lowest test dropped. Probably gonna be easier for neuro majors more so than psych majors.

Amazing professor. Explained the material well and was always willing to help with questions. Lectures were prerecorded which sucked. Exams were decent, but some questions were not covered in lecture. Be prepared to study, although its interesting material.

I took Dr. Supe's online psych1100 last spring and had a good experience, so I took psych 3313 this fall- again, I'd recommend her class! While I didn't like this course as much, it was still engaging and easy to manage atop a busy schedule. Modules are organized and you can finish the course early to leave less work during finals.

Dr. Supe is great about encouraging outside learning and is the most understanding professor I've ever had. Her lectures actually make sense and is very willing and able when it comes to questions. Classes can be pretty group work/discussion heavy.

hands down, the nicest professor I have ever had. I had to get accommodations and miss a few weeks of school, and she was such a big help and incredibly understanding. Class is really hard, but she is more than willing to help. Such an amazing person and teacher, and truly cares about her students.

Don't do it! Never make the mistake of taking her summer class, all of us in that class struggling to figure out whats all due in that given week. The readings you do through the chapters is not enough for you to pass the quiz. But it seems like its mostly hard for pysch majors compared to neuroscience majors, so if you are a pyshc major good luck

If you can, take this class with someone else. Dr. Gibbs is clearly very passionate about the material, but his teaching is BEYOND outdated. He'll regularly teach concepts that were disproven years ago, and refers to publications from 20 years ago as "recent." Only redeeming quality is that exams were easy as he provides study questions.

Although you can tell that he cares, Dr. Gibbs' class is very outdated. Don't expect to find your grade on canvas at all during the semester. Going to his lectures are pointless, as you can just study the questions he posts and quizlet and still pass the exams with a B. If I had the option, I would take this class with a different professor.

Dr. Gibbs was a great professor for Psychology of Adult Years. He is very knowledgable and caring about the topic, and genuinely enjoys teaching. He has many fun stories and jokes. The layout of the course is very simple, and high success in the course is very attainable as long as you show up to class and read the textbook. Dr. Gibbs.

Dr. Gibbs is incredibly knowledgeable about psychology and gives clear grading criteria/instructions on how to succeed in his course. He is an expert in his field and provides insightful feedback and comments on student work in addition to comprehensive lectures. Exams are fair and I felt well-prepared. I learned and retained a lot in this course!

I have pretty much nothing good to say. He's very passionate about the material and obviously knows what he's talking about (he's friends with half of the psychologists in the textbook it seems) but his teaching is super outdated and he just needs to retire. The exams are easy enough if you study a bit. Coming to class is pointless though.

Attendance was not graded, but he did take it every day to see who actually came to class. Final grade is only based on the three exams and there is opportunity for extra credit. Lectures were insanely boring, if you read the book and use the study questions he provides you will do fine on the exams.

I can tell he's passionate about the subject. But as often as I try to smile and pay attention during lectures, I can't help but feel frustrated when he starts ranting off track. His answers are often really long and vague. Even if you study the 70+ study questions, there will be a lot that he never brought up in class or mentioned on Midterms.

Bless his heart but man he is too comfortable and uncritical about his knowledge and beliefs. He cites single study from 1990s to make confidence causal claims, ignoring the on-going "unrepeatable" crisis in psych research. His old-news-video-collection excludes experience of ppl who aren't cis straight white or well off. Sad and frustrating.

He is a nice guy, don't get me wrong, but he needs to retire. His content is extremely outdated and lectures are a waste of time as you're only tested on bits of it. 95% of everything you need to know is in the textbook, which is hardly covered in class. He takes attendance only to see who is coming to class (he won't help you if you don't attend).

Terrible. Avoid at all costs this class is basically self-taught. You have to read chapters from a textbook since the test is over all of it, but he spends each lecture on around 2 pages. Lecture is WORTHLESS and his lecture really just feel like an old man rambling on without clear idea of what he wants to get across. DO NOT TAKE IF U CAN

Nice guy and all, but not great professor. The reason I gave three stars was because I love studying Adolescent Development (and did well before this class). Very very outdated material is taught. Also uses old school teaching styles, which is fine I guess but dont expect anything on carmen or really for him to use the internet. But he is caring.

Slides and information are very outdated and honestly, problematic. He cited a study that was used to promote conversion therapy, cited another study that claimed that gay adults feel unsatisfied with their life, and used the term transsexual in class. Very little of the material was published within the last 5 years. Information is useless today

AVOID! (grad and undergrad). This class was incredibly frustrating. Read the book or you will not get above a C (that is as low as he goes at least). Lectures consisted of nothing but boosting his own ego & showing clips of "moral exemplars" and "What Would You Do?". Only grades are a paper, presentation, 3 exams, and "discussion Qs" NOT optional.

Obviously knows his stuff, he literally "wrote the book" on developmental morality. However, can be a bit vague and confusing at times, lecture slides do not give much info, and I had to rely on the textbook to really get the necessary information for the exams. Great genuine guy and solid professor

Gibbs is a really great instructor. He really cares about his students and hes really accessible. The content is awesome if youre into developmental psych and its a really laid back upper level psych course since exams are straightforward, easy, and dont count for much of the grade. Highly recommend him if youre looking for an easy A.

There were 3 exams, all multiple choice with 70 questions. Going to class and buying the book are pointless. All you have to do is go on quizlet and study the study questions from the powerpoint he post on Carmen. If you study those it is an easy A. Also does an extra credit book review which is optional.

Okay so the class is super easy if you have taken any basic psych classes before this. I literally tried with every thing in me to pay attention during lectures but they are excruciating. Only grades on 3 exams but has an extra credit paper option. Hes old and his class reflects old psychology methods, etc. Easy A if you dont mind boredom.

Lets just put it this way, hes old. Doesnt curve exams even if no one is getting perfects and no one got a perfect or even within 5 of a perfect on any of the exams. Would avoid him as a professor again or any class he teaches. Even my advisor sighed when I told her I had him lol.

Is not clear when trying to teach; teaches his own views and research instead of what is in the textbook; does not answer questions well; lectures are very boring but he shows a lot of videos; only graded on three tests including final but gives an extra credit book review that saved my grade; READ THE TEXTBOOK; gives study questions for tests

He is pretty long-winded, so lectures last the whole time. He has 3 exams which are based directly off his powerpoint and study questions during lectures. He takes attendance sometimes and will boost grades if you are a regular attendee. He is pretty understanding and if you miss a lecture, you can go to his office hours for a review of it.
He only has three exams and that is it. I liked how he gave us the questions but they were broad compared to the ones on the exams. His lectures were very boring.

Dr. Gibbs does not teach modern psychology. He teaches old psychology that is much more similar to armchair philosophy than modern, scientific psychology. For the love of everything holy, if you take a class from him do not believe that what you are learning is actually psychology!
Lectures were boring, but he gives you study guide question which are helpful for the exams.  Definitely have to read the textbook to pass

Gibbs could be a hot mess. Usually wears a mic that is torn off his shirt every ten minutes because he continues to step on the cord. At least it's a bit of a shock to wake you up from his boring lectures!!  Big mumbler; No need to attend class. Read book, fill out the study guide and you'll do just fine.

Was super boring but somehow got away with an A by reading the book the week before the exam. Don't need to attend class.. there were no participation points given just taken if you need an extra bump at the end of the class. Could've literally fallen asleep in his class

Don't know how its possible but he never actually taught. He talked about what he was going to talk about for 90 minutes!  must read the textbook in order to fill out the study guides. Only ever went to class to get the participation points. extra credit was amazing! reading a book and writing a review can bring your grade from a B+ to an A- exc.

I was not the biggest fan of Dr. Gibbs' class. He seems very nice, and was always very helpful if you had questions. But staying focused in his class was a huge challenge for me. He just wasn't a very engaging or interesting lecturer. Exams were okay, as long as you prepared.

Dr. Gibbs is charming. He wants you to succeed and will help you if you take the time to ask for it. If you the reading beforeclass it makes his lectures much easier to follow. 3 m.c. exams, definitely managable. He is understanding and down-to-earth.

A subtitle for this class: how to live the best life as long as possible. This class was more about adult growth and development than adult psychology. Gibbs is a brillant lecturer and I enjoyed his class greatly. Exams are 90% book reading, 10% lecture. Exams are specific, so do all review questions. Textbook=necessity. Extra credit=available.

Nice guy and easy class. I wish he would have been more engaging and that there was more discussion; he had all these interesting discussion questions on the syllabus but then never really asked them or one person would say something and he would move on. I personally really enjoy discussion so it was a bit disappointing. But overall interesting!

I loved this prof.  He's such a nice guy that cares about his students doing well.  He gives fairly good study guides (tons of work though-70 questions on each one).  His tests really weren't that hard, but you do have to study some.  He gives an extra credit option as well. Grade is based on 3 exams. No comprehensive final. Highly recommended!
He lets the students run the class, as is appropriate in a 600-level course.  Good class.
Really easy class if you do the readings and the paper. Three quizzes, which he gives you all of the questions ahead of time.  Really nice guy and extremely helpful

Prof. Gibbs is a nice older psychologist with a lot of experience in the field.  His lectures are boring, but the class is really easy.  3 midterms are the whole grade - they are 90% from the book, 10% from the lecture.  He gives really good outlines and study guides.  Extra credit opportunities. Minimum time & effort will = A

He doesn't teach anything, the entire class is based on presentations by your classmates.  He doesn't answer questions when you ask him.  He does give you all the test questions beforehand so it's easy but going to lecture is completely useless.
No Comments
I loved him.  He's incredibly intelligent, tells you what to study for, and makes you think.
Great professor, great person.  Helpful and likeable if you give him a chance
Horrible teacher.  Loves to hear his own voice.  Did not teach at all - but expected us to know the material.  Did not offer clarification when asked.

Dr. Gibbs leads an interesting class. You simply go over the assigned readings, & listen to classmates' presentations on papers.  Gives  the questions to all tests at beginning of quarter tho.  Overall, very cool.  His comb over will kill you.

Laura herself is very sweet, she reminds me of a Disney princess. However, this class is a decent amount of work. You must read the textbook because 10% of exam content is on it. She has very high expectations for her classes. Final Paper and Final Exam is a time killer. Only take this class if you are very passionate on the content.
she is amazing I recommend taking a class that she teaches. Assignments not too hard and help on anything is always provided if needed.

Laura is a great professor and brings a positive energy to every class that made me excited to learn! If you pay attention and take notes the exams are not hard (I didn't study at all for the midterm and got an A). Her expectations are a little high but she will always answer questions that you have. I would definitely take a class her class again!

She's very nice and gives good lectures, but she has high expectations. She does random attendence checks so you'll need to go to class, 10% of the exams are not apart of the slideshows so you'll have to read, and there's a semester long paper that's not too bad.

This class is definitely not an easy A, but the material is so interesting and Laura is amazing. The midterm was extremely hard but there was a curve, the whole class is only based on 200 points. Midterm, final, research paper, and random participation quizzes, that you had to get right, are it. Also reading is necessary, but take a class with her!

LAURA SIMON IS AMAZING! She is the most energetic, friendly, and fun teacher I have had at Ohio State. Not to mention she literally pavlovian conditions us in class with candy every time we answer a question. Like it is conditioning us to participate for candy, and she is using us as her guinea pigs! Agh she is so cool. Her lectures rock too.

This class is very definition heavy. I found it interesting, but it can get boring. Laura keeps it interesting by being very upbeat. She finds a way to mix humor, and it is clear she cares about her students. She gives candy out constantly.
Laura is a great professor and is very caring about her students to ensure everyone is successful. Loved this class!

Laura is a great lecturer. Her guided notes are very clear, and she usually explicitly points out the things youll need to know for the exam as shes teaching. She also hosts study sessions for every exam (VERY helpful), and she is very positive, funny, and caring.
Very great teacher and very caring. Also very very good looking..
More papers than I thought, but it in general it is a easy course.

Pretty incredible prof. She cared very much about us, and she was pretty good at explaining things. Her review sessions were incredibly helpful-- I only went to the review sessions for the 2nd midterm and the final, and my 1st midterm was by far my lowest exam grade despite my attempts to study on my own. Pretty funny, too, in a quirky way.

Professor Miller is an incredibly kind and engaged instructor. While the class can be challenging, he cares deeply about student success and offers ample support. Using resources like Unstuckstudy alongside the textbook has proven very helpful for exam prep.

Lectures are easy to follow and representative of class exams. Gives lots of extra credit so attend classes and use learning lab hours. If you pay attention in class and do practice problems you're all set.

Great professor! Always in a great mood, willing to answer questions, and has been nothing but kind and welcoming. Genuinely cares about whether students understand the material and whether his teaching methods are fair and useful!

Seth Miller is one of the best professors I've ever had. He is radically welcoming of questions and feedback and makes sure that he is fully answering the questions that you're asking(So many profs struggle with that) He stayed after class multiple times to help me fully grasp concepts. He genuinely loves teaching the class and it shows. W prof.

Dr. Miller is an amazing professor and one of the kindest people I've ever met. He truly cares for his students and wants them to do well. He takes somewhat difficult material and explains it really well. Extra credit for attendance at times. 100% recommend.

Professor did not allow open notes on exams like other sections and often left off equations on midterms. Difficult class if you've never taken stats before. He does not give example problems and his "study guides" are just a list of concepts. Overall, he's a really nice person outside of class but not good at lecturing imo

The class information was very uninteresting to me, but Seth Miller did an amazing job teaching the material. He provided tons of extra credit and encouraged students to go to his office hours and ask him questions. He always reviewed harder chapters with in class activities as well.
This course is incredibly easy, and Quizlet will be your best friend to prepare for the exams. There are three midterms and a final.

Unlike the other sections, the exams are closed-note and in person. Personally I do not really think this is fair, as it is far easier to have notes accessible for this course- without them get ready to actually put in a good deal of work. Dr. Miller is really nice, but I would look for another section.

Miller was the most caring professor I've ever met! He genuinely cares about all his students and will go out of his way to help you succeed. His lectures are fun and engaging and he thoroughly explains any questions we have. With that being said his exams are a but difficult because you have to remember many equations and understand all material.

Dr. Miller is a gentleman. I almost couldn't make it to a midterm because I was stuck in another state, but he let me know we could work things out. I also didn't go to class that often but still got a good grade. As long as you put in the effort, you'll get an easy A for sure.

SO NICE. You can tell he REALLY wants you to succeed and will do anything in his power to make that happen. Class participation is important as it lets him know what he can do to help and also shows that you're listening but he is so, so nice. He deserves professor of the year honestly

He is very passionate and cares about his students and teaches in multiple teaching styles so that everyone can understand the content. There's opportunities for extra credit and resources to do well in the class.
Was the sweetest man I have ever had as a teacher. Very understanding and class was great and easy.

One of the kindest people I have ever met. I don't think I've ever been more excited to attend a class than I am his. If you have him, you are blessed. He is open to literally any questions, moves at a pace that is good for everyone, and truly wants to get to know you. Truly the embodiment of a professor who is aware of mental health.

I had this professor for research methods and data analysis and enjoyed both of them! This is one of the best professors I have had at OSU. Professor Miller really cares about everyone and is ready to help if you have questions. The class is also really organized and super clear. Not too much homework and the tests were fair.

I was excited to take Professor Miller's class because of his good reviews but I was very let down by him. He is extremely hard to ask questions as he does not give you a straight answer to be "fair for everyone". I tried asking questions for clarification but it never helped me so I gave up on asking him. I wouldn't take any of his classes again.
Awesome guy, awesome teacher, peal of professing abilities

GOAT in human form. I truly do not know why this professor doesn't have a perfect rating. He is knowledgeable about the content and truly cares about his students. Dr.Miller is a paragon of virtue among a sea of miserable, overworked, and on-edge professors.
GOAT in human form.
He TRULY cares about his students

I was blown away by how compassionate Dr. Miller was, and by how open he was to questions. You can tell that he legitimately cares about his students and making sure that you understand the material. The class can be tricky but Dr. Miller structures lectures so that everyone has a chance to ask any questions, and he works hard to answer them.
Professor Miller is awesome! He really cares about his class and making sure everyone understand the materia thoroughly. I would 100% recommend and plan to take another class with him in the future.

professor miller is easily one of the best profs ive had at osu. he is super caring towards his students and genuinely wants nothing but success for his students. he always strives to make sure that everyone is accommodated.

Seth Miller is an amazing professor and you should definitely take his classes. He is extremely clear and really wants his students to succeed. Asking questions after class and taking advantage of office hours is a good resource for his classes because he is super helpful one on one. Test questions are clearly worded and he gives tons of resources.

Hard to fall behind. Go to class, ask questions. Not necessary to read textbook-he covers it all in lecture. Debatable if I'd take again as it was painful to stay awake in class. Miller is so thorough I couldn't pay attention to his lengthy explanations. Not sure it's a bad thing that he covers material at snail speed though-made class very easy!
Love the class!

Dr. Miller is great! The class was pretty easy as long as you study the formulas and do your work. The only time I struggled a little was for the final, but I still ended up with an A. He gave us chances for extra credit and if you did all of that you could earn up to 5% added to your final grade which was awesome. I highly recommend him!

Seth is a great professor and is out to help his students. I found this course to be sometimes tricky to follow as there were different websites for each type of assignment. There also isn't much graded!

I do warn anyone signing up for psych 4508 that it is a statistics-heavy course, which I somehow did not gather beforehand lol. However, Seth is great! Even online he was very clear and accessible with online lectures, feedback, and review sessions before the exams. As always, highly recommend him as a professor!

The best professor I have ever had thus far at OSU. He is very eager to help and cares about his students. I was nervous about this class being difficult but Professor Miller is excellent at making his topics clear and concise and explaining things. Everyone should definitely take a class with him!

Professor Miller is one of the best professors I've had, not only in my psych major but at OSU overall. I had him for 2220&2300. He really cares about his students and makes it clear he is always happy to help. He sends a lot of reminders out about upcoming assignments which is nice. I would 15/10 recommend him as a professor.

Probably one of my favorite professors so far. Good at explaining the concepts and goes above and beyond to help his students succeed. Assignments and exams are fairly easy, and there is extra credit as well. I would for sure take Dr. Miller again and would recommend him to anyone.

By far one of my favorite professors on campus so far. He is extremely clear and easy to understand, and always makes sure to clarify or help if needed. He also gives nice examples and walks through each step to make sure concepts are well-understood. The class was also extremely lax, and although easy, was very important. 10/10, definitely choose!
amazing prof who really cares about his students.

Dr. Miller truly wants his students to pass. During COVID his class is online and is entirely asynchronous aside from optional review sessions. He sends out reminders about tests and homework. I have taken him for two different classes and for both his lectures covered all the content and I never had to read the books. No complaints from me!!!

Dr. Miller is hands down one of the best professors I have had. There aren't many assignments so missing a few can really hurt your grade but they're all easy. He has great recorded lectures & is amazing at explaining things in so many ways. Responds to emails quickly & gives great outlines for exams. I cannot express how much I enjoyed his class.

He is such an angel. Replies to your emails in rapid timing, and he literally explains everything in 10 different ways. He's extremely understanding, and his tests are pretty easy. The textbook is basically in the lectures. He is also a great online teacher, and his recorded lectures are relatively short. Gives you tons of practice, too.

Professor Miller was a great professor. He gives extra credit just for showing up to class. He is constantly checking up on his class during lecture to make sure everyone is understanding what is happening, he answers emails very quickly, and he is overall a very nice guy. I definitely recommend him! I had him for both Psych 2300 and Psych 2220!

Hes a really nice professor and you can tell he cares about what hes teaching. He often pauses lectures to make sure everybody is on the same page. His exams are easy if you go to lectures. He also quick to answer emails.

Dr. Miller is a good lecturer and he really cares about his students. Sometimes he overexplains and makes the material more confusing, but overall he is a good professor. This course is test heavy, but I don't think it's hard as long as you read the book and go to lecture. His exams are reasonable, not difficult. I think it's an easy class.

You can tell that Dr. Miller really cares about the content of the course and also helping his students. However he is a little inflexible when it comes to extenuating circumstances. There are few opportunities for grades outside of exams and all of his 'extra credit' assignments put together are worth less than 1 point. His exams are unnecessarily

He is a wonderful professor who really cares about teaching. Hes extremely easy to reach and explains everything well. However his class is easy but unforgiving. Exams count for 70% and there are only 3 exams. The homework isnt a guaranteed 100% since the questions can be really tricky. Take it with Yocom, she gives a lot more extra credit.

He is a very fair professor who cares a lot about making sure his students understand the material. You will hear him ask if theres anything he can do to clarify like 15 times per class lol. Exams are straight from the slides and practice problems. Absolutely would recommend!

Explains things very well, all slides available online, and the textbook is useful if you don't understand what's going on in class. Like other users said, we only have 3 exams and 6 HW. The extra credit he offers is useless. If you study well though and understand definitions/content, you'll do very well. I missed class a lot and got an A, so dw

Dr. Miller is great. He consistently offers up the opportunity for students to ask questions during lectures and answeres those questions well. The only frustrating thing about his classes is they are graded by very little ( 6 homework assignments and 3 exams), leaving very little room for mistakes to be made.

I LOVE DR. MILLER!!! one of the nicest, most caring professors I've had!! You definitely need to go to lecture, even though he post the slides, he always thoroughly explains concepts and makes sure everyone understands. he always says "does that make sense?" before moving on. homework is easy and the stat learning lab is great! good class!
Dr. Miller gives really heavy lectures with a very robotic voice. He is really good at answering questions and clarifying topics.

He was great and class wasn't hard at all. He's nice and is very happy to explain things again if you're confused. There's 6 easy HW assignments and 3 exams total. Honestly, I skipped class a lot and did very well. The lecture slides are good enough, but some topics are harder, so the textbook helps if you're confused! Overall, I recommend.

Prof. Miller is really knowledgable and wants his students to succeed. His exams are very straightforward (he doesn't try to trick you). His lectures can be a bit boring but it's more the material than his teaching. There's not much we're graded on so it's important to do well on the exams but the exams aren't very hard.
A great professor. Lectures can be really boring, but he wants students to understand the concepts and succeed in the class.
Amazing professor. Very clear and super nice. Lecture and notes are enough to pass the class without the textbook!

The nicest professor that I have had. Going to his office hours helped me do a lot better on his exams. He is there for you as long as you have questions. There is homework but its generally pretty easy. He gives a study guide before exams and random attendance extra credit. Overall a pretty chill guy.

Prof Miller is the nicest professor I've ever had. The lectures can be dry and boring but he's very good at explaining and making sure you understand the material. Exams are a big part of the grade but he gives good study guides. He gives extra credit but it doesnt do much. The material is stats so its still hard but if you have to take it take him

He is one of my favorite professors here at OSU by far! He is so kind and caring and always smiling! He is willing to go the extra mile to make sure his students understand. If you study the information he gives you and study the review guide you should be set. He is very clear on what you need to know. I highly recommend him!

He is a really nice professor and he cares his students a lot. He would like to help his students even the questions are not from his lecture. His lecture is a bit boring, but easy to understand. He provide about 2% extra credit for participate in class. The exams are not hard at all. We all like him and m taking his 2300 this semester.

I hate statistics, and I am bad at statistics, but professor Miller really does his best to assure that everyone understands the material. Seven homeworks and four exams; exams are all multiple choice and the homework is cake, but if you forget to do one your grade is doomed. He is super energetic, and you can tell how passionate he is about class

Seth Miller is absolutely fantastic! He shows a genuine interest in helping his students be successful and offers extra credit for attendance some days, so I suggest always going to class. Gives out good practice activities in class to help better understanding of concepts. Lectures can be a little boring, but very informative and clear.

One of my favortie professors. Can be pretty robototic sounding at times but one of the most genuinely caring teachers Ive had. Material is clear and the study guides posted helps a lot when studying for exams. This class is not hard. Once you get a couple concepts down, you are bound to pass. Highly recommend Seth Miller.. easy A for me!

Seth is the most kind-hearted, welcoming soul. He's honestly been one of my biggest role models in college, as Ive had him for 2200 and 4508. He will do everything in his power to help you succeed and get as much as you can out of the class. You NEED to take a class with him before you graduate!

Seth Miller is the most caring and thoughtful professor I have ever encountered. He stops and asks "does that seem fair to everyone?" as well as "any questions or concerns, or anything I can do to help out??" and genuinely appreciates questions. He has always answered my questions on Carmen or email promptly and with great detail.

Very nice guy. Attendance isn't mandatory, but he does take attendance randomly for extra credit. Tests aren't that hard as long as you study a little bit. He is very robotic and reads off the slides, but does his best to answer any questions you have.

Seth Miller is the best professor I've ever had! He is smart, caring and very encouraging. He truly cares about every student in his class. He makes the concepts of this (already pretty easy) class very clear. If you have to take Psych 2220, make sure you take it with him.

Seth is VERY nice. He's kind and caring (yes, boring too & reads the slides), but there were so many people who didn't use a graphing calculator and struggled. PLEASE. USE. THE. GRAPHING. CALC!!! Goddamn, I can't stress this enough. He's nice when explaining things though :) Tests you really gotta study for, but they aren't "hard", just medium

Seth is one of the most thorough professors I've ever had. He definitely loves his job and he makes sure that students' questions are answered fully. Although attendance is not mandatory, he does offer extra credit throughout the semester. The exams are extremely easy and if you pay attention to the lectures, you'll be sure to pass.

Professor is a great guy. Kind of acts like a robot but really cares about his students. Quizzes every couple units are easy 100s. Exams are MC and really straight forward as he gives a review for each one. Lectures are boring, occasional attendance for extra credit. TAKE HIM!!!!!!

Easiest class ever, but Dr. Miller is EXTREMELY robotic and boring. He has you read the textbook outside of class, but everything from the textbook is covered in his lecture slides so it's not needed. Super easy class though, so if you're okay with a boring professor he's a solid choice.

The material for the class is unbareably dry, but Prof. Miller does his best to make it interesting. You can tell that he is passionate about what he teaches and truly wants his students to enjoy and understand the material. He occasionally takes attendance for extra credit, but showing up isnt necessary to do well. Just do the exam study guides.

Prof Miller is such a caring, goofy guy. He's incredibly helpful, his homework questions are important for your grade though, but the slides make passing very very easy. He's also very transparent and willing to hear criticism/have discussion. Extremely respectable & respects his students in turn.

Seth is alright but the class set-up is HORRIBLY. The way the class is set up, each homework question is weighted just as heavily as each EXAM question, and EVEN MORE THAN EACH QUESTION ON THE FINAL EXAM. The homework is usually about 10 questions long and 5% of your grade, making it impossible to learn from your mistakes and get a good grade.

He is the most caring professor I have ever had! If you ask him a question, he will make sure you understand it and even will make examples for you. His lecture is not so fun probably because data analysis is not a fun class, but he manages to make all things clear and easy to understand.

Seth makes everything extremely clear. Hes a little awkward but it truly works to his advantage in this class. 7 quizzes, 4 exams, some reading to aid with the quizzes but i never read the full chapters. Quizzes are very easy but make sure you actually do them because there arent very many and they have a large impact on your grade (5% each).

Really nice guy, always eager to talk to you and help you out. Tests are fair, and everyone usually does really well. If you study then you'll do fine, but you do need to study. Participation extra credit at random, so show up! He doesn't grade on a lot of things, so your extra credit will actually help boost you a lot. One of my favorite profs!

Important to go to class for extra credit and in-class activities that really help with material. I did not buy a textbook and did not go to review sessions, but I did fine. I really enjoy Seth's teaching, as he is very caring and committed to students' understanding. As others have stated, he is quite robotic in nature, but in the best way.

One of the best, kind hearted, genuinely interested professors I've had at OSU. He will take a lot of time out of his lecture to make sure you're understanding and makes the environment a welcoming place. I went through some personal troubles and had an exam the next day, but after emailing him he let me take it the next day. Genuinely cares.

such a nice guy! the material was super challenging, but he really tried to help and make it easier. have to study a ton for his exams. gives review sheets and in class practice to help. had lots of time to do the online homework, made that as simple as he could. material is just plain old difficult, but would take another class with him any day!

Prof. Seth Miller is AMAZING. I absolutely adore him. His lectures flow logically and he breaks down all the concepts with examples, repetition and questions so you learn and retain them. He will go above and beyond to care for all his students and make sure no one gets left behind. Don't take this class from any other prof. 11/10!!

One of the best professors I've ever had. Tests/HW incredibly easy & straightforward. Lectures nonmandatory, he reads directly off the slides & gives EC for attendance on days w review activities. Weird dude but so kind/understanding. Once gave me 3 pts back on an exam where i wrote the right answer and circled the wrong one. 10/10 would take again

NOT TAKING ONE OF HIS CLASSES IS DOING A DISSERVICE TO YOURSELF. I had optometry school interviews & family emergencies whilst in his class, and he could not have been more understanding & accommodating. In a culture of professors who couldn't care less about their students, he will undoubtedly go the extra mile for you. (also no attendance grade)
Class is pretty boring but Seth definitely cares about his students and makes sure they understand the material. Probably the most caring professor I've had yet.

Pretty monotone lecturer and dreaded going to that class everyday because of how boring it was. Class is relatively easy and extra credit is sometimes given out for attendance. Do the homework and end of chapter problems for exam practice and you'll be fine.
I've had several classes with Seth, he is the best. He makes sure that everyone understands it all. Tests need some heavy studying, but not impossible. He's great!

You can tell he cares about teaching and likes what he does, but he doesn't necessarily care about your progress in his class. Lectures are extremely boring, and usually not very helpful as far as learning the material goes. It's easier to teach yourself the material and pray for the best on the exams.

He is super caring. I don't know what other people are saying. Data analysis is a boring class, yeah it's gonna be monotone but he's one of the most caring profs I've ever had. He deserves way more credit than he's given.

Seth was one of the nicest profs I've had. He really cares about his students and always asks if anyone has any questions. Attendance isn't mandatory, but he often gives extra credit for showing up. Would recommend!

Run awaaay! Dr. Miller is a good guy, knowledgeable, and enjoys his job... but, maybe to a fault.
