There is no sense in going to class because he will trail off topic or give you information he will later tell you that you "didn't need to know." The tests are hard and time in class is insanely boring. You can tell he's sweet so I hate to rag, but no

Dry lectures. He tries to be funny, which is respectable. Super nice guy, and loves his job. He also cares a lot about students doing well which is really nice. Overall if you study the lecture notes and come to class to learn stats you'll do great. He's a really great guy

Professor Miller loves the material and loves teaching.  Class wasn't too bad, 3 exams each worth 25% and homework worth 25%.  Final was cumulative, but the class average was a B.  Would definitely recommend, one of the most passionate teachers I've had at OSU and very interesting subject to learn about.

Overall not an extremely hard class if you read the notes very carefully. He reads directly from the slides but it is still worth going to class because he gives extra credit for attendance and the in-class activities are super helpful. Seth is very enthusiastic about stats, easily accessible, and wants to help! Best professor for PSYCH2220.

Dr. Miller is great! He is super nice and although his lectures can get boring he is very caring/open to helping anyone who is having trouble. Grade consists of 3 Exams (65%) and a few online homework assignments, which definitely require attention to do well (35%). Extra-credit for attending class too. Study and do homework well and get an A.

He is quirky and kind of weird but he's a nice guy who cares about his class. Sometimes the quizzes and tests seemed harder than they needed to be, but overall the material was just way denser and more math based than I expected. Seth is very into it though and tries to make you interested too. He is defintiely willing to talk and help if you need.

Seth is an incredible guy! He does his absolute best to make sure he's explaining everything clear enough so that everyone understands. He is definitely the kindest professor I've had so far. He explains his grading style in depth so you understand why you got the grade you did. He's great and I would love to take him again!

Dr. Miller is so friendly. He is a bit boring but he is so kind and is extremely approachable. He always makes sure everyone knows what is going on and is encourages people to challenge him and ask him to explain things differently. Awesome professor.  Some pretty simple homework assignments and tests are totally fair.

He is such a great guy! He cares a lot about your grade and loves to answer questions. He is very helpful. There is weekly homework, which I thought was a little difficult but overall it was an easy class.

Take a class with Seth Miller if you want a teacher who will go out of their way to help you understand the material. Seth is super friendly, has a positive attitude, and truly enjoys teaching. Also, he posts grades faster than most instructors I've had and is very fair -- if an exam question is subpar, he'll make it bonus points.

Go to class, he gives random extra credit just for attendance. He's kind of a robotic lecturer, but in a good way. It's like watching an extremely well rehearsed ted talk. He's a very fair grader, very nice, and obviously wants students to pass. Only two midterms, a final, and a couple HW assignments determine the grade though.

Random in-class attendance for extra credit. I never went, I hate stats. He is strange but cool, this is my second class with him. I had to study extra from the book just because it's math. He does a good job at getting practice for the people who go to class.
Would never be able to focus in class. Reads word for word on slides and I can never pay attention.  Very dry lectures and doesn't do enough in class activities to help us understand the content.

Professor Miller is helpful and wants you to pass! If you have problems with homework or have a question about anything you can go to his office hours and he will sit down and do your homework with you or walk through whatever your question may be. He gives extra credit for attending class so I would recommend you go for easy points.

He's very excited about teaching and his enthusiasm makes the boring material bearable. He wants to make sure that every student understands the material before moving on and answers all questions very well. I really liked having a teacher that actually looked like they enjoyed what they were talking about, instead of just blandly reciting words.

I really, really like Seth's class.  Great lecturer, with youthful enthusiasm and a genuine interest in his subject and teaching.  I'd definitely recommend him for anyone needing to take 2300, which all psych majors at OSU need.

Dr. Miller was an incredible professor and a genuinely great person.  He really cares about his students.  His lectures are a bit dry, but his positive, outgoing attitude makes them bearable.  His class is very straightforward and to the point.  The best professor I have had at OSU, thus far.  This man is an angel.

Content is boring but if you study hard for  the tests you should be able to pass with at least a B. If you attend class tests are definitely easier and material is easier to review. Text book questions are sometimes in the homework, but I did not necessarily need it to study for the tests, his power points are pretty helpful.

Despite his dry sense of humor (which I enjoyed), Dr. Miller is a good teacher. His lectures are extremely informative, the exams are straightforward, and with minimal studying (maybe 2 hours per exam), this class is an easy B. He does take attendance grades about 10 times throughout the semester, so be ready to show up. Textbook is a must, rent it

Dr. Miller is a little awkward but definitely a great professor; the material is just incredibly boring. He takes random attendance with a couple drops allowed, so I stopped going to class after I got the credit. All I did was study the notes before the exams and got a solid A in the class. Never bought or had to use the book.

Nicest professor I've ever had. The material for this course is rather boring but he tries his best to make it interesting...I struggled to stay awake in class. As long as you read the book before the test you will be fine!!

Dr. Miller is a great professor who works hard to make sure students understand the material he teaches. He is obviously very passionate about psychology, and it helps make the dry material more interesting. I would definitely take him again.

Great instructor. He regularly asks if anyone has questions. Homework & exams are straightforward. The material is really dry but professor Miller does his best to keep students interested during class.

He is a great teacher! Most of the time you feel bad for not paying attention in class, because of his  enthusiasm and love for the subject. Respects, and treats the students as equals. Very fair. Tests are not tricky, if you study, you will do great! If you mess up the homework but he sees that your thinking was correct, you'll still get points.:)

Lectures are very clear. He stops for questions regularly, so nobody gets lost. He really makes an effort to make the material bearable, and is aware it's dry. Gives activities with the option to work together, but doesn't force groups. Everything is straightforward- no surprises.
Very sweet guy. Really wants you to understand. Material is very dry but he tries to make it less so.

Seth Miller is very nerdy. He is also very nice. His class wasn't difficult and I would take it again and recommend. It is boring, but that just comes with the material. You can easily get away with skipping class the entire semester and just go in for the exams if that is what you are looking to do.

His tests are extremely difficult and lectures are very boring.   All he does is read from the power point. I recommend taking this course with a different professor. After the first exam 15 students dropped the class.

This class itself was boring, but Seth really tries his best to be clear and helpful. If you have any questions, go to office hours or email him and he'll respond right away. Attendance is taken at 10 random times throughout the semester. The textbook isn't absolutely necessary, but if you don't go to class often you should get it and read it.

Straightforward test questions, if you know the basics of the material then the questions are super easy. His enthusiasm makes up for the dry material. Always looking to be as helpful as possible. Going to class helps at the end, but the participation grades for the 10 activities throughout the semester

Professor Miller was by far my favorite professor of this semester! He was super clear in lectures and would answer any questions with great feedback. I especially admired his enthusiasm towards trying to make a dry topic bearable. He really goes above and beyond for students. I'd recommend his class to anyone needing a Research Psch credit.

Really, really nice guy. The material isn't too difficult to begin with, but he walks you through anything that could pose a problem. You can tell he enjoys teaching and is happy to help any student. The class isn't too interesting, but I think that would be the case regardless of who was teaching it.

The subject matter is a bit dry, but he really does his best to communicate it well to the students. Sometimes I think he gets caught up and might make it seem a little more confusing than it is, but that's rare. He is incredibly helpful, always encouraging questions, giving great responses and always willing to help you understand the material.

His research methods class basically saved my semester. He wants his students to understand the material and is more than willing to go over the material again or in a different way to explain it. Exams are super easy. The class is a requirement for psych majors, but I would definitely recommend taking research methods with Seth over someone else.

It is an easy A if you put time into learning his study guide. Dr. Leber creates his exams based on the study guide he provides in class. His exam is straightforward, no tricky questions. He loves to put on some silly, funny answers on the exams as well. Grade is based on 2 MTs with 40 questions each and one cumulative final with 80 questions.
super super nice! i loved dr. Leber, he was super kind and understanding and extremely clear in what will be on exams. everything is straight forward!

Dr. Leber is a great professor! Truly one of the smartest and kindest professors I have had. He has clear grading criteria and his exams are very fair-2 exams and one cumulative final (all MC). Very little coursework. He explains difficult topics really well and is more than willing to go over anything. Def recommend!

Dr. Leber is a very enthusiastic and caring professor. His 80 minute lecture tended to drag on a bit, but overall was a fun course. The exams were very fair, and the quizzes and paper are essentially graded for completion and take up a decent percentage of the grade. If you pay attention in lecture and do assignments, it's a pretty easy A.

All the lectures are recorded which is a lifesaver!! 60% of the class is divided between 3 exams but if you study they aren't difficult I had a 99% literally the whole class until the final which dropped my grade to a 97% because I didn't study much for the final. He makes class interesting so the lectures aren't hard to listen to at all.
Grade is mainly test based and communication outside of classroom is not that great.

Dr. Leber was awesome. Genuinely enjoyed his class. He's so funny and his sense of humor is perfect for engaging college kids. Attendance isn't mandatory and lectures are recorded which is great. Exams are all multiple choice and totally fair. Easy class for Neuro majors.

Dr. Leber was such a great professor! You can tell he is very passionate about what he teaches and ALWAYS answered student questions. The pace of the class was very manageable (sometimes a bit slow but I can't complain about that) and he gave helpful study guides for exams. As long as you attend lecture and do the study guide, it's an easy A!

Dr. Leber is funny and just a very welcoming person in general. I was never scared to ask him a question! His quizzes and exams were very fair, and he graded papers very leniently too. I was not a big fan of the weekly breakout room session, but I understand why he did them.

We did group discussions (breakout rooms) that were worth a lot, but it was basically if you showed up and submitted something, you were fine. Tests were fair, he's honestly just such an awesome guy. So understanding during the pandemic, definitely the teacher I'd recommend for this class!

legit a dad figure. Such a great guy. I will take any class he offers because he makes class so much fun. not only is it fun, he makes neuroscience easy to understand and is always super helpful. He tries to make his class a "sanctuary" and it really is. Seriously though, love this guy. You won't regret taking his class.

The class itself is not terribly hard, however, IT'S SO BORING. His voice is monotone which makes paying attention to the already boring material very hard. He claims he only tests on material from his study guide and then puts random material on his exams that were not from the study guide. Good guy, BAD teacher!
I LOVED DR LEBER!! I always recommend him to anyone. I just studied the slides and I was fine. He's really not out to get you.

He's really cool, passionate and interesting. Recommend him. His lecture consists of: 50% jokes (ehich I really cannot always get) and cute puppies or some other animals, 20% about personal experience, mostly academic experience, 30% real lecture which is awesome. Class is not hard, just pay attention and rebiew carefully, then you'll ace it.

Dr. Leber is amazing, he's a really cool guy, and he reminds me of Shaggy from Scooby-Doo. Psych 3513 was literally a joke. Just read the slides and make sure you know all the terms on the study guides he gives and you'll get an A.

Professor Leber is very passionate about cognitive psychology, and would often share personal research stories, which definitely enhanced the course. His exams were based off the lectures, but it helped to look up things in more depth in the textbook, as the exam questions sometimes required a deeper level of understanding.
Great guy, explains everything well. Does call out people for cell phone usage but he is genuinely a great lecturer. Not many assignments and exams were very doable. Great class!

I LOVE Dr. Leber. He plays animal videos before each class and he's just such a pure human. He really enjoys psychology, and he does his best to make the material interesting. This class is very simple and he posts study guides for each exam. The final is cumulative, but fill out the study guide and you'll be fine. He cracks jokes a lot too.
His lectures can be a little dry, but the class is super easy to get an A in.

I loved having Dr. Leber! He was super interested in the subject material and made a long lecture fun with his humor. Tests are super fair, he gives a study guide and as long as you understand the material, you should have no problem doing well. With a slight curve, I got above 100 on one of his midterms. He's a really nice guy, too.

Let me at least give hime this: he's a super nice guy. However that's where the list of positives ends. His lectures are dry, I could barely make it through the class and dreaded going to it every day. Half way through the semester I stopped going. He obviously tries, but this was the single most boring and hated class I've ever had.

Leber gives lectures with really interesting examples (often old psych experiments) and is funny and a very cheesy way. His tests are fair but have some questions that you would only know from in-class lectures. He had a few HW articles with short quizzes that were really just checking if you read the article.

He teaches the material well because he's an expert in the field (he has a lab, does experiments). Relates things to real life and his in class demonstrations help in remembering for the exams. Has quizzes, papers, and midterms. All are reasonable. You will learn from his class.

Professor Leber is a really nice guy and always plays cute animal videos before class. He seems to genuinely care about the class and although Cog Neuro material can be dull, he does his best to keep everyone somewhat engaged.

He knows a lot and will help you if you ever need anything. Lectures are not too fast, has powerpoints online, grading is straight forward, you will want to take him again. (keep an eye out for his jokes, subtle at times but hilarious if you get it) plus he's tall and kinda cuute..

He was a super nice guy! Always started class with a cute animal video. Lectures were kinda long and dry, heavy focus on research studies. Had a few essays and discussion posts on studies. Exams weren't bad, always had a few fun extra credit questions (ex. think of a clever psych related pun or joke)

Dr. Leber is a really really nice person, but not the best lecturer. His class can get very dry and he seems to talk about some other things instead of focusing on the materials. He also forgot about things or couldn't fully explain everything  clearly, but he is always there to help and there is a curve for the grades! Yeah! Nice guy!

Dr. Leber is wonderful. He starts off every class with cute puppy videos and tells a lot of funny bad jokes through class. He tries to be as helpful as possible and is pretty approachable. If you go to class you won't need the textbook (and if you must have a textbook, the old addition is fine). Good guy, and good class!

May just be my learning style, but his explanations were confusing to me even with knowledge from other psych courses. Maybe because he often gets sidetracked. Probably will still get an A but not one of the clearest profs. Dry sort of humor. Does give quizzes and DB postings on 4 articles throughout semester. Can't fail quizzes if read article.

Dr. Leber is funny, interesting, and knowledgeable. I loved his class, but the lectures could be very dry at times. If you don't like Psych classes that focus on experiments to teach, you won't like the class. Overall, very good.
He makes some classes very interesting and some extremely boring. Study guides are very helpful and if you do them you will do well on the tests for sure. I would definitely recommend this class!

Teacher is very nice, he does give you a study guide that was useful to a degree, don't expect a curve or additional extra credit. His exams are worth alot of your grade, so if you fail one your practically screwed. I wouldn't recommend unless you have a basic understanding of the subject already. Also his lecture s are very boring.

Dr. Leber is an insanely nice dude and his lectures are genuinely interesting. He often started days with a video of puppies to cheer everyone up. Quizzes are straightforward and provides a comprehensive study guide for the exams, but the content is difficult. Would still highly recommend him!

Professor is very nice and is caring and wants everyone to feel comfortable asking questions and is very approachable. However, he tends to overcomplicate explanations of different concepts. He doesn't know how to simplify it for someone who's a beginner. It is important to be self reliant  and resourceful in order to be successful.

Dr. Wegener is a fantastic professor. He explains the topics really well and is always willing to answer questions. Only grades are 4 exams (not cumulative) and 13 open-note assignments (can drop 3 worst). Definitely one of the kindest and smartest professors. He truly cares about his students and wants to see them succeed. Definitely recommend!

Dr. Wegener is very kind and passionate about what he teaches but his lectures are very hard to understand. He seems to know what he is talking about but does not explain it in an understandable way. He also grades on a Z-table. He also uses many symbols interchangeably without telling us they are the same thing. nice guy, but not the best lecturer

He is nice but not a good lecturer: explains things in abstract, confusing ways. 3 exams and 1 written assignment make up your grade. Each question is worth 3 points, with 3 short answer questions (16 pts). The mean for the first exam was 66/100. Attendance is not graded, but slides are not helpful. Textbook may help, I didn't use it.

Dr. Wegener is a very competent researcher - but not a phenomenal lecturer. His tests can be really tough and the material isn't always explained effectively. He implements a curved grading scale on assignments because most people don't do very well. Not that recommended unless you really want to learn about Attitudes and Persuasion.

Professor Wegener made the material as interesting as he could!! Tests can be tough! So read and re-read the books and his vague lecture outlines! He gets very specific about theories and major experiments discussed in class!
Dr. Wegener is fantastic, but a little boring to listen to at 8 a.m. He is an expert in the field of attitudes and persuasion, and it's easy to learn from him.

If you have taken some stats before, maybe you'll be fine. If this is your first taste of stats, good luck. He said that he would stay away from math and deal with "concepts".  That seems to have amounted to: you don't have to memorize formulas.  But we NEVER get anything explained using concrete ex's. it's always abstract.

wasnt bad definitely better than what youd get if you took STAT 514 instead His first exam took about 1 hour 30 minutes longer for us to finish than he had planned. He acted shocked that we werent done, and kinda insulted us saying his undergrads get the same LENGTH of test, which means nothing.

This class is basically stat for psych majors, and I'm so glad I took it!  I hate stat, but Dr. Wegener made it so easy to understand and he cut out a bunch of the stuff we were "supposed" to go over, because he said we'd never need it.

dr. wegener was teriffic.  he has an amazing amount of knowledge and experience in this subject.  he communicate very well and teaches in an exciting manner.  he makes sure that everyone can understand and master the materail.  i would recommend taking a c
Yeah he was very cool.  He was always pleasant to deal with and seemed genuinely interested in student's concerns.
No Comments

Prof. Cheavens is a bright teacher that cares about her students and the subject. I would have no problem taking her again. Beware that she posts an abridged version of the slides online and showing up to every class will help because it's where online pop quizzes are announced and the exams are pretty tricky that contain fairly specific questions.

AMAZING professor. She is extremely intelligent and is the author of the textbook needed for class. There are some exam questions from the textbook not covered in class, but I did not read it in much depth and still did well on the exams. She will also curve the exam if the average is low. Lectures are fun and assignments are graded very easy.

I'm obsessed with this woman. Do I want to be her protege? Do I want to be her bestie? Do I have a crush on her? Yes all of the above... it's very confusing. I know this says absolutely nothing about her teaching, but I do highly recommend everyone take positive psych with her she's great.

Prof Cheavens was one of my favorite teachers I've had at OSU! She is so funny and makes it so easy to pay attention and participate in her class. She made everyone feel welcome to speak up and share opinions during lecture. Final grade was made up of quizzes, a group project and light homework. Would recommend to anyone!!

Easily the best professor I've had at OSU. She is fun, outgoing, and passionate about the content she teaches -- not to mention the material is fascinating in general (coming from a non-psych major). Huge fan & would absolutely take the class again!

My FAVORITE professor at OSU. She is extremely approachable, fun to be around, entertaining with great lectures, and helpful/understanding with any concerns you may have. Always in a great mood and has never come off as standoffish to me. 10/10 would recommend taking one of her classes before you graduate. She is AMAZING!!!

Nice, but personality is standoffish, extra credit of 15 points optional at the end of the semester. attendance non mandatory but she will randomly take attendance throughout the semester the points. 4 papers that can be on anything, only one page, super easy 20 points. Not much reading.

Jenn is by far my favorite professor I have had in college so far. She is funny, engaging, and shows the BEST videos in class. Very willing to help at office hours. Tests are fair, so you have to study if you want a good grade! Attendance is not mandatory but she does do random attendance quizes. Would HIGHLY recommend her to anyone!

Dr. Jaime was a good professor. The class was very lecture heavy, however their expertise in the field made the lectures very interesting and engaging. One issue was some of the grading on the writing assignments felt a bit unfair, but Dr. Jaime is approachable with questions. The final was also pretty easy and very consistent with the study guide.

Lectures were my favorite I've taken in my 3 years at OSU. Attendance is most of your grade but you learn a lot if you even just sit & listen. Syllabus makes them look scary but if you reach out to them they are so understanding & they WILL help you. Definitely one of the few professors that actually wants their students to do well

This professor was absolutely horrible and late when it came to grading assignments. Get ready to get low scores on everything if you put in hard work, because that is what he does unfortunately. I was really bummed when I read his reviews because I thought they would be helpful but boy was I wrong.

Prof Wagner is one of the best Psychology professors I have had at OSU. He makes sure to make class interesting and engaging with humor and his knowledge of the subject. The projects for this class are also very engaging and fun to do. I would recommend this class 100%.
Dr. Wagner's class is often interesting and stimulating. The slides are well organized and help a lot with note-taking. Very easy to listen to and learn the materials.

Dr. Opfer is passionate and funny in his lectures. He explained the experiments well and provided real-world examples to make concepts more interesting. The exams require a lot of studying and the study guide only lists the concepts. He offers retakes for the first two exams to replace your grade. Each lecture covers a ton of information so show up

His lectures were really interesting and you can tell he's passionate about childhood psychology. He was very charismatic during lectures and it was easy to pay attention. His tests were relatively easy if you paid attention and took good notes. Some things on the test were things he only said in lecture but weren't in the slides or book.
Nice guy, lectures were interesting. Reading the textbook is important and theres a lot of it

He's really passionate about psychology so lectures are pretty engaging. A lot of the material you need to know comes from the book, so you should stay on top of textbook reading. For studying DEFINITELY DEFINITELY do the review questions, from each module that are in carmen, the questions really are similar to the tests. Absolutely do the REP xtra

Opfer is a nice guy who's really passionate about psych but his class lacks any real structure and he gives little to instruction on any of the graded assignment. Exams are only multiple choice and theres a retake but prepare for the worst because he gives you a study guide with basic terms and then test on super specific topics. So much READING!!!

He is very passionate about the material and tries to get everyone interested. He posts multiple choice reviews on his website that are very useful because they are very similar to the test (some of the same questions). The grades were based on several exams and a paper. His expectations are clear.

My favorite professor during my first semester at OSU. There is a lot of reading and I would recommend keeping up with it (instead of reading everything before each exam like I did). Strongly suggest going to every class. He reads from the slides on his website but keeps it interesting. Also throws in facts that are used as extra-credit on exams.

He doesn't post anything online so don't lose your syllabus. He doesn't remind you to do the REP even once so if you lose your one paper copy of the syllabus, you won't know how to do it and your grade will drop 10%. Exams are easy just do the "review" things and don't bother studying anything else.
Good professor. Made the lectures exciting and worth going to. A lot of textbook/book reading for a gen ed, but otherwise very interesting.

The honors version is easier than the regular intro to psych. You don't have to do as much out of class work, and the exams are incredibly easy. The questions are taken directly from some of the practice quizzes for each section, and he offers a retake for each exam, where he reuses questions. The final just takes questions from previous exams.

I went to one class. I read the book and did his practice problems. Got an A. The material was far too easy for him to bother teaching, and he recycles his exams. It seemed to me he didn't care--he had more important classes to worry about.
Not a terribly hard class if you attend lecture and skim the book.  Opfer is a great lecturer and really likes psychology.

Heard he was easy, so I took his class. It was really boring and class was pointless as all his powerpoints were online and they took things directly from the book. Seriously just read the book to take the tests. Retake tests if you can for the extra opp, it's nice. IF YOU SKIP DO NOT FALL BEHIND ON READING. that's what I did
This was a really good choice for an introductory level Psych class. Opfer is hilarious and always willing to help or answer questions. All of the slides are online and you can retake two midterms.

Professor Opfer is extremely helpful and funny! Always willing to help and tries his best to make classes interesting. You can also retake two midterms! He is such an awesome instructor for this introductory course!

No clue WHAT these terrible reviews are about. Dr. Opfer was outstanding. Allows you to retake midterms; learn all the vocab from the first midterm & you'll ace the retake. Final is repeat midterm questions plus a LITTLE new material. Passionate about his work and a fun guy. I'm not a psych major, but I LOVED the class and aced it.

I really enjoyed Dr. Opfer's class; you can tell he is passionate about his work. He also had a good sense of humor and a pleasant personality. The book was very good; I read it and didn't think the exam was hard. You are not graded for attendance but you'll enjoy participating in his class.
He's a good teacher who keeps classes interesting with stories and humor. Tests are fairly easy and you get to retake them and take the better score. Good teacher to have for this class

Tells you to study the powerpoints which are very general, but then there are questions about neuroscience on the test. He expects you to know the most minute details about the material, he takes the fun out of psychology. Full of himself, not very helpful. AVOID THIS CLASS

Dr. Opfer is one of the worst instructors ever. His tests are never what you think they'll be. He expects you to think at his level. If you try to go to him in person to get help he's intimidating and he doesn't want to help you improve. Exams are based primarily on examples and experiments presented in textbook and on powerpoint slides.

While this class is not easy, it is worth the effort. Opfer is extremely intelligent and he is full of info. I think he communicates the material clearly and his examples stick in your mind. He does not hand out grades, you have to earn them. I got an A by reading all of the material, attending every class and studying my ass off.

I got an 83% went to most classes, but didn't really try that hard. This class is interesting but not an easy A...more like an easy B. He tends to say ummm uh uh uh uh all the time when he speaks which is bothersome at first but you get used to it. You can tell he knows a lot about the subject, pretty interesting class

This guy is obviously prestigious when it comes to research, but he couldn't teach what he knows to save his life. Too bad- he's smart, but just doesn't know how to help others learn, which is essentially what smart people should learn to do. Unclear lectures and attention to numbers rather than concepts, which is the point of undergrad.
Hard tests, but re-takes are offered. Must be able to relate concepts, this class definitly is not about memorizing notes or definitions! He seems almost too smart to be teaching undergrads
Tests are a little hard, but we are allowed to do re takes.

Dr. Opfer is a fascinating man.  I loved the class and am contemplating a minor or second major in Psych.  The exams can be difficult, but there is a retake and the final contains questions from the midterms.  The exams were manageable enough that I could actually enjoy learning the material without worrying about the grade.
He's unhelpful and doesn't even answer emails. His tests are extremely difficult, but he offers makeups. He's full of himself but funny in class.

H100A-  John Opfer is an amazing professor.  I took this class freshman quarter and I loved every minute of it.  The tests were quite difficult at first but JUST TAKE THE RETESTS and you will be fine.

Very hard.  After you get 2 grades lower than you'd like on the tests, study the test, know it and take them makeups.  Lectures can be pretty entertaining.  He has a nice website with notes and  semi-helpful study guides.

he did not answer my emails and he lies about material on the exams. The only thing good about his class was he let us re-do midterm 1 and 2 if we wanted... prolly cuz they were impossible. ... would never recommend him
No Comments
very animated, take the retests

He loves what he's teaching and he's good at it.  Tests were not easy the first time but the re-do's allow you to do well and know what to expect.  The final was easy.  You can definitely do well in this class and learn a lot.  Had some good discussions and quite a few good laughs.
really great professor. tests and exams were easy, and if you did bad you could take it again. made lecture interesting and put all the notes online. only class i never skipped.

Amazing professor. Laughs a lot and tries to make the class as interesting as possible. Clear lectures, but he does assign a lot of out of class reading.  The tests are insanely easy and he also allows redo tests for the two midterms!  Also, the final has half questions that are repeated from the previous tests.  A fun, interesting, and easy class!
Dr. Opfer was awesome, he's very silly and always tries to make class interesting. But his class is by no means easy. You have to do all the reading to do well in the class.

The material is interesting and the classes are good.  There is no curve but there are redo exams so you can make up points.  He repeats a lot the questions from the midterms on the final.  Overall, easy and enjoyable class.
I find his midterms to be very hard especially after having read all the book material and having studied for a solid 8 or 9 hours. Too self-absorbed for my liking.

I dont know why everyone is so high on this guy. He rushed through his notes in lecture and expects you to know some of the most obscure stuff for the exams. There is also a TON of reading that he expects you to complete. Sorry Dr. Opfer, but I have a life outside of your course.

This was my second time having Opfer, and i still love him.  He makes class fun with his goofy sense of humor, and is very clear about what the tests are going to be like.  He puts everything online too!  Very cute!

Great prof. takes pride in his teaching and it shows. Laughs a lot and sounds like a cow in heat while doing it, but it only serves to make his presentations more interesting. Study and you will succeed.

quite funny and explains info really well.  the tests are very easy (mult choice) and he lets you retake them once. essay quiz is slighter harder but only counts for 5% of your final grade. lots of reading, but he puts all the notes online. great dresser too!

wow, this class is making me consider majoring in the area.  He makes it interesting with his pretty slides and jokes (even if they aren't funny, it's funny to see him laugh at them).  But, most importantly the material makes you think.  Just read the book and slides -- tests are mult choice.
Hard class, but my favorit prof to date.  great at teaching and very animated.  always helpful.  a winner.
No Comments

Ok I definitely don't think he is hot. However, he is definitely an amazing teacher. He is a bit quirky but you can really tell he loves this subject. The class is hard but that is to be expected from an Honors class. I urge anyone to take his course. But be focused on doing well.
This is the professor to take if your goal is to be a reknown expert in psychology; all others, become PhysEd majors instead. Firm, but fair.
absolutely not hot, very knowledgable, but sort of enjoys being VERY hard.  really excited about the material though.
No Comments
Very knowledgeable, clear, concise, funny...the list goes on.  Read the books and study his power points and you'll do fine.  Great class...I learned alot and had a great time doing so.
This is the best professor I have ever had - he's smart, funny, and knowledgable. And he is hot as hell.

Doesn't teach or talk in class. Gives outdated articles and you have to figure out what you're supposed to be learning from it. In class, you have to answer questions based on the topic, sometimes not even relating to the article. Doesn't provide lectures or work of her own to take notes on. If you miss one thing on an assignment, you get a 0.

I enjoy having Strunk as my professor. This class's content is hard to grasp sometimes and the exams are the only things you are graded on so make sure you understand everything! He is extremely knowledgeable on the subject matter, making listening in class a lot easier. The textbook is pretty expensive but I found a PDF on Reddit :D
The class is just based on 4 exams basically and they are hard.

He is really passionate about what he teaches. Tbh sometimes it's hard to stay awake in his class if you have it for 80 minutes since it's all lecturing. He doesn't take attendance, but you'd be a fool not to go because he tells you the test essay question options in class and gives extra info than what's on the slides alone. He curves most tests.

Grade solely based on four (rather hard) exams. Twenty-five multiple choice (3pts each) and one 25pt extended response on all four exams. No cumulative final. Material was very interesting, professor tells cool stories about his job as a clinician, but these rants often completely unconnected to exam material. Class not required, slides posted.

Great person but terrible teacher. He goes off on tangents that are impossible to follow and expects you to know that information for the test. Tests are only 25 mc with one or two short answers and are so easy to do bad on. If you miss a lecture be sure to get the notes from someone or else you won't pass the class.
Excellent professor. Exams are straightforward and willing to provide a lot good feedback for the potentially daunting 10-page paper.

No surprises on the midterms. The final was not cumulative. Had to write one research paper- START AS EARLY AS POSSIBLE. Got really good feedback on the paper from Dr. Strunk before turning it in which was very helpful. Show up to class and study the notes given in class. Reading the textbook helped me but I could still have done as will without it

I realyl liked the class because I found the material very interesting but Dr. Strunk made it more difficult to get an A because the only grades were the 4 exams (no extra credit). You can tell he likes teaching, and he is good at explaining everything, but he does like to rant, and it's important to take notes on EVERYTHING because it is tested on
You will only get out of the class what you put into it but the professor is very knowledgeable and ready to answer every question. Also very good-looking.

If you come to class and study your notes you'll do fine. His tests are extremely fair, and your grade will be reflective of the amount of studying you did. Not a difficult class if you put in the effort.

Literally THE WORST class i have taken at OSU! I am in my forth year so ive taken enough classes to say that and mean it! Unclear in lectures and teaches beyond a comprehensible level.   Exams based on notes but notes are basically anything he says on his RANDOM TANGENTS! AVOID THIS PROFESSOR!

Dr. Strunk is amazing in his field, but he expects you to share in his passion. It took me a while to realize this, but the tests are largely based off of class notes, but you can't get them unless you show up to every class.  I struggled, but I was always below the average, so it might have just been me.

Strunk is a depression researcher and focuses only on his research during his class.  This class is supposed to talk about abnormal psych, something I am very interested in, and he made it so boring and narrowly focused that I really wish I had taken it with someone else.

He says he's there to help, but half asses his "help" and simply refers you to an article or the textbook rather than explain. Slow at returning graded materials and is overall not a good professor. Extremely biased and if your answer is even slightly off or not complete, you'll get a lot of points docked. Avoid this professor.

He is a good professor. His exams are not too difficult and he does curve them to an extent. He is passionate about what he is teaching and wants his students to do well. Also, don't get too scared of the 8-10 page paper he has you write. It's not that bad. The lectures are somewhat interesting, but can make you sleepy at times. Overall, decent!
Wish I had not taken this class so much. Strunk does not keep up with grading assignments and is incredibly vague. Class was highly boring! This class ruined my 4.0 goal for the quarter!

Strunk did not keep up with any of our work yet he expected a lot out of his students. On the day of the exam, he had only graded 3 out of 13 assignments of that quarter so we had no idea what our grades are. However, the class was boring but attendance was crucial. A lot of outside reading. Class could have been A LOT more interesting/enjoyable
Somehow made a very interesting subject boring. Disappointed in this class and wish I hadn't taken it. Did not learn much besides what is covered in an intro psych course.

331 is not that hard.  A lot of people are complaining, but I don't know why.  I never read the book; I just went to class and studied the notes and got A's on both midterms and final.  He curves A LOT, and is very generous w/ grading in my opinion. He is really helpful- offers several review sessions.  Take his class; it's not that bad

I was very interested in abnormal psych BEFORE this class. He is extremely biased and is not helpful in explaining the material needed for the exams. Final exam was comprehensive, which, with so much info in the class was nearly impossible. The T.A. never came to class just graded our essays as hard as she possibly could. He ruined it for me.

The class was awesome. It got a little long winded being a 1:48 lecture 2x a week, but he let us take breaks to keep us from getting too restless. He makes the content clear and answers all questions pretty quickly.

The class was very interesting, but was taught in a biased way. It was obvious wich methods and subjects he ageed with or liked the best. Tended to focus on info that wasn't on the test. The TA was useless and didn't attend the lectures but graded the tests which were mostly essay on subject matter covered in class and not in the text.

the class material is very interesting, however he goes off on tangents and makes it impossible to understand what you actually need to know for the test. grading is a joke, his t.a. did it and took off for every little detail on essays. his tests were very hard, and i don't recommend taking this class with him. other teachers were a lot easier

I heard a lot of people complaining about him in class; which I didn't understand. I thought he was passionate about what he was teaching and the material was interesting and presented in an orderly fashion. I do think it'd be better as a full term class but not because of ease but because the subject matter is so interesting. Didn't need the book.

he said that attendance could not hurt only help you, but then factors it into your grade as x of x instead of x/0. claimed grades were curved, but there was none. Good class if you want to be in the field but don't recommend taking it in summer (esp 1 term). Too much info for such a short time!

Very interesting class. Strunk is very clear and organized. Seems like a very nice guy. Only complaint is that he isn't exactly timely when it comes to posting slides and grades. Tests can be a little bit challenging but overall he is a great professor.
Great professor, he''s really one of a kind

An amazing professor. 3 exams, open-note, 50 points each, 10 different weekly assignments, 5 points each. Although exams were open note, they weren't easy enough to get 50 but if you attended the lectures then you were bound to do good on the exams. The weekly assignments were easy and self-explanatory, just required some reading.

This professor was the very best professor I have had. He deserves a rating higher than a 5/5. He truly cared about all of his students. There were 50 points worth of reflection assignments, and 3 exams each worth 50 points. The exams were slightly challenging, but Professor Petrill offered extra help and was always there to talk to.
Dr. Petrill is an amazing professor who really cares about his students and the material he teaches. His exams are manageable and he really challenges you to think outside the box! Highly recommend!

The BEST professor I have ever had. He is passionate and teaches material very clearly. He is understanding and helpful.10 of 12 reflection discussions are graded and are all pretty easy. Exam questions are pretty much off the slides, but you do have to read assigned articles and study. If you are thinking about taking this class with him, TAKE IT!

I would rate him a 6/5 if I could. Dr. Petrill is a lovely professor who's thorough, yet not overwhelming with the amount of info he goes over in lectures. This is a professor who genuinely cares about his students and their understanding of the material. Definitely one of my favorite professors and classes so far!

3 out of 4 exams are graded and 10 out of 12 discussion posts are graded, and that is it! You will get full points on discussion posts as long as you write it. Exams are not too easy but never too hard, and you can skip final.

Dr. Petrill was pretty understanding this semester and held optional meetings each week where students could ask questions. The course was your best 10 out of 12 discussion posts and best 3 out of 4 exams. It was pretty easy to get an A in this course and Dr. Petrill was always genuinely kind and caring to his students.

Things were different this semester, but Dr. Petrill was great. The class was graded based on exams and dicussion posts. His exams were very fair- if you read the slides and took notes, you'll be fine. Zoom classes were not mandatory, but I'd definitely recommend going. He really cares about his students and is passionate about what he teaches!

Professor Petrill was super helpful and super clear. He wants his students to succeed and it's very easy to get a good grade in the class. He gives out a study guide before the test that tells you exactly what the test is on so if you get a bad grade, it's your own fault. Sometimes there is random participation points.

The midterms are multiple choice with some short essay questions in the end. He prepares a good study guide that'll help you do really well if you use it.  He takes random participation points during some classes so it pays to show up. We had one 3 page final paper that was doable but took effort. I'd recommend this class and he's a good professor
Really enjoyed the subject matter and made his students want to learn and enjoy it as well. More conceptual than memorization. Takes random participation points.

Very straightforward class, he seems to care and if you listen in lecture and go over his powerpoint, you should get a B. If you pay attention to detail, then you probably could get an A. Really nice guy, and he's just very down to earth.

Dr. Petrill is an amazing guy. He has been one of the most caring professors I've encountered at OSU. He genuinely cares for his students and wants their success. I would recommend taking notes using the powerpoints on your laptop. He goes too fast through the slides to write it all. Exams are straight forward from the study guide. Not a hard class
Dr. Petrill was a good professor. He was a good lecturer and was clearly passionate about what he teaches. His exams were tough (mainly the short answer portion). I enjoyed this class!

Professor Petrill's PowerPoints are presented well, his lectures are engaging and he encourages class discussion. Stephen seems to genuinely care about his students, makes himself available for questions, and is clear about his requirements for the course. Although attendance is not mandatory, his passionate attitude makes you want to be there.
Professor Petrill is a really great professor.  He's really helpful and genuinely wants his students to succeed, learn AND enjoy the class.  I highly recommend him
The class was definitely a challenge, but Professor Petrill was kind and always willing to help out students.

Class was difficult in the beginning but he adapted it based on feedback. he cared a lot about us and did everything to help us throughout the class. He offered retakes for exams and extra credit for above 80% attendance. Super helpful outside of class - he wrote me a lot of recommendations for job/lab applications and was very kind.

2220H: his first time teaching ever; was a very hard grader; midterm/final material was difficult, although based on the lectures. R software was a little hard to follow and was not clear in the lectures. There was an opportunity to make up one midterm, class was curved because not enough people received an average grade. Super sweet though

Dr. Myung is a great professor even though the things he taught were extremely boring to me. I think he knows it can get dense so he tries to make it funny sometimes. There's a lot of reading to do in this class, but you can get away with doing the bare minimum that is required for the eight reaction papers. The exams are all true false so not bad.
Please avoid taking any classes with him. One of the worst professors at OSU!

If you want a professor who will give you a zero for a simple mistake then he is the right professor. Not only is his lectures hard to follow due to him only standing in the middle of the class and getting side tracked talking about anything else other than the material we are being tested over, but also he gives no assistance whatsoever.

If you're taking 5612 as an elective for CSE, find something else. Class is run abysmally and his lecture slides are the worst I've seen at OSU by far. His lectures are damn near impossible to follow, as he goes on tangents about his conferences or his college life. He's a nice guy, but don't take his class if you actually want to learn something.

Tough but fair, one of my best professors yet! You will not regret taking his class, but you should regret not taking the time to learn the material. Ignore reviews on his accent, he is well spoken. He is fair and upfront about the grading scale, but it is tough. I found he is the best instructor of PSYCH3312. Also READ READ READ, the book is good!

People either love or hate Dr. Myung. He is incredibly passionate about the material he teaches, so he tends to touch on all the developing topics he's excited about, even if they aren't related to class material. If you love the material you're learning, you will definitely enjoy his classes; if you're going since it's required, then likely not.

Myung is a terrible prof, please don't take him. He covers a wide range of material at a superficial level so it's hard to know exactly what you need to know. He told us in class today NOT to study for our first exam because he needs some way to differentiate our grades - everyone does well on the essays and he needs some people to fall behind.

He gave lots of extra credit and easy going. No attendance. HOWEVER, this course is NOT EASY AT ALL! Though it's a psychology course, it almost all about neural networks. For passing this, you must know programming (use MATLAB), multivariable calculus, linear algebra, and more. HE IS THE ONLY CHOICE IF YOU WANT TO TAKE THIS COURSE. So, be prepared.

Only teaches concepts in class and says only basic math is required. You need to know calculus. If you don't already know how to code you'll struggle. We all struggled through the homework. Luckily there were a few knowledgeable people in the class. He did give relaxed grades on some of the homework and projects though.

He is an amazing person. Really nice and understanding. He cares for all of his students, and encourages people to visit him outside of class to talk about their interests. His lectures, however, were monotone and it was easy to fall asleep through. Thankfully, he is very clear with what he expects the students to know on both exams and papers.

His accent isn't the worst that I've heard, but there are still a fair amount of times that you have to think about what he said. Seems like he cares more about the history and people involved in the topics discussed than the material itself. Also he is more interested in talking about his work and what conferences he's attending than teaching.

Be sure to look at your exam after it's graded because many of the "correct" answers don't make sense. You should challenge them. Will ask about dates of research and other useless trivia on exams. Helps to take statistics class prior this one. Lectures weren't that exciting but you must attend or there's no chance you'll pass the exam!

I spent more time trying to understand what he was saying than actually learning anything.  I hated this class more than any class I've ever taken in three years of college.  He was TERRIBLE and I don't know if he could have made the material any more boring.  TAKE MY WORD FOR IT, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS FROM THIS PROFESSOR!!!!!!

He is the worst teacher ever. He just talks at you and doesn't really make sense while he does it. The tests are super hard and he weights them really heavily. Multiple choice questions worth 6 points each!WTF?! Don't take this class with him!

This is the worst professor I have ever had!  He has the most boring lectures (very thick accent and monotonous voice) ever but you have to go to get the notes.  His exams are hard and before our first exam he said that if he said something that didn't agree with the book to go with what he said!  Overall the worst professor I've ever had!

This guy is terrible! Not only are his lectures incredibly boring, but he also contradicts himself constantly. I went to all of the lectures, but he posts the lecture notes on Carmen, so you'd do fine w/o going to class. The midterms were harder than the final. Terrible professor. Avoid Jay Myung if at all possible!
The most boring class I have every taken. He has no speaking variation. I think I went 5 times all quarter and atill got a B

He is not very nice or helpful. He speaks English but has a hard time with pronouncing words. His homeworks are easy but his lectures are boring. For our class, right before the exam he changed the chapters that would be covered by adding another one.
To sum him up as a teacher he was horrible. He was incoherent in lecture and in his tests. The tests were extremely tricky. Hopefully I don't come across any more bad teachers like him.

I think he may be the worst prof I've had at Ohio State.  Horrible at explaining things, not at all willing to help, and his accent is so hard to understand that I spend more time trying to figure out what he said than actually learning the material.

This class is manditory, so I would suggest keeping up with your math.  The grading is pretty strict but otherwise he's a cool guy.  You'll receive extra points for questions that "spark" the intellect, and that he likes.  He'll help you out if necessary.  Don't feel shy to visit him at office hours.
not helpful, terrible teacher

Despite his accent he is able to communicate the material thoroughly, speaks better english than most native speakers. Learnt a great deal in his class  as he encourages and spends time explaining things if you come halfway. Is very rigorous and knowledgeable but not inflexible, I have had him as an advisor so I know. I recomend meeting him halfway
Poor explanations, poor teaching, poor professor. nuff said.

Accent is not hard to understand but a lot of times he has trouble understanding your questions.  His exams are hard to understand because some questions it is obvious that english is not his first language. The class shouldn't be hard but because of that it is.  Homeworks are graded for correctness which is also hard.  Only take if ur good at math

i had him some time ago,i am fine with his accent. but he's pretty good at making simple things complicated, and he weigh a lot on Math. the test is not that hard and it should not be, but he's not very clear maybe that's why the test seem weired. and yes,it's like an essay test+true or false(very tricky!!!)!very helpful though,an ok person!
You aren't allowed to ask questions in lecture, and he doesn't base his exams on the homework at all.  The homework is math problems, and the exams are essays.

This guy sucks, hands down.  I wish another teacher taught this class.  I have no problem with his accent, but he mumbles to himself quietly and then continues teaching in the same voice so you miss a lot of what he says.  He needs lessons in how to speak to an audience.  His exams sucks balls, it's like he's trying to make you fail

I don't know how this guy got smileys. he is awful.  I know the material backward and forward and did not do well on the midterm.  The questions are just dumb and he totally contradicts himself. I have taken 5 other psych classes and gotten A's in every one of them.  Except this one. Steer clear! Take stats 145

Prof was great.  The class had hard bits but it was interesting and more theory-oriented than I expected.  I didn't notice his accent after the first ten minutes and I haven't had a prof as interested --genuinely interested -- in teaching and students in a long, long time.

Poor guy had pit-stains. While I could understand him despite his accent, the material wasn't clear until the lab TA went over it again. Puts WAY TOO MUCH WEIGHT on the true/false questions. I was getting As on the hws and Cs and Ds on the exams. Scraped a B, total, because of point distributions.

The lab instructor gives better explanations in lab than he does in lecture. He mumbles, and the exams are nothing like the review he gives you. Not at all like stats classes I have taken in the past. Not a hard class,but not fun AT ALL!

Interesting class and an interesting area for him to be teaching, seeing as he is in the Quant Psych Dept.  His test weren't too bad although, he does look for very specific answers, which if you don't give he is very strict on giving any slack for such.  Awesome accent as well, for any ling majors.

He is very kind and understanding to his students and does his best to be personable. He does a walkthrough assignment that is almost exactly the same as the assignment that is graded, so it makes it easy to complete and work off of. The tests are open book and you can take them any time during the exam day.

Pretty funny and caring guy who definitely wants his students to succeed. Class was a bit disorganized and as someone who had prior knowledge of most of the concepts, still confusing, but overall it was a fun class. Pretty technology dependent but he teaches R studio well. Tests weren't hard and homework was longish but easy.

Dr. Wasserman was a great professor. He made difficult concepts understandable and he taught R Studio very well. Understanding R Studio is crucial to doing well in this class, so this is not one you want to skip! Most of the exams were online with 2 attempts, and he offers an abundant amount of extra credit. His dry humor was also pretty funny.

If you like dogs and dad jokes, then Dr. Wasserman is the instructor for you! He wants everyone to succeed, so his assignments and exams always mirror our in-class activities. Lots of extra credit and second chances. Despite how intimidating it looked at first, he made it very easy to learn R Studio. Would recommend him.

Dr. W. wants his students to succeed and provides plenty of opportunities to do so. Material can be challenging but all you need is a basic understanding. Attendance matters because of TopHat, but you can zoom in if you want. Best professor I've had at OSU when it comes to teaching software. Exams are online async which makes it easy.

Literally one of the best professors out there!! He is so caring and accommodating. He is always there to help and gives students many chances to do well in class. Definitely the best professor I ever had at Ohio State. 100% recommend him for Psych 3321!!

Nice class, take it. He's one of the most patient and empathetic professors I've ever had. Good at explaining, structured & organized lecture and slides. Lecture is lowkey funny too. The content may be hard for some, but trust me (I've tried other like 2 profs) he really made it as easy as it could be.

I could tell that Dr. Wasserman had a very hard time teaching this class from the lack or organization and abundance of mistakes. All the material taught in the course was not new info for most of students (taught in the prereq course- PSYCH2220), however test averages were very low because of the poor grammar and rules that he used.

This is your dream professor. Amazing lectures that really help you understand the material. She cares about her lectures, very organized, and very respectful as long as you apply yourself in her class.
One of the best professors. She moves fast, but she knows how to put the information in your mind.
Do not recommend taking Summer class with Dr.Bailey.
worst teacher ive ever had.. literally taught me nothing
Shes an awesome professor, the way she teaches makes the class very interesting! Highly recommended!!

Dr. Sullivan is very caring and keeps her lectures interesting. Attendance is not required, but there are random in-class assignments about once a week. You only get graded for 10 but are given more than that, and your best 3/4 exams scores are kept. It is a pretty easy course as long as you show up to most lectures!

Dr. Shoppe-Sullivan is a great professor and the class was interesting. She cares that you learn, so she loves when you ask questions. Attendance isn't mandatory, but there are random in-class assignments and you get points just for doing them, so I recommend showing up. Tests are somewhat difficult, but easy writing assignments cushion your grade.

Should have been such an easy class but she made the quizzes impossible. You have to take active notes in class or you won't be able to find answers for the tests. She expected way to much and the group project was dumb.

There are quizzes every other week and they were overly difficult for an elective course. Her averages for quizzes were very low and she wouldn't provide adequate feedback. There is a big group project which was structured weird as we hadn't actually worked as a group until presentation. Definitely take this course with another professor.

The class had relatively easy and self explanatory concepts however she graded very hard taking half points off of as many things as she could. Quizzes were unusually difficult and there were weekly discussion posts. No exams thankfully and every assignment was online except for a group presentation that was very easy.

Very nice professor with interesting material, but her online quizzes are difficult and they're worth a good chunk of your grade and lectures aren't that much help. Doable course load and easy points otherwise. Many extra credit opportunities and she's always willing to help. No final or exams, but there is a group project.
Never read textbook or went to class. Lectures good, homework kind of busywork, but easy points. Interesting topics, easy tests, would take again.

Lisa seems like a lovely woman and had an upbeat personality. Always came to class positive but when it came to her quizzes (which made up most of the grade), they were impossible!!! I get that with online learning some teachers may want to make things more difficult to make sure students are working for their grade but her quizzes were ridiculous.

Overall, the coursework is light and doable. However, she's very careful about her word choice on the exams. I would take 5-6 pages worth of notes a week on her lectures and still fail her quizzes. The content itself is fun to learn, but I didn't enjoy it as much when she made it extremely complicated. A little ridiculous for a Tier 2 course.

I thought the class was overall pretty easy. I studied around 3 hours before exam and always got an A. However, the final wasn't cumulative and so I studied how I usually did for other exams and I absolutely bombed it and got a D. She ended up curving the class so I got an A so it didn't matter. Overall, it was easy except for the final

The book isn't required, but it explains the material better than her. Her tests are based on examples from lectures. Her powerpoints suck. There isn't much to boost your grade. Tests are very difficult. She allows you to earn 0.5 points of extra credit during tests. Test averages are really low in the class.

In this class you have 10 weeks to come up with an experiment idea, create the experiment, analyze your data, and write a research paper. If you can't handle the amount of time that will obviously take then don't take the class. Dr. Libby did a great job of presenting the material in way that made the class a lot easier than I was expecting.

Dr. Libby is a good professor,however,she needs to improve her teaching style and provide students with study guides/review sheets to help them prepare better for the exams,because there is a lot of material to remember,which is overwhelming and a bit like a guessing game,because you never know what to expect on the exams.(I failed all 3 of them!)

loved the info in class, but very specific. tests were hard, averages for midterm were in 70's, final average was a 68%. opportunities for 4 extra credit, fairly easy to obtain. exams are VERY difficult. 2 "discussions" to attend with 10 other students, easy points. overall, good teacher but hard exams. read book for first exam, not for others.
I've loved every psychology class I have ever taken at Ohio State... until I had Dr. Libby for a professor. I would rather drink molten glass than have to deal with her again.

She might not use a textbook or give tests or quizzes, but she is sadistic when it comes to classwork. Plan on reading at least 3 journal articles a day, writing 1 to 2 papers a week, and when it comes to research she is the pickiest person in the world. Avoid at all costs, unless you plan to cancel everything else in your life for 3 months.

AVOID. I was so excited to take this class but I nearly failed bc of frustraction. Her teaching style did not match book which did not match notes which did not match test. 1/2 MC half essay but hard grader (nit picky...if not exactly clear no points) EC is joke, 1/2 class did not know answ. BLAHHHH

Decent class; good experience if looking at graduate school in psych. A bit unclear and slow at answering emails. Sometimes seemed like she shoved a lot of her dirty work on her TA. If you haven't taken psych 321, just be prepared for some frustration when it comes to reporting data. fast-paced and quick deadlines, but no tests or book.
pretty good class. as long as you study well you should do fine. very clear in her teaching and standards.

This class is a scientific study of human relationships, so you can't go into it expecting something out of Cosmopolitan. That said, I thought the subject matter was very interesting and the tests weren't THAT hard. She is straightforward and clear, and more personable 1-on-1. She's also very willing to help. Kinda cute in a professor-ish way.

Hardest, trickiest (essay) exams ever! They don't test knowledge directly, they ask you to infer things from what she talked about. And she's boring as crap. Explains relationships in terms of  evolution. What a joke! Disappointing. If you're interested in relationships, just buy the textbook on eBay and avoid this class at all costs.

The class could have been so much better! She is pretty boring for how great the subject matter could have been.  Tests are some of the hardest I have had in my 4 years in the Psych department.  She offers lots of extra credit but its only worth half a point.  It was overall a disappointment

Prof libby is great.  her class is kind of interesting, no homework assignments just 3 exams.  3 discussion sessions per quarter and you only have to attend two..super easy.  test's aren't the best, but definitely not hard.  if you study a little you'll be sure to get an A, B-

I found this course to be difficult and rewarding at the same time. I thought the Sex and the Cty clips worked well with the material. The tests were rather difficult, but there were plenty of opportunities for extra credit if you bothered to show up

One of the best professors I've ever had.  Very reasonable in her expectations.  I thought the exams were extremely easy, but some people had trouble with them.  My favorite course in all 4 of my years at OSU.  Material is very interesting!
If you are interested in relationships, and how to make them better you will like this class. She is monotone and boring. Tests are somewhat difficult. I learned stuff from the book.
Very boring, my friend dropped the class because she couldn't stay awake.
This prof is wonderful.  The class is great, and I would take anything else she teaches.

Really interesting class, excellent powerpoints, really clear about everything.  The textbook was easy to read and she picked a lot of good videos to demonstrate the material.  One short paper & 2 tests - pretty great for a brand new class

Prof Shankar is a very nice person but her lecturing and teaching skill lacks a bit. She's a grad student at the same time so I guess that's why but just wait for exams it feels like you didn't learn and then a 2 month wait for your grades. Read the textbook and memorize the answers to the guided questions on the lecture slides for exams.

I didn't do so well in this class but that was 100% my choice. He's a great professor, I just didn't go to class for half the semester and fell behind. He's really good at explaining things. He genuinely cares that everyone understands and succeeds in his course. Very approachable guy, never makes you feel dumb for asking a question

I had Dr. Miller for PYSCH 2220 and he was amazing. One of the nicest professors I have had, cared about the class, helped understand the material extremely well, gave time to ask questions in class and explained them.

Great professor that makes expectations clear through all the assignments and exams. Lecture heavy and being in class is important, but not required, and material was pretty interesting. 3 exams, plus a final, and lowest exam score dropped (don't have to take final if first 3 scores are good). Lots of extra credit opportunities. 2 response papers.

I love Dr. Saygin. She cares a lot about the material in this class. As someone who was scared of doing presentations (the whole class is about doing presentations on the journal articles we read), I really enjoyed talking with my classmates about the material. I learned a lot, but be prepared to read about 6 journal articles a week to prepare!

I definitely not recommend taking this class with her. She is super nice, but nice well experienced with the material. She reads from slides most of the time and her exam questions are not related to what she gave in the lecture.

Hard class but makes you think. Expects a high level of understanding of journal articles. Fun lectures and she obviously cares about the material. Presentations have to be well thought out. Be prepared to discuss the articles in class. Debate at the end of the semester helps bring it all together.

Like a lot of grad classes in psych I found this one to not be very informative. I learned a few things. Some of it was repeated from lower level courses, or the lectures were very mundane. Graded items are three presentations, and short weekly response paper to articles, which are difficult to read. Make sure your presentations are very detailed.

Attendance isn't mandatory, but I promise you'll regret skipping. No textbook. There are 4 research papers, and 4 midterms/1final - closed note. His material is LECTURE HEAVY, he provides slides but those are incomparable to what we learn in class - it goes way beyond that. He is helpful in accommodating students, and he has gained my respect.

Dr. Pitt is a good professor and he did a great job on teaching the lecture. There are only 4 exams matter for the final grade, and if you dont want to take the final exam you can submit an essay instead. He also provides about 5% extra credit. The exam is hard, but if you study for it before then you will have a good grade.

This class is hard mostly because of all the information in the lectures. Studying is extremely difficult because he gives virtually no information about what is actually going to be on the exam so you end up spending a whole day going through hundreds of slides for a 32 question exam. He is very helpful answering questions during lectures tho

Mark is very knowledgable. However, I found his class to be pretty difficult. The lectures were boring and the material is very dry (especially at 8am). His exams are pretty tough since they are only 30 questions, he gives you no study guide or help with studying, and there is a lot of material covered (especially for the cumulative final).

I struggled with this class probably more than any other class in college (I'm in my fourth year). Overall, PLEASE don't take it at 8am like I did. No homework is required, it is only there to boost your grade - everything is based on test scores. Attendance is not mandatory but it's very hard to keep up without it. The material was very dry to me.

Pretty easy class! Exams and discussion posts only. As long as you study you should be fine! A lot of material but pretty straight forward and reviews it often. No book needed and powerpoints online. Knows a lot and would take again!

Good prof. Very clear and his powerpoints are easy to follow. Don't have to go to class, just study powerpoints and you'll be fine for the two midterms and final. If you do go to class, don't be afraid to ask questions. He's extremely knowledgable and knows how to answers questions in a clear and interesting manner. Highly recommended.

Best professor I've had. He is clear and makes you think outside the box. There is only one exam, the final. There are quizzes every week but they aren't too bad. A lot of the lecture is class discussion and we have debates, which is nothing to be afraid of. He'll ask you questions that will make you rethink your opinions which I love. 10/10

Graham is great! He's very nice, likeable, and his course is not difficult. There were 4 exams that were straightforward and OPEN NOTE, 2 responses papers that were not hard, and 50 participation points with many opportunities to get them. Plus, he offered a ton of EC. The course was interesting, and attendance is highly recommended to take notes.

Mr. Bartels made Abnormal Psychology easier to learn and to be successful in. He gave great lectures, providing insight and real-world implications of concepts, and gave good extra credit opportunities. Mid-terms were also open notes which was a huge plus.
Mr. Bartels is a very considerate and kind person, his lectures are fun!

I love Graham, he is an awesome professor and lecturer. His class is very manageable with light homework, and the exams are very straight-forward and he prepares you for them well. He cares a lot and tries to remember everyone's name. He also records his lectures with notes so that you don't have to worry about missing class or not understanding.

I loved this course, there was a lot of interesting information that was very easy to follow. All lectures are recorded, so you never miss out on anything. The assignments and quizzes were pretty easy if you watch the lectures. The professor himself is very understanding and enjoys teaching. Overall a great course!!

Lectures are great and have a ton of information in them. There are a few assignments outside of exams that are totally doable and don't require a ton of time. The exams are straightforward and open note. Prof Bartels made the material easy to understand and engaging, I would definitely take again.

Graham was very understanding about the covid pandemic and was there to make life easier. He was caring and flexible. Online there was 1 live class day to catch up on the material provided in the lectures required to watch by that day. Overall an amazing guy would 10/10 recommend

This class had the potential to be interesting, but Brittany was one of the worst I've had. Assignments were confusing, not helpful to learn the content, and inconsistently graded with unclear criteria. Videos are low quality and do not help with mastering content and most of the time do not help on the weekly quizzes. Take this with someone else.

Her "lectures" are low-effort 30 minute recaps of the book. Class time is just a study hall. Assignment instructions are incredibly vague, and she docks points when you can't intuit her unspoken expectations. I hesitate to even call this a flipped classroom course, as she did nothing to encourage higher order thinking in class. She's just lazy.

she's a nice lady but her method of teaching is so lazy imo. uses a flipped classroom model so you basically have to teach yourself and the mandatory classes are just a glorified study hall where she takes off points for the dumbest things even though she'll say to your face it looks perfect. do not recommend her at all.

Brittiany gives you many opportunities to get the grade you want in her class! She was quick to respond to any emails you needed to send and answered all questions you had thoughtfully. I can't stress enough how much I loved her class -- my only advice is to reach out and ask your questions, its the only reason I got an A+.
