This class was pretty easy- minimal effort put in and got an A. However, this professor is terrible. Her lectures are a joke and her assignments are stupid. Her grading is so odd- it almost seems like she takes off points sometimes to just make it look like she actually reads and grades them. If you want to learn, don't take this class.
I took psych 3325 and she was amazing. Group assignment and homework/quizzes.
one of the smartest and best professors at OSU!!!!

Class was required for my major but very interesting and easy to stay engaged, gave lots of real world examples to make topics clear, if you ever have a question, email her and she'll respond right away

She's a very nice person and a pretty good lecturer that tries to make pretty boring material interesting, but her exams were overly hard. Even though I had pretty much every term from her slides memorized, I still struggled on some of her exams because she asked very nit-picky questions that forced you to know many intricate details.

Dr. Shoots-Reinhard is by far my favorite professor that I have had. She is extremely funny, smart and honestly cares about the students and will go out of her way to help. When it comes to her lectures she is extremely enthusiastic, and can really relate the content to your life and the real world. I recommend signing up for one of her courses.

She really cares that her students do well in the class and gives many opportunities to bring up your grade. Participation matters but she gives more than enough opportunities to earn all the points. She usually tries to end class early, and reviews after every section. She drops 6/11 quizzes and 2/3 written assignments. I would take it again

Overall, a good professor and an easy class. Class was mandatory for my major, but Professor Shoots-Reinhard made the lectures enjoyable. The quizzes were sort of tricky, but easy tests and easily graded paper. An obvious and admitted liberal with a bit of a teaching bias, but it's not hard to get past. She is very endearing and very funny.

She is one of the best professors I've had. She cares about the subject, cares about the students, and loves to share personal stories. As much as people have complained about her tangents, they are relating to the subject matter and will help you learn and retain the material. I've had two classes with her & will be taking another next semester!

She'd be a better professor if she lectured on subjects covered in our quizzes. As others have pointed out, it's about 55 minutes of her telling the class about her day. Reading can be interesting, but it's very long. She is at the least upbeat, and genuinely interested in the subject.

Super nice professor who works to make sure that you learn what you'll use in your career.  Is readily available to help students who need it and works to get to know students, which is uncommon at large universities like OSU.

Be prepared to be bored. You're spending tuition on her basically telling the class to tell personal stories as opposed to actually teaching anything (about 20-30 minutes of every 55 minute class is personal stories).   On the rare instances that she is teaching, it's dry, and ridiculously boring.  Easiest A ever when I stopped going to class

Brittany likes to facilitate class conversation which can get a little boring, but her exams are easy (you can contribute questions to them and she has buffer questions), and participation points can be made up by posting on the forum.  Going to class isn't strictly necessary because she posts slides, but I enjoy it for her helpful examples.

Participation points are the only reason to attend. Not really a surprise but she's an obvious liberal to anyone over 21, but most college kids dig that, so understandable. Other than that, really dry lectures, tries too hard to fit in with the students. I wasn't a fan. Easy pass though. As far as security goes, they should have someone else teach.
She is really funny, makes assignments and tests pretty easy if you memorize the notes. The examples she uses in her slides are on the exams. Great professor
She is a really funny person. I had a lot of fun in this class. It was interesting and she made the class atmosphere laid back and comfortable.

Brittany is a funny and friendly person. The problem with this class is that there are many sections of it so the instructors have to be strict on certain things like late papers and such. There's lots of note-taking, and the tests are pretty hard, but not so bad if you prepare yourself.

Brittany made psych 367 very difficult. She made ready exactly off her power points and made class very boring. There was no benefit in going to class besides getting participation points. For the exams she never gave out review sheets and told us to know "everything". She graded the papers and test like it was a graduate course. No fun, no help!

Was a very thorough and thoughtful professor. The lectures were easy to follow along with and notes were posted to go along with the lectures. There were weekly quizzes over vocabulary. Heavy textbook reading is not required but recommended that vocab from the textbook is reviewed for that week.

I would have to say that Dr. Donithen is really good at his lectures and the class overall is super easy because it mainly consist of short vocab quizzes every week and a few homework assignments. I would recommend him for sure!

Fairly easy class. Lecture heavy, but attendance not required. If you don't attend any of the classes all week, you may start to struggle, especially on the bigger exam. A few easy quizzes. Midterm/final were online/open note, but timed. I did okay, but it definitely helps to study, so you don't take as much time looking through your notes.

Literally no homework involved, and as long as you go to class you can disregard the textbook. His lectures are very interesting and you can get an A by writing down what's on his slideshows. He doesn't post slideshows after classes, which is the only bad part, but if you pay attention it is hard not to get an A as the exams are a breeze too.

Robby Ralston took way too long to explain concepts in lectures. These lectures being 1 hour plus for each 2 lessons per week. Definitely could have been less time. Examples don't make sense sometimes and basically makes us figure everything out for ourselves. Does not take the time to make sure we understand. Easy class, bad lecturer.

He is genuinely understanding and wants his students to succeed. However, he often has "tech issues," preventing him from posting the material on time. He usually pushes the due date back as well, but don't create a plan to get this classwork done on a specific day because the time it's posted every week constantly changes.

The class structure is clear with two recorded lectures a week along with a weekly quiz on the material and check-in surveys. There are three open-note exams and "designer question" assignments every 2 weeks. Class is easy and manageable, only critique is that lectures can be slow and boring.

He is a fantastic lecturer. He knows what he is talking about and answers questions well. The course is not hard AT ALL! He provides pre-written notes with fill in the blank. If you go to lecture and complete the notes you cant fail. Tests are open note open book! Book is included in course fee.
Dr. Golomb stepped in when my first prof. left halfway thru the semester. She does her best to make lectures interesting and engaging. Made our midterms open note and take home.

She's a sweet person but the lectures are a drag. It's entirely possible to pass the class with an A and only show up for the 4 required classes. She is passionate about what she teaches and cares about her students but lectures are not very engaging and are relatively boring. Exams are open note but they're also difficult.

She is AMAZING! She gives interesting lectures(cute memes) and offers study guides before exams. If you do them, you will do well in the exams. Papers are graded clearly and have rubrics(useful) beforehand. Attendance is not required unless there is an activity on that day. The activities are funny and not difficult. Assignments are easy.

She was so sweet! She seemed to genuinely care about her students and had interesting activities to do in break-out rooms (which I usually hate). Her tests are moderately difficult but all content is from her lectures which is nice since you don't have to guess what material is from the book/lecture. I definitely recommend !!

The most boring class of my existence. Make sure you peep her extra credit point, as it would've allowed for me to not take the final haha. Basically you can schedule this class and only show up for exams and be 100% fine. It just is a drag. She will throw shade at you if you are not paying attention in lecture. This includes being on your laptop.

Lectures were bland, but posted online. Class was relatively easy, as I never read the book and only studied a loose hour before the exams, earning a B overall. Then again, I'd also taken a couple overlapping Psych courses. I think my boredom with the material contributed to my lack of motivation tbh. Average course overall. DOES DROP 1 EXAM GRADE!

Easy tests, engaging lecture (for the material)- there's lots of videos and comics. If you do the study guide for each exam you will be fine. You can also drop one exam making the final optional! Easiest class a neuro major at OSU will ever take.

For Cognitive Neuroscience, lectures are very dry and basically consist of her reading off lecture slides (which you can study online) and throwing in barely class-related comics or videos.  Took me about 5 lectures to realize that you're much better off reading lecture slides on your own time.  I got an A by just studying 3 hours total per exam.

Julia is awesome. She is funny, and the lecture will fly by if you love neuroscience and the structure of the brain. Her lectures are a lot lecture-based, so take advantage of her online posts and don't skip class!! You will fail and she will not like you.

Exams are fair and pretty easy if you study the slides well and pay attention to videos she shows in class. Your grade is basically based on the best out of three of exams so you have the option to not take the exam. Great class. For neuro majors this is basically a review of everything you've ever learned from other classes.

Awesome professor! Interesting class, AND a very easy A!Despite the easy tests, you learned a lot in this class. Study the study guide and you'll enjoy the class without stressing yourself out. You also get to drop a midterm/the final if you did well enough on the other exams. More teachers should be like this!
Dr. Golomb made an extremely uninteresting class exciting and engaging. She is very knowledgable and always willing to help students out. HIGHLY recommend her!

She's awesome! She knows what she's talking about, is clear, helpful, and uses a lot of videos and other stuff to help you understand the content. And if you don't, all of it is pretty much in the slides... She always seems to be in a good mood and isn't monotone (thank god). Useless textbook, though... Save your money. You won't need it.

I took Cognitive Neuro with Prof. Golomb. I really enjoyed this class! The material was very engaging when the content could have easily been very dry. I appreciate the fact that she was so open to feedback. I also appreciated the learning aids (videos, demonstrations, etc.) she provided that helped the material sink in.
Definitely a good professor and loves what she does. Very straightforward with what you need to know which helps a lot to do well overall. I would recommend her!

Great professor. Easy to understand, clear powerpoints and lectures. Exams are based entirely on powerpoints, which is great. She also provides study guides which are super helpful. The most interesting and fun neuro class ive attended.

Don't take this class unless you are really passionate about decisions. This class is extremely counterintuitive for anyone that isn't a psych major, especially for Business majors with a psych minor. Seems interesting at first but the tests are long and confusing. DeKay is great and helpful but very monotone and boring. Lots of work outside class.

Prof DeKay is nice, but can be harsh at times. I didn't do well on our first exam and when I asked for help to better prepare for the next one, he did help after belittling me for my grade saying I was a "lazy senior". But after the initial conversation he really helped me when I went to office hours! Not an easy class, but he will help if you ask.

Materials laid out in a digestible format, major concepts clearly outlined. Long boring unhelpful lectures. Most learning happens out of class. Questions usually met with disdain, he gets defensive/mean/weird if you are confused? Get ready to work hard. Extra credit for going to lecture, open book quizzes, collaborative homework's, and tough exams.

Lectures from minute to minute of 1 hr 20 min class. No breaks. Have to take many notes during class. Uses unfamiliar examples so it is difficult to understand. Decision making is a statistic class. NOT a psychology class. It has almost nothing to do with psychology. Do not take if you are a senior and wanting a low work class.

Professor Dekay is a very approachable professor and will take whatever time out of his day that he has to help you understand the material. His exams are hard, but he will offer regrades if you defend your answers. He genuinely loves to teach and explains the material in depth

Dr. Dekay changed the curriculum of this class, so I was in the pilot group. Things were poorly organized and he frequently waited until the night before to make our exams, rendering any questions we had about format or content useless. However, he was very flexible and took student feedback into account, which was nice. Grading scale is flexible.

Worst professor Ive ever had in the psych department (my major). Had a test average of 50% for almost every exam and would yell at us for being dumb and incompetent. Lectures make absolutely no sense. Got defensive and weird when asked questions. 15 of students in the groupme voted that they were failing the class the day before the final.

DeKay is a nice guy and can be helpful. Spends all of his class time lecturing and can go on and on about one topic for a really long time. Out of touch with technology for someone teaching a stats class that uses programming. Assumes that you know all of the basics already even though it's a foundational stats class.

Dr. Dekay seems like a really nice guy; this is his first semester teaching 2220H and it very clearly shows. His exams don't necessarily match what you have homework on (you use a coding software called R but you don't code for the exams). He tends to go on tangents when asked a question, but overall, he's okay. He responds to emails quickly too.
Typically if you do not come to class, you're screwed. Most of the exams, even when studied for, were difficult. Also has a weird grading system and quizzes/homework are a low percent of the grade.

Pretty good professor, just a boring and tough course. Not much homework but when we did have some it was always easy. Exams are way harder than the HW and you have to put in a lot of effort into understanding the material on your own to get an A/B but its not impossible.

Few homeworks and quizzes, but they're not too hard and there's a lot of help available. The material involves a small amount of statistics, but really not deeper than introductory knowledge. He is very funny, helpful, and understanding. Genuinely tries to keep the class engaged and interested. Often encourages independent thought.

Professor DeKay is a great professor, he really cares about stats. If you have the option to take this class or to take another I would highly suggest thinking about how much you like stats. I am not a stats person so I had a really hard time in this class. I also highly suggest going to class, I did not and it really hurt my grade in the end.

Very interesting class, but it's a long lecture so it is difficult to sit through. A lot of people had trouble with the tests for some reason, but I thought they were fair and I found that reading trough lecture slides was sufficient to study from and I got an A on all three tests. I didn't need the book at all.

attendance wasn't mandatory but he did give pop quizzes which REALLY end up helping your grade! he was a good professor but taught dry material which was difficult to sit through. don't take him early in the morning!

I really like this professor.  He makes the lectures interesting and brings cookies to class on test days!  Good job at relating the material to the real world.  This class is fun because it's so diverse.  If I had to classify it-it would be labeled something like: stat/econ/business/psych/philosophy 508.  GREAT PROFESSOR! Take his class.

I only took this class because it was a major requirement and I have no interests in stats, but I learned a lot. He's a good teacher that gives you everything you need to do well on the tests. Carmen homework was time consuming and a pain, but other than that the class was really easy and didn't require much work. I would definitely recommend him.

His teaching style is ok, it's long for a 2 hour session, keeps the stats pretty interesting and clarifies whatever. Pretty approachable. Tests are easy but make sure to read because some essays answers may be ONLY found in the book but go to lecture, it's necessary to fully learn all the algorithms. Problem sets aren't bad at all, good prof, 8/10

This was one of my favorite classes of the semester. Yes, she does read from the slides at times, but she often elaborates and gives further details if people ask questions. It's an interesting subject and she teaches it well. There are optional extra credit assignments throughout the semester, and exams come from the lectures, which are recorded.

This class isn't bad at all if your a neuro major. There are three midterms, one of which you can skip, and a final, as well as a small paper. She posts all lectures online, so I never went unless it was a test day. One thing I thought was off about her is that she's weird about questions. Might as well not even ask because she isn't gonna know.

hormones and behavior is a good adv class to take but be prepared to not learn much from lecture. she stands there and reads her slides verbatim. her exams are straight forward but cover a lot of material. lots of true/false questions and the rest of exam are mcq. she gives easy homework assignments and small ec opportunities.

4644 is a good class for the sequenced advanced psych class, but I had to study a lot to get good grades. the lectures are pretty boring and when you ask questions in class she usually doesn't even know the answer. there are extra credit opportunities and the homework is easy, but the exams can be tough. overall, its a fair class.

Dr. Leuner is wonderful! Her lectures were exceptionally well-organized with clear information and lots of real-world examples. I appreciated how she worked in relevant cultural topics and integrated science + society together.  Outside of class, she prioritizes communication and is accessible to answer questions and provide guidance.

Dr. Leuner is a great professor, and I really loved the class! I loved how she worked some important social issues into her presentations. The class is super interesting, which always makes studying easier! Her quizzes and final were very fair.

You don't need to show up to this class to do well. All lectures are posted online and her exams come directly off that. Sometimes there are experiments that are on the slides that may be unclear if you don't show up to class. I only showed up to class on exam days and started studying 3-4 days before. She also drops lowest exam and provides EC

Might be the easiest upper-level neuro class OSU offers. Dr. Leuner is great and the material you learn is very useful for the MCAT. Never went to class and studied for exams the night before and got an easy A. She offers extra credit for every exam. Highly recommend using Anki to keep up with the material. VERY EASY A!! TAKE this class.

I LOVE Dr. Leuner. She's very relaxed about teaching and just wants her students to understand more about hormones and the brain. There are 4 multiple choice exams and 10 points of extra credit given throughout the course. One exam is dropped from your grade, but you have to take the final. She can be so funny during lecture too in very subtle ways

Dr. Leuner is a great professor and she is always willing to help her students with their problems. Her lecture is very comprehensive and her exam is fairly easy, of course as long as you study for it.

Dr. Leuner is great. This was by far one of my favorite Neuro courses. Would leave class everyday fascinated. Drops lowest Midterm grade but ended up allowing us to drop our cumulative final because the averages were low. Super fair and great!
Dr. Leuner is one of the best professors I've ever had! She is passionate about what she teaches and cares that students do well.

So, 4 tests, hard, and thats it for grades. Some extra credit, but not enough to actually help. She only reads off the slides, so going to class is a waste of time. Must read the book and extra articles for tests. Her tests are also very wordy and you slip up on them if you don't take your time. Not one to boost your GPA--difficult :(
Extremely bright professor, very knowledgable, and always willing to go above and beyond to help students understand the material. Would take another class with Dr. Leuner in a heartbeat.

Dr. Leuner is very clear in her lec. which are based on slides. Textb. difficult to get through; highly technical and dry. Exams mainly based off of lec. & slides. 4644 Hormones and Behavior has a lot of info. Dr. Leuner seems to keep it on the simpler side, so if you are a neuroscience extraordinaire, it may not be detailed enough for your taste.
Class isn't difficult if you attend and study the notes. Enjoyed the subject matter and thought it was interesting. Dr. Leuner is a good lecturer and her exams are very fair.

Dr. Leuner is a really great teacher! I feel like I learn a lot from her, and she is challenging in a good way. I took Behavioral Neuro with her and am now taking Hormones and Behavior and I love both classes.

Juan was a great professor. His lectures were easy to understand, exams were open-note, and there were several extra credit opportunities. Attendance wasn't mandatory, but he randomly assigned Top Hat questions to track participation. You didn't have to be there all the time to get full points, though. Overall, he's very accommodating and kind.

Best professor this semester!! Kind, caring, and a very chill professor. Lectures are straight forward, easy to understand, examples, etc. Exams are very fair, open note, and you have lots of extra credit opportunities throughout semester. Interesting content that's applicable to real life. Highly recommend!

The kindest professor I have ever had! She is so kind and her lectures were always very interesting and easy to understand. Her class activities were engaging and interesting as well. Super understanding and helpful! Couldn't recommend her more.

This class was a breath of fresh air. Attendance isn't mandatory but there are very easy group assignments and TopHats done randomly during class that are a big part of your grade. There are many chances to make up any missed points and gain extra credit. She is very nice and supportive. You will get an A by just showing up. I would recommend!
There's a quiz every week but they're really easy and just on the vocab. She gives you a list of words to study and you just answer around 10 questions on them. Definitions come from the textbook.

Very nice and wholesome teacher that accommodated students' needs when things got difficult. Class had 3 exams. All the psych 1100 exams were very easy and the weekly quizzes were a little difficult but other than that, it was easy to get an A in the classes. Top Hat questions in lectures that were graded and lots of extra credit opportunities.

Even though most of your grade is based on exams, he grades them extremely fairly and always tries to give his students points. It's important to take notes while he's lecturing because some of what he says will be on the exam, but he does a fantastic job of explaining everything at a speed you can understand and answers questions very well :)

Givens shouldn't be teaching an intro neuroscience class. Seems like his lectures are aimed more towards grad students. 3 exams are worth almost all of your grade and require an insane amount of studying. Questions on exams come from a topic he mentioned once or twice in a lecture. Nice guy and really helpful, he's just teaching the wrong class.

I think Dr. Givens really cares about what he teaches, but I feel as though he didn't do a very good job of teaching the material. Instead of what he used to do, there are three exams and very few other assignments. The exams themselves are quite difficult and require a lot of memorization and dedication to get down. However, this is neuroscience.

Dr. B was a great prof, esp during the pandemic. He was accommodating. For the online class, there's no final. Just a quiz every alt week, and very basic homework assignments. He was always v helpful and accessible. Attendance isn't mandatory, but it's harder to get an A if you don't pay attention. Gives hints about questions before quizzes.

2 midterms, 1 final, 1 group presentation, 1 unofficial presentation and 1 short essay. The grading is clear. No text book use. The course materials were complicated and there were a bunch of things to remember, but Bennet was always willing to help you with that. Participation is not required, but it was hard to get high grade without attending.

He was super nice and caring, and always accessible outside of class. He often gave us hints for potential exam questions, which was very helpful. 2 midterms and a final, with multiple choice and choice of short answer. I found his lectures to be pretty engaging and he was happy to answer questions as class went along. I would take his class again!

While Dr. Givens can be quiet and scatter-brained, he is such a nice guy. He validated all the concerns I had on my presentation and research articles. This course was mostly discussion based, so it was mostly students presenting. You'll be bored a lot, it can be time consuming for essay exams that you write in advance, but its not too stressful.

The class have a lot of memorization. However, the exams are straightforward and have extra credit. Print slides before class and/or add notes from his lecture to the slides. He only focuses on important points and some exam questions are from his lecture (not on slides). He didn't really agree with textbook sometimes. One presentation assignment.

Dr. Givens is a great professor who genuinely cares about the material and helping students learn more.  The class is pretty tough, and I would recommend it only if you're a psych/neuroscience major; as I'm only a psych minor (business major) it was actually the hardest class I've taken at OSU.
Not too difficult but not too easy. 3 hr long lecture was boring but overall not bad. Never touched textbook...
Was a little...okay very monotone and the lectures were a bit of a bore but all the info you needr is on the power points and his jeopardy games help a lot. Overall a decent teacher.
Easy, lecture wasn't necessary as he basically read right off slides, but exams are online and you have ample time

Talks so quiet! Class is boring but not terrible, 3 online exams and 2 assignments. Sounds easy, but he expects extreme detail in answers so if it isn't perfect you will miss points. Zero curve and only 200 points so hard to get better than an A- in my opinion. Frustrating but not too bad if you are familiar with neuroscience.
He was an Amazing teacher; very informative and the class was a breeze (very easy)

Class was relatively easy. Lectures are somewhat boring, but his PowerPoints are incredibly useful. The exams come straight from them. Make sure you pay attention in class because there will be exam questions that cover material that he vocalizes.

Lectures are long and boring. He claims his test material comes out of the slides, but I found the book way more helpful. Tests are very difficult, but he curves them, which helps a lot. Difficult, but technically do-able class. On an unrelated note: he's kinda hot in a bizarre way
Very boring lectures. I found myself learning more from the textbook than the lectures. Tests were moderate.. not impossible though.

He seemed very friendly/eager to help students, but he was a terrible lecturer. He was very vague about a lot of his slides and generally seemed uninterested in most of the material. Tests were very difficult.

Super friendly and helpful. Lectures could get dry, but the material is really interesting.  He tries to stick to what you need to know, but will also go more in depth if people ask.  You can really see his passion for the field even though he is a bit monotone.

Super nice guy, crazy-making quiet/scattered lecturer. If you don't know much about neuroscience you'll have to teach yourself from the book (what I did) or spend lots of time with him one-on-one. He's probably much better for advanced students.

This professor is very boring. It is very tempting to just skip class and teach yourself from the book.  He is helpful one on one because you can constantly ask questions.  For such a boring class, it didn't help that he didn't provide any way of making it interesting.  This class is required for my major and I might have to retake it, yikes!
Hard class, but professor was sooo willing to help. He made pretty dry material interesting. Very straightforward and tells you what he expects.

I took this class for summer quarter, basically three lectures a class. But the prof did his best to make it clear. I liked his style, low key. Probably boring for people who aren't interested in neuroscience or biology.
He's a great teacher. I missed a few classes toward the end of the quarter that led to me not doing as well on the final as I'd hoped.
An exellent professor, and a nice person,too.

He is a nice enough guy but do NOT take him for summer quarter.  He crammed whole weeks of lectures into each class.  3 lectures a day! The tests are somewhat hard but he offered review sessions.  He is somewhat disorganized and it seems like the lectures aren't in a good order.  I guess he is fine for an already bad class.

He is a really nice guy and knows his stuff very well. In lecture sit in the front to make sure you hear him. I found his class very easy. He posts all his notes online. To succeed all you need to do is memorize the notes because all the test questions come from the online notes.

He's perfectly nice and all, but I found his lectures kind of dry and his teaching style awkward. The material also wasn't quite what I was expecting- it was much heavier on the neuroanatomy and physiology than on the relationship with behavior. Two midterms and a final, 50? each, so that wasn't bad...I just found the whole experience boring.

An inevitable class for psych majors, this professor is not bad, It's all about brain chemistry/circuits and the CNS. Fun if you like hard core neuroscience.  I ended up with a C without too much effort. The class average was an 80%. Study hard though!
Great teacher, and not bad looking. Very helpful, and cares about his students. Very down to earth, and knows the material inside out.
I liked this teacher. He is helpful, down to earth, and not bad looking. He is a nice guy over all. I took his class after a few students recommended it. They liked the guy too.

A great teacher, but make sure to sit near the front, as he speaks quietly.  You really have to go to both lecture and read the text to do well.  I STRONGLY recommend asking for his grad student, Karen, as a tutor if you don't have a background in biology.  She's GREAT at dumbing the material down and making it easy to remember.

Professor who is very enthusiastic about his subject (but gets embarrassed when he gets too excited). Attractive in an odd way and has great legs. Looks like Bert from Sesame Street. Take his class!! =D
All of notes are posted online... for lecture he just reads off of the notes.
hard class, must know biology well and understand it. boring class, long lectures. hard but tests are all multiple choice not tricky tests.

Great class!It should be considerably easier for anyone with a bio backgraound and I think the psych majors will have to do extra work outside to understand the biology parts.  Prof was always willing to answer questions outside of class and was generally likeable.  His voice is quiet, so sit close to the front to prevent distractions.
Great professor if you're willing to put in the work.  If you're lazy, you'll do poorly.  Otherwise, just go to the lectures, read the text, and you'll easily get an A.
Great Prof.  Highly recommend.  Whoever says its boring is probably boring themselves.
Very kind and intelligent.
This class could easily be one of the most boring I've ever had to sit through and because of that I rarely attended, monotoned, and lecture seems disorganized.
great prof - very smart.  office hours were the best way to get help.  midterms were tough, but he tells you what to study in lecture.

I attempted this class twice, but had to drop halfway thru because I can't sit thru class. He will tell you directly that he doesn't care if you do well in his class-he will not help you. He speaks in monotone, mumbles, and teaches as if your a moron if you don't already know the material.
Just a lot of memorization... three 50 question multiple choice tests make up the entire grade. Pretty easy class and there's no point in going to lecture
The lectures were not helpful and he was not good at explaining anything.  The test reviews are pointless.
No Comments
Regardless of whatever people before said, his tests came DIRECTLY from his lectures.  Everything.  You just REALLY have to pay attention to everything he says in class.
inconsistencies in his explanations

Regardless of prof psychobio is hard!  Tests were right out of the book, even though he said he only tests on lectures. He lectured as though he expected you already knew most the info. Also, lectures were monotone hard to stay awake in. However, I've heard he's tons easier than other 313 profs.

Dr. Givens is a horrible prof...when I asked him for some help he told me that there wasn't much else I could do that I wasn't already doing and then told me not to concentrate on the book because his lecture material is from an old book,but then the questions on the exam come straight from the book

Heard so many horror stories about psychobio, but was told to definitely take it with Givens.  I am actually doing excellent in this class, but DEFINITELY know the info.  He's a very smart guy and knows his stuff.  Be prepared for specific exam questions.  But he's a good professor and a real cutie!
Amazing! Loved him! the material is pretty tough and sometimes overwhelming but he is MORE than willing to help! really nice guy
Doesn't care if you do good or bad, very dry in class, sometimes I don't think he understands what he is saying and if he does he can't explain it to the rest of the class.  Terrible teacher!!!

Awesome class. Interesting, but he is a bit dry in his lecture. I thought the multiple choice exams were ridiculously easy, always over a 97. Just pay attention to his slides. Didnt even touch the book.
Yikes! Agreed, tests were absurd and waaay detailed! be afraid.

I agree with the person below me.  He never emailed me back either!  The lectures were DULL and did not touch 1/2 as deep as the questions on the test he expected us to know!  Read the book and lectures and am still doing horrible!

Tests were absurd. There were things on them not mentioned in lecture or in the text. Lectures were vague and dull. This professor never responded to my emails. I did better in Biochem 511 than in this class if that tells you anything.
Givens is hot!  Besides that, he wants the students to understand the material and is willing to go out of his way to help them.
Great person, always willing to help out students in any ways he can.  A must have Professor.
No Comments
I actually took 313 with Prof Givens and chose to take 512 b/c he was teaching it.  Awesome instructor.  Very helpful, will write letter of recom for almost anyone
No Comments

Dr. Meyer is clearly passionate about what she does and knowledgable which helps make class more fun and engaging. However, she is a very very tough grader. She gives feedback for rough drafts but if you want real, helpful feedback, you need to speak with her one-on-one. Enjoyed the class but it didn't need to be as hard as it was.

I feel that Dr. Meyer's Psych 4510 was difficult, but manageable with effort. She is pretty responsive to emails with questions, which definitely helps. Almost everyone in the class receives an A or a B. She's a pretty tough grader on the writing assignments, but there are so many of them that one bad grade doesn't really effect your overall grade.

Dr. Meyer is very energetic and funny. Makes class enjoyable and entertaining. sometimes she throws candy at us for participating. Lots of easy assignments but you get multiple tries. lots of tophat but they're easy

This class is really manageable and interesting! Dr. Meyer is very approachable and kind. Make sure to go to lecture, as TH is important for your grade and there are in-person activities that will tank your grade if you miss them. Just go to class, do your assignments - and you'll get an A.

Dr. Meyer is just lovely! Her lectures were as entertaining as they were informative and she's super approachable and kind. She provided a scanned/pdf format to give us a free textbook, and her assignments were super easy but still help you to learn. Make sure you attend lectures though because she does do some in-class activities and TopHat.

I did not need to buy a textbook. She is very flexible with deadlines and participation. There were no big exams just many different types of assignments. Best teacher and fun class! You can tell she wants you to do well in the class.

Got a good grade in the class, but had to work tirelessly to get it. The grading critera is unclear, the templates given are overwhelming, and little to no guidance is given before you have to write. Grading is super tough and is looked at as if you are supposed to be a PhD student. Dr. Meyer was not good at walking us through the final paper.

This class is formatted so poorly. We are given barely any guidelines on the papers, but then graded as if we are well established professional researchers. my parent wrote a dissertation and even she doesn't understand how we are being graded so harshly as an undergrad. I honestly have no idea how anyone could have a good grade in this class.

Assignment rubrics: Not clear
Timeline to present research: Extremely tight ie. 1 weeks to code, modify, and gather participants
Teaching style: Just end up using a lot of Purdue Owl guides then tells you to reference it. 
Assignments: Paper heavy, 1 paper every 2 weeks usually. Not difficult but you get no support in writing it.

Dr. Meyer's cognitive psych class is literally the easiest class I've ever taken. Papers are practically for participation because she's not looking for the most beautiful piece of art, and all 5 online quizzes have 2 attempts to get it right. Homework is super easy too. Least amount of work I've ever had for a class in college.

Dr. Meyer is probably my favorite professor that I've had thus far at OSU. She has a great personality and prioritizes learning over memorization and grading. She is a great in person lecturer and also provides online video lectures. She really knows what she's talking about and is really detailed with the material. Uses practical assignments.
One of the very few professors that want you to actually learn the information. She does not rely on tests to check your knowledge. Had great humor and was very caring.

Dr. Meyer is enthusiastic, makes showing up to class worthwhile, understanding, and a great professor overall.I would highly recommend you take her if you're a psych major or need to fulfill a GE req. She is super chill and engages with her classes wonderfully. She conveys material concretely, and was very flexible pre and post pandemic.
She is the best!
Dr. Meyer is so sweet and understanding and as long as you do her work you can get an A. She tries to make the content more fun and provides extra credit.

Dr. Meyer is great. The class content can be dry, but she does her best to make it interesting and fun to learn about. This class was an easy A because of the sheer amount of extra credit opportunities and the fact that she drops the lowest grades from ALL categories. Quizzes and papers were easy if you watched the lectures. Strongly recommend her!

Prof. Meyer was so caring and kind. Her class was boring, but I think thats just because I dont find the topic interesting. Regardless, she was always so accommodating, and honestly the class was rather easy. You basically do activities for your grade.

One of the most enjoyable classes Ive had at osu. The homework is always easy and interesting. Quizzes were all open note with no time limit and she offers extra credit. Dr Meyer is quick to answer emails and her lectures were always enjoyable to sit through.

This class was so easy and Dr. Meyer was super understanding and helpful. Tons of extra credit available, she often extends deadlines, and very clear grading criteria. Exam questions were taken straight from her quizzes. Nice easy A, and you can tell she really wants her students to succeed!

Her subject is kind of boring, but she does her best to make lectures fun. She was a great professor before the COVID-19 situation, but after we went to online she was particularly amazing. She was very understanding of our situation and was always kind. She drops the lowest exams, and smaller assignments are easy. Easy, fun, definitely recommend.

She is very generous about giving high grades and it is an easy A class even if you don't study hard. She is a very nice and easy-going person who is always willing to help. But honestly the content is a bit too boring.

The content of this class is kinda boring and can be hard to understand sometimes but the exam questions come directly from her carmen quizzes (which you can take as many times as you want and it keeps the highest score) so the exams are easy if you study her quizzes. She's a good lecturer. Lets you drop an exam. It's an easy A class.

Low-stress class. Exam questions are straight from the online assignments. You do have to show up to get TopHat points though. She has been EXTREMELY accommodating throughout this Coronavirus nonsense, which I see as a testament to her good character. The content itself is pretty boring but she really does want students to succeed.

I can't lie, I found this woman very irritating. She spends more time trying to make people laugh, rather than lecturing, so we end up having to study stuff on our own. Lots of content on exams, but they're not hard. Lots of extra credit and you get 1 exam grade dropped (don't need to take final if you've done well on 3!!) Overall, not terrible

Dr. Meyer is an amazing professor and she seems to really love what she does. She frequently includes memes in the lecture slides which helps to keep the lecture interesting. If you miss the lecture, however, you will miss your opportunity to complete your tophat participation points and you won't get to hear what the short answer question is.

Such an easy class, and Dr. Meyer is the best. Does do tophat in classes randomly. Exams are easy -- just study with her "not a study guide" study guide. Highly recommended as a GPA booster (and it's even interesting too!)

BEST INSTRUCTOR EVER! Exams were based on lecture so if you showed up and payed attention, it will be an easy A. Honestly, if you don't get a good grade, you had to do absolutely nothing. Had small assignments every week, but you only need to do so many so the rest is extra credit. Recommend doing the reading just to help understand the material

She is so fun and dynamic, never a boring lecture so you won't want to skip. Class is not too hard, material is pretty easy to understand, and she gives SO much extra credit. Like I'm pretty sure you get extra credit points for COMPLETING 90% of the homeworks (which take literally 5 mins to do). Would highly recommend.

Rosalee is AMAZING, I absolutely loved her class! If you attend class, do the tophats and even zone out afterwards you will get an easy A. Put in effort and she will offer extra credit, connect with you on a personal basis and possibly write a rec letter. 10/10 if you are questioning what to take, take this class

She has a great spirit and is a funny lecturer. She makes it very easy to succeed in the class with several opportunities for extra credit. However, I attempted to talk with her after hours about related material, and she didn't know too much outside the course material.

Dr. Meyer is the best professor Ive had at OSU! Attendance is not mandatory but I always went because I enjoyed her teaching so much. She genuinely wants all of her students to do well and sets up the course so everyone will succeed. I wish there were more professors like her. TAKE HER!

You can't fail this class. She gives so much extra credit. Got a D on the first exam and I am going into the 3rd with over a 100%. Just show up to class so you can get credit for tophats and do her make it sticks outside of class. That is where you get all your extra credit. Highly recommend even though lectures are boring.

Definitely take this class! Dr. Meyer gives so much extra credit and makes it really easy to pass. The exams are straightforward and don't try to trick you, and you can drop the lowest score! Attendance is "mandatory", because she does random top-hat quizzes. However, so much extra credit is given that the attendance grade won't affect you too much

#1, she doesn't "check" on you. She "checks" when you do inappropriate things and says something to you to make you stop (it happened in my section). # 2, now that that is out of the way, SHE'S AMAZING. I love her so much! She gives tons of extra credit, is personable and knows how to teach so it sticks. Reasonable easy tests if you study :)

Took Professor Meyer for PSYCH 3312. She basically made it impossible to fail. SO MUCH extra credit available. Just do all the home work quizzes (I never read the textbook and passed, but you'd certainly get a better grade reading it), go to class and do the in-class quizzes, study a little for the tests, and you'll get an A no problem.

Dr. Meyer is one of the best professors I have had at Ohio State! She wants everyone to do well. Attendance isnt mandatory, but there are tophat quizzes. I loved going to lecture because she is a wonderful teacher, and her class is always fun and engaging and filled with lots of laughs. A lot of material for exams, but lowest score is dropped.
Easy exams and multiple chances to boost up your grades. The grades are designed to be much more than 100% so you'll be good even if you miss 5 carmen assignments.

Go to lecture, pay attention, ask questions if you have any. Make a study guide for the exams, don't study at the last minute, do the assignments she assigns, and you should do well. Optional attendance, but I would highly recommend going. Book is kind of used, but you could possibly get an A without it. Library also has free electronic copies.

Seriously take Dr. Meyer. Go to class AT LEAST 60% of the time. I literally got over 30 extra credit points and, if thats not enough, she's just a great professor. Does her best to make the class interactive, engaging, and funny while still being informative. Take her. You and your GPA won't regret it.

Dr. Meyer was a great professor. She actually cares about her students and gives great feedback (and lots of extra credit). Pay attention to her lectures and come to class, and you'll do great on the exams!

Top Hats are worth participation and top hat questions resemble those that will be on the exam. The textbook is helpful, but not necessary. You can receive extra credit for being present for more than the required amount of top hat lectures, so going to class often is very helpful. She allows one dropped exam or optional cumulative final.

Dr. Meyer is really annoying and you don't learn anything in lecture that isn't in the textbook. I didn't show up much and it was still easy to get an A. Lots of extra credit opportunities. She tries way too hard to act like she's 'in the know' with what's cool in our generation and isn't helpful at all in class. That said, easy class, easy A
Dr. Meyer really makes this class enjoyable, gives extra credit for getting the in class pop quizzes right, drops lowest exam score. A very fair professor and a great class to take!

I really enjoyed taking Dr. Meyer's class & learned a lot.  Honestly, I didn't use the textbook.  I got all the information I needed from the lectures & readings posted online.  Attendance isn't crucial, but I would recommend it because there are easy pop quizzes in class.  The only grades are 2 midterms, 1 final and 3 homework assignments.

I really enjoyed this course (Psych 3312). Grades are made up of in-class pop quizzes and 4 exams of which she counts your 3 best. If you are not a good test taker you wont do well. However, she is funny, engaging and very knowledgeable. The book is helpful and the notes are posted but you need to attend to get the daily quiz points. I'd take again
Super kind and caring! Actually cares if you pass.

Super easy tests and top hats every day, but they're easy too. She's really nice and really excited about her subject. Easiest class ever and you don't have to read the book, but it helps. She throws you candy if you answer questions!

I loved Rosalee. She gives you a very clear picture of what is in the class and how to pass it. Honestly if you go to every class and participate in class you will get at least a B, there's also a lot of EC opportunities

Dr. Scott recently moved to UNCC. Im rating for psyc- 2121. Overall I found the lectures boring. Dr.scott is a very kind prof, and can be humorous. Attendance is not mandatory, no homework, you are graded by 2 Papers, 3 exams, and 1 extra credit paper. Exams are very hard.

Dr. Scott is an amazing lecturer; she makes the material very clear and tells a ton of stories that help you remember the concepts. Attendance wasn't mandatory and lectures were posted online, but I recommend going anyway just because she's so entertaining and passionate about psych. Also, she gave a few extra credit pop quizzes based on lectures!

Attendance isnt mandatory, so barely anyone shows up. But I would recommend going because she gives fantastic lectures! She told interesting stories to make each concept relevant, and I found myself with a really deep understanding of everything in the course. She had 2 or 3 assignments, and just a handful of noncumulative exams. Lovely woman!

Loved taking an Intro to Psych class with Dr. Scott, she really cares about her students and makes her lectures very fun and interesting. I always enjoyed going to her class. Her tests are not too hard but you do have to study and read the textbook. I probably did more studying than was required but still did not feel like it was a waste of time.

The class itself isn't difficult, but the exams are all written, very specific, and hard. There are other psych professors for this class who solely use multiple choice, and I wish I would have chosen one of them. However, she is an amazing lady and her lectures are interesting. Just conflicted by how much studying was required.

Awesome professor, accessible during office hours, easy essays, straightforward exams, really enjoyable lectures. will ask questions on exams that aren't in the notes but she gives a really good idea of the exam content with her study guides. ended with over a 100 in the class

Bertrina was such a fun professor. Child psych is such an interesting subject and she just makes it more fun by throwing in personal stories to explain different concepts. Grade is based solely on exams and a couple short writing assignments, so it's definitely recommended to go to class everyday. Exams and papers are easy and straight-forward
Dr. Scott is very knowledgeable. I learn so much from her that I actually enjoy coming to lectures. Tests aren't bad at all. She is a lenient grader on the group project. Highly recommend.

Dr. Scott recognizes that this is an intro course, which makes it very doable. Her lectures are very enjoyable, though! The exams are fine as long as you follow the study guide (which includes referencing the textbook). Highly recommend Dr. Scott!

Dr. Scott is a very tough grader. Any deviation from exactly what she said in class results in significant point deductions. Because of this her class was needlessly difficult. If you do take a class with her, be sure to write down everything she says, how she says it. Anything besides regurgitating what she says will be graded down.

only three exams and three papers. exams are really tough. the teacher assistant is a strict tough grader. I went to see the professor during her office hours, she showed me that she is busy and I was not welcomed at all. Hard class, better if you can take another one.

I took Pyschology 3550 over the summer and she provided a very clear cut course, making it interesting through story examples. The relections were very easy and the exams highlighted book material questions and lecture material. Overall, an easy and fascinating class.

Only need book to fill out study guides she gives you. I got almost 100% on each exam by just filling in and studying the study guide. Slides are posted online, but lectures are hilarious and she fills in the slides with extra details and information that will really help. Just come to class, and focus on the study guides. Easy A!
I love this professor. The lectures were very well prepared and kept the class from being boring. She is a wonderful addition to OSU and beautiful too!

LOVE Professor Scott. Her lectures are always entertaining and she uses lots of personal, relevant stories of her own kids. I always come to class (not mandatory) because I actually enjoy listening to her teach and speak. If you listen to her in class studying for the exams are a breeze. HIGHLY RECOMMEND

It is incredibly easy to get an A in this class because she gives so much extra credit. The exams (4 total) are very hard and it's all essays, so you really do have to study, but make (or find) a good quizlet and you'll be fine. I averaged about an 87% on the exams and ended with a solid A.

Professor Scott is an awesome professor. It was not an easy class, but most people do well. I had her first semester freshman year, and it was a real wake-up call to what college is like. I never had to study to do well in high school, and this class taught me the hard way that you ALWAYS have to study. She makes psych interesting, fun class.

A lot of extra credit given and the one paper we had to write was an easy A. Lectures can be a bit boring but its definitely important to go because she gives great examples and helps clarify things. The exams are fine if you memorize everything in your notes but she is a tough grader if you dont say exactly what shes looking for.
Dr. Scott is a great professor. Her tests can be difficult, but with extra credit, your grade will be fine if you focus on learning the material.

Dr. Scott gave a ton of extra credit throughout the semester. The extensive paper you write is not too difficult and Dr. Scott is a lenient grader. The fill-in-the-blanks were probably the trickiest part of the exams, but the abundance of extra credit makes up for bad exam grades. Understandably, more difficult than 1100, but not a hard class.

My only problem is the way she grades her tests, which are the majority of your grade. She is not lenient at all when it comes to definitions or extended response questions, which make up the entire test. So if you take her classes you need to remember everything she says word for word.

I loved Dr. Scott. She gives pop quizzes that are solely extra credit, so I ended up with a 103 in the class. She is really passionate about psychology and her lectures are extremely interesting. She explains everything really well and is always open to questions. Would highly recommend!

Bertrina Scott was easily one of my favorite lecturers at OSU. She is very knowledgeable and is very passionate about her field of work. She is always willing to help students with material that may be more difficult. I barely did any work outside of class other REP experiments and reading the chapters. No homework for this class. Very easy class
I really enjoyed this class. She gives extra credit when most students don't even need it, but it can make the difference between a "B" and an "A". Would HIGHLY recommend.

Engaging, humorous and intelligent lecturer! Although I'm not a psych major, I'd love to take more of her classes. I absolutely loved her teaching style and personality and I'll miss her dearly after this semester.

Dr. Scott doles out extra credit unlike any instructor I have ever had! The test have difficult fill-in-the-blanks and definitions, so the extra credit really helps-- I got an 98% even with a C midterm! The course does include a paper, but she does not grade it harshly at all. When given the option to write papers or do REP, DO REP!!!

Bertrina is definitely one of the best professors I've had at OSU! The material is dense and the chapters long, but she keeps the info very easy to understand and keeps you interested. She gives study guides for tests which are difficult if you don't read or come to lecture. I went to every lecture because she was so entertaining!

She was a great instructor! This was an easy class because of her teaching! Attendance isn't mandatory but showing up for class will help your understanding of the material! Could do just as well though reading the book! Gives one extra credit assignment which is easy to do and gives a good grade boost!

Bertrina is hilarious! She has great energy and shares so many anecdotes that are completely relevant AND entertaining. Only three exams makes it smooth sailing, her questions aren't tricky and if you read the textbook or go to class you'll get an A, if you do both you'll definitely get an A. Loved this prof!

Prof Scott is very straight forward, and uses related examples for almost every psychological term which makes it easy to understand the concepts. Gives study guide before exams. I enjoyed lectures and found myself looking forward to attending them, which isn't all that common for me

Prof Scott made it very easy to study for exams. She posted lecture slides online, mentioned possible test questions in lecture, and even made a study guide for us. She also answers emails on the weekends! She is a lovely lady and I would definitely recommend her to anyone.

Dr. Scott gives interesting lectures and in general runs the class well; however, she has absolutely ridiculous tests for a GEC.  The tests are all fill in and short answer, and the written parts better be word-for-word how she presented it in lecture or it's wrong.  It is kind of a shame because the class would be quite enjoyable if not for that.

Attendance is recommended, but it won't hurt too much if you miss a class. Four tests (final not cumulative), journal analysis paper (just follow the rubric), research participation. Grading is fair except for some unclear fill-in-the-blank questions.

LOVE her. She is very straight forward - her tests aren't bad as long as you study for them (she gives study guides), the textbook isn't necessary because her online notes are very detailed but it helps nonetheless. Going to class isn't mandatory but I enjoyed going and listening to her lecture.

I took the honors level Intro to Psych course - while the concepts were easy, the tests in this class were a lot more difficult compared to the regular level Intro class. Otherwise, I enjoyed Scott as a prof in general.

Very straight forward. Questions taken right out of the study guides given before every exam. Attendance is mandatory to be able to easily answer the questions in the study guide. Textbook not needed.

She gives out study guides for her midterms, but the midterms are only 50 questions and the study guide lists pretty much everything that you cover, so it isn't that helpful.  Overall if you attend class and read the book you will be fine, not that difficult.

Pretty straightforward.  She gives a study guide that says exactly what will be on the test.  There are two midterms and a final, but all are the same weight and are set up the same way.  There aren't any surprises and she doesn't try to trick you.

This class is a lot of work but it is not all that hard.  Prepare to study a lot two or three days before a test but she gives you everything that could be on it.  Paying attention in class is optional. Just study and she is an easy grader overall.

Dr. Scott is an ok professor. She is pretty boring and the lectures are almost impossible to make it though. She has her funny moments though. She understands that this is a GEC, classes arnt mandatory and the book isn't really needed. Exams were kinda difficult. 3 mid terms, no final, and a paper, which im convinced she didn't even read.

Great lecturer, interesting and more than willing to answer any questions. I enjoyed this class overall, but the exams were pretty tough. You will have to study a lot in order to do well on them. The good thing is, she does give you a chance to earn back points missed from midterms on the final exam with extra credit questions.
Great teacher
Easy easy easy.  Go to class, read the book (she tests over material that is in the book but not covered in class), and study the slides.  She also tells some good stories.

You do need the book for this class, unless you want to look up any topics online.  Most of the test material is from the slides, but a few questions are from the book only.  Otherwise, boring, easy, and simple class.  Take the other, better prof is you can.

WORST CLASS, longest 2 hours of my life! She gives too many examples for the easiest concepts and all examples relate to her life. She can't complete a sentence without "um" and stumbles over words. Don't buy the book, if something is on the review sheet you don't know, look it up online.  This class is ALL memorization!

This is a difficult course.  She is organized and her review does include everything on the test, but it is A LOT of information to memorize.  If you are genuinely interested in the material and can memorize easily, you should be fine.  Otherwise, be prepared to work.  This class can get boring.

Print out the notes, come to class, try to stay awake, make flash cards when she posts the review sheet, and you will get an A. The only thing that is on the exams are on the review sheet. Attendance isn't mandatory but it helps when you added your own notes to hers as she explains things.

Pretty decent instructor nothing spectacular but also nothing terrible to report.  Notes are online... but going to class is very helpful.  Fairly interesting class even though I'm not a big fan of developmental psych.  My only complaint is the heteronormativity in the lectures... but I have this complaint in a lot of classes.

Very easy to pay attention in class. Print the notes, bring them to class and write in the missing info. Thats it. She throws one or two questions that are not not the review sheet, but she does tell you what you need to know. You will have to crame for about two days for each of the three test. But thats it. They're easy Grades the paper eash too.

Decent lecturer. Got better as the course continued. Was distracted by the sheer number of 'um's she used for the first week or two. Interesting information. All of the lectures on Carmen. Don't need to go to class, but helpful. Book not really needed (only a bit on the final.) Stick with study guide and you'll be fine.  Easy tests.

Her classes basically consist of showing slides. She also puts them on carmen prior to class, so you don't have to bother writing everything down in class, just print out the slides beforehand (if you go to class that is).

Dr. Scott is a great lecturer and despite the length of the class I found it easy to pay attention. The exams were not difficult like some people have said; they're based on straight memorization from the powerpoint notes. I studied for about 2 hours for each exam and got an A on every one.

Covered material clearly in class as well as provided access to the powerpoints online through carmen. Exams were fair and stuck to the information presented in class on the powerpoints. Textbook reading wasn't really necessary, but was interesting nonetheless.

I'm confused as to why some people suggest not taking this class?  Dr. Scott was great.  I went to class each time, took notes off her PowerPoint, and only studied those the night before the test.  The tests were easy - if you came to class.  The class was REALLY interesting and based on alot of discussion.  I wouldn't recommend this class w/o her.

Dr. Scott is a great lecturer; her stories that go along with her slides really helped me remember the material. Her tests are fill in the blank, short answer, and definitions so you do have to study. She does, however, give you a study guide before every exam that outlines the possible topics that will be covered.

The tests were ridiculously hard, and the curve she had to give due to that was crazy.  This is supposed to be a 100 level class, not a 500 level class.  Lectures were alright though and not all that difficult to understand.
She was very nice and the lectures were interesting.  The exams were a bit difficult, and study guides were deceiving.

Her lectures are interesting but its almost pointless to go to them because she doesn't cover harldy any of the material on the tests during lecture. Also, she doesn't use Carmen which sucks because when you do actually go to class you spend the whole time racing to jot down notes and not absorbing the material. Tests were moderately difficult.
Very clear in lecture, but her exams are very difficult. The exams are multiple choice, but tricky. She does not lecture on what is really on the exams.
The exams were very easy and based on memorization. I did fine by just going to class and copying the notes from her powerpoint. The lecture was very boring, though, and were over two hours.
I've never had a more enjoyable professor.  She's entertaining, personable, and has a great sense of humor.  Her exams are very fair.

Class is very easy. The exams are not too bad, either. I only studied for about an hour for each and got an A on them all. Never gives homework and reading the book is not necessary. If you go to class you should do okay. The only thing that sucked was the length of the class, 2 hours and 18 minutes.

the material is easy and her lectures are fairly interesting, but she curved the honors class at a 75, which penalizes us for taking the honors class.  i pulled of an A but it took a few all-nighters.

I thought she was a great lecturer, very interesting.  Spoke to students with respect, didn't dumb things down.  Exams are hard though, and you really have to know everything she covers in the quarter.  Great class, though.

I dont know what these ppl are talkin about..she was really cool and interesting.  true some questions were ambiguous but all you had to do was talk to her about them and she'll throw it out justifiably.  i got an A from simply doing what im supposed to-go to class and read the book.  I reccomend her over other psych teachers anyday.

This class wasn't bad, Scott is a pretty interesting lecturer, just be prepared for exams.  Even though it's mult. choice, there's few points, and you really have to know everything.  READ the book, the majority of things she tests on are directly from the book, but she doesn't cover it in lecture.
this class is rediculously hard for an Honors beginning psych class. my recommendation... do not take this class.

Lecture are not that interesting. Material seems very easy but tests have 40 very easy questions and then 10 that are ambiguous. Got a B plus and I have a 3.8. Her questions always seem to focus on African-American adolescents so everybody mishandled the first test. No curve when there needed to be.

This class was horrible, the hardest class i've ever taken.  Dr. Scott is a good professor and knows everything there is to know about psychology, but her exams are extremely hard.  If you study more than you've ever studied in your entire life you can manage to get an A.

This professor ruined this class for me and I really enjoyed the material.  Scott comes to class unprepared, doesn't have any type of backing for the information she presents and her tests are poorly written and not fairly curved.  Take this class from one of the professors that deserves to be one.

Dr. Scott is a really cool professor, she speaks to students like a friend instead of a professor, and her lectures are pretty interesting.  Her exams are tough though, all definitions and short answer...you have to study and study and study for this class.

This class should be a requirement for all psych major. The articles analyzed and discussed are eye-opening and definitely changed my perspective on the field of psychology. If you find the science component lacking from other psych class, take this class as we go over empirical evidences and why it matters. Lectures can be dull though.

If you are wanting to pursue graduate school/ phD / PsyD in clinical psych, take this course! I found the material to be absolutely fascinating. Looks at a lot of research, identifies key problems in the growing field of clin psych, prepares you for furthering your education. A good amount of reading, but never just "busy work". Smart and nice prof

Dr. Vasey's class prepared me for grad school, and he's a wealth of knowledge on clinical psych. There's much to do for the weekly readings, but they're opportunities to practice critical thinking/research literacy skills rather than busywork. Lectures could be hard to follow, but worth going to if you're interested in clinical psych topics/issues.

Do not take his class if you're a full time student and have limited time to study. His class is very boring and he's a very though grader. in order to do good in his class you need to consume a lot of time preparing every week. He gives pop-quizzes. I do not recommend taking this class while taking other hard courses. He's very boring.

You definitely need the textbook to do well on the quizzes (4, worth 10% of grade) and some of the exams have book based questions. The exams have a ton of free response essays but he's a very fair grader, it's just a bit tedious. If you're going into the psych profession at all you neeeed this class.

Essential if you are considering on becoming a Clinical Psychologist, he teaches you how to critically evaluate research, most of the material is about logic. Rarely used the textbook (just rent it from the library for the assigned readings). Had 5 quizzes at the end of the semester from assigned papers (not textbook). Exams have like 6 essay :(

Brilliant professor... and provided a completely new perspective on psychology that I would've never had unless I took this class.  Very beneficial because the field is turning to evidence based practice and he's obviously a strong supporter of it.  Personally don't think you should graduate with a psych degree without taking his class

A very interesting class. If you like clinical psychology, this class is essential. It's mostly about evaluating clinical research, ethics, and policy, not a basic continuation of abnormal psychology 3331. If you like research and clinical psychology, you should definitely take this class. It helped me develop research reading skills too.

Went to office hours and got a lot of help. One of the few psych professors that made me feel like I actually learned something. After his class I feel remotely competent in the field of psychology which is something I've not felt before because most courses cover the same studies with the same dry memorization approach.

I loved this class!  All essays, long and hard but if you attend class, you will be fine and you will have the choice to not take the final. Which I think was the best news ever! The material is very interesting and he makes the class so much fun. He is very funny. Take this class, you will love it.

Great class from a great profesor. Should be required of all psych majors, simply because Dr. Vasey delves into important issues in psychology that you'll never hear from your advisors. He helped me in & out of class to better decide what I really want to do in psychology and where I should go for grad school. Hard tests, but class is worth it.
The exams are hard and all essay questions. But he is very helpful.

Dr. Vasey is an incredible professor. You will feel so much more prepared to make decisions regarding psych and your future plans after taking this class. He is also very genuine in wanting to help his students learn and make good decisions in their careers. Understanding, intelligent, and entertaining, you can't go wrong with this prof!

TAKE THIS CLASS!! Should be required for ALL psych majors! Dr. Vasey is incredibly informative and helpful. The subject material is interesting and sometimes even astonishing. Attend class, because most of the material on the tests comes from lecture. Tests are all essay, but if you attend lecture and do readings and they should be fine!

Dr. V is the BEST professor at OSU. He is fun, witty, interesting. You will walk away from this class satisfied. No textbook, but daily article readings (not that hard). Exams are a bit lengthy, but just know your stuff and you will do fine. Lecture attendance is mandatory, he goes over what he wants you to know for exams. TAKE THIS CLASS!
I love Dr. Vasey, awesome class, have to take it if you are a psych major, he is my honors advisor, and I could not have asked for better..!!!!!!! :)
IF YOU DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS YOU SHOULD NOT BE ABLE TO GRADUATE AS A PSYCH DEGREE

Really cares about what he is teaching.  Tests were all essay, but everything on it was discussed in detail during class, the format makes sure you have a working knowledge of the material, and the grading was very fair. A little bit of effort goes a long way in this class.  Overall a great class.

Loved the class, loved his critiques, but the tests are in essay format and really difficult (and I love essays!). The TA we had graded all of the exams, and  for some reason, was a total nazi about it. We were allowed to justify our answers to get more credit, but we had to go in to argue with her.
Great class, I learned a lot. He really makes you think critically ! A nice guy too.

I loved this class. I learned so much. Dr. Vasey makes you think like a scientist and look at information critically. You were really able to apply things learned in 331 in a practical sense. Tests were all essays...so know your stuff well.
the best psych class i took...he makes the class very interesting and easy to learn....if you're interested in counseling as a career, take this class
Great Professor, class is great, learned a lot out of it.  A must take class for all psychology students.

Dr. Munneke is a great professor. He is very kind and fair with grading. There are 3 exams, and they're based on the lecture slides, which are also posted online. If you learn the slides well, exams aren't bad. There are lots of opportunities to bring up your grade, and it isn't a very hard class. Group project at the end of the semester as well.

He is a great and caring professor, and he makes this course really easy to understand. You can ask him questions in the homework session and he always answers patiently. The textbook is not required but can be useful if you don't understand anything in the lecture. I didn't go to the learning lab but it is a way to earn extra credit.

Definitely recommend having him as your prof! He is such a nice person and is extremely patient with explaining material and answering questions. Attendance isn't mandatory, but definitely recommend going because he gives great lecture!

Dr. Munneke is a great professor. Very clear lectures. There is a book but only refer to it if you are confused. You have to do a group project and write a group research paper, which he does not grade hard if you meet the clear criteria provided. He is engaging and gives extra credit here and there because the course is not graded by many things.

Overall, loved the class and professor. As long as you come to class prepared, I think you'll be fine. He was very flexible, and tailored things when a previous activity didn't go as well for most people so that we could better understand future material. He's pretty easy to talk to if you have a question/concern about anything.
This course was very interesting! My one issue is that I really wish there was a textbook associated with the class. I think it would have been really helpful in solidifying course content for me.
Great prof! Explained the course material very well and there was a lot of time to work on problems in class, so it was super easy to get any questions answered.

This class was the hardest class I took this semester but also my favorite. Dr. Petrov is genuinely passionate about the subject and very knowledgeable, he's also pretty funny and manages to make even the most boring topics interesting to learn about. It is a lot of reading/taking notes but if you keep up with it it's not too bad! I'd recommend it.

I loved this class even with all the quizzes. The little check in quizzes every lecture really helped me learn the material. You can drop 8 quizzes and one exam(including the final). He really cares about what he's teaching and it is a super cool class if you're interested. If you want an easy A pick another prof, but I loved learning from Petrov

Despite the ratings here, I think Professor Petrov is one of the best psych professors in OSU. He ensures that you truly understand the material, and spares no effort in teaching you. He's extremely passionate about the subject. His syllabus was very well organized and his grading was fair. Anyone would be lucky to have him as a teacher.

I was intimated to take this class due to the low ratings on here, but I actually really, really enjoyed him as my professor. He not only was funny and kind, but could teach the material in a concise way and made everything very objective so that there was no confusion with grading.

I love Professor Petrov's class. He's always ready to help, provides great resources, and his lectures are engaging. The quizzes are frequent and the pre-class readings are many, but they prepare you well for the exams. His passion for the subject and dedication to his students is what makes this course amazing.
