Overall, he's a great professor.

Not sure if it is a cultural disconnect but Professor Petrov is very verbally disrespectful to the attendees of his lectures. Insinuating a lack of basic knowledge to a room full of people is not very conducive to a healthy learning environment. 
Read the textbook and required readings and you'll be fine.

Dr. Petrov assigned almost 50 pages a class, and we had a class quiz every class and an outside quiz after every class. Exams were not that hard if you came to class & paid attention, but it was just A LOT of reading & work. He expects you to memorize charts & schematics (of memory paths, for example) I'm not a math guy, so the cog. part was hard.

Man I didn't expect his rating to be so low here... I've had difficult profs but he is definitely not one of them. Detailed study guide, well prepared & organized lecture & materials. On the overlapped content with my PSYCH3513, Dr. Petrov's explanation is better. He is one of the few professors that can catch my attention throughout the lectures.

- The quizzes he gives to start every class can be very specific and it is hard to remember such details from the required reading
- The lectures are long and cover some irrelevant information

Other than these criticisms, Dr. Petrov is a good professor. If you follow his instructions on how to go about learning the content, you will do fine.

Very enthusiastic professor, but course was very content-heavy. In-person lectures were a waste of time; the content we were tested on was in recorded lectures (which were hours longer than the amount of in-class time every week), the textbook, and additional videos/readings. You are expected to memorize everything; I truly mean everything.

He's intelligent, funny, likeable, and most of all, a sadistic grader. Grades grad students less harshly than undergrads. Exam averages are C-; not a single grad student got an A and he still didn't curve. Gives 6-8 lectures per week including recorded ones and extreme expectations for time commitments. This is basically a 6 credit hour class.

Content is the most amazing thing, but undergrads only had 2 exams, 45 ques 90 points each. total points in class only 280. rest of the points come from lame online quizzes that don't help you but you'll get 100% on most. Doesn't finish the material in class, so makes us watch his online video lectures, read the textbook chapter, and do discussion

I dropped this class 2 weeks in. I saw these ratings but needed the class so I gave it a try and quickly regretted it. His lectures are messy and hard to understand. The content was so dry and he made 0 effort to make it bearable. After the quizzes, I dipped. Don't even bother with this guy, take a different prof.

This teacher is possibly the worst teacher that I have ever had the misfortune of having to be taught by. Petrov was never consistent with the due dates of his modules, which was contradictive of his syllabus. For example our final module was posted on Friday 12/4/2020 and due on Saturday along with the previous weeks module. Don't take his class!

Yeah, this class is not it. Try to get a different professor for 3312. Gives quizzes at the beginning and end of every lecture, and his lectures are incredibly confusing and uninteresting. The content is already a little confusing to begin with and his explanations do absolutely nothing expect make it more confusing. Would not recommend.

He is literally all over the place when he teaches. He goes back and forth on all the slides. Then there are not only 1 quiz but basically two quizzes every day in class, one is at the beginning of class and another at the end. Im sure he knows what he is talking about and seems like a nice guy but is just such a horrible educator.

I really hated his class. He quizzes on the material he is supposed to cover in class, before class. The quizzes aren't easy, so you have to understand the material before coming. They are a big part of your grade. Then he spends too much time explaining easy things and makes them over-complicated. It's more confusing to pay attention than to not.

This class was a nightmare. Make sure to read the book and review the slides before class because there are quizzes at the beginning and end of each class that ask specific and advanced questions. Study literally every assigned page of the textbook for exams because he asks about topics that were never discussed in lecture but appeared in the book.

This class is not worth the stress, I would not recommend. The professor is all over the place and makes no sense. If you zone out for five seconds you're lost for the rest of the lecture. The book is boring to read, but important because he asks questions on exams that were not covered in lecture. He also gives a quiz every single day of class.

Alex is knowledgeable and funny. I took the intro and advanced cognitive science class with him in 2012. I was a computer science major so some of the stuff many people find difficult was probably easier for me.

NOT easy, but not impossible. "Pop" quizzes nearly every lecture, but they also count for extra credit once you hit a certain amount. Tests are challenging. HAVE to go to class and keep up. I went to class, reviewed every lecture, and I did fine. Not a walk in the park but not as bad as it sounds. Drops an exam and grading is curved significantly

Dr. Petrov is very knowledgable about cognitive psychology, but tends to be all of the place when teaching. The material itself is not hard, but lectures are all over the place and difficult to follow. Tests cover specific topics that may not have been covered in lecture, only in the book.

Lecture heavy, but he is so passionate about the course that it makes it enjoyable and interesting! Has a great philosophy of how putting in the most work can guide you to an A. Would definitely recommend taking this course!

Had to retake this class because I didn't take it seriously the first time, but he really is not a bad professor. He is passionate about psychology and it shows in class. Lectures are almost entirely being lectured at, and almost every class has a pop quiz at the end. Read the book, take good notes, ask him questions if you have them! Nice guy.

Ridiculous. Avoid at all costs. If you are taking him for an elective, find someone, anyone, as a better choice. He snaps at people and he uploads 50+ slides a lecture and makes it to slide 22,then assigns 20 readings for exam on top of the slides he didn't get to. You cannot even apply what he teaches to any aspect of life. Huge language barrier.

Incredibly smart, and teaches a hellishly fast-paced course. If you don't care about the material, you will fail in a week. If you love the material, you will learn a ton and STILL almost fail, but enjoy it the entire time. Would only recommend him (and the course) to current or aspiring graduate students, though.

I was pleasantly surprised by Prof. Petrov's class compared to his ratings; although his lectures are long, you can honestly see that he enjoys teaching the material. Read the textbook and attend lectures, and you'll do just fine in the class.

Gives pop quizzes almost every lecture. His lectures are long and always go over. The material is dense and sometimes confusing, especially when he goes on a tangent about a topic. If you read the assigned readings and review before class, the pop quizzes can help your grade. I did well in his class because I reviewed the material almost everyday.

He's nice and has an interest in the subject, but every lecture is 80 minutes of constant lecturing, hardly any chance for questions, and no in-class/group review before a test. There is a pop quiz after almost every lecture that's supposed to be given during the last 5 minutes, but he talks so much it's usually the last 2 minutes. READ THE BOOK!!!

He really likes what he is talking about but he talks for way too long and can be confusing. Lectures always go over time. Pop quizzes almost every lecture. He doesn't test on specific concepts, so you have to study every single little thing. Instead of a study guide he says to read the book, lecture slides, and other required readings.

Alex is comical. The class was extremely tough,and he doesn't go over exams. (Only one question that everyone missed). The book was so helpful. Go to class because those pop quizzes really save you. I thought I was going to fail the class, but a miracle happened. (I don't even know how). Drops one exam grade. And I really enjoyed what the class.

Don't take this class if you hate reading. Students who work hard are rewarded; I did the  assigned readings after every lecture, studied material before class the next day in case of a pop quiz, and ended up doing well. Highlight things he emphasizes in class- it will be on the exam. You can earn extra credit through extra pop quizzes.
GO TO CLASS! If you are an average student you should go to class because the pop quizzes saved me this semester.

Dr. Petrove is very interested in the subject, but unfortunately he is not good at teaching. He talks the whole lecture, and he usually takes minutes after to finish; however, he does not use the lectures much in his exams. Dr. Petrov unlike all professors, he refuses to give any helpful information for exams; furthermore, he says that everything (
Pop quizzes in class but not too bad if you've gone to lecture and reviewed the material a little. Textbook heavy class but doable. Very interesting subject material though, and I learned a lot!

Do  not take him if unless you are ready to be bored, frustrated & unrewarded for hard work. This guy gave a pop quiz almost every class. There was no way to guess what was on the test & he tested on things not focused in lecture

Gets through about 20 of his 50 slides each lecture but still tests you on what he didn't cover. Extremely boring and hard to pay attention even though the material is hard. Don't take this class if you don't have to.

Boring ! Not an effective communicator. My section would struggle to stay awake. Hard to follow at times because he can't deliver his lecture effectively. He knows he is boring and doesn't care. Exams are hard because you don't really know what to expect out of the 200 pages you just read this makes him smirk. Class Average 1st Mid 71% D.

If you are interested in Cognitive Psych you will enjoy this class. There is a wealth of info in the readings and Dr. Petrov posts additional readings for those really interested in the material. He is a pleasant guy and offered help to students who needed it. The exams are difficult! He gives 30 points for simply attending classes though, so go!

Alot of work for a class..He tends to use some of the same slides for both the 612 and the 312 if that gives you a hint as to how hard it will be. I studied for a couple weeks before the tests and ended up getting C's as well. I usually get A's. I like the guy but material is not explained well and you are not sure what will be on the test.

His class was terribly unorganized. He took four weeks to grade the first assignment, which was a mere 500 word summary. His tests are unfair and require memorization of, mostly, the graphs and charts he uses in his lectures. No one finished the first exam because he had 12 essay questions and gave about 30-45 minutes to do them.

Class was not mandatory, however there was role and the extra points are deffinetly needed to help your grade. Tests were very difficult, I read every sentence in the book and still came out with two Cs on each test. The hw were time consuming and hard. If u have to take this just do everything to get every point possible I came out with a B.

absolutely HORRIBLE professor.. i felt like he felt he was better than everyone. i asked for help on the 2nd day and was basically told to do it on my own. homework was graded way too harsh by TA, and tests didn't even follow the notes. just try to get a C and move on.

Gets annoyed easily.  5 homework assignments with medium difficulty. 2 exams with unexpected information covered on them. neither professor nor TA very helpful. subject matter is very dry and difficult to understand at time. also, petrov has a pretty thick accent

A very likable guy, but I agree, don't take this unless you are a computer sci grad student. Even though the grading was easy, it was miserable to sit through the incomprehensible, mandatory lectures. Intense essay exams. Seriously, unless this is your area of interest and you know computers, stay away!

Petrov is a SMART man, but sometimes he jumps around too much... Hard to understand if you don't already have a good general understanding of the material. DO NOT take this class if you know nothing about computer science. On the plus side he's a VERY lenient grader!

I took this last quarter with another professor (shulman) and had to drop it because i could not understand anything he was talking about.  Petrov is WORLDS better.  He's interesting and funny, he's an expert in the field, and he really wants you to learn.  Go to class!  Lenient grading scale too, 86% was an A this quarter.  GREAT PROF.

The most interesting class I've taken here at OSU. Dr. Krajbich consistently makes the content interesting and engaging. The course is stimulating and made me want to pursue this field in the future. Couldn't recommend this class more.
Great professor. Class was straight forward and homework graded based on effort. Exam short answers are based on homework problems.
Great class. Great prof

There is a midterm and final exam each worth about 30-35% of your grade and then there are optional pop quizzes that you can opt-out of at the beginning of the semester (about 5%). the last 30% is based on problem sets that are based solely on completion. All in all the content in this class is very straightforward and this is a pretty easy A.

Really interesting lectures, in a really interesting subject area. This class was mainly an overview of current research in the field. Dr. Krajbich does a great job of creating excitement for his subject within others, and he is sometimes pretty funny.

She is awesome! She really cares to see if you know the material and understand what's going on. She acknowledges that she's a fast talker so if you need her to slow down she will. Grade is based on 3 exams and tophat homework. You don't need to take one of the 3 exams if you feel good about how you scored on the other 2.

An amazing prof!! Really cares that her students actually understand the material and you can tell how passionate she is about what she is teaching. Most of your grade is determined by how you do on exams but when a lot of people did bad on the first one, she gave a great extra credit opportunity. If you miss class, it is super easy to catch up.

Super nice lady who is passionate about teaching but I took this class for a GE and it turned out to be my hardest class. Lots of extra credit and points from TopHat but exams were confusing and most people did bad on them. Exams are in person while the other psych class exams were online. It was not the worst but not enjoyable.

He is super chill and easygoing. There was 1 paper and it only had to be 1-2 pages long so nothing terrible. 3 exams, all online and aren't too difficult but challenging enough to make you think and apply what you learned in class. Attendance isn't really mandatory but you do get attendance/participation points for in-class Tophats so I would go.
Brooklynn is a very thorough teacher who is engaging during lectures. Always felt prepared for quizzes and exams.

She was so kind and understanding and I felt like she genuinely wanted us to learn in the best way possible. Tests were all open note and online, but still study a bit. There were several extra credit options. Don't procrastinate REP. As long as you keep up with the work, study a decent amount, and show up for some classes you'll get an A.

She is an easy grader and was always willing to help with questions/problems. The only thing is her lectures aren't the most engaging. While attendance isn't for a grade, she doesn't post the notes' answers but if you miss one or two you can talk to her about it and get them in office hours.

Personally, I think REP and the class were fun. You'll pass the course if you do all the assignments and extra credits. There are 3 midterms and all of them are open notes. I got b, c, and a on the three midterms, and still passed the class with an A.

Lectures use guided notes and TopHat for attendance. As long as you complete the assignments, it wasn't difficult to get a good grade. Online exams and 2 short papers, plus a few discussion posts and other small assignments. Lots of opportunities for bonus points. Dr. Yu is very nice and understanding, and if you need any help just send an email.

Psych 1100 was honestly a breeze. Attendance was not mandatory whatsoever, and there were 3 big tests throughout the whole semester. Besides that, there were occasional discussion posts, papers, and the REP that was time consuming at times. Honestly, do the work and the extra credit and youll be fine.

Lisa was an amazing professor and cared about her students. A lot of her assignments were completion, and she did her best to not overcomplicate the class. All of the tests and quizzes were open notes which just made the class easier, but review a bit before the tests as the free response questions require you to understand the topic.
Great teacher, average class, easy enough to understand, still have to work for the grade.

Dr. Spencer is a kind spirit and very accessible and understanding. The only downside to this class is that he can be a very slow grader, and when it comes to grading, it often seems like he doesn't actually read the responses but rather give you a random grade. There is no rubric or comments so if you do poorly you won't know why.

Dr. Spencer was a great professor. His lecture presentations were bland but if you took note on the words he was saying and read the textbooks the exams were not bad. Also is an understanding grader. Would take an exam from him again

Good professor but takes forever to grade. Let's you submit things a week early to get feedback. Lectures are good, but slides are confusing if you don't go to class. Good professor if you go to class and don't procrastinate its a great class!

Quite literally one of the worst professors I have ever had. This class was 1.5 hours long when it should've only been 55 minutes. He rambles on about studies without actually providing us with any useful information. He has a kind spirit, but there is no way this man is fit for teaching. He is impressed with his own research more than class.

The course is graded by four exams and a final research application paper. There is an optional cumulative final that can replace one of the four test grades. The info on the tests are half lecture, half textbook. The lecture slides have very little information on them so your notes are really important and you have to know the studies discussed.

Dr. Spencer was great. Unfortunately with 2020 he had some family complications come up and had to go off schedule but he was always great at communicating that and was very lenient with grading. Class is very lecture heavy and youre graded by a few things. Overall it was a great class and Id be happy to take a course with him again.

Sooo many people complain about him but he's honestly such a nice guy and he really does care about your grades. His tests are hard I wont lie but I studied for 2 hours before the test and I never got below a B. I believe he does a fine job fo explaining concepts but you actually have to go to class because his presentations are somewhat bare.

He does not seem to prepare for lectures and also has taken the whole semester to grade the only three exams taken. Does not respond to emails and if he does it is after many many tries. Lecture slides provide no information and is very scattered and all over the place when explaining concept.
He does not care at all about us. If you see that the class is not doing so good, why can't he find a way to help us? He contradicts himself while explaining the lectures, so it is very confusing.

This class is not impossible, and it is very interesting and intellectually stimulating. There is no homework, but there are 4 tests that require a lot of studying. It is difficult to take notes, but I recommend recording the lectures and taking notes at your own pace. I left this class with more knowledge and an actual understanding of the concept

I like this professor, attendance isn't mandatory but it is mandatory if you want to do well on exams as your notes are all you have to study. His exams can be tricky and he is a tough grader especially when it comes to the essay portions of his exams, make sure you know this studies he describes and how they connect with the topic of discussion.

He has passages that should be read prior to each class and I did not read one of them. He goes over them in depth in class and that was enough for me to do very well on the written portion of the exam. The class is hard but there was a google doc full of notes that was helpful for studying. It's an interesting class and his Qs are conceptual.

Never been more lost in a class. The studies he teaches are unprofessionally done and don't make sense, so they are very hard to study for. He gives 4 exams and an optional cumulative final to replace your lowest exam but he will not have all of your grades in in time to see if you need to take the final so you pretty much have to take it anyway

This is a 3000 level undergrad course that is formatted like an advanced graduate level class. We can rely only on empirical articles to piece together class concepts. There is no textbook. The slides are minimally helpful, and the professor is hard to reach. If you want a challenge, great. But know what you're signing up for. I sure didn't.

This professor is horrible. He takes forever to grade exams (like a month). He doesn't email you back and he teaches the class on stupid research that is very difficult to understand. The class is nice but with him teaching it makes a whole lot worse. I think he is a grad professor as well; this is a mid-level undergrad course
Impossible exams and very unclear notes. takes him over 3 weeks to grade exams and very hard to reach through email. If you take this course- take with a different professor

Took Stereotype and Prejudice. There are some basic online notes, so you have to show up to class and pay attention. 4 hard tests and optional cumulative final to replace your lowest exam. This class shouldve been easier but the amount of info was too much and he describes all these studies in a difficult way. Nice guy but hard class.

Make you read and memorize many junk research articles for exam. Those articles are not very informative and some of these research play around with number and graph makes the result seems significant. Just Awful!

She was such a nice professor who really cared about her students! This class is easy, as long as you show up and take decent notes you should get an A. She really prepared everyone well for the exams and you could tell she really wanted everyone to succeed!

I loved this class and I liked her as a professor. She was very caring and she explained things very well and put them into real life scenarios for us to understand more. I would highly recommend taking her for psychology.

The lectures were not the best, was hard to stay engaged, but is very caring and wants you to do well. Will respond to emails and is flexible and understanding. Easy class as long as you take notes. Tests were online, at home, and open note, no final.
Overall a good class! A super easygoing professor who knows what she is talking about and seems to enjoy it. show up to class and pay attention and you'll do well- it's laid out nicely.

This class was wild. There is no structure, lectures are all over the place and it is so disorganized. Definitely an easy A if you just go to class. You have a confusing quiz once a week, 3 homework assignments, and a presentation, but if you go to class he basically gives all the answers. He is pretty funny but I retained nothing from this class.

Professor Rizzi is very passionate about what he teaches, he makes the class enjoyable and keeps us engaged in the lectures. If you are very interested in psychology I recommend taking him. He gives a lot of quizzes and tests but it helps you actually learn the material. I would definitely take him again!

Professor Rizzi is patient, caring, and passionate about what he teaches. He breaks down the material. If you suck at math then this is the professor who is more than glad to help you. Lots of work but that's any PSY3211 class.

THIS GUY IS GREAT. No seriously, he is a really cool guy especially if you're passionate about behavior analytics. He cares for his students and will try his best to help you understand the material and pass.

Lectures were either interesting or so boring the class would fall asleep. He would go off on tangents in class and we would end up having to learn the material ourselves. There were quizzes assigned online for each chapter before we even went over it in class, but he does take into account our busy schedules and change the game plan accordingly.

Rizzi is very energetic and engaging but i just can't seem to stay awake in this class. The material is pretty boring but he tries to make it funny and relevant. The material itself is pretty self-explanatory and stuff ive heard in literally every psych class ive taken here. Just read the book, take the quizzes seriously and actually go to class.

Dr. Rizzi's lectures are very entertaining. He makes dry content interesting and provides lots of examples in class to clarify concepts. Attendance is part of the grade, and there is a weekly reading assignment that is timed and graded, but pretty easy. He has plenty of extra credit, and for being a mandatory class, it is great. No complaints.

He's not a bad guy but assigns way too much work. Online quiz assignments, with a 25 min time limit with a range of questions from 13-21. Not enough time to actually read the question and make sure you get the right answer. Grades way too difficult on homework assignments.  He's one of those angry grad students that think his class so important

Sometimes the material can be a little confusing, but Professor Rizzi does a pretty good job of working through it. There's only 3 homework assignments, but a quiz every week (timed, about half an hour each). He has bonus points on his quizzes and his exams, as well as a couple other opportunities for extra credit. Definitely would take again!

One of the best professors I've ever had. You can tell he really cares about his work and what he is teaching. He is cool and really understanding, and he is very open to answering questions and repeating himself.

TAKE HIS CLASS!! He is so funny and relatable because he is young. He is super understanding and clear when lecturing and does so much to help us out. No homework or assignments aren't extra credit and the tests are easy if you take notes and pay attention. Going to class not necessary if you take good notes and use common sense.

I have almost finished this semester but I would recommend taking this class with this professor to anyone! The expectations are explained from the start and he is very understanding. The lectures are engaging but he does not expect you to make it to all of them. Recently graduated so he understands what it is like to have a large courseload.

one of the easiest classes ive ever  taken . Professor ryan was super understanding and sweet gave extensions on assignments. Easy class does require a textbook as long as you read the textbooks youll do fine in the class

Ryan was a good professor and a nice person.  He was very considerate about work and flexible with deadlines.  He would go off topic somewhat frequently in his lectures. This class was very easy if you went to class and took decent notes.  For the "exams," I recommend just skimming the textbook and looking at the notes you have taken.
Interesting and easy class. Professor is a great guy!
Easiest college class I've ever taken. Highly recommend. I will admit that it may be due to my strong neuroscience background and the fact that I've been in therapy for years.

Very easy going and very understanding. Lectures were goodish although the exams leaned towards the harder side and being open note didnt make much of a difference. very nice about extensions and looking back at low grades and changing them.  no attendance grade and uploads video lectures online. very very nice guy

Dr Hansen is so sweet. love him. I did not go to his lectures a lot and ended with over a 100 in the class. Some assignments took a little too long, but the assignments were interesting. As long as you do the work you will do great and learn a lot

Bro easiest A I have ever got. Literally so many options to get extra credit. My grade is over a 100%. I ended up not doing his last 2 assignments cause I would still be at an A. I took this in the summer, in the 2nd session. The class goes by fast but if you stay on top of things you should be good. If you email him, he will give you extra time

Professor Hansen was really interesting, but there was a ton of reading in the course, like a ton. He had us submit our notes for that reading, so there is no getting out of it. It is a good class though. I wish there had been areas touched on more in depth, but its an intro psych course so I can't expect that much. He allowed it to feel personal.

Dr. Hansen is extremely caring and understands that we are humans, not everything goes our way. At the end of the semester, he gave everyone two weeks to turn in anything they may have missed. Also, there are 14 "exams" which consist of roughly 20 questions. If you do the assigned readings, these will be easy A exams. Great class overall!!

Dr. Hansen is the most caring professor I have had while in college. At the end of the semester, he gave two weeks to turn in anything that you may have missed. I do have to say, there was a ton of reading, but was worth it when the "exams" were easy. The exams are after each chapter, no more than twenty questions.

Dr. Hansen is willing to help students. There are a lot of readings which take a huge amount of time but that is definitely necessary to learn psychology. A quiz every single class but it ensures that you would read. Exams are not hard, and there are extra credits.

There are daily top-hat quizzes for attendance but he is very understanding and will let you take them if you miss class. Read the assigned reading before class and you will ace the tophats. He is so kind and understanding and genuinely cares about you and has a passion for teaching. tests are open book and online and are easy if you read.

This was his first semester teaching this class so it was kinda disorganized, but still very easy A. He had all the exams take home, open note, online so that was nice. Honestly learned more from the book than class, but he does easy reading quizzes every class so you have to show up.

AU14: Lectures can be helpful but if you read the textbook it is basically the same thing. I read the text for every chapter which was time consuming but made everything easier. Lectures not mandatory, hes a nice guy, grades things easily, tests are department tests, no quizzes or homework. Tests are hard so you better make time to read.

Very enthusiastic about psychology and really engages the audience. I took his online class and he posted videos of all his lectures and the powerpoints he used. He could not have been more clear of what was expected from the students.

Ryan is amazing! He knows what he is talking about, is absolutely willing to give extra help, and makes sure everything that he says is clear as day. I would definitely take him again if he offered another psych class. Love him!

Loved this course and this instructor! Material was easy and instructor is extremely helpful when you have any questions. Midterms are straightforward- as long as you read the text and study the material, you'll be fine! :)

Dr. Hansen is a nice guy. Really dedicated to his students and their learning. Lays class out clearly, easy to contact. Tests are very straightforward. Study your online lecture notes and you can do well. There are flashcards on studyblue which are pretty helpful if you don't have time to make them. Study hard, stay on top of things and it's easy.

Very friendly and easy to contact. His job and his students are his #1 priority. He made video lectures for his online students and gave us tons of helpful resources to study. Without discipline to study, the class can be hard because there is a lot of information. Be warned that you need extra time out of class to do the REP credits.
He was the nicest prof I have had. He genuinely cared about the subject and the class. He gave many extra credit opportunities and always pushed back due dates!

This professor is awesome!!! Dr. Ryan Hansen taught at Ohio State University and at Dominion University. One of the best lecturers I've ever heard and he is very enthusiastic. He gave clarity and refreshing life to an ordinarily dull subject. He was VERY helpful and one of the best teachers I have ever sat under. Awesome with an A+

This guy's awesome. One of the best lecturers I've had here and he's very enthusiastic. If you didn't understand anything he would help. He made psych pretty interesting actually. Study the bolded words and you HAVE to ace this class. (He also made a flashcard app you can use that is helpful).
Very helpful! Best instructor of Psych 100! If you want to get A, choose him!

This class was SO easy I could have aced it without going to lecture or actually reading the book (just study the bolded words). However, Ryan Hansen is one of the most enthusiastic and fun lecturers I've had. He should be teaching something MUCH higher level than Psych 100.
Clearly cares about the material and tries to make lectures funny. He is an all around good guy and a pretty good teacher.
Great professor- he wants to help the students.  He does a wonderful job and is very thorough in his teaching and explanation.
Very committed lecturer. He really wants to help his students. Will go the extra mile.

Dr. Cook is one of the only professors I've had that I actually could have seen myself talking to outside of class. Her lectures are pretty interesting, but she'll admit herself that she's not super interested in topics outside of social psych. Very tough grader for an intro to psych/GE course. Difficult exams, but a fun and engaging professor.
Extremely unhelpful and condescending. When you have questions, she tells you to figure it out yourself. Super nit picky grader and is not always clear in her grading. I do not recommend.
For an intros honors class the amount of work and time required for this class is ridiculous. I suggest taking this class taught by a different professor as it is much easier.

She's passionate about creativity. Have 2 books to read. We have a one page paper due every week connecting stuff learned, super easy 5 points each week. Extra credit available at the end of the semester. Always tends to bring into conversation about the people that "work for her"-at her day job which is kind of annoying, saying she is the boss.

She is a great lecturer and really nice. She is horrible at explaining what she wants for her papers and most people in my class felt like they deserved better grades than they received. She is very understanding that outside circumstances can affect class attendance, and I would definitely take her class again.

Dr. Cook is a decent professor. Her class was very easy because I came to class, skimmed the readings, and did the homework and extra credit. The exams are the basic "take-aways" of lectures. She is a talker and lecture can be kind of boring. She believes in group work to the max, so maybe not the class for an introvert - but I made it through.

She is the best professor that I have had at OSU. She makes class very interesting and truly cares about her students. She will help you work and get whatever grade you need. I read the book for more information but if you go to every class you won't need to. She is a really cool and helpful person and I would recommend this class to anyone.

I had her last semester for social psychology and I could really tell that she knew what she was doing and loved it! Attendance isn't mandatory but strongly suggested, some class discussions. Her lectures are really interesting and getting an A in the class isn't hard but you learn a lot!

Just a really cool all around person. She works for a non-profit and only teaches part-time, and her passion for teaching really shows. She is always willing to help out one of her students. Interesting in class examples, too. I would definitely recommend her class.

Honestly and amazing professor and person. Very helpful in class and always willing to take time and explain things to students who don't understand it. Works a day job and still went out to lunch with me to discuss potential careers in psychology just because I had asked. Reading the textbook does help prepare for the lectures.

If you've ever wondered about psychology, take this course. Lynette is one of the best professors at this school and makes the material absolutely fascinating for psych majors and non psych majors alike. Her tests are totally fair and if you pay attention in class you could get away with skimming the book.

I thought Lynnette was a really great teacher. While she was quite a difficult grader, she was extremely helpful and you could tell that she genuinely cares about her students. I would definitely recommend her, but don't expect and "easy A."

Best teacher I've had in college. She's very personable and wants nothing but the best for her students. She is a bit of a hard grader on the papers, but eases up after the first two. Dont really need the book if you go to EVERY lecture.
She is awesome! Super nice, really helpful, and knows what she is talking about.

Lynnette was one of the best teachers I have had! She was very enticing and really cared about the material. She cared about her students as long as you cared to voice concerns. I really enjoyed attending her lectures and the material. The one negative about the class was that it was hard to get an A but easy to pass but it was of no fault to her.

She is a very good teacher but this is a difficult class. She tells you attendance isn't mandatory but you should attend. Exams aren't just regurgitating info, you have to apply the concepts. Keep up on assigned reading and attend class and you will do fine.
Nice teacher but impossible grader!
Really helpful and nice. Class was best ive had so far.

Lynette is a good professor overall when it comes to teaching. She has great examples to help further explain the concepts. However beware, she is an extremely hard grader! Midterms are straight essay pretty much 5 out of 7 questions. Final is the same way only longer. Class graded on a curve, but still she is hard.
Lynette is really funny. She makes the class really enjoyable, but you still learn a lot.She is also really cool about letting you leave class early.
Lynnette was amazing.  She is very intersted in what she is teaching and it comes across to her students.  She is very helpful and responsive to emails.  Wish I could take another class of hers...

Great experience! Lynette was sooooo funny and down to earth! Really has a desire for people to do well in the class! She knows what she is talking about and is also passionate about it! I could not imagine a better experience! GET HER AS A TEACHER!!!
Awesome Prof! Funny, good examples and useful lectures. I am trying to schedule another class she teaches as a matter of fact. I would rec. this prof to anybody!

Enjoyed her class, lectures where very interesting, make sure to always print off the guided notes. Midterms where not to bad, but there where many questions on the final that I felt we never covered in class(never missed lecture), so reading the book might help. Class discussions were always worth while and interesting so attend class.
A very entertaining and interesting prof .. Class discussions were always pretty funny. The only downside: No curve.
she was an awesome teacher, very smart, very helpful, the tests were not that hard and and everything was always explained well.  i would deffinately recommend her class.
She suucked..
Such a good teacher. Her class is interesting. She is the most helpful teacher ever. I even had to call her at home once, and she was so understanding and helpful.
She a very nice lady. She's a good teacher.

Dr. Osher was an amazing professor. Very flexible due to COVID and easy to contact outside of class. Cared about his students and the material he was teaching. Offered a lot of extra credit and took extra time when needed to review confusing topics. Made a relatively boring class much more interesting, the best psych professor I've had so far!

LOTS of terms. Heavily learning about anatomy of different senses and how they work, which gets confusing. Class is huge and so not a huge opportunity to learn. Online lectures and the groupme were my best friend. David is super nice and understanding. He really does care about his students but class is boring and difficult if you don't like it.

He is amazing! The class itself wasn't the most fun, but he tried his best to get people engaged and make it enjoyable. The exams were pretty easy and one of them gets dropped. As long as you do the work you should get an A
I really enjoyed this class and learned some really cool stuff! he is a kind and helpful professor so definitely reach out to him if you need any help or questions.

Dr. Osher was awesome. Although I was not interested in the course content and only had to take it for my major, he made it not horrible throughout the semester. He was always willing to go out of his way to help, and also mentioned he will likely make his in person exams open notes. You can tell his enthusiasm on teaching the subject
You need to watch the lecture videos for points, but the exams are completely open: youre even allowed to use Google. As long as you put in minimal effort, its easy to get an A.

Love this dude. He's super chill and helpful, and he very clearly loves the work he does. His lectures were a little difficult to get through online even with 2x speed, but overall, his class was almost always the highlight of my week. As long as you keep up with the work (there's not a lot) and study before tests you should do very well with him!

I'm really glad I took his class. For some psych majors it might seem a little difficult since there is a good amount of bio/neuroscience, but I enjoyed it a lot. He covers all kinds of interesting and unexpected things about perception and I learned a lot. He's really enthusiastic and eager to help outside of class. The final was pretty hard

The material could be considered difficult to grasp but his lectures, study guides and overall enthusiasm for the material made it incredibly easy to understand/learn. Not a crazy amount of work outside of class, over all really enjoyed his teaching style/enthusiasm for the subject! 10/10 would recommend sense and perception with him!

Sarah is very sweet and her class was not difficult at all. I made two of my best friends in her class. She gives extra credit and brings in candy. There were 3 exams (60 mcq I think), and they were not very hard. there was some homework, but they do not take long at all. highly recommend her for an easy A!

Instructor Prieto is very sweet, personable, and lenient. She's very passionate about what she is teaching and willing to admit and research further if you ask something she doesn't know the answer to. She makes sure to host review classes before exams to make sure we're ready, and the exams were online.

Dr. Kirby is a GREAT professor. She structures her class in a great way for a busy college student: four exams are your only grades, so you don't have outside mandatory homework or quizzes to do. It is really up to you to learn the material-and she wants to help you. Midterms aren't mandatory and can only help your grade. TAKE this class with her!

I loved this class. I did it online, she talked so fast I needed to watch recordings, but regardless of long lectures, they were interesting! Great job of preparing you for exams, which is the only thing the class is graded on. She only counts your final exam grade, but if any of your 3 midterm grades would improve that score, she also counts them.

I always enjoyed being in his class. He truly cares about helping you succeed. Not only is he a good teacher and explains the material well, but his awesome personality makes the lectures even more enjoyable. Just study well for the tests and do all of your assignments and you will be fine! Definitely recommend!

I thoroughly enjoyed this class and I think a lot of it has to do with the professors teaching style. The only thing I would say is to make sure you study for the tests. Overall it is a pretty easy course as long as you do the work.
The GOAT, one of the only professors that actually cares about you.

Mr. Coutts is one of my professor who made me feel welcome at college during such an unusual time. He is understanding, in a way that he doesnt just care if you have an A rather that you are learning and are happy and healthy! I 100% recommend

Mr. Coutts is the type of teacher you hope is proud of you. I missed my essay and he informed me that it wasn't turned in and gave me time to do it, which I appreciated more than I can say. He made the zoom calls genuinely enjoyable and comfortable.

I really liked him and this class! Content was interesting and relevant. A decent amount of test prep is required due to the number of studies presented, but go through those and youre golden. Lots of grades with exams, online quizzes, top hat, paper, and extra credit. He listens to student feedback and tries to make lecture interesting.

I absolutely love Baldwin Way. I took his course in the midst of COVID and he was really understanding with everything going on. If you have the option, 10/10 recommend him. Make sure you read and study, and you'll pass.

Prof Way is always willing to answer questions, and it's clear to see that he has a big heart & really cares about his students. The class format is lecture heavy, but it's an upper level course so it's expected to be hard. But of all the upper level courses I have taken, this has been the easiest! 10/10 would recommend!

Lectures are super heavy like 50-90 slides but he never finishes most of them. Quizzes and readings are easy but the exams are very difficult. My exam grades did not reflect the rest of my grades. He seems really caring but he makes way too many mistakes on his own exams. I would not recommend. This class was the definition of stress.

lecture heavy. take good notes. exams are tough but it is a 4000 level course- it is expected. He's nice, and very caring. Even though his lectures are heavy he doesn't make it boring- seems to really care for his students

Professor Way always tried to keep class interesting. His exams were a little tough and he lectures a lot but always tries to keep things upbeat. You can tell he cares about students doing well and is always open to answering questions. He also is open to giving him feedback on the class which is rare but good! I would take his class again!

Super easy and she had guided notes so you really didn't have to go to lectures. The 3 midterms were open note and relatively easy I got above an 88 on all three. One quiz a week on the lecture which is open note and has no time limit (a lot of the answers are from quizlets). Easiest A of my semester honestly. Do REP extra credit raises grade a lot

This was her first semester teaching and she was pretty good for social psychology. She makes herself available and her tests aren't too hard. The only bad thing about the class is that most of your grade is based on 2 midterms and the final but if you study for those you should fine.

Writing class- so obviously a decent amount of writing. There are three major projects, and Kenneth gives great feedback and sets you up to succeed. He is a great professor!! Participation is graded, but you can do weekly assignments to get those points back if you miss class. No exams! This is an amazing class and an amazing professor!
super nice and the class is really easy. as long as you watch the lectures, youll be okay.

Very easy class. Just read the textbook and do it frequently to make it easier on yourself. There is a lot of extra credit. You do not have to attend since the exams ar based on the book.Make sure you study for the quizzes even though you can you the book.
great rapport with class

Classes were okay. Gotta read ahead the textbook anyway. She did give some helpful handouts but sometimes diff from the slides. Quizzes were fair, was difficult the first time but a lot better later. Explained clearly enough at least for a foreign instructor. BTW she's cute. lol

The best professor At UC!!!! Really stands on student's perspectives to teach and grade. Easy A, no textbooks, no weekly assignments, only 4 exams and can drop the lowest one. He is a cool and nice guy. Strongly recommended

He was a great instructor! Very easy grader and understanding when you approach him on a mistake that you think needs fixed. Review sessions before tests are really helpful! Attendance is recommended; he gives random pop quizzes. Great class and very interesting!

He was a cool laid back dude. Took intro to social psychology with him. Makes his own notes & prints them off for everyone in class. 3 Exams and final along with in class points so don't skip too much. Tests are relatively easy as long as you read from his notes and actually try a little. Overall good teacher. I'd recommend him!

Mr. Joseph, Is probably the best professor OSU has. He shows that he cares for his students by knowing everyone's name, and talking to everyone and helping you think about the material in deeper ways. He made me enjoy learning ( I thought was impossible). I havent taken his class in a long time but realized how much his class change my life.

Nick is a great teacher and genuinely cares about his students. He works hard to make sure you have all of the material you will need for exams, and will even give guided notes if you ask for them. He is still learning himself, and if you have a question he can't answer he will often try and find an answer for you, which is really nice and helpful.

He passions for teaching students and always willing to help students get good grades. Assignments are kind of irritating but still good for getting extra credit. Exams are fair if you follow the lectures and, keep an eye on what he starred or mentioned in review sessions. Some questions  appeared on the exam exactly the same.
He is always involved in your learning. He tries hard to know all the names of students who answer questions in class. Very funny and speaks clearly and loud so it's easy to hear.

Nick is an amazing instructor and is very passionate about the course material. His teaching style is great as he always encourages participation and includes great real-life examples in his slides. He is very caring towards his students and makes sure they are prepared for exams.

Nick is an awesome professor! He really cares about his students and it shows. He is willing to put in the time and effort to help you if you go to him. His lectures are really helpful and he does a good job of putting extra emphasis on things that are going to be on the exams. Overall great professor and great classwould recommend.

He's excited about what he teaches and the lectures are never boring. His Psych 1100 section consistently preforms the best on exams and he is always willing to help when you are struggling. He cares about his students both in and outside of class. A really great professor for this class, you'll have fun in his class.
Hes engaging, unlike other professors. He doesnt just read off slides, he provides videos, group work, top hat, and resources. He shows that he really cares about teaching.
He provides great examples, in different ways, and slows it down for some students that he notices is taking a while for notes. I learn so much and he makes teaching look effortless.
The lectures also really interesting, mostly because it is a very interactive class and often includes visuals and analogies.
He is very charismatic, caring, and is patient. He explains the material very well and in a multitude of ways that foster learning and participation.

I don't really know what the previous reviewers on here are talking about... this class was super easy and the test questions came straight from his slides. I will say he rambles in his lectures though. Overall I found the info to be interesting, and the class was pretty average as far as professors go.
DO NOT TAKW HIS CLASS!!! Awful professor!

Dr. Bennett was the worst professor I ever had. He was inconsiderate and lacked empathy towards his students during a pandemic. His exams were non specific and at times no correct answers were listed based off of his lectures and the text book. I would not recommend him to anyone. If you have him as a professor change while you can or good luck.

I had Dr. Bennet during the pandemic and while he seemed nice in lectures, he did not respond to any emails and was extremely hard to get into contact with and did not answer questions or try to help students succeed. There were a few times were there was NO CORRECT answers on exams according to textbook and lecture notes- when asked- no response
DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS. He didn't care about his students and the class is super dry

Dr. Bennett lacked empathy and understanding towards students going through a pandemic. Several students gave SLDS notes which he did not follow or ignored. His lectures are very boring and rambles on a LOT. We had 3 exams including the final and 4 discussion posts for the entire class. The exams were very generalized and hard to answer.

Dr. Bennett's Honors Intro to Psych class was very easy. He said to read the book, but it was never really necessary - just skimming it as you watch the lectures is good enough. Quizzes and projects are not difficult, and extra credit boosts the grade a lot. He was not the best lecturer, but it was an easy A for GE and Honors credit.

This class is okay. Even after reading the book and watching his recorded lectures, the test questions are nonspecific. The book is far more incorporated into the exams than the lectures are by ANY means. He rambles quite a bit in his lectures, and doesn't make a ton of sense. It's hard to take notes on the lectures. Good luck, you'll need it.

I took counseling psych with him during this pandemic. He says the exams are heavy on the book, but i did not even read the book. I just looked at the lecture notes & listened to the lectures. This got me 88-90% on the exams. He is very monotone w/ lots of ums/uhhs. I had to play lectures at 2x speed. He lacks empathy! Wont let make ups at all

Dr. Bennett gives really great and personable lectures. He gave a lot of useful information about furthering a career in counseling in addition to class material. There were 3 tests & 1 paper with no HW and no attendance requirement, but I can't imagine doing well on tests without going to class--he asks multiple questions specific to lecture.

Avoid this professor like the plague. This is my first time rating a professor and its because I do not want other students to have to suffer through this mans horribly boring, monotone lectures. His syllabus and organization of class is all over the place. I passed with a B but that is solely because the exams were open note.

He was nice, but this class was so annoying and terrible. He stood and spoke for 80 minutes and was occasionally asked questions. Exams and pop quizzes were open note, but had stuff we had never seen before. Writing a paper every day and summarizing each class was redundant and not helpful. Lots of extra credit, but this class was so tedious

He's a nice guy, so I feel bad rating him poorly, but he does not know how to structure a class. His lectures just read off the slides, his tests are unreasonably difficult and he doesn't give enough time given the number of questions, his assignments are unclear, and he doesn't explain them. And we had to read and write a paper for every class.

Sloutsky uses a grading set up that baffles me as to why he thought it was reasonable. two exams total, but the mid-semester exam is worth 90 points (80 minutes to take) and the final is 120 point cumulative (105 minutes to take). When I emailed him he responded with little thought or effort much like his in person lectures. Please spare yourself.

I feel so bad giving Vlad a bad grade. However, Vlad simply talks for an hour and twenty minutes straight right off the slides, and he doesn't know how to structure the class. His pop quizzes and exams, while open note, have things on them I've never heard of before. In class, everyone looks at one another in confusion. Avoid him if you can.

The lecture is kinda boring but Dr. Sloutsky does work hard to teach it. He covers tons of experiments and great ideas. This class also push me to read journals that I might have never read and I learn a lot from those. Tests are OPEN BOOK + 55 extra credits, so you can't complain for anything! Also, he is really patient and always ready to help.

Sloutsky can't teach and his lectures are incredibly boring. At the end of every class you have to turn in a paragraph summary for attendance so you have to go. He does offer a ton of extra credit though and the tests are open book, open note, open computer! He also can be kinda rude. He will put you down if your opinion is not the same as his.

This guy reeks of insecurity. At every chance he gets he tries to uphold the validity of psychology and puts down anyone who challenges anything in his class. He is really, really condescending if your answer to a question in class isn't what he's looking for (even if it's right). That being said, this class is a SUPER easy A, but lots of busywork.

Sometimes the class could be a little dull, but overall it was pretty easy. You have to summarize a lot of academic  journals, but you can do an extra six and get sixty extra credit points! which is aaaaawesome. There were two separate final projects and a final exam, but both exams are multiple choice and the projects aren't difficult

Dr. Walton is amazing. She is dedicated and very knowledgable about the class subject. She was also really understanding when this class was taught during the pandemic. She grades pretty easily too as long as you do the work. The class is super interesting.

Wish more of my online classes were like hers. Simple, straightforward format with lectures that were just the right length, and plenty of opportunities to practice for exams and ask questions. Also loved the fact that she talked about students' research interests during office hours! She' great at communicating and responds to emails quickly, too.
She's amazing! Make sure you take one of her classes before you graduate!!!
She is so sweet and caring! Her material is super straightforward so exams are too.

Dr. Sullivan is a great professor. She is super knowledgeable and her exams are very straightforward. If you attend lecture and take good notes, you should be fine! Make sure to read/watch the supplemental materials also!

she's so nice and funny and keeps lectures really entertaining and clearly knows what she is talking about. she has made me consider getting a career in something with the psychology of children and or family psychology she is super sweet and understanding as well. if you watch the lectures and do the reading the exams aren't bad at all.

Dr. Sullivan is a gem. She clearly is passionate about the subject matter, and her heart for the students and content is evident. She is passionate and intelligent, and I learned so much without really trying.

Dr. Sullivan gives INCREDIBLE lectures. Her lecture slides are pretty simple, so going to class and listening to what she elaborates on is really important. Her tests are easy and straightforward. She's also an angel and wears the best outfits.

I love Professor Samimy. She is so nice and gives great feedback. Her grading criteria was clear and she gave great feedback. I wish I hadn't bought the book because I never used it. All the information was provided in the slides and lectures. Definitely would take her again for other classes!

Professor Samimy was always ready to help, despite the class being delivered asynchronously, she responded to emails and was willing to chat. The abnormal psychology topic is very interesting, integrated into the scientific writing aspect of this course. Exams are easy, make sure to put in work into papers and take note of feedback!

This class shouldve been an easy A, but I will say a few things that I messed up on. Do all of the weekly discussion posts because 3 of them are for extra credit which makes a huge difference. Also, she is a tough grader on papers and there are 4 of them so make sure you proof read and get them checked. The lectures and quizzes are easy content.
No drawbacks. Just take her section, learn fun&easy, and then get A.

She is a perfect graduate teaching assistant. She is good at helping students understand course materials and willing to help you at office hours. Take hers will be a good choice. The whole course composes by 5 papers, 1 mt and 1 final and participation.

Mark is a very good professor and really cares about what he does. He is not the best with technology, so taking his class online was not my favorite, but if you can take his class in person I would definitely do that! He loves talking to the students which is fun. A lot of group work, a quiz biweekly, 2 papers.. overall easy A

This class was online and he was very relaxed about it, we even met his cats. Sometimes he forgot to post his lectures for the quizzes, but if you sent him a reminder he would have them up by the end of the day. All the material covered on the quizzes is on the PowerPoint. There are weekly group homeworks that take about 30 minutes to complete.

Dr. Polifroni is awesome. No textbook for the class, so almost all of your learning is done through his lectures, which was nice. Group HW assignments almost every week, but they were pretty easy, and so were the quizzes and DB posts, and there weren't that many of them. Two papers that were also simple and straightforward. Strongly recommend him!

This dude is awesome. This is my second class with him and he did not disappoint. This isnt an easy course (none of his courses are), but if you put in a little effort, its not a problem. He wants everyone to form their own opinions and ideas about the course material!

Dr. Mike is such a great and inspirational lecturer to have. Hes super helpful and understanding, and challenges you to think for yourself. The class was heavy in terms of coursework (it was over six weeks) but very manageable. If you do the readings and attend the lectures then youll learn a great deal from this class and earn an easy A.

Dr. Polifroni is an incredibly sweet professor who truly cares about his students success, and is clearly loved by a lot of students. Unfortunately, I found his lecture slides to be dry and confusing to follow, which made studying for exams a bit difficult for me. Aside from the exams, he's a pretty easy grader on papers and discussion boards.

I really enjoyed Mark's class. His lectures are very straightforward and the exam questions are taken straight from his powerpoints/lectures. I felt like his explanations during class were very helpful so I recommend going to class. Not too work outside of class either. I recommend Mark!

Mark cares about his students and knows what hes talking about. He listens to feedback from the students to help us out. He gave us 3 extra points from unfair test questions, as well as 5 easy points EC (if one other person in your group did it, he gave it to all of you). Not mandatory, but going to class is needed to get in class activity points.

He was a good professor. Only "was"! He changed the syllabus before the final exam. Even he did not send any message about that. The syllabus change increased the percentage of exams from 73% to 80%!! That caused many students to gain lower grades... A terrible professor...

Mark's class was super easy, 4 quizzes and 2 papers. I enjoyed the material we went over and Mark clearly really cares about his students. Lectures and grading were super laid back and it was a very easy A. Occasionally had in class assignments but I still did fine missing a few days. Would highly recommend taking any of Mark's classes!

Emotion psych is not about emotions rather people who study them - disappointing. Lectures are unorganized, he goes off on tangents. The content is easy but the lack of organization makes things hard. The guy really likes philosophy which is annoying for a 4 level science class. If the class had more psych in the psych class it would be better.

He is the most hilarious professor I've had; I always laughed during his lectures. He is great at taking dense material and giving relatable examples that are easy to remember. He can sometimes read through slides too quickly, and he tends to get political at times. All in all, I would definitely take another class with Dr. Mark.

Easy class with 4 exams, an easy paper, and 3 discussion posts. Attendance isn't mandatory and all notes are posted online. He is a great guy who is really funny as long as you don't mind his clearly liberal views! Highly recommend.

Mark is my favorite professor I've had at OSU so far. He is funny, thoughtful, and overall a great teacher. I would highly recommend taking any class with him because he is very passionate about the subject. The class is a bit hard... study for the exams! The content is taken DIRECTLY from the lecture slides nearly verbatim.

Dr. Polifroni has easily been my favorite professor so far at OSU! Even though attendance isn't mandatory, I never miss his class because he makes lectures so interesting. The exams aren't bad, there are three midterms and a final. As long as you study the lecture slides you can get an A.

Professor Polifroni is a very nice dude and cares about his students, and his class is easy. Sadly, lecture slides are very unorganized, and he goes off on political tangents every day that rarely have anything to do with the content (and if they do, they are forced connections). It almost seems like he uses class to get out his political anger

His lectures are so engaging; he often references his own research. There were two research papers in the class, one of which was challenging to read but he is not a difficult grader. Final is not cumulative, just memorize the slides for each exam so you dont have to buy the textbook. This class was an easy A as long as you memorized the info.

Dr. Polifroni is amazing. He's one of the only professors I've had who is truly open-minded and respectful of all students, even if someone disagrees with something he said. His lectures are unbelievably interesting, funny and he's a great storyteller! He's also easily approachable and I can tell he truly cares for all his students, which is rare.

I cannot rave enough about Professor Polifroni. Best teacher I have had in my 4 years at OSU. He just gets it. He is so clear about his expectations and his exam questions are taken straight from lecture notes. Also super easy to reach if you do not understand something. Definitely take him especially if you are a psych student!

Mark is a great, funny professor to have and his class was enjoyable to have for my final semester! I hated missing class because I enjoyed the material & his teaching of it. The material is very comparable to Intro to Psych, with a little bit of Abnormal Psych maybe. Not a challenging class, and made easier by Mark's explanations.

I actually feel bad when I miss his lectures because he is so interesting. One of the best professors I've had hands down. Super passionate about what he's saying, too. Pretty easy to pass as long as you review slides.

If you want to listen to him talk about the paper mill and not make ANY sense all semester- this is the class for you. 4 exams and group project that he gives ZERO rubric for so good luck figuring out what you're suppose to do. Wouldn't recommend and my least favorite professor after 4 years here.

Professor Polifroni is single-handedly the best professor I've had at OSU. He is super funny. I am in my second class with him now. I have horrible test anxiety and he really is a strong believer in being engaged in the material without having to take impossible exams. Only class I have ever gotten straight A's on exams in. TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN!!

Don't buy the book, I did not end up using it at all. The exams come straight from the lecture slides, word for word, even the short answers, they are not bad at all. As long as you really study the slides and understand them, you'll be good. There are random in class activities, which effect your grade a lot, so its important to attend lectures.

So he gives out random group projects in class-- so make sure you attend every class. The tests are easy if you study the powerpoints-- word for word. Reading the textbook helps for misunderstanding, but not necessary. STUDY THOSE POWERPOINTS. He is an easy grader and very nice. He lectures with A LOT of opinions though, a lil annoying

He is clearly very passionate about the material he is lecturing about; however, gets very off topic and distracted. He does not have a typical grading skill in regards to papers and group activities. It is an easy class but miserable to sit through lectures. Very boring and monotoned.

I took this class over the summer, so it was a smaller lecture, but  I still absolutely loved it. Mark is such a good professor, and he really knows this material. He has so many stories from all the different people he's met or jobs he's worked. He was very upfront about his experiences and opinions, and they actually really added to the class.

Mark is somethin. He often makes up data & theories and uses the classroom as his own personal counseling session delving into unnecessary parts of his experiences growing up. He occasionally does have some good stories that relate to the class. I've taken 3 classes with him and all I can say is don't come into these classes thinking you'll learn.

Funny teacher and knows a lot. Only 3 exam that as long as you study for you should be fine! Really really interesting material. Puts powerpoints online so don't need to go to class, but gives good examples in class

Dr. Polifroni was a great professor! His tests are pretty tough just because they cover a lot of content, but everything is straight from his lectures which he provides on Carmen. Don't buy the textbook! His power points are more comprehensive and cover the same material in greater detail.
One of the best professors at OSU

Mark is one of the most entertaining professors I've had. The content was very interesting and taught me a lot about the modern court system.  He encouraged class discussion which always led to good stories.  Attendance wasn't mandatory, but was helpful.  Tests were tough and study guides led me to study a lot of material not on the exam

His tests are hard because they consist of LOTS of truefalse, few multiple choice, and A TON of short answer questions. Mark his a GREAT story teller and has a lot of interesting life stories that add to the course material and make it more interesting. You could easily skip class but I always went to hear him tell his stories.

Mark was an amazing professor! He made the material so interesting! Even though you may be fine skipping class and learning most things from the book he assigns, you learn it more thoroughly when attending his lectures!! Plus he explains it in such a way that REALLY helps to stick in your mind when you are working on his exams!

1)This course is not hard 2)The course is very helpful for psych major students 3)Mark is the best psychology teacher I've met so far. He's hilarious too. 4)Lots of extra credits 5)Flexible with deadlines. Amazing teacher. He's mastered what he need to teach and he can easily help you understand the course material. Definitely 5 Star.

Mark is awesome! Understanding, thorough, and an all-around chill guy. Textbook use was virtually zero, so if you're strapped for cash don't buy it. Take good notes during lectures and you'll get an A on the tests.
Best Professor at OSU

Mark is a great professor. Though I would have been fine not going to class, I found myself going to class just because I didn't want to miss out on what he had to say. You don't need the book at all and though his tests are mostly essay, the questions are fair and he is a lenient grader. TAKE THIS CLASS! I absolutely loved it.

Dr. Polifroni was an amazing teacher! I had no interest in the subject of Law before I took his class, but I became fascinated by it because of him. I would recommend this class to anyone who has a chance to take! It was definitely one of my favorite classes at OSU.

He was great, but he got extremely angry when he found out some misconduct. and he decided to punish the entire class. and then after two weeks telling us to study 8 chapters for final, he said he was changing it back to normal (i wasted 2 weeks studying things not being tested). it would have been great without all these drama.
Mark's great and this class was super easy - I got a 100%. I highly recommend it as a GPA booster.

What a wonderful professor. Extrememly helpful and extremely easy to talk to. Easiest class I've ever taken at OSU. I got a perfect score of 100%. There are 3 exams which are open-note, open-book and the final was a paper we wrote at home and the otehr half of the grade was our comments on ppl's presentaions. We had to do presentations, but if you'
One of my favorite classes at OSU. Definitely take it!

One of the best professors at OSU! I recommend taking this class and psych 485 as well! He actually made going to class fun and interesting! Do not have to buy book but I found it helpful for short answer tests
very good teacher. keeps your attention during lectures. at least once every class i have to remove myself because im laughing too hard. goofy guy.

Took Psych 462, 522, and 485...all very interesting classes and well taught. does a great job of keeping your attention. I got near 100 on all my exams just by studying for a few hours the night before. Missed an exam and he was very helpful and let me retake it. Best teacher ive had at OSU.

This is the class to take!! Very interesting and Polifroni is a great prof!! You don't need to buy the book, but if you do want it as a reference when you study it's on reserve @ the library. Exams can be difficult b/c they are short answer, so study the main concepts in your notes and have them down well and you will be fine!

I love this class! I highly recommend it! Class is fun, we all have a great time discussing things.  Tests can be a bit tricky, but go to class and study, you'll do fine.  You need to take this class! Polifroni is great, funny and entertaining.
best teacher i've had, makes you think for yourself, but not in an extremely demanding way

We worked on group research projects for most of the quarter. Overall, he is easy to get along with and lets you know what to do to succeed in the class. The project took a lot of time and you really have to work hard, but if you put in the effort you probably will get an A.

easy. 3 exams and semi-comprehensive final. exams are a mix of short-answer, T/F (if unsure, pick false), and multiple choice. they're pretty short too. lectures are interesting enough to keep you awake, especially the discussions in class.
I have had Mark for 3 classes in 8 years and he is one of the best teachers at OSU.  I recommend taking his class over any other.  Great sense of humor and very easy to talk to.
Great professor!  Class was very interesting!  Likes to joke with students and trys to keep the atmosphere lighthearted and fun.  Probably my favorite professor in 3 years at OSU!!!

Mark is a good person, very understanding!! but he's a tough grader. The material isn't hard, but his grading is tough. I took all the tests thinking I was going to get A's and B's but got D's. Lectures were good and bad, but thats because he posts the notes on carmen before hand. I recommend Mark, but I suggest you not take the tests lightly.STUDY
Awesome professor.  Excellent class, clear, concise.

He is a hilarious professor, and he has a great attitude. You can tell that he is cocky though. His grading is what kills you. I have always been graded well in writing, and I have been told I'm an excellent writer. I can't seem to get above a C+ on his papers though.  There goes my GPA.
Awesome.  His class was interesting.  He was extremely willing to help students.  He even set up study sessions before exams in his office so he could answer questions.  I highly recommend him!

I loved the group work in this class.  This professor is always engaging and encouraging discussion, which is not always easy with possibly 50 people in the room.  He made it very clear teaching was extremely important to him, and it shows.  I also took Psych 485 taught by him, excellent.

HE is a really laid back, easy going guy. He is very willing to help, and an "A" in the class is definately possible if you go to class, and read. His grading can be frustrating, but he is getting you ready for the real world.

Horrible professor. Reads from notes, provides no practical value, doesn't know the requirements the course is supposed to meet or modern statistical packages. Prof Beauchaine is a nice guy. However, I personally hated everything about this class. Exams are pretty difficult. There's a lot of material. He doesn't do anything to help you prepare/study for them either. To be honest, I found watching The Wire to be pointless as it took up 50% of our class time and only made up about 0.5% of exam questions.

Dr. Beauchaine is a really nice guy, but I did not enjoy his class. Exams are pretty difficult but discussion posts and The Wire (watched once a week and one day lecture) did help. Lots of numbers and specific details from his notes (which he posts online) but overall a difficult class to get through.

Dr Beauchaine is very nice. He lectures one a week, then shows an episode of The Wire for the other class day to get a perspective on what we're learning. Learned a lot from his class! Watching the Wire really helped solidify the information. Test questions have lots of numbers rather than info, pretty specific. Discussion posts each week help too.
